As a local (for all you tourists out there who think we see shows and gamble nightly), who rarely visits the strip, it's nice to have a casino that's away from the traffic and tourists but not ghetto like some "local" casinos.  I don't care if your breakfast special is only 99 cents!  I'll not share a restroom nor a table with the last crack-head or pj-sporting greasy mess.  I'll list some of those latter so you too can avoid these places lol!  I'm not fond of bowling myself but they have an alley that I hear is decent, make sure you bring your Crowne Regal card for the movie theater (do not use that restroom though), they have a Capriotti's which is one of my fave sammich shops, and all the gaming you can handle.  Have never stayed the night here but I can say this...I WOULD and that's saying a lot.  Yardhouse and the fountains are major pluses too. XD

I went to the hard rock through orbitz. They had trouble finding my reservation. After a very long call with orbitz it was solved I thought. Well I wanted two rooms. The hard rock only showed one. After dealing with that and it was resolved. I found out my low rate was not so great after a hidden spa fee was added. Plus throughout the night I found several more hidden fees. Also the 730 wake up call of the leaf blower at the pool and the shop vac in the hallway added to the whole thing. I wouldn't stay here again or suggest it.

I can't review the entire hotel, but I can review the HRH tower, which is where I stayed.

The all suite tower was rad, and the room was way sexy--you can tell that this place was designed for men, and I mean that because everything in the restroom is glass (except where the toilet is), so you can see someone shower, get ready or take a bath from the bedroom.

Everything was kept clean and eight (yes, 8) of us stayed in the one room with just two queen beds, one blow up mattress and the couches that were in the living room area.  I ended up being $33\/person each night which was freakin' amazing.

Everyone was very sweet EXCEPT for the beezy at the pool; there are a few pool areas and we were at the pool with the beach where they do rehab starting in April, just minding our own business and tanning in those chairs that are half submerged when some chick came and took the towels that were covering our faces from the sun.  She told us that we were not allowed to have towels in the pool and instead of giving us the option to, oh I don't know, put the towels with the rest of our stuff, she just took them and ran off.

Uhhhhh, wtf?


Other than the crazy pool beezy, we had a good stay at this "off the strip" hotel.  It's a $12 cab ride--including tip--to get to Caesar's from the HRH tower, but it's worth it to stay in the badass room and tan on the beach.

I've stayed here years ago and booked last week on a promo from hotels.com and thought it would fun to be off strip. It was just ok. It feels tired at least from the staff pov. No energy or glad you're here kind of vibe, just hey how ya doing. 

Some of the newer restaurants were ok, but not enough to bring me back. The pool was closed due to bad weather and Sunday it cleared up, but the pool was going to close anyway. That let the one shining star named Lionel come to the rescue. He brought us to another pool (rehab) and we had a beer. He had the juju hard rock was known for. The era of the Stones, Aerosmith and Bowie. Icons. 

A big renovation is planned and maybe with that they will reclaim the magic of old. I hope so, such a great brand.
I enjoyed this place very much. Good restaurants. Very cool and exciting decor. Very appealing to the eye. The casino smells great. I would stay here again.
Never staying here again. The Rehab pool party was going on while we were here and it was such a mess. Not my scene.
Nirvana pool was SO HOT! it was not enjoyable to try and cool off in this 110 degree heat in a 90 degree pool. & I understand that sand is hot but this sand was very hot.

I love this place, wish I could live there. It's great if your a music junkie like me, it's basically like sleeping, gambling, and drinking in a museum. The rooms are very affordable especially if you go on a week day, and they're very clean and I loved the look of the room. Very rock and roll. 
Some people will complain its off the strip, but you should have considered that before hand. We took a taxi to and from the strip and it was at most $20, including tip. You're in Vegas, if you can't afford a taxi what are you doing? If you are driving you can definitely park in one of the other hotel parking lots while you walk the strip, seeing as how most of them have casinos and shops inside them they don't discriminate over who parks where. They also have free shuttles that come every 30 minutes, but they do stop running after 6pm.
It's also nice that you can check out from your room, using the tv, especially if you have a plane to catch. 
If I get the chance to go back I definitely will.

If you enjoy getting away to a place that doesn't give a shit about it's guests, Hard Rock Las Vegas is the place to stay! The food is bordering terrible to mediocre, especially room service. The only restaurant that caters to its guest is Nobu & that's probably because of its reputation & price tag. Nobu & the spa are the only reason the hotel rates a one as it's definitely not for its rooms\/service. 
We rented a movie in our room to which it stopped playing 20 min in to it - never to be played again. We called the front desk to have it removed....guess what - no one answered the phone! The next morning we ordered breakfast via room service only to be on hold for 15 min. We got two calls in an hour making changes to our order. 
Save your money & go to a place that actually cares about their guests!

Lively and historic hotel with good restaurants (ate at 3 of them) and nice, hip rooms with dazzling views of the strip and numerous pools. Stayed with both my kids so was only allowed access to the Family pool (all others are 21+), which had real sand just like the beach. (Be careful cuz it'll get stuck in swimsuit or trunks.) Pool area had good shade towards the end of the day from the many palm trees, giving it a Miami vice vibe, and making it all worth the $30\/day resort fee. Good service from hotel staff. And the friends that came to visit me at the hotel all said they liked the vibe\/being there and it was a very nice hotel (much improved from back in the day). Though the hotel is off the strip, it's only a short\/inexpensive cab ride away (about $8 going to High Roller, $9.50 to airport). I'd definitely stay here again!! 
Would give a 4.5 Star rating and take off 1\/2 Star because I could've done without *both slanting beds in my double Queen room, clogging bathtub, and vibrating windows from the loud music from the pool party, but other than that, I was very impressed with my stay.
Ehh, it was alright. Much better choices closer to the strip.

A cool place to stay if you're a young person.  Great for groups.  A lot of cool memorabilia for the music fan.  The rooms look nice, but upon closer inspection, you can tell they cut a few corners here and there, but honestly, who needs the nicest room in Vegas?  On the plus side, the bathroom and shower was nice and the bed was heavenly.  Rehab is an absolute Vegas must.
decent, affordable option for the party-oriented sect.  Would return.

Honestly I wish this hotel experience could have been better. The front desk wasn't as rude as people said they were, in my experience they were really helpful actually. But that's where it ends. We checked in on a WEDNESDAY they said our room wasn't ready yet so I said it was fine and gave my phone number and they would call when it was ready. So after 3 HOURS of waiting in the hotel lobby's I went to the desk and asked if my room was ready thinking that they must have made a mistake with my phone number, unfortunately it still wasn't ready. So I waited another hour and asked again, when the Asian lady helped me again she saw how long I waited and offered me a room on the 3rd floor. Because my original room on the 16th floor wasn't cleaned yet and the cleaning crew is barely on the 5th floor. So I thought about it and realized if I was going to wait I would be in my room by midnight. So my wife was disappointed because we didn't have a view but we were tired after a 6 hour car ride. When we got into our room we were surprised that this room has been "cleaned" there was shrimp tails on the floor and the bathroom smelled terrible. The bed was comfy but smelled terrible like the staff never changed the sheets or pillows. Honestly the whole bed smelled like body odor and sweat. We had to contact the front desk about this problem and it took them around 1. Hr to send someone to fix it. And on top of that the shower smelled terrible like the water coming out of the shower smelled bad. Not to add to the fact that there was semen stains the glass walls of the shower. Honestly they said the paradise tower was beautiful but it was so dark in there I don't see how that is considered paradise.

If I could give the HARD ROCK HOTEL & CASINO a big FAT ZERO I definitely would.  We arrived at 10:15 a.m. today July 31,2017 and still haven't checked into our room, it's now 3:53 p.m. We stood in line over an hour to be told we were only "pre-checking" here for a for a convention I'm sure they've known about over a year.  We received a text at nearly 2 p.m. to tell us the room was ready and now standing in line AGAIN and it's longer than the original registration line, which now the guests arriving and registering are receiving their rooms before us!!!!! Like WTF REALLY.  We're NEVER AND I DO MEAN NEVER EVER STAYING HERE AGAIN.  We went to register four the convention with 3 times the people send was out in less than 20 mins.  This is the WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!!! There are many hotels in Vegas be smart CHOOSE ANTHER ONE  the only reason were here is because it's the host hotel

Stayed here on Friday, Dec 26, 2014.

Price is a huge factor in this rating - I was lucky to get my room for just under $70 because of the $100 off Orbitz Cyber Monday deal...  THEN, Lady Luck continued to smile upon me when I arrived to a fully-booked hotel, and was upgraded to the Celebrity Suite, which came with its own pool table.

But huge discount and upgrades aside, comparing the $150 rate to other comparable hotels on the strip during that busy weekend:

Pros:
- Divey bar at Pink Taco
- Promising swimming pool
- CVS across the street
- You don't need to deal with sh*tty Strip traffic to get to the hotel

Cons:
- Low-energy casino floor; not many people hanging around
- If you're planning to dine or drink\/club on the strip, then it's less convenient

You should have a general idea of what you're looking for in a hotel when coming to Vegas, as there are PLENTY of options.  I like this hotel, and the staff was very friendly, but it's really important for me to be walking distance to the clubs\/pool party I plan to attend (Marquee, XS).  I don't want to have to deal with sitting in a cab to get from Point A to Point B when I'm trying to maximize my time and fun, so I don't mind paying a premium to actually stay at the Cosmo or Wynn.

But, for those that are looking for lower budget, and a spot away from the hustle and bustle, this is a decent option.  And I'm a fan of the rocker vibe they have here (dark & metallic).

Perhaps Im missing something or perhaps Im just getting to that ripe old age in my 20s where getting drunk with a bunch of frat boys and 30 something guys who never left their frat party is just unappealing. I went to LV with a couple of friends and they wanted to stay here. I'd stayed before, but it had been awhile so I agreed to it.

The room was probably the best thing about the hotel. We stayed in a suite and it was admittedly quite nice. I am a hotel snob so if I admit it was nice, it really was. I am hard to please. 

Leaving the hotel room was a totally different story. We went down to the pool (no cabana the first day) and good lord was I ever reminded of my first year of college! Simply put, the whole experience really was some never ending frat party. I hate to admit this as it just means that I have yet another review that proves I have officially reached old fart status in my ripe old 20s. The cabanas are great so if you have the means, reserve one. (Note, if you're with a group of your girlfriends and tell them that, they may comp. it!) 

Someone mentioned that security is really strict here and I agree with it... however I do think that is due to the fact that this hotel attracts your typical MTV Spring Break type crowd (aka never ending frat party) and thus, it rubs off on to all patrons. Just something to keep in mind.

Good bye Hard Rock. If I ever become unboring and feel the need to party hard like a drunk soroity slut, I'll be back. 

(I will come by for Nobu but that is a whole different review!)

I love this place.  

I've stayed here about ten times and I keep coming back time after time. Part of me wishes they would have kept it small, but I not going to be "that guy" who always complains about the "good ole' days".

I've never had a complaint about the service, the employees are always very nice, and any room I've ever stayed in has been clean. 

I feel like this place has a certain vibe to it - more so than any other place I've ever stayed in Vegas.

And PLEASE stop complaining about the high drink prices. That's the way every establishment in the world makes their money - on booze. You're in Vegas for Pete's sake. Save an extra $500 before you go, stop worrying about drink prices, and have a good time.

And don't forget to go to the pool... I've heard the scenery is very nice.

Badass rooms. Nice showers. Rockin' pool and bar outside. Not bad prices for Valentines Day\/Presidents Day weekend.

Busy, busy, busy place. Awesome clothes from rock 'n roll stars shown everywhere. Loved that!

Do NOT get below the 9th floor. Seriously, the difference is ridiculous. Gross compared to Amazin'!

When I booked this hotel through Southwest Vacations, it was my understanding that it included all associated costs.  Upon check-in the agent told us there would be a resort fee of $15\/day for use of the hotel gym so we decided not to use it for that reason alone.   Upon check-out, we were told I was charged an additional $50 for resort fees which are mandatory.  When I communicated what we were told upon check-in,  there was no apology or willingness to compromise or admit any kind of blame.  On top of that, we asked for a late check-out  time for Sunday.  We were told we'd have to call back the morning of so we did and were then informed that there's no late check-outs allowed.  They did give us an option of paying $40 to stay until 6 p.m. that day.  I felt like they were trying to get money from us anyway they could and everything was an add on.  Lastly, Rehab (the pool) was consistently a pain to get into.  The bouncer actually told me I couldn't take my pack of gum in so I asked if we could leave it on the table and grab it on the way out.  We were only at the pool for 10 minutes tops and when we went to pick up the gum, most of it was gone.  I'm not sure if the bouncer chewed it or just allowed randoms to take it but we thought that was all really weird.  I know it's a silly thing but it was unreal.  Be prepared for added costs and issues at the Hard Rock.

I have stayed here twice in my life time and I enjoy it every time. Once in the casino tower and once in the paradise tower.  One of the major reason why I enjoy it is because everything you need in Vegas is right in the hotel. You would never need to leave. No it is not on the strip but walking the strip can be overrated. When I stay here the club is awesome, the restaurants, mostly pink taco is awesome, the gambling is awesome, the hotel itself is awesome, the employees are nice and the pools are awesome. 

Only issues I have ever had is room service getting out meal completely messed up, which they comped us for, and sometime you can hear to music from the pool area at 09:00 am. When I want to sleep in the last thing I want to hear is Snoop Dog. 

The rooms are clean. It doesn't smell like smoke like some of the other hotels do.  They have a Starbucks which is real nice. And they have an awesome players club where you can win prizes. I am only about $600.00 away of game play time until I earn that Hard Rock Hotel min backpack. HA HA. 

Whatever you do Whatever though do not touch the mini fridge. It is on a weight system and if you even touch it then they charge you a gross amount of money which is ridiculous. That is my only grip so I don't touch it not even when I am drunk and I really want to. 

So I like the Hard Rock and have turned many of my friends onto the hard rock. If you like Vegas but are getting tired of the strip defiantly give this place a go.

Only half the pools were open and the ones that were close way early. Nobody is allowed to bring their own drinks. Check in is slow and the restaurants overpriced. Not very close to the strip, can walk but takes 20-30min. Shuttle not great, no airport shuttle. Rooms are nice and a good price.

So wish this had been a better hotel!  I love the Hard Rock locations in other cities.  This had pedestal sink in bath - nowhere but the floor to place items.  Hot water was not always available (so weird!) parking is frustrating\/confusing but once found is nice since it's free.  Came for another event - had to be up early - concerts every night until midnight or later and our room windows shook.  Would be good to know ahead of time so we could decide if we wanted to stay here.  Lots of the music is old, pool was 1\/2 closed and not intended for sun bathing.  Fitness Center\/Spa hard to find, no signs.  People are a bit frustrated when asked, like it's my fault there's no sign?  Wi-fi is sporadic. That's ok if you like it but we will plan better next time.

My husband and I just returned home from a four night stay at the Hard Rock Hotel, and I couldn't sit down to write this review fast enough.  
We have stayed here nearly every summer for eight years, and have been satisfied with our experiences thus far.  It has always been very simple - no special treatment really, but not drama either -- Until now.  From the get go, we were told that we would be called once our room was available, as we preregistered at 10am.  No biggie.  We just killed time by walking around and stopping for a drink at Culinary Dropout.  By the time 1pm rolled around, I figured I should check on the room to see if it was ready.  When I asked about the room, the lady at the front desk said that it had been ready for a while.  I realized that they were busy (it was a Saturday after all), so I wasn't going to make a stink about the no call.
We got a room in the Casino Tower with a view of the pool - clean and simple - which we were completely okay with.  
The next day, four of my family members came into town.  I had recommended the Hard Rock Hotel to them, which I was kind of nervous about, because they usually stay in the higher end hotels.  We all booked rooms in the Casino Tower several months ahead of time, and ended up in three different towers.  My sister was given a room in the Paradise Tower, which she was not happy with, and my brother and his wife were upgraded to a suite in the HRH Tower, which they loved.  
By the time Monday rolled around, I had booked a pool villa suite in addition to all of our rooms just for Monday night, so that we could enjoy the pool and party in the suite for the day.  I preregistered for the suite Monday around 10am, knowing that it may take a while for the room to actually be ready.  Again, no biggie.  The suite that I wanted (Gorilla Suite) was not available for the night, so I chose the Tree Bark Suite.  I walked around to pool, only to find out that we would not have access to the pool from our patio, as the Breathe Pool was closed, and we would have to walk through the hallway to get to the main pool.  The whole reason I booked the suite was to walk right out of the patio area and have access to the pool - hence POOL VILLA - and when I booked it directly through the Hard Rock reservations, I was told multiple times that we would have an OPEN pool directly outside our patio gate!!  I went to the front desk to express my concerns, and the lady (I'm sorry I didn't get names... ugh) told me that she would have security unlock our patio gate and we would have access to the Breathe pool.  Sweet! I thought.....Right on track.  Until I spoke with the security guy, Pilot, who ended up being the most friendly and helpful person at the Hard Rock.  He told me that the Breathe Pool does not open on the weekdays, and we would not be able to use it, as they did not have a lifeguard on duty.  ((This was not communicated to me in any way shape or form by the front desk staff)).  He apologized profusely on the behalf of the whole hotel and made it a point to try to make me feel better about the situation.  What a guy!  I again, walked to the front desk where I spoke with another young woman.  I began explaining my situation and tried to do what everyone else does when they are unhappy with the hotel.... Get something comped.... in this case.... Maybe a cabana?  WRONG! As soon as I opened up my mouth the woman got stone cold and her eyes glazed over.  I knew there was nothing I could do or say at that point.  Not even hand her some cash.  She was on the dark side.  At that point, we were all pretty much over the idea of a POOL VILLA, so I asked her to cancel the reservation with no penalty, which she did.  I did not once hear an apology from the front desk staff; not even the manager.  
There is a huge communication gap that Hard Rock Hotel should address, and the customer service is hardly up to par.  I appreciate that they did not penalize me for cancelling the day of, but IMO, that should have been expected.
Here is where I wanted to pull my hair out.  My brother in law went to the front desk ten minutes later and explained our story.  He demanded for a comp cabana.....AND GOT IT!  AND also got an apology out of them.  What??? I was glad, but really... How ridiculous!  Couldn't they have saved everyone the headache when I ASKED for it?  I guess you have to act like an A-HOLE to feel like you are a "guest" at the Hard Rock.  Sorry, I don't work that way.  I will take my polite and friendly attitude somewhere else next time.  To sum it all up.... We ended up having a great time at the cabana, but I only have my brother in law to thank for that.  I would have given Hard Rock one star for such poor customer service and lack of respect for their guests, but the second star is only because of Pilot (I give HIM five stars).  Hard Rock.....if you hire more people like Pilot, I may consider coming back.  But not anytime soon.  Sorry!

I will not return to the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino and I do not recommend staying there! 

Our check-in was great, no lines and pretty speedy.  Sounds good so far...the room was spacious and clean but had not coffee maker...and here is where the problems begin.  They do not allow outside food or beverages making it extremely inconvenient to get a morning cup of coffee or a late night snack.  To try and save a few bucks we decided to self park our car... while walking down to get something out of our SUV my husband walked up to a broken in car with glass everywhere.  While security and management were "very sorry" the only thing they took care of was an incident report.  Our day was spent finding and paying for a new window.

If that wasn't enough...the pool hours are too short, spa services are incredibly spendy, wireless is constantly dropping, casino tables are desolate and empty and the shuttle to the strip (2+ miles away) only runs until 5pm.

Will never stay there ever again!

music memorabilia. strong drinks. you feel like a rockstar here. This is my typical place to kick off any of my vegas visits. It's just routine for me. I love the restaurants here so far and payout on the machines are pretty good!

Decent. This is our third time in Vegas and the HRH has treated us fine.  The Nirvana pool is great,  love the sandy "beach". The bartenders at Nirvana are wonderful and mean business.  We did express checkout on the TV and you can view an itemized list from there as well. Room was clean,  stayed in 1027. Housekeeping came everyday.  The only issue was the sink wouldn't drain,  we had to stick a plastic knife in the drain to hold it open.  We came back and it had been fixed. I won't fault the hotel for the loud guests that woke us up two days in a row at 6am and then 8am with loud music and pot next door. Would stay again but maybe in one of the newer towers.  If you stay in the older part,  be aware of the tub,  was very tall and I had to bend to hold onto the rim to get in and out of the shower. Would stay again.

After staying at SLS Hotel & Casino, the Hard Rock seemed like a huge downgrade. The Hard Rock has definitely seen better days. 

Upon entering the room, I was greeted by 90s dark, grunge decor. You didn't get ample light in the room or bathroom unless you opened up the curtains to let sunlight in. The entire time I was there I had to do my makeup by the window, as the light was so dim in the bathroom. I'm wondering if they keep the lights dim so that you won't notice how dirty everything is? I was definitely afraid to walk around the room without my socks or shoes on.

I did like how there was a lot of closet and drawer storage. It was great to actually unpack all of my clothes for my weeklong stay. There wasn't much ambient noise since we weren't directly on the strip, so a room on a high floor wasn't necessary. The casino was larger than what was at SLS, but still didn't compare to any of the other hotels on the strip. On the bright side, all of the staff were friendly during check-in and check-out.

This is gonna be my spot to play craps, I win here for some reason, maybe because the staff is cool and I felt comfortable not like the strip casinos, I thought this was gonna be a nasty casino but its not. I don't know about the hotel rooms, but the casino is cool. I will be visiting more often during my Vegas summer vacation.

We only stayed here one night on the way south to arizona but i think the hotel was ok.  Rooms are big and "rock n roll" furnished in black and red mostly, at least in the Paradise Tower where we stayed.  I liked it! 

Beds are comfy and we had a view of the pool area that looked nice even though we didnt have time to test it this time. 

The hotel as i guess most people know is about amile away from bustle of the strip. We didnt mind since it was only for 1 night and we like to walk. If i where staying there for several nights with the only purpose to party (after all its Vegas.....) i would probably choose something on the strip instead.   

Ive seen some complaints about the "resort fee" that you have to pay even though you have prepaid the stay on expedia, hotels.com etc. This is like all Las Vegas resorts so you will have to pay it even if you stay somewhere else.

I wish I could give this a zero star rating. After spending the weekend there with a bunch of friends at a bachelor party I wasn't particularly impressed but that's not why I'm writing this.  On Sunday during the rehab pool party I left my room all day and left my wallet in a drawer with $700 in cash in it. When I returned that night it had $200 in cash. 

No one except my roommate (my friend since 10th grade...I'm 30) had been in there. So basically someone on the staff stole my money expecting I was a drunk idiot who wouldn't remember. However, I don't drink at all. So, I did remember. I told hotel security and they did " an investigation" which took over 10 days and I only received a response because I called 10 times. The response was "we didn't see anyone walking out of the room with money in their hands".  Oh thanks. Glad I waited a week for that. 

I understand that they can't pay people back for every crazy claim but I was asking for $500 while my friends (who have way more money than me) spent $10,000 at the pool that day. So you'd think it's unlikely to spend 10k and make up a story about $500.  

I wanted to talk to a manager and after 10+ calls no one would call me back and I finally stopped trying.  

Will never stay at this theft factory again.

Anyone who gave the Hard Rock under 3 stars is either an idiot or an old fart who just didn't get it.

I recently had an epiphany: the ONLY place to stay in Vegas is the Hard Rock.  I don't care what anyone else has to say about it.  All of those other big time casinos are too huge, desensitized, impersonal and just plain suck to stay at.  I like the fact that I recognize certain employees at the Hard Rock- and they recognize and are friendly to me as well.  Those huge mega casinos are fun to visit for a club or restaurant, but staying at them is like getting lost in the mall of america.  Senior citizens and screaming children running up and down the hallways- uh, yea...NO THANK YOU.  Kids shouldn't even be allowed in Vegas in the first place.

The Hard Rock is so fun, young, edgy, hip, beautiful, has great music and the best all-around party scene in Vegas.  The only other casino that can compete is the Palms, but I still think HR is better because its just so much cooler.  It has great restaurants and great entertainment.  AND, its only going to get better with the expansion.  Body English is arguably the best club in Vegas and Rehab is definitely the best summertime party for sure.  The Hard Rock Store carries quality items that I'd actually want to buy outside of Vegas- not the cheap "Las Vegas" crap merchandise or Celine Dion memorabilia- I'm talking cute clothes, great designers and nice jewelry.

Not to mention the rooms!  Their beds are so comfortable.  And the rooms are decorated well- not cheesy with crappy generic furniture and floral wallpaper.  They're in the process of expanding the hotel so the construction noise does suck, but you should be too drunk\/hungover to be bothered by that anyways, right?!  And, we must all pay some price for improvement....I just hope that the expansion doesn't take away the great vibe the hard rock has now. 

Oh, cant wait to go back on opening day of Rehab...I'd move into the Hard Rock if I could.
Free rooms...How can you get better than that. The girl that comes around and massages while you play is a delight!! Love the Hard Rock!

I stayed here for my first EVER vegas trip back in April for the opening of Rehab.  The theme of the hotel is cool, but the crowd this place attracted was definitely not cool.  I thought the ed farty and assliction trends had died out a few years ago-----i guess this is where they buried all the hideous foil, rhinestone, tattoo gear! $%*!

the bell staff was nice, i'll give them credit, and security was good too (we actually had them help us find this girl's room who was so blacked\/coked out she thought our room was hers...wtf).  The front desk people weren't too smart, when I called and asked if they had an auxillary cord to connect my BB to the alarm radio (which had a head phone jack for it) she had no idea what i was talking about even after I described it several different ways.

Our room was *not* clean.  As a matter of fact while I was sitting on the floor next to the bed reading ::gasp! a book in vegas?! blasphemy!:: I looked over and saw a black wad of something under the bed.  I got closer and nearly died....it was a WAD OF SOMEONE'S HAIR! ::barf:: I took a picture of it and have it posted

It was convenient that Rehab was there but otherwise i'd *never* stay here again.  My IQ seriously dropped 20 points from the crowd here. booo.

The rooms are big and spacious. This place is not family friendly as everyone here is ready to party like a rock star not Barney.

The Hotel is a small ways away from the strip which was somewhat inconvenient, but that do have a shuttle to the fashion show mall every hour at the top of the hour.

I was just there this past weekend and overall, I enjoyed my stay here. I got a great deal from hotels.com. I had a mountain view in the Casino tower. I loved the theme of this hotel!  I loved seeing all of the music memorabilia around the hotel.  This is what pushes my rating to 4 stars.  But there were some definite likes and dislikes:

Likes:
Arrived 4 hours before normal check-in time and was able to get a room since it was available for no extra charge!
Bed is super comfy!!!
Theme is awesome and consistent throughout the hotel.
Small--it is so easy to find everything in the hotel!
Pools are very nice.
Never had to wait long for the elevator at any time of the day. 
For the Rehab fans, they offered half price tickets for hotel guests!
Balcony doors opened up for some nice fresh air!
Majority of the staff were pretty friendly--minus the one d-bag who wouldn't let us walk past the cabanas area to get to the walk-way for the other pool instead making us walk alllllll the way around!

Dislikes:
I was in a smoking room, but didn't have an ashtray.
I asked for a list of restaurants or a map of the hotel but was told it was in my room and they do not have one--guess what, there was none in the room!!
The resort fee--I only used the internet, and even that kept acting up so I just used my own phone wifi.  
The remote for the TV would only work right in front of the TV.
The desk chair in the room was seriously worn out!
Could not get a drink when I was at a slot machine--I was across from a black jack table, and the waitress (who told me she only works the tables) told me another waitress would be by to get me a drink, but an hour later, no one ever showed up!
Lines at the front desk were always long.
There wasn't always someone available at the conceirge desk.
Too many Pauly D wanna-be's running around yelling "Yeah Buddy!!" (note--I love Pauly D!)
I was not a fan of the restaurants.  Went to Pink Taco, and it tasted like Pepe's!  Nothing special about the food for what you are paying for.

Luckily, I rented a car (which was super cheap through Pricelines name your own price!).  I was able to save a lot of money on food by going to local spots and eating at fast food places.  I have been to Vegas plenty of times so I liked staying off of the strip for once.  I went to the strip when I needed to (for a show and for a club), but other than that I toured around town at my leisure in a convertible!  Although it's not perfect, I would definitely stay here again!

Money saving tip: If you do rent a car--drive down Flamingo road away from the strip and you will find a grocery store (Food 4 Less) a few miles down where bottles of liquor are SUPER cheap (even cheaper than a liquor store) and you can load your room with cheap drinks and snacks.  Plus you will find many restraurants and fast food places along the way! Also, avoid going to any drugstores (i.e. CVS or Walgreeens) on the strip if you can make it to one off the strip--huge difference in prices!

Recently stayed a second time in the Paradise Tower.  Nice room.  Probably the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever had.   However, the Paradise is quite a walk from the Casino area.

This is a  pretty high-end room:  Flat Screen Sony, higher end furniture, premium bed linens, all granite bath, over-priced minibar and floor to ceiling windows.

The HRH draws a younger crowd - average age probably 30 something.  

Big draw for us are the pools - 5 distinct areas, each with their own appeal.  Enjoyed a weekend day in a cabana with great service.  Female wait staff was attentive and very hot in string bikinis.

Staff here is always top-notch and polite.  No problem with an early check-in, and everyone could not have bee nicer throughout our stay.

Thank goodness for Janice, the front desk manager. The 3rd night of my 8 night stay had turned into a challenge. My otherwise pleasant room was inundated with the putrid stench of Marijana. 

The night shift could do little but provide temporary relief with room fresheners and an ionizer. 

Fortunately Janice followed up the next day and arranged to change my accommodations and helped make my stay here much more enjoyable. 

Thank you for your attention and care for my well being in handling a challenging situation.

Wow. 

I will tell you why I would have given this five stars.
This place just doesn't stop partying, there is a very young crowd as well, I could tell I was not the only one here to celebrate spring break\/ my 21st birthday. The staff here are always smiling, and always pleasant. They will do just about anything to make your stay more pleasurable. When we first arrived to the hotel, a very drunken lady came up to my boyfriend (ladies do not leave your man alone here) and began to kiss his cheeks and hold him with a ninja grip, though I quickly intervened, the staff quickly called security and took care of the situation, they apologized a lot for that, so I wont take away that 5th star for that because that drunk lady (at 7 at night mind you) was not their fault.

The odds at the tables are great, and this was of course my first time gambling, every one of the people helped us out and taught us how to play, taught us the rule book, and helped us make our betting decisions. I walked away with a couple hundred bucks, and I am not complaining. And all of the bartenders are very nice and recommend their fav drinks if you ask them. When I went to the luxor, they were a little bitchy about suggesting anything. And the drink the luxor guy suggested was GROSS. 

The only down side:

-18 dollars for one cape cod cocktail!!!
-music playing non stop, I think they stop playing it only between the hours of 4am and 10am. Not enough for me thank you. And it seems to be the same playlist?
-Non stop smoke....but thats Vegas for you. My lungs hurt!

Definitely my favorite casino to gamble in.

Let's put it this way -- the Hard Rock is like RollingStone circa 1970's, or maybe MTV circa 1980's\/early 1990's.

The Palms is modern day MTV, in all its cheesy, illiterate glory.

The suite at the HRH tower was really nice for the price we paid. It was a great place to party before heading out to Vanity. If you call the concierge before 9pm they'll get you on the list for Vanity and you'll get in right away so that was a great perk. We continued the party late into the night and never got a noise complaint. Good spot to have a great time.

There are two people checking in 100 plus people .. The process is ten min or more for check in each party. Technology is here that can help automate but it seems we rather have people in line and some of the people in line are loosing their patience . I cannot blame them. Can we have a better process please or more staff ? Sure would make allot more people happy !!!

I was with a friend helping him do a report on the memorabilia at the HRH. The ONLY staff member that knew even remotely anything about the memorabilia inside was Dan the taxi guy. He worked 2\/22\/12 at around 8pm. Im ashamed of the employees inside! You should know your stuff if your gonna work there! Good Job Dan on knowing everything about everything inside!

It's not one of my favorites. The service is terrible all the way from top to bottom. I stayed for 4 days and the only the ones who really work hard are the valet and  bell hops. Most of the others I encountered were lazy and terrible at there jobs. I know there going through management changes and they need them. So hopefully the new management will clean it up. Either way it's just a name now. Too pricey for me from rooms to food and drink. I can stay at a much nicer casino for less and be on the strip. I honestly can't find one reason to stay at hard rock ever again. Unless they resolve  my points issue, that they screwed up. Wait I remember one good thing about Hard rock, the elevators work great, really fast. Other than that I'm just not impressed with the Hard rock. I'm sure it's an awesome place to see a show at the Joint. But I'm sticking with my gut and it says stay away.

Because I was traveling to Vegas with my children (ages 11 and 9) I decided to stay at the Hard Rock actually it was the HRH Suites (new towers) due to their advertisement of the "best pool party" in Vegas. Being that I was traveling in July and the weather being 110+ degrees I wanted a hotel with awesome pools. BIG BIG DISAPPOINTMENT!! ALL pools were warm..
Over all my stay was good. Check in was a breeze and they coulda gotten a 5 star rating from me . However I was really let down by the warm pools. Especially because I choose to stay there because of their pools. When its above 110 degrees yes I would like to relax in a cool pool not a warm one that's gonna make me sweat when I'm in it. No one on staff could explain why the pools were so warm and they all blamed it on the hot weather. Come on Hard Rock you gotta do better than that especially when you're known for the "best pool parties in town".

We had a horrible experience for check in. We called a day before to see if we could check in early and we were told we would have to pay an extra fee for early check in, which was okay with us. We were also told that we needed to sign in early in the morning to put our names on the early check in since it was a first come first serve...again we were okay with it. We arrived at 8am and were greated and was put on the early check in list. We were told we would be getting a call around 10am. We left to go get some breakfast and walk the strip. Around 1pm we went back to the hotel to see what was taking soo long. Again we were told we needed to wait as they were cleaning the suites. We went back to Las Vegas Strip to kill some time. We got back to the hotel at 3:30pm and was told our room was still not available. By this time our group of 6 was super irritated and just wanted our suite to rest. Regular check in is at 3pm and we waited to almost 4pm to get our suite. The receptions was not helpful at all and said there was nothing she could do but wait. We asked to talk to a manager but no one came down. We expressed our concerns and told them we wanted our room. This was the worst experience we have had checking into a hotel. We come often to Las Vegas and we have never had this experience before. The suite was nice after we got our keys but the wait was ridiculous. We will not be staying here in the future and I recommend others to look somewhere else.

For my bachelorette party weekend, I wanted to send some stuff to the hotel instead of bringing it with me on the plane. I called the hotel and asked them how it would work. They never once mentioned a 'handling fee' to receive boxes. Granted, it was only $35 but I still feel cheated with all these ridic fees (there's a $23 resort fee when you check in).

Let me preface by saying: 

DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES STAY AT THIS DISASTER OF A HOTEL!!!

My friends and I booked here only because other friends that we were to be meeting wanted to stay here. I was irritated because of it's location off of the strip, but I didn't want to rock the boat, so I acquiesced. Turns out I should have put up the biggest fuss of my life. 

When we arrived at our room in the casino tower, the card reader at the door was faulty and did not work for the 1st, 2nd or 3rd key. Finally, the fourth key worked. When I entered the room, I saw disheveled sheets, tissues on the bed like somebody had just had a "session" a wet washcloth on the alarm clock CRAWLING WITH ANTS, ANTS ON THE ROOM PHONE  and a HORRENDOUSLY foul order flowed out of the room as well. I called front desk and they moved us to the HRH tower. Definitely nicer but guess what... the SHOWER HAD SLIME ALL OVER THE BOTTOM!!! I wore shower shoes for the rest of the weekend after that. The floor was not vacuumed and so I had room flops as well. Just wholly uncomfortable and dirty. 

Honestly, there are so many annoying things to tell, so I will save you the rest of the bloody story and just tell you about the cons.

CONS:

- Rehab will charge you an additional $3 per drink because of some nonsencical LET tax that they don't tell you about ahead of time

- They gave us a $50 food credit for the inconvenience, then charged my card for it

- Did I mention the DIRT??

- OUT OF THE WAY!! You will spend $80 additional on taxis 

I don't even want to go on. Just save yourself a headache and don't do it!! You've been warned!!

This review is for gamblers. Stay away!  This hotel does not know how to treat it's loyal players. 

I've been staying and playing at the Hard Rock since it was a small boutique hotel in the 90's. With each expansion and renovation they seem to provide less value and  provide more contempt- Not only for their regular hotel guests but for mid level gamblers such as myself. Im not a high roller but I do buy in for $10k at a time so not exactly $5 hands. I haven't stayed there in a bit because it seems like their rooms are really falling apart. Always something broken and always nasty stains. But I have considered myself "lucky" when playing there so I tend to stop by there whenever I'm in town and buy in for between $2-10k. Never again!

Last time I went there I dropped $4k on a marker. Nothing crazy. I've dropped $10k on a marker before and have ZERO history of issues paying back my markers. Their policy has always been 30 days then they deposit them. Typically, they'll send an email before they do so and have always been super cool about giving extra time if needed. 

With this last $4k, they deposit 2 markers for $2k each within 7 days of my visit. No word. No email. Just a deposit. Which isn't really that big of a deal except I set up the marker like 7 years ago and there is an old account attached to them so it required moving money from my main bank account to the old one. 1 marker clears, the other doesn't. I get a call from Robert "Bob" Ginter in casino credit department. A man I've spoken to on a NUMBER of occasions in the past. I asked Bob what the deal was. What's up with 7 day deposit?  Bob says their policy has changed and it went from 30 day deposit to 14. Even though they deposited after 7. Still. Not that big of a deal even though it's odd that the usual courtesy call I've gotten in the past was never made even with a significant policy change. I tell him I'm going to have my assistant mail the check. I leave town on business trips on and off for the next 2 months. I come back and Bob reaches out to me about the check for the measly $2k that my assistant forgot to send. She was fired for other but related reasons shortly after. 

I apologize and say ill send a wire. He then proceeds to threaten me that he was going to file charges with the Attorney General after decades of patronage and ZERO issues with markers in the past with Balances MUCH higher than $2k. I'm astonished. I tell him that it's interesting that he would threaten such a long time player with the law over $2k and I would never play in a place again if they pursued such petty matters. Maybe it was unwise to test them on their threat but i decided to see what would happen and how they would handle it if I were to delay payment again. I thought there is no way they would risk losing such a steady player that reliably pays his markers in an expedient manner except for this one time. I should've known better. 

Well, today... I receive a letter from the attorney general for "writing bad checks" dated sept 13th with 10 days to take action or be issued a warrant for my arrest. So I receive the 10 day notice dated 9\/13 to pay on the 23rd. Today. The 10th day 

In retrospect, I should've just paid it when Bobbo threatened me. It's clear that the Hard Rock has become the worst place to play and stay in Vegas. Everyone knows they are losing money and they cut corners and treat their guests horribly. I mistakenly assumed that players get more leeway but again, I should've known better. LISTEN TO ME HARD ROCK. EVERYONE I KNOW WILL KNOW ABOUT THIS. I WILL NEVER PLAY ANOTHER DIME IN YOUR CASINO AND WILL DO EVERYTHING IN MY POWER TO MAKE SURE NO ONE I KNOW WILL PLAY THERE EITHER.  So it looks like I have to deal with the AG instead of Bob Ginter now. Genius work guys!

PS- I dropped another $6k on the same trip at the Golden Nugget when I was in town for Punk Rock Bowling. I had never stayed at The Nugget before and I actually had to call THEM to ask them to deposit my markers. They asked if I needed more time. I said no. So the Hard Rock has become WORSE THAN A DOWNTOWN VEGAS HOTEL NOW.   I have markers all over town and have a balance of 0 on all of them.

*This review is based on staying one night in the Paradise Tower in the winter (I say this because I'm imagining the Hard Rock being a very different scene in the summer when Rehab is open and fully functional)*

My buddy and I were coming into town a night early before my bachelor party kicked off. We wanted to stay somewhere neither of us had been to before, so we chose the Hard Rock based on that and he had found a sweet deal (expensive week with the CES trade show in town). We didn't realize it was so far off the strip, but we thought no biggie.
Checking in, the front desk was really friendly to us, and gave us a free upgrade. We ended up being in the Paradise Tower, which we thought was the newer part of the hotel (?). Our room was great...no complaints at all. The room seemed newer, and the bathroom was actually nice...overall I liked it. We had a great view, which was directly above Rehab (amazing how large that whole pool area is). Outside noise was virtually non-existent. We didn't really hang in the casino much so I don't have any good or bad info for it. All in all I was impressed with the stay, and would definitely consider going back.

My wife and I stayed at the Hard Rock this past weekend because they were cheap. We reserved the room on Travelocity but the problems started as soon as we rolled up at the Valet. I own a limousine business (LA LimoScene if you wanna look me up.) and we drove to Vegas in a Limo with a friend. We tried to valet the Limo and they first told me I needed to go over to the South Valet on Harmon and they could valet the Limo over there so I drove around to the South Valet and they also refused, accusing me of being some guy that tried this last week. I told them I wasn't that guy but they still gave me attitude. I asked them for oversized parking and they told me to park in self park. I drove up to the self park area and there were NO spaces big enough to accomodate the Limo so I had to park in a non-space at the end of the parking structure. I wasn't blocking anyone so I figured it would be okay. When I came out at the end of my stay, I had a parking citation on my car for parking in a non-space. I was pissed since I asked and they sent me to park there.

Then, once we got inside, the girl at the Reservation Desk couldn't find our Reservation. We were in a hurry to check in because we had tickets to a concert so the added time it took for her to figure out where our reservation was didn't help. It took about 20 minutes to check in. Once she found it and we got up to our room, it took them another half hour to get our bags up to our room from the valet.

The room was fairly nice. The bed was really comfortable and the black out curtains would have made it possible for us to sleep in had it not been for the planes flying over and landing every 20 minutes. HRH proximity to the airport is a definite downside. The bathtub was really high so when you get in and out of the bathtub, you trip over the edge and either fall in or out of the bathtub, depending on which direction you're going.

The prices were ridiculous throughout the hotel. It was like renting a room at the airport. $10.50 for a pack of cigarettes.

Checking out was equally poor. We couldn't get the Bel desk to answer the phone so we had to go down to the front desk to request someone to go up and get our bags. When we finally got them, several things were missing including my Gucci Sunglasses and that $10.50 pack of cigarettes.

When we got home and checked our statement, we found that they had charged $400 to our card even though we prepaid for the room and then credited back $166. When we called to find out what happened, they were rude and said the charges were $15 per person for a resort fee and then hung up on us.

All in all, the Hard Rock sucks. I definitely do not recommend them.

Stayed at the Hard Rock for about 5 days, and loved every single second of it. They always have something going on. Whether it be all the diversity of restaurants, or different bands at bars. The rooms are gorgeous. We had a huge group of 20 people, and everyone was well catered to and loved the rooms. We had a pool view, and it was amazing. You could look out of your window to the huge pool area. The pool area had a water slide, and we even reserved a cabana by the pool one day and loved the service. First time at Vegas and it was an amazing trip thanks to the Hard Rock!

I really enjoyed my stay at the Hard Rock Hotel. The rooms are all very decent and they usually have good rates. Check out their Twitter on Tuesdays for special deals (I've seen as low as $30 per night Sun-Thurs). Our particular room was on the 8th floor with a great view of the Rehab Pool. For the younger set, Hard Rock is the perfect place to stay. I've also heard Vanity is one of the best clubs in Las Vegas to check out though we didn't make it in on this particular trip. Check in went along fine without a hitch and from there everything was great til we left. I would absolutely stay here again.

I know it's off the strip , but my husband and my self  love this hotel ...rooms are always clean and they stop by every morning to ask if we need anything and how we are doing ! And my app on Vegas.com always has deals for HRH !

This was my 4th time at the Hardrock hotel in Las Vegas. I keep coming back because of the awesome beds, good rates and good location on the Strip. 

We arrived late at night and we were here for a birthday celebration. We got a complimentary upgrade to a suite which was totally awesome. The room was devine, we only stayed for 1 night but had a great night rest and the bath was huge. Would recommend and always come back to the Hardrock in Las Vegas.
Very courteous staff from the valets room service. Clean modern rooms, great hotel to go with the great price. We are really enjoying our stay and all of the memorbilia thru out the hotel.

I usually win here at the blackjack tables, so the casino is more like 4 stars.  The restaurants are great (namely Nobu, and Simon), it's very tongue in cheek, and the clubs and music venues are good.  It is a tremendous meat market, so know that going in.  The hotel beds are great, super comfy, and easy to sleep in.  The in room products are very good, and the packaging is slick.  Despite it being about 15 yrs old now, the property still smells clean.  Also, the sayings in the elevators, though cheesy, are very cute.  Why not 4-5 stars?  Read on, you crazy diamond.

The staff is a bit rude at the front desk, and the check in system is a royal pain in the butt, including a $150 deposit on the room as you check in.  I guess it's assumed you're going to trash your room, which bugs the heck out of me.  The parking structure is hella far from the registration, so you're dragging your luggage all over the place to get to the check in.  It's also off strip. Right then and there, it drops a star for location.

This place used to be the "IT" spot but when I went back there recently it felt so different! I never realized how small this hotel and casino was! I guess I'm spoiled with always staying at places like Aria, the Venetian, Encore, etc. Anyways it's still a great hotel to stay in. Not my favorite but still good. 3.5 star rating for me

Pros:
- Stayed at the new tower and new suites which was awesome! You have a separate valet, entrance and front desk than the rest of the hotel.
- Suites are nice and spacious with a completely separate living room and large L shaped sofa which could comfortably sleep 2-3 people if you wanted to. There was only 3 of us in the room so we didn't need to do that. I had my own bed hehe =)
- Convenient location of the new tower. Right downstairs in Johnny Smalls which is an EXCELLENT restaurant as well as the entrance to Vanity Nightclub.
- Tiesto is spinning there once a month for all of 2011!!!! GAHHH! That in itself deserves 10 stars!! 

Cons:
- Off the strip
- Ventilation is horrible! The other hotels do a better job at sucking up most of the smoke. They didn't do so well here. =(
- Smaller place in general
- Bathroom lighting SUCKS! How are we supposed to put our makeup on in this horrible lighting. I didn't know when to stop adding more blush lol

Went to Hard Rock this weekend.  Good food at Mr. Luckys. I like the the lqyout of the casino.  But they have went down to the screw the gambling  customer  and pay Blackjack  6 to 5.  Vegas  built  their empires without this latest reduction  in players odds, but apparently  that is not enough.  I say boycott  6 to 5 Blacjack!

Stayed from 7\/10-7\/13 ...the casino is kind of small but it doesnt have that nasty smell like most hotels do thats a plus. You get free entry into Rehab and Body English after that it was all downhill
Getting to the hotel asked for early check in. I was informed that they would give me a call..so I hit the strip. I never got a call came back around 2 asked why didnt I get a call and guess what a room was ready and they were just abount to call me SO I ended up getting charged for early check in on a not real check in  ..the bathroom is small , the..seen a  couple crickets killed one while i was leaving Friday (had to run so half of it was left) The cleaning people obv didn't do a good job because it was still there when we got back !!. The room was hot and cold..Never staying again ..better off staying on anyhwere on the strip so even if you have these problems you dont have to catch a cab everywhere

EDIT: One day later, the guest relations manager got wind of what happened and gave me the proper comp prices... Now i have no complaints and changed my review to 5 stars.

In the past, this place has taken good care of us. We gamble a LOT so we get comp rooms on the strip and at the hard rock. During my trip to las vegas during the World Series of Poker, i had an offer of 5 comp rooms for the hard rock. 

I called and the people on the phone were very nice, so i offered money to upgrade our comp rooms to a suite.. which the person agreed.

Upon arriving, i was disappointed to find our HRH suite was no nicer than the standard rooms that we were comped. The standard rooms even had an open air balcony type thing overlooking the rehab pool party, where the HRH suite had no fridge, no opening windows, etc.

A light was burned out in our room, the ice machine on our floor was broken, and the phone didnt work.. plus no fridge no open window,  so i decided to walk down to the front desk and see if we could switch into our previously offered comp rooms. The suite simply wasn't worth it, and I had nicer comp rooms already at hotels on the strip.

The front desk person said, my rooms were completely comped and that i didnt have to switch rooms, that maintenance would take care of the issues and i could keep my suite free of charge. Great. Later that day i wanted to double check this, so i returned and asked again what i was paying for the room, and they again told me zero charge...... this was all good until checkout... Ill explain that later.

We had a decent time at the hard rock... a waiter in the culinary dropout was pretty bad and im pretty sure he was feeling me out to sell me drugs, but whatever... its vegas. The hostess at the pink taco made my wife and I upset one night because we wanted to get takeout, and she told me it would be over an hour unless i wanted to eat there i could get served immediately... I explained, why can't you just serve me the food and i can put it into a box and walk away... it didn't make sense to her... so we ended up grabbing something quick at Mr Lucky's.

The real problems happened at checkout. They offered me a 25 dollar per day food credit, which they never applied to my bill... but i was SHOCKED when i saw over 400 dollars worth of 'room upgrade and resort fees'. Not only did they charge me the full 'upgrade to suite' charge, but they also charge random fees between 30.01 and 75.01 as 'resort fees'. My checkout amount was over 1300! I was nice and smiling and asked to speak to a manager. They had me walk to the other part of the Casino and i spoke to a woman manager who offered to take 120 off. I told her my story but she didnt want to hear it, she suggested that unless i had a 'casino host' i couldnt be reimbursed for my rooms. She admitted that it was the casino's mistake for telling me that i had comp rooms, because the suite upgrade system was different than the hotel checkin system. Although she admitted fault, she told me there was no way she was dropping anything additional off of the bill, and I would have to dispute it with my credit card.

I felt cheated and scammed by their misleading offers. The money i saved from the rooms, I had already pumped into their slot machines and table games as a 'feel like I owe them one'... now i was charged anyways.

Ok I'm sitting here in my room holding my bladder! I'm here for my cousins wedding.. I just checked in which by the way wasn't a good experience. I always bring water with me because I drink it all day long. I was told by the Bell Hop I was not aloud to bring it in and to read the rules near the entrance. I was hoping to be able to bring my organic apples and strawberries as we'll but he said no coolers, no food, no water, nothing. So that really puts a damper on trying to eat healthy. Then we waited in line for about 45 min and they had our reservation incorrect with the payment. Uuuur so than we get to the room and there is black stuff all over the toilet and toilet paper in it. So I thought I would take the time to write this review. Time elapsed so far after calling house keeping 45 min. I have to pee!!!!! Oh and there is a lovely throw up stain on the chair ottoman. Seriously feel like I need to take a shower in bleach. This hotel needs to be cleaned. Absolutely unexceptable! But what's the worst I'm missing by cousin wedding dinner at the moment waiting for then to clean the room.

I would never stay here again.... Where do I begin??

First of all no matter what they tell you, it is FAR from the strip. Way farther than most people would want to walk. Especially in 100 degree weather. So you have to take a shuttle, that stops running at 5 pm, or find some other way to get there. 

Basically, everything about this hotel is geared towards trapping you there, making it difficult to leave, and then charging you as much as possible for as much as possible.

Our room was a little dirty and run down. It looked like it's seen its share of wild parties, i.e. stains on the rug, chips and scratches on the furniture. The maid service was a little sloppy and careless. The room had a desk, but with no chair to sit at it with, so I had to call the front desk and ask them to bring one so I could do things on my laptop. The bathroom had 2 sinks but no bathtub, just a shower stall that leaked all over the bathroom floor.

The pool was a  real pain to deal with! It was a far walk from the room. One of the main things I like to do when I'm on vacation is hang out in the Jacuzzi. Since our room didn't have a bathtub, and I could not take a hot bath which is what I also like to do, I was looking forward to the Jacuzzi by the pool. So I went to the pool and the guy tells me there is only one jacuzzi operating today. I looked at it and it was nasty. There were about 15 trashy looking people hanging all around and it and in it. And honestly, it looked like a scene from a low budget gangster rap video. I wouldn't put my foot in that water if you paid me. I happened to find another jacuzzi that was kind of hidden in a corner, that was actually quite nice and had some cool decent people in it. But if I didn't stumble upon that on my own I would have never known it existed. The staff member didn't even mention it.

I always went to the pool in the late afternoon, and each day they suddenly announced that they are closing the pool early because they didn't have enough staff. So I got gypped out of pool\/jacuzzi time each day!

Forget ever "chilling" by the pool. The music by the adult pool was almost as loud as a heavy metal concert, I'm not kidding!

The family pool had loud music too but not as loud. They also had sand in both pools, to make it seem like a beach. I just found that to be annoying because sand got everywhere and in everything just like at a beach, only this sand didn't seem very clean.

They do not allow any outside food or drinks or coolers into the hotel. I am very into healthy\/ organic, high quality food. So when I drive to Vegas I always bring a cooler with some of that food in it so I don't have to eat 3 meals a day of hotel junk. Well, they don't allow that. They don't even have a fridge or microwave, or coffee maker in the room. You are forced to buy their way overpriced garbage instead.

They had some decent restaurants in the hotel, but most of what they had was way pricey. For instance, a breakfast omelette like you'd get at a Denny's was $16. And they do NOT have a buffet.

The worst part  of my trip was that I got food poisoning after eating at the Culinary Dropout restaurant in the Hardrock. I was puking all the next morning and felt a little sick the rest of the trip (and no, I was not drinking at all). My friend also felt a little sick after eating there, but not as bad as me. I think it was either the oysters or the fondue.

Another thing that annoyed me is this, it's called the "Hard Rock". But when I first walked into the casino I saw exhibits for Miley Cyrus, Tupac, and Niki Menage. What they have to do with "Hard Rock" I'll never know! Not to mention, the whole rock and roll vibe that they did have was mostly of the darker side of rock. I wish they focused more on the fun and exciting side of rock and roll.

Believe it or not, there were some good things about this hotel. They did have a lot of cool displays of rock memorabilia all over the place. And they do have some cool concerts right in the hotel. While I was there they had the Scorpions doing a 5 night residency, which was awesome!! There was also a great 80's metal cover band playing in the club in the hotel right after the Scorpions concert. 

There were also hot and sexy female acrobats swinging from the ceilings stationed all around the casino on the weekend! And it seems they went out of their way to hire lots of good looking cool and sexy staff. So, the eye candy was nice. But still not enough to make me want to stay there again.

I bought a groupon for 2 nights here. We arrived and were greeted by Larry who was extremely friendly and helpful. Ive stayed at many hotels in Vegas but this was our first time here. I was extremely surprised at how nice it was. Checked into our room and it was beyond what I excepted! Super clean, beautiful, Nice view, and so quite! Which was great as were more of a laid back relaxed vegas type. We ended up renting a pool cabana the next day and that to exceeded my expectations! Staff was wonderful and accommodated my request to giving us a private relaxed style cabana. We didn't get a chance to eat at any restaurants there however we did order room service one morning and that was quick friendly service and really yummy! We also went to the juice bar one morning and that was awesome! I can't wait to come back here! This is our new go to Vegas hotel and I seruisly can't believe how affordable it was! Defentuly worth every dollar and more! Loved everything about this place! Also enjoyed the fact that its an older crowd, I didn't see to many young drunk annoying kids here LOL Cant wait to come back!

Hard rock and heavy metal gambling nirvana in Vegas. Listening to Slipknot, Bad Company, Red Hot Chili Peppers, and Jimi Hendrix while playing blackjack rules!

I have been to the Hard Rock on many occassions while in town on business and pleasure. Though I have never stayed in a room overnight here I have used the facilities to dine and gamble at multiple times.

As a lover of all things metal and hard rock walking into this place is like entering a musuem of my favorite things. Every wall is covered with rock band memorabilia, cases contain all types of rock star oufits and mementos, guitars hang everywhere, videos are playing, and classic to current rock and metal is blaring over the loudspeakers.

There are usually some lower limits on the table games and it's not too hard to find $5 and $10 blackjack here. GoGo girls dance on stripper poles over the table gaming area adding to the rock aura of the place. Waitresses in skimpy outfits come around to serve up drinks. There is a new tower and gaming area that adds even more slots to make a deposit of your hard earned cash. It's a fun place to play at, but I always found the slots to be tight, while having much better luck on the table games. Sometimes it's better to play some video poker at the circle bar over a few drinks while listening to good tunes.

Restaurants like Mr. Lucky's and the Pink Taco offer up decent to pretty good eats, while the "Rehab party at the pool" can best be described as a human petri dish of bodily fluids. Taking in a concert at The Joint is always a cool experience, along with after partying at one of the bars or on the casino floor. The Hard Rock is a place to party down, soak up the scene, and be seen.

One of these visits I will actually stay here overnight for a few days to get the full experience, so for now, three stars.

Dark and Depressing.  The inside of the Hard Rock looks like the set from Batman Returns.

This is especially true of the poker room, which is in a back room with low ceilings and blue\/black painted walls.  I hated it.  Admittedly, it didn't help that I lost a huge pot with pocket Aces, but that's another story for another time....

The sports book is about the size of a studio apartment in Allston.  No legitimate casino should have something that small.

And the blackjack tables pay out blackjack at a lower rate if you're at a table in front of the dancers (6:5), which caused my friend to storm off in a fit of anger, which was pretty funny until he woke up the next day and realized he still had chips from the casino.  Since we were not staying at this godforsaken place, we had to go back in the morning before his flight and cash in the chips, which was not that much fun, because this hotel\/casino is a 30 minute walk from the Strip.

I was beyond satisfied with my stay at the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino in Las Vegas! So close to the strip (15 minutes walking, 5 minute drive) and with affordable pricing, great accommodations and stellar service; I couldn't help but think why more people don't frequent the Hard Rock services.

The front desk\/attending service was incredible, being very helpful and kind enough to draw a map to our room. Walking through the casino portion, everything was very up-to-date and laid out in a manner of ease, including passing two separate bars and several well-known restaurants. 

The room itself was easily accessible and the decoration superb for $40 a night (gotten through a deal of course) furnishing two beds, a full bathroom, dining area, and mini fridge. The environment was very clean and went perfect! 

The hotel and casino portions has everything ready to host a full weekends stay at Las Vegas!

A group of us were in town for a convention and decided to stay at the Hard Rock. Huge mistake.

A few colleagues arrived the day before I did and got rooms near the top floors of the Casino Tower. They could barely sleep because of the in-room parties and planes all night long (Hard Rock is right next to the airport.)

Next day I arrive, walk in the doors of the hotel and it's like douche-bag central. Loud, obnoxious, sloppy drunks all around me, bumping into me as I'm trying to make my way to registration. It's barely past breakfast-time.

So I thought I'd be safe with a room on one of the lower levels, but my room was overlooking the roof of the kitchen from one of their restaurants and the smoke from their huge vents would fill my room with smoke.

Next morning, we decided to eat at Mr. Lucky's-- Hard Rock's over-priced diner within the hotel. We sat down about 7:50am, waitress came over to take our order, and we said we were all going to order the breakfast special but were were still waiting for one person. Since the deal ended at 8, we asked if we should order now so we could still get the deal. 

"Oh, no problem", she said. "You were seated before 8, so you'll still get the deal."

8:05 and our colleague arrives. The waitress comes by and we tell her we'd all like the specials. 

"Sorry, that deal ended at 8."

"That's not what you told us 15 minutes ago."

"I'm sorry, there's nothing I can do about it", then something about the computers locking them out at 8. So we paid for our $17 coffees and left to have breakfast somewhere else.

Stay away from this place.
Check in was quick & easy! Everything has been perfect thus far. Rooms are #rocknroll & clean. Beds are comfy . Food is good. Time to party! Haha! #vegasbaby

I really liked the style of this hotel.  All of the staff I met were friendly and accommodating.  None of the staff came into the room to rush us out during check out, which is a plus. Check in took a while and should have been faster.  There was a lot of confusion when it came to the pools.  Even though it was around 70 degrees each day I was there, they were sometimes closed and then opened other days. 
My hotel room was at the end of the hall, which took forever to walk to, but I fully appreciated how quiet it was.  I liked the variety of the restaurants in the hotel and I like their casino.

We stayed in the HRH tower and the suite was unbelievably nice.  Two flat screens, one in the bedroom and one in the living room that are seperated by two sliding doors.  If you have an iphone or ipod there's a dock in the wall with a touchscreen so you can play your music or the hotel's music through a speaker under the flat screen in the living room.  Huge bathroom and plenty of closet space.  I know people don't usually spend too much time in their hotel rooms in Vegas but this room makes you want to just stay and relax until it's time to go out.  Also really comfortable beds when you're in recovery mode all day.

My husband and I love to go to Las Vegas but especially to go to the Hard Rock Hotel!! We have stayed at the Hard Rock many times and we always have a great time, get great service and leave happy and looking forward to coming back!! One of the best parts of the Hard Rock is sitting at one of the bars, relaxing and watching music videos!! They play such great music and it is such a fun way to spend the day just singing and enjoying the atmosphere. Over the years, they have added outstanding restaurants like Culinary Dropout! Of course ~ Mr. Lucky's and Pink Taco never disappoint either! One time when they accidentally gave us two beds instead of one king, they moved us to a suite the next night! As small business owners, it is next to impossible for us to get away so when we do ~ we are so happy to get to the Hard Rock to have a great time!! Thank you Hard Rock for your continued improvements to your hotel, the great service and the great music to listen to! We cannot wait to come back!!! Would highly recommend the Hard Rock!!

I love this hotel for a few reasons! One, its real people that check in here. Meaning, its the Hard Rock! People come here to listen to music, jam out, and get their swim on. So if your not feeling music, jamming out and swim parties this isn't the hotel for you! Plan on pool parties Saturdays and Sunday's with awesome DJ's. People walk around in flip flops and relaxed, which is what I love the most! Hotels are done in fashion.... of course to match "HARD ROCK"! I enjoyed everything from the check in to check out process! If you plan on leaving to head to the strip, its a short cab ride over! However I love this place cause you can really do everything here! Also everything priced correctly! So even though I went a little crazy, I didn't feel so bad doing so! I will be back, the beds sleep amazing!

We got a free upgrade, not sure why.

We stayed in a double double and it was the most spacious hotel room I've ever stayed in. And best yet, it was facing the pool! (saweet; we even took advantage of it and did a mini photoshoot! The pics came out fantastic... unfortunately it was a little exotic so sorry, no preview) I love the decor and the white sheets and blankets. Me and my girlfriend kept on saying, "OMG, I want to steal these blankets!"

I do not recall on having to ask for the hotel service for anything so I can't tell you how their service is like. The good thing is that we didn't run into any problems with the room. So, that's always a good thing.

Oh, one thing though. as spacious the room was, the bathroom was pretty small. Which was a little disappointing. I guess they put more thought into the bedroom then the bathroom. (I don't know)

I would definitely return to this hotel as long as someone's willing to split the room rate with me. =]

First things 1st- THE BEDS and pillows are soooooo comfortable!!!!! Like heaven! Sleep was great here! LOL

The Hard Rock is located about two LONG blocks OFF the main strip. I found the rooms here cheaper than some of the strip hotels. 

If you want to be in the middle of everything, the hustle and bustle, complete craziness, traffic, too many people then this isn't the place for you. I actually liked that it was LESS crazy that the strip ( especially on the weekends and holidays).

I hear there is a shuttle during the day to the strip. Other than that - there is a self park garage  that picks up UBER\/Lyft customers .. otherwise taxis can be found at front entrance. Just to take me two blocks to Planet Hollywood\/ Cosmo cost us 10 bucks. It is a mission to get between hotels for sure! 

There are three hotel towers at the Hard Rock. I stated at the Paradise tower which was the farthest to walk to from front desk but I was very comfortable. Had a great view of the pool and part of the strip. The beds and pillows are amazing, bathroom was spacious- 2 sinks, great shower head pressure. Rooms are less decorative than other hard rock hotels I've stayed with but I was comfortable none the less.

Pool... I saw 4 pools. 

WARNING- the sand will BURN your feet when it's hot!!!

The nirvana pool is free for guests and was chill and relaxing. The other side has the Rehab pool-usually open 11-6pm. Promptly.  Need to call for times and prices etc cuz it seems to change . Rehab is a party pool NOT for relaxing. You will go thru TSA security - entrance is in the paradise garage BTW- super strict on what you can bring inside or they will have you check your bag for a price. Cabanas and daybeds are Insane prices. Not gonna write too many on here and more on the yelp for rehab. Otherwise music is good and it's a fun time once you settle in.

I love the music memorabilia around the casino ... which the rooms and the floors of the rooms were more decorated like other Hard Rock Hotels I've been to.
