When i came there, they made me wait in the pool for 2 hours because my room wasn't ready, and they were going to charge me an additional fee if i checked in early. I was just really mad with their service because there was packed line and there was only 3 people standing at the counter. 
The pool was okay, they had white sand and it was burning hot. Overall, it's an okay hotel, i just expected better

Been to Vegas 15+ times, have stayed exclusively at the HRH the last 4 years. BEST hotel for the 25-35 year old crowd. No kids to be seen, the pool parties are outrageous and the restaurants are good (Mr. Lucky's is my fav - cheap American food. Yum.) If you want to party don't stay anywhere else!! Oh and don't plan on leaving Sunday, stay until Monday and don't miss Rehab!

Only have been here for 5 hours and already want to leave. Very unfriendly staff... took forever for our room to be ready... locked out of other room and security was suppose to come up per cleaning crew so we waited, but no one came. Just been waiting all day and I'm so over it. We're here to celebrate a wedding and the bride and groom are only here for one day. Nice job hard rock.

Came for a stag party. Great base, attentive staff. While the Hotel is off the strip that has it's perks too. Easier to get around. Vegas always has Cab challenges. 

Ate at several of the restaurants and they were good.

Went to Top Rank Boxing at the Joint, perfect venue for almost any event.

Andrew Dice Clay at Vinyl was a scream.

The Rehab party is everything you've ever heard and more.

Was told my card was being charged only for the security deposit as my dads girlfriends card was being used to pay the rooms. First they tell us cash only and they won't take an international credit card and want to charge us double for the security deposit unless we pay with a debit card. So I gave them mine and said to put the security deposit on my card, that's it.  Ended up being charged for 3 days stay plus the security deposit and was told too bad so sad won't be getting my money back because it "takes too long to send the money back to my card because its a debit card" will never be staying here again! I have never been treated with so much disrespect by a front desk member. You asshats are supposed to help me not talk down to me and my family. He was treating my dads gf like she was stupid because of her Asian accent much worse before I walked up to the counter. Larry needs to be fired for his blatant disrespect and racism and for handling customers in his care so poorly . As someone in a management position this would never fly as one of my employees and their ass would be out the door ASAP!

Watch out for the  fees. You will be charged everyday for WiFi and a resort fee. You are not allowed to have outside food or drink even in your own hotel room. If you pay out the ass to go to the Rehab pool party do not set foot in the hotel without a shirt on. You will be called out, yelled at and confronted by security. The lines at the front desk are endless. The parking garage is a nightmare. Park at your own risk. They do not consider themselves responsible for anything that happens to their own paying customer's vehicles. Do not let them put you in the Casino Tower. It is the oldest tower and looks it. Half the time you go to one of the bars they are unattended. No bartender needed for no customers. All in all, there are so many other places in Vegas to stay and gamble that treat you like they're glad you're there and they want you to come back. if you want a good time surrounded by fun people  try Planet Hollywood or The Palms or, last but not least , The Cosmopolitan.
I really like the vibe of the HR and its one of my favorite casinos to hang out at.  My only problem with the place is NO POKER ROOM.  C'mon people..get with it.  I would play here all the time!

As soon as we (my new wife of 1 day) got through standing in line 45 minutes to check in, we were notified that the room we reserved FIVE MONTHS AGO was unavailable. So, they were happy to take our money but couldn't be bothered to save our room. The options presented to us were: A. For the first night, stay in a disgusting smoking room with 2 queen beds instead of the 1 King non-smoking we booked. B. We pay another $56 per night to upgrade to a suite for the duration of our stay (3 nights)... If that isn't extortion, I'm not sure what is. Talk about putting a sour taste in your mouth right away - ridiculous. We opted for the "upgrade" because we didn't want a stinky room for ANY nights.

The suite we were put in was nice on a superficial level, but on closer inspection the curtains were ripped and had some gross stains, the living room entertainment center and TV was broken, but by far worst of all, the bed was hard as a rock, springs completely worn out, and honestly wasn't that much better than the ground. The $68 Quality Inn bed we stayed in on our return home was vastly superior. We didn't mind the loud dance music pumping out of the pool area all day, but the room came complete with a weird, annoying droning sound at night when all was quiet, like an electric can opener being operated in the room above us intermittently, on for 20 seconds, off for 5 seconds all night long. Overall, the room and facilities just looked and felt a bit tired. There is a very apparent lack of care and attention to detail here. Also, we ended up not caring for the off-strip location at all: we spent a lot of transportation money on Uber because public transportation wasn't viable from the hotel, and the hotel shuttle to the strip operates very limited hours. 

Through all the negativity, there were a few redeeming qualities to this place. Walking around to discover all the cool band memorabilia was great. Also, the restaurants seemed pretty good - we had some good meals at Culinary Dropout and Pink Taco. More importantly, when we approached the front desk about the issues we'd found, the agent actually seemed to care about the issues we'd been having and offered to refund the resort fees and the initial room upgrade charge. The refunds haven't hit my account yet, so that promise remains to be seen. Still, it would have been far superior service to just comp us the upgrade in the first place instead of extorting us right when we stepped through the door. 

The million dollar question: would we come back? The answer: absolutely not. Between the room extortion insanity, rock hard bed, off the strip location, lack of attention to detail, erasure of first-time mystique, and tired atmosphere, there is simply no reason to. I'd vastly rather stay at just about any major chain hotel out there and save money instead of the Hard Rock. Next time we'll be doing things differently - namely a much nicer hotel on the strip.
It second trip was freakin amazing. It's now one of our favorite places to go. We refuse to stay anywhere else while in Vegas. Such a good time. Thanks, hard rock! :)
Amazing all around.. went to a ball there and it was the best time in my life, and I'm 35 years old, that's saying something..... If you visit Las Vegas you must go to the hard rock, it's a must

If you like to smoke, stay here. If you don't, avoid staying here.

This casinos is pretty big with table minimums starting at 15. There are plenty of slots around and lots of dealers at the tables. 

We picked a non smoking room but yet it still smells like smoke? I would just avoid staying here if you hate smoking like I do. I can stand it in the casino because it's required but not when I'm trying to sleep.

The 24-7 cafe is good as well. Remember to sign up for the players card to get their steak special at 7.77 with purchase of drink. 

There are two different self parking garages which work out great! Overall 3*, I just can't get over the fact that it smells like smoke in my room when I'm trying to sleep.

I really like this casino. I think the vibe is young and trendy and I always feel cool when I'm here. It's kind of similar to the Planet Hollywood, but much smaller. We played craps here with Amare Stoudamire and Rick Ross like it was no big deal. Definitely a good stop even though it's off the strip.

We pulled in on Saturday morning and valet was a mess. We got in line and didn't move for 5 minutes, got cut off a few times, and ultimately decided to go into the parking structure instead. The first few floors were crazy, but the 6th floor was nice and empty, so parking ultimately wasn't too bad.

Time for check-in. We received an e-mail earlier in the morning that said we could do early check-in for an additional fee, but declined and took our chances and tried checking in at 1 instead of 3. We got in line, waited for about 20 minutes, and were told that our suite was not ready quite yet. No biggie, since we were a bit early, there were a ton of people, and it was a holiday weekend. We were told to check back in 30-45 minutes.

Went back at around 1:45-2, and were told that the room was still not ready and to give them about another hour. Okay, so maybe were were a little ambitious, so we decided to go back at 3, which was the standard check-in time. 

We decided to have some drinks at the bar near check-in and do some exploring while we waited. The bar was nice, drinks were good, and enjoyed looking at the memorabilia displayed throughout the hotel.

3:00 rolls in and we try again, for the third time. Wait in line again, and are told that the room is still not ready and to come back between 4 and 5!. My friends and I are now getting impatient, and wish the front desk would have just told us a realistic return time instead of having to go back so many times...and check in was supposed to be at 3!! "Ok, FINE", we're all thinking, "let's go to the pool". 

We finally decide to check our things in and go to the pool. So nice! there are a few different pools to choose from, beach pool that has sand in it, DJ, and tables for beer pong. We grabbed a bucket of shock tops, and my boyfriend paid $15 for a bottle of water (ridiculous). It's now 4:30 and we all just want to go to the room and get settled in. We find our other friend at a cool bar inside the hotel (with a sweet chandelier made of chains) and the bar tender there made us some drinks while we decided what to do next. He was so nice and we regretted not getting his name!

Finally, at 4:30, 2 of my friends decide to go back and try checking us in (for the 4th time), where they are told, AGAIN, that the room is still not ready. This time, the concierge was being really rude to them and to another party who was going through the same problem. I understand that it was a crazy weekend and he had probably been hounded on by other customers, but we were being nice and understanding (i mean, come on, after waiting for almost 4 hours) and to be disrespected by an employee representing Hard Rock was now the icing on the cake, the deciding factor that we would probably never be back. We then asked to speak to the manager, and the rude concierge said something like "so you want me to pull him away from another customer just so he can talk to you?" Shocked and feeling like this must be some kind of joke, we said yes. One of the managers finally came to talk to us and was able to help us out. We told him the situation and said that while we understood it was a busy weekend, we felt like we were being understanding and that the concierge really just sent us over the edge. He apologized and thanked us for our patience (since some other customers were yelling and cussing in the lobby out of frustration) and agreed to get us into the Body English nightclub with 5 free drinks and a $50 comp to our room. Finally, we get to go to our suite!

Sunday comes along and it's a disaster to get into the pool area. We go to the 2nd floor to get in, and the security guards say "you either have to go back to your room or downstairs" rudely and without explanation. We get sent around to 4 different areas, and each time, the security guards would tell us something different. We just wanted to go swimming in the regular pool :( Our friends got in but couldn't take their bags because it was "too big" (didn't see a sign and were not told about bag regulations) AND we saw 2 other girls get in with their own alcohol. There was a HUGE line to get to the pools, and heard there was some sort of stampede of people at one point because of a fight or something. Someone in the elevator told us that some girls had waited 4 hours to get in and got kicked out shortly after. After about an hour or two of being given the run around, we finally get in. The pool was nice but we are all just so over it and regretting not having stayed at our regular hotel.

Overall, staying at Hard Rock was a mistake. I know it was a holiday weekend, but things were so unorganized and chaotic, it was incredible. The staff just seemed unprepared and rude, and our party felt ripped off for having paid almost a grand for our suite (which may not be a lot, but it is to us!). It was nice of the manager to get us into the club with free drinks, but we were never given that $50 comp to our room. We will not be back.

I have been to this hotel so many times but have never stayed here, so when I got an amazing deal through Orbitz I was in! We were able to stay in the brand new Paradise Tower over a weekend for $48 per night. A seriously big score! The tower had only been open for a week or so and our room was brand new and beautiful. The decor is kind of goth meets Vegas. The bathroom had double sinks and a huge shower with a rain shower head. Our room had a great view and overlooked the pool. The best part of the room was the bed. It was a big puffy white marshmallow of luscious sleepy dreaminess. I had the best night's sleep I have ever had in a Vegas hotel in that amazing bed.

Checking in was a breeze and the desk clerk was friendly, efficient, and customer focused. The gift shop has a great selection of micro brews for $2.50 a bottle including Dogfish 60 minute IPA and Full Sail IPA...which made me a very happy camper!

Our only disappointment came when trying to eat in the hotel. Mr. Lucky's 24\/7 supposedly has a $9.99 AYCE prime rib dinner, but the two days in a row we tried to order it we were told they were out of prime rib. We asked for the manager who made excuses (none of which seemed valid or even plausible) and on top of everything was a serious unaccommodating jerk. One of the nights we tried to eat at Pink Taco but when we entered at 8:30 pm (in Vegas mind you) we were told they were closed. The hostess, who was very sweet and apologetic, explained they had been slow all night and the management was closing them down early. I am not sure what is up with the restaurant management at the Hard Rock but clearly they need to up their game and be more customer focused.

Overall the experience was great and I would gladly stay here again.

The hotel was nicely remodeled. My only issue is with the fool\/ crook (Fredrick) at the front desk during check in. I booked through booking.com, all my expenses including the resort fees were already charged by booking.com, I tried explaining this to this fool and he said no that's not correct and he proceeded to charge me this amount over again despite me already pre-paying it. The entire interaction was very tense, he seemed like he hated his job and the customer in front of him. I called accounting 1 day after check out and they acknowledged his error and credited me back everything. Buyer please be aware. I'll never stay at this place again.

So we experienced probably one of the worst experiences for a Vegas hotel, and definitely the worst as Hard Rock hotel goes. 

I've come to expect great rooms and service from Hard Rock in the past. There was a serious sand storm in Vegas the day we arrived. When we entered our room, the balcony door had  a defect that basically couldn't stop the flow of air and sand to come into the room. The room also had 3 butterflies flying around and pretty nasty vomit stain in the bathroom. 

I called front desk to have my room changed but they told me they were completely booked. Funny thing, the front desk clerk offered me an upgrade for 25 dollars when we were checking in....so yeah they had rooms. 

So yeah, pretty crappy experience. Will never recommended.

The quality of your stay here is 100% based on your reasons for visiting. If you're looking for a romantic getaway with your significant other, hell to the no. But if you're looking to go HAM on your liver, lungs, libido and wallet... Hard Rock is your huckleberry. The pool party at REHAB is basically a 21st Century version of a Greek bathhouse, ripe with singles looking to mingle. The casino itself is fun enough and there's a cavalcade of live performers who come through here every month. But if you're in town for work and the company puts you up, I would ask for a room at the end of the hall, so you only have to share one wall with the partygoers next door. The rooms are nice, mine have always been as advertised, but the smell of cleaning product is so strong that I often wonder what the hell happened before I arrived.

This is a totally mixed review for this hotel\/casino.  First of all, the rooms in the newer HRH tower are amazing.  Clean, huge, comfy.  Bathrooms and shower are also awesome.

Since they have remodeled the casino, it's also freshened up the entire place.  The food here at HRH is also amazing.  

For you sushi fans, you can't go wrong with NOBU.  Pink Taco will take care of any of your mexican cravings, and Lucky's will solve any 24 hour craving you may have.  

As far as gambling goes, I have always done well here.  Multiple hand pays, and the video poker machines have always paid well.

Where this hotel falls short is the way they treat their players.  Their players club is an absolute joke, and the hosts are very rude and inconsiderate.  They treat their players like total shit.  Their comps are a joke and getting anything comped is always a chore unless you've lost 5 figures.  For this reason, I will not stay here anymore.

Lots of other options closer to the strip and in the middle of everything.

WOW!  I never realized how many cool suites and penthouses  the Hard Rock Hotel had!  We stayed in the Stones Penthouse Suite and a friend of ours stayed in one of the pool villas - both were unique in their own ways - and very, VERY cool.  

You can't find other suites like these in Las Vegas.  In my opinion, the luxury standard has gotten some of the strip resorts caught up in buying ikea-quality furniture made to look fancy - I don't like it.  However, Hard Rock, keeps it real.  The Stones Penthouse Suite (look at the photos I posted) is fit for a rocker, or just anyone who wants to feel like they're on a serious FUN Vegas vacation.  High ceilings, crystal lights, on-queue music upon entering, massive 60inch+ televisions, oh yah.... the list goes on.  Probably one of the best suites to host a party in. 

Our friend got a pool villa located on the second floor.  This suite featured a private outdoor courtyard, kinky artwork, and a path leading to a private pool (with cabanas) for all villa guests.  I felt like it was his own tropical hideout.  

Both suites were amazing in appearance.  The Stones Penthouse is FLAWLESS;  the furniture looked brand new, and the room was spotless.  I had to call the operator to ask for help with the massive television's remote control - this thing is no joke.  She was kind and helpful which I appreciated.  

I really hope to be back someday!!!

Note:  If you're debating staying here because it isn't on the strip - don't let that turn you away.  They have free shuttles that run all day.

Eric was the best pool guy there is he was awesome I asked him for everything and he delivered!! Way better then the girl
Security guards!!!

I've stayed at the Luxor and mirage (don't get me started on the Mirage after having the worst experience there) but I definitely thought the Hard Rock Hotel was my kind of place. Great music selection blasting out all day, gorgeous pool equipped with fake sand, so what if it's fake I still liked it. Nice clean rooms ( a bit on the dark side due to the red & black colour scheme) with a lovely big walk in shower. This place was a bit like the place to 'be seen' in with ample show off's etc but if you dismiss this it's actually quite a fun hotel with a young gorgeous tattood crowd prancing about everywhere.
The hotel is not near the strip and is a taxi ride away or the hotel provides a free shuttle service hourly to drop you on the strip.
The hotel itself swings either way as some of the party we were with hated everything about it so not everyone's cup of tea. If you like rock music, fun times and a young crowd head here, but if you like to be in bed by 9 so you're up early to see all the sights on the strip and wake to a buffet breakfast and get a relaxing time then this won't be for you

Hard Rock.
Exactly what you expect when you go to a Hard Rock. 
Reliable bar food and delicious mixed drinks, a spunky waitress and songs that are apparently "rock" songs.  
Grilled chicken sandwich hit the spot but the Pineapple Coconut Mojito was the prize winner for sure.

Not impressed. 
Rooms have no refrigerator or microwave. 
Rooms too far from elevators 
Confusing where to checkin & parking
Sink in bathrooms were small 
No shower caps 
No place for hand towels 
Facial soap was awful
No shuttle to the strip
Won't stay here again

We are vegas regulars and have stayed at many hotels in town. I have to say this is the first time I can't wait to check OUT. First we arrived and at check in, 2 people on front desk, clearly understaffed for the over 15 guests waiting in line. 
The atmosphere is pretty cool so we let the over 45 mins to check in slide.
We got our room, and some nights I like to stay in, order a movie, or in this case watch Game of Thrones. To my surprise neither was possible. Movie we ordered didnt work, they send a guy to fix it, ended up not working either. Other guy comes in, we could finish the movie a night later, only to find tv didnt work either on some channels. 
I have long hair, asked for an extra towel, they bring them just to have them taken away hours later by the cleaning service along with a couple of bags of snacks we left over the vanity. I still cant get over the fact they took my chocolates 
The the danger of all dangers, shower was broken, almost fell on my foot. Again, someone came and "fixed" it.  I take a shower, only to find water goes all our of the door through a gap that is supposed to be covered by some sort of plastic. Almost fell down on the freaking slippery floor. I tell the cleaning lady who was outside and she plainly tells me that they take the plastic out of the showers because it is so hard to clean and they better take it out. Who cares, right?
We leave the toom and ask them to come clean it, specially cause the floor is soaking wet, and when we come back the same soaked towel mat and slippery floor are waiting for us with a freshly made bed  
We still had a couple of nights left on our reservation so we went to try and talk to the manager to see what we could do about it, but he was too busy to come out and address our concerns. 
Too bad such a cool hotel has been the worst experience I have had in Vegas ever. 
Just as an FYI, we try to stay at different hotels here to try them all out, we have been to Venetian, Palazzo, NYNY, Polo Towers,Luxor, even Hooters and the Plaza amongst others and I have never ever had this bad service. We are changing hotels for the remaining of our trip here, but I don't want this to happen to anyone else specially on their vacations, cause it is not a cheap hotel and being so far from the strip, it MUST have a better service to charge what they charge. Many many better options by far less prices many on the strip. Very dissapointing. Hope they pay attention before someone injures themselves badly to the shower issues.

meh. Came here for the AEE and was disappointed. I haven't been in the actual rooms here so take my review lightly if you're planning on booking a stay here. 

Hard Rock is about a 5 minute cab ride from the strip. Not too bad. The casino area is so yuck. Dim lights create that concert type feel which I don't have a problem with. However, the AIR... OMG. The cigarette smoke is the equivalent to LA smog during rush hour cramped into this itty bitty space. If I were ever to die from second hand I would blame it on my visit here. If everyone was smoking weed I'd have a contact high in like 3 seconds.

That was a huge turn off. They have a Pink Taco here, pretty cool, along with a starbucks and some cool little shops. Nothing really stands out if you're just planning to stop by and see what's going on.

DO NOT BE FOOLED WITH THE CHEAP SUMMER RATES.

1. Loud construction going on right now. Half the casino floor is gutted down so very few tables + slots available to play.

2. Limited access to pool. Okay so I was really excited to check out this hotel for their oh so popular paradise pool. checked in on a Sunday and they tell me there is no discounted price for hotel guests on cover charge for the beach party. What?? Ok... So I let that go. Decided to skip Rehab that day and decided to go next day.Came back the next day and half the paradise pool was closed and the breathe pool was also closed! So much for a pool experience 

3. Sports book staff were VERY disrespectful! Went to place a bet, and because "their computer system is down" they wouldn't verify and cash out my winnings. Their staff was very smug about the situation and gave no other explanation about how we could claim my money. That is just SAD for a casino.

4. 80% of the staff I dealt with were very rude. They were smug, defensive and have a "Go figure it out yourself" attitude. They look miserable and just a sad representation of the facility. A few of the security, the housekeeping staff, and bartenders at the pool were the only few who knew how to deal with customers. Everyone else was completely rude. Oh and they messed up one billing at the front desk! hah they got me on a good run around about what they were charging on my card after checkout and the best answer of one of the front desk staff was "oh i don't know, maybe something went wrong?" And shrugged. I had to go back an hour later at my frustration to deal with someone else who took care of the situation.

Overall besides the pool (which really Isn't all that great, I've seen better) and the restaurant "culinary drop out" this place should just close down because that's what they're heading for at this rate. 

I've never had such an  unpleasant hotel experience here in vegas! I've tried every hotel from Wynn, Palazzo, Ceasars (love) Bellagio, and even luxor, New York New York and the works...and this is my far the worst. 

I got upgraded to top floor of the "newer" paradise tower. It's a joke. My phone was broken for one, and not enough toiletries and towels were provided for TWO guests.

I feel like I've wasted my money on this place. NEVER AGAIN. 





.

First let me start with the positive:
1.  The rooms in the HRH Tower were AMAZING..AMAZING. Be sure to ask for a higher floor though because we were on the 7th floor and we could hear and feel the thumping of Vanity Nightclub, nothing crazy but if you were on a lower floor it would be a problem.
2.  Out of all of the casinos we went to the cocktail waitresses at the Hardrock were the best and most efficient.  We were never without a drink.

Problems:
1.  On New Years Eve we went to the Bell Desk to arrange for a limo to take us to dinner that night.  We really weren't sure if it would be possible due to the time we made the request and the fact that it was NYE.  However, we were assured it wouldn't be a problem and to come down at 5:30 and our limo would be waiting.  We come down at 5:30...no limo.  The bell staff present had no clue about our limo.  Lucky enough (or so we thought) a limo pulled up to the HRH entrance to let guests off.  The Bell Staff was kind enough to arrange for us to take that limo.  We should have know we were in for an interesting ride when the limo driver started driving off when our party was still getting into the limo.  Nevertheless, we all got in and on our way we went.  About 5 minutes after we left the Hard Rock our limo driver informed us that he would need to drop us off at the Flamingo Hotel instead of Ceasars because he had an emergency.  Trying to be understanding, we agreed.  However, as we approached the limo driver got nervous because they started shutting down the Strip and he pulled off into a side street\/alley and made us get out..  So we walked in our party dresses and heals (it was freezing cold that night).

While I understand that the what the Limo Company does is not the problem of the Hard Rock, the whole problem started because the Bell Person didn't make the arrangements.

When I complained the next day the desk clerk looked at me with sheer horror on her face.  She was very kind and helpful and directed me to the right people for my complaint.  I got a call from the Head of the Bell Desk telling me that the person I spoke with wasn't actually a Bellman, but rather a limo concierge service (from my understanding not really employed by the Hard Rock) and thus I should call those people.  At this point I would like to point out that the person I spoke to was standing behind the Bell Desk, doing Bellman type things, was dressed EXACTLY LIKE A BELLMAN...but apparently, I should have known that he wasn't a Bellman.  Frankly, if you dress like a bellman, act like a bellman, and stand where a bellman stands (and the hotel knows this and condones this) your a freaking bellman and thus, the Hard Rock is responsible for your actions.  However, the Manager of the Bellmen simply passed the buck.  Thankfully, the manager of the front desk got back to me and gave us a $50 credit to our room, didn't offer one to the rest of our party even though they got stranded too.

2.  When we arrived at the Hard Rock it was still very early in terms of checking in, which we fully understood.  So they told us they would text us when our room was ready. Great, that is awesome...or so I thought.  We made ourselves busy, gambling and exploring.  Several hours later around 2pm we decided to check on the status of our room, no not ready yet and assured us we would get a text.  Finally 3:15 came around (check-in starts at 3pm) we decided to just double check on our room as we were really tired from traveling.  Sure enough our room was ready.  Thank god we asked about our room because we got a text at about 8:30 p.m. telling us our room was ready...oiee...thank god we didn't wait for that text to come (5 hours after check-in was supposed to start).

3.  When we originally booked the rooms, we put both room deposits on my card to make things a little easier.  We were assured that we could move one of the deposits to another card when everyone arrived at the hotel.  And so we did just that.  The front desk clerk assured us that the deposit I had made would be credited back to my credit card within 2 weeks, and the other person would be charged for the room deposit.  GREAT, easy enough.  Well, we got out final bill and everything seemed fine.  The other party got a bill for $550 with no explanation as to why it was so high...it was just that way.  2 weeks came and went...no credit.  Finally, I called and was told they had no record of our request and that the other party was charged only $354 instead of $550.  So after arguing with the person, they finally agreed to put the charges in the right card and credit me.  We shall see if this actually happens.  We are still confused why the Hard Rock's invoice said the other party would be charged $550...considering even now with the $133 charge put on their card they will now pay $484 (the correct amount for the rooms).

The Hotel looks nice and the rooms are great, but they have major Customer Service problems.

Excellent service. Would gladly come here again. They upgraded our room without us asking and it was a great surprise! Very clean, room service did a great job. No complaints at all. Parking still free at this hotel. Pool that you don't have to pay for is clean and great for lounging. When we were leaving my boyfriend had a stat fax that he had to return to work and at checkout they printed out the document for us at the front desk for free! Internet is fast and also free. Don't waste your time shopping around for a better place, it's not worth it for the price.

Horrible... I arrived at three and its 5 pm and my room still isn't ready ( I was told twice that it'd be "ready in 15 min") ... The registration employees were less than accommodating... I will never stay at HRH again...

Stay here if it is the summer and you want to use the pool or are going for a specific concert.  Do not stay here if you want to gamble or have options outside of your hotel.  We stayed in the HRH all suites tower which is a good amount of space for the price & the beds were comfortable, other than that there is nothing to recommend about the room.  I have no idea how this is a new tower.  The couches were badly stained, some light switches do nothing, the iPod dock took a full day to load the information from my iPod, the TVs were so bad that we could not see anything when the back ground was dark (we had a movie refunded because of this), they charge $20 a day for a refrigerator, in a suite.  In the poker room you were lucky to find one table running, yet for some reason they think they should run 1\/3 games as if they are a popular destination.  The famed bar in the middle of the casino was empty and certainly has lost any reason to be considered a good place to meet women, the whole place was dead on super bowl weekend.  One last positive, the food is really good here.  Culinary drop out is great & the 24 hour diner is also very good.

I live here and have never been treated as badly anywhere as I was treated here. I can go on for days telling you how bad it is but please just trust me. I can give u many more places to stay that are actually on strip and cheaper. I left there crying and I'm no crybaby. The bell captain got so asinine with me I wanted to spit on him. Nothing worked. Mostly everything was broken or closed and it takes way too long to get anyone's attention. Let alone the bartender yelled at my boy bc he wasn't making a straight line. What?! A straight line to what? Everyone there needs a hospitality class and a good strong hug from their mother. I even made a complaint on BBB and I've never done that.

I stayed at Hard Rock Hotel 4 years ago and went with a group of friends. We had a blast so just recently my fiancé and I decided to go back there to revisit some good memories. Well, after a pleasant LA to LV road trip, we were greeted to HRH telling us that they could check us in early and they would call us when our room was ready. They never called! We went back in that time frame and they said they couldn't check us in until 5 unless we wanted a smoking room. That is ridiculous to me, we had already paid and were promised an early check in. In addition to the fact that they make you pay a resort fee that includes basically nothing. Free internet which barely works. You have to pay extra to go to their pool; Rehab. $30 for girls and $50 for guys and that does not include anything except for admission.

For being located off the strip, no shopping, having to pay extra for everything and baring the chance to have your room not ready is not worth it. Sorry, HRH: Reliquary Spa is amazing (see review below), everything else-not impressed. HRH I would consider to be among the ghetto casino\/ "resorts" now.

Besides the sports book, I hardly ever feel the need to gamble in Vegas.  It's probably not for the best that I've become entirely enamored with the dealers at Hard Rock.  Even if I'm loosing money, it think it might be worth hanging out at the poker tables just to banter with them.  If someone would like to bankroll this habit or let me accessorize them while they play, I'd be more than happy to be your good luck charm.

We come to Vegas every year and every year we stay at the Hard Rock. Primarily for the ambiance and what used to be a finer smaller casino. This review is in the hotel and the hotel only. 

The rooms here are good. If you come prior to check in even 30 minutes, you will wait in line only to find out your room is not ready. You then will have to wait in another line if you want your bags kept. They have not found a way to fix this. 75 people in lines with maybe 5 clerks and 2 bag drop guys. 

We booked a King Pool View Room which might be $25\/$30 more than a normal mountain view. When we finally did get a call that our room was ready we were already out. So we came back late 6pm or so. Waited in line again to get our key and off to the room we went, dog tired. I immediately wanted to see the Pool View only to see the roof and a mountain. 

I called the front desk and had to hang up and call back because I was on hold for literally 18 min. I explained that we were given the wrong room and the manager on the other end said "you did not specify a room type". I was furious because I am looking down at my iPad with my confirmation on it. "King Pool View" and I even booked the room directly from their website. Now, knowing that there is a difference in price for these two rooms, how could a manager flat out lie about the room type booked?  Would he\/she not know from simply looking at the price paid. I already pre-paid the first night to guarantee my room type. Then he tells me he has nothing available in the pool side. Awesome!

This review is for the hotel and the hotel only. Standing water in the shower, noisy hallways, uncomfortable bed and a regular that was just not take care. Levels me disappointed and cannot rate any higher than a 2.

Changed to a 1 - Upon checkout I had to speak to a manager (Evan) because what the manager told me about crediting us the difference in the rooms booked was NOT reflected on the bill. Evan, the manager at the front desk basically said "tough, if you don't know who you talked to, here is the number to our accounting dept". Done staying here now. Which is a shame because I do like the ambiance.

We stayed at the Treasure Island for two nights before staying at the Hard Rock for two nights(not the tower suites). I recommend the TI way more than the Hard Rock. The Hard Rock hotel it's self is pretty cool but once your done checking it out, there isn't much to do around the hotel. They do have a shuttle that goes to the strip but it stops running at 5pm. My biggest complaint is about the rooms. Although the bed is very comfortable, the walls are SO THIN you can hear people talking in the hall. You could probably hear them whispering in the hall. Still, that's nothing compared to the airplane noise! You would think when a hotel locates themselves underneath the flight path of take off and landing, they would go the extra mile to sound proof the rooms, this is NOT the case. The TI on the other hand is VERY sound proof. There was also a septic smell that came from our bathroom periodically, which was sickening. Also, unlike the TI, they don't equip the room with a mini fridge, they give you a mini bar full of insanely expensive selections. The curtains attempt to block out the light but they still let some through. The TI has AMAZING black out curtains! Overall, I will never stay at the Hard Rock Hotel again. It's cool to check out but I do not recommend staying there.

Wow has HRH Vegas changed!  Very disappointing experience in May.  Going back 4-5 years I used to frequent this hotel\/casino\/resort with some frequency.  I think it must be under new management or ownership or both, because while I used to enjoy and frequent this locale, it no longer will be someplace I come back to.  I go to vegas 5x a year.

1) New tower.  The rooms don't really seem any larger than the old rooms, and there are no closets (just wardrobes), and there is way too much dead space because of the size of the bathroom.  Nice look and feel but poor on the functionality.  Also the room sound system only worked 1 of the 5x I tried to use it.  The other 4x it said "system temporarily unavailable while updating the system."

2) There were massive design flaws in this upgraded "tower".  They didn't design in enough sound proofing for the walls and windows.  You can hear the pulsating music and base of the nightclub as you are trying to go to sleep at 230am, as well as the nocturnal activities of your next door neighbor.  The curtains don't "black out" the windows, so you are fighting the sun at 7am.  Come 830am the massive pool music system is up for sound check and running so you can't sleep because the room is shaking from the pool sound system.  I know what the HRH is known for, and I expect loud music but I expect to not have it destroy my ability to sleep.  At any hour.  Isn't that part of the vegas "deal"?  Party hard and sleep in?

3) The whole pool set up has become ridiculous.  You have to wait 45-120 minutes in line to get your wrist band depending if it's a Sat\/Sun to go to the pool.  I don't pay 300+ a night to wait 2 hours to go to the pool.  And to pay 75 dollars as a hotel guest to go to the pool.  It used to be free for hotel guests to attend Rehab or some nominal charge, and the wrist bands were issued at the front desk at check in.  No crazy lines, no crazy expenses.  This is insane the way it's set up now.

4) Are you ready for this?  A pool chair now has a 100 dollar food and bev min.  For REHAB sunday that jumps to 500 dollars.  As a result, 85+ percent of the beach chairs were unoccupied and everyone was sitting on towels draped over concrete.  Somehow I don't feel I should be forced into choosing between being extorted or sitting on concrete given the Rack Rates at the HRH.  I would obviously have skipped waiting in line 90 minutes plus paying 75 dollars as a hotel guest if anywhere it was mentioned on the web site or marketing materials that a chair was 500 min food and bev.  I would have saved my time and money and done something else.  Wasting time is one thing, wasting money is another, and wasting both is inexcusable

5). Really cheap on the comps.  Look, I don't play 5-10 dollar hands, and I don't play for 15 minutes.  I play hours a day at a respectable average bet.  Most casinos vie for my business and it's reflected in the sizable comps.   The comp rate here is as bad as the Venetian \/Wynn.  And with much fewer rollers or high rollers.  And not a whale in sight.  How does this make any sense?

HRH, I like your scene, and I like your brand, but you really must fix these items to get another dollar of my money...  As usual Lucky's Diner was great, but that wasn't enough to save the experience!

This is a very nice casino to spend your Vegas trip. 

During the week the rooms are super cheap. Mine was $37 a night plus the "resort fee" which adds another twenty bucks. The rooms are nice and each one has a different theme. Mine was for the movie The Fugitive. My friends theme was the mafia and they had a bunch of gangster shit on the walls and in the table. The beds are comfortable. The bathroom is nice and it has a jacuzzi. Room service is incredibly fast. I have never ordered room service in Vegas and gotten it in less than an hour (an hour is actually pretty good). The meal I ordered at HR got to my room in 20 minutes.

The pool, Rehab, is set up to look like a beach with sand and free lounge chairs. Other casinos (Planet Hollywood) make you rent a daybed or cabana. Hard Rock does it for free. The pool also has a lazy river, a water slide and swim up blackjack. The cocktail waitresses are all really hot and they come by as frequently as you need them.

The casino has all the same stuff you will find everywhere else - blackjack, craps, roulette, slots, baccarat, war, all of those Asian games like Pai Gow and three card poker. The minimum bets here are lower than the casinos on the strip.

Be sure to check out Pink Taco. The food is outstanding. They also have a tattoo shop, so don't get too drunk or not everything that happens in Vegas will stay in Vegas.

Very nice stay at the Hard Rock this week. I was weary based on the hit or miss reviews but must say the HRH stepped up. 
The Good- stayed mid week (wed-fri w living social deal) and upgraded to the new HRH Tower which is a must if you want a nicer experience. Check in was easy. 
Room was fantastic! 10th floor view of pool and strip and totally sound proof! 
Cool audio system in the room for playing music. GIANT bathroom and shower. Beds were super comfortable. 
The HRH Tower is nicer and more chill than the others and even the pool is more mellow which we liked. Crazy town pool just on the other side for easy access. 
Easy to grab a taxi to the strip for $10. 
Pink Taco was solid for lunch and we sat pool side. 
Fitness center and wifi included in the resort charge of $18\/day. Both were good.  

Not-so-good- Need taxi to get to strip so factor that in. Housekeeping wasn't very thorough, ice machine didn't work on first day, etc. Minor irritations and the only thing that kept us from giving 5 stars. 
Take Home- Great stay at a great price but highly recommend the new HRH Tower if you want quality, other Towers if you want to just party. And of course, epic people watching at no extra charge!

Pros:

- Decor is excellent, like the rest of the Hard Rock.
- Comfortable chairs
- In my experience during two tournaments, the dealers were friendly and knowledgeable (accurate), and also there were lots of inexperienced players (one didn't know you could check!)

Cons:

- Cheap playing cards (papery)
- Uncomfortable felt (hard, no "give")
- Tournament structure suffers from too many levels early, too few levels late

Personally, overall I would much rather play poker elsewhere until they get some reasonable quality cards and felts.  This is a peeve of mine in poker rooms.

Hotel cleanliness is horrible. Customer service is not good. I booked a suite in the HRH towers. I paid extra to have a premium view. When I arrived, my view was of a parking structure for big rigs, my carpet was not steam clean( which caused a horrible odor), furniture was run down an appeared to be old, trash was under my dresser, bathroom mirror was dirty, and worst of all, my toilet had a poop stain. Once I seen the dirty toilet, I called front desk to ask for a new room. Unfortunately, at the time I arrived, HRH could not accommodate my needs. They offered to have my room serviced.  I was fine with that, and decided after my trip I would contact the Hard Rock to follow up on the cleanliness and my poor view that I paid extra for. I ended up staying an extra night and booked a room in the  Casino Towers. I found trash in the bathroom around the toilet.

I got home and contacted customer service. A rep Janice contact me and apologized for the trouble.She offered me to come back with a discounted rate. I was disappointed to find out I would have to pay the same amount of money to stay there again. I advise her the figures she provided were no discount as it was what I paid last time. I expressed my concern and disappointment. The rep Janice never contacted me back. 

I'd recommend booking elsewhere.

So disappointed. On a map it looks like the hotel is a mere 2 blocks from the strip. Nope, it's 1 mile away. Our room was in Paradise Tower. 
1. Bed skirt actually had dirt tracks of where people dangle their legs before getting out of bed.
2. Trash under the desk
3. Bathroom floor had hard water stains that were not wiped up
4. TV remote only had 2 working buttons: power and volume LOL
5. Lamp switch broken so no desk light
 
Needless to say we left after only being there 13 hours.

This review is for the HRH *room*, not the overall hotel and casino. 

Got a Groupon for a 2-night weekday stay $41\/n. Seems cheap but of course, the friggin place charges $22 resort fees per night so it ends up being regular price that you could get at another hotel on the strip on weeknights. Booo. 

Pros:
- Standard Tower King room is spacious. 
- Can open windows for fresh air into room
- Soft bed and pillows


Cons: 
- Resort fee $22\/n (boooo!)
- No bathroom fan anywhere in any room in the entire hotel! You better just suck it up with the smells! 
- Either lights by the TV didn't work or they didn't have any switch to turn them on. We kept searching and did not find any way to turn them on. We called front desk and they said they were going to send someone to take a look. No one came. Great customer service!
- The TV remote didn't work! I keep pressing the Power button and pointing it from all directions towards the TV and...NOTHING. You'd think there's an alternative way on the TV itself to turn it on manually...NOTHING. The hell?
- Room looks a bit worn out.
- We requested for mountain view, but we got this crappy view with the mountains far far away and instead we were looking straight down to walls and pipes. So romantic.

I will NOT stay here again. It never crosses my mind to stay here - only because of the Groupon. It's off the strip (about a mile or so) so there's no convenience whatsoever. For this they should step up their game in making the stay as comfortable as possible for guests.
This once was va very cool off the strip Casino, with a great crowd & vibe. Now they have made massive expansions , cheesy slot machines , changed staff and is a lame scene

0 stars, it is very ghetto. If you don't want to get robbed or get into a fight DON'T STEP FOOT IN THIS CASINO!! The staff is unprofessional and rude!! For the type of crowd that go to this place, there should be secure in every section of this place. It's scary and very ghetto!

I'm sorry to dissapoint other readers but this now my least favorite casino in Las Vegas.   The place wasn't very crowded and I  can only guess why.   Staff was pleasant enough but we never got service in the sports book area.   So we meandered over to the bar.  It wasn't very crowded.   We ordered 2 beers.   $24.  Short pours, too. They were craft beers,  good,  but no reason for them to be that expensive.    Lesson learned,   be sure to ask for drink pricing before accepting your drink.   The HR is totally taking advantage of customers by leveraging the American custom of ordering a drink without confirming the price when the custom is based upon the premise that drinks and cocktails are a reasonable price in an establishment.  I didn't see anything else special about this place except the rock and roll themed video slots.  This place is off the strip and a long way to get there do you will have to drive or take a cab or bus. .   But they may have good room rates and you could have a good time there.   It is not a casino to just stop by and visit,  though.   There are a a couple really tasty restaurants and reasonably priced restaurants across the street.  Try those out.

I stayed at the Hard Rock this week for the first time.  I was in las Vegas on business for a total of 5 nights.   I stayed in the casino tower.   My view was great.  My bed was comfortable & I was very happy to have a door that opened to a ledge so that I could let fresh air in.  

Everything was fine up until Friday night.  There was a special event being held at their club, Vanity.  I was in bed by 11 since I had to work at 8:30 the next morning.  Around midnight I wake up to the sound of music blasting & a DJ's voice yelling on a microphone.  Had I had earplugs with me, I don't think it would have helped because it was so unbelievably loud.  By 2:00 am I was on the verge of tears because I was so tired.  I called the front desk to find out when it would end.  The person who answered my call had a very, "you're S.O.L. attitude".  He told me. There was an event & I basically had to deal with it until 3:00am when it would stop.  I just can't wrap my head around the fact that this hotel expects its guests to put up with this.  

If you are planning to stay at the hard rock, I strongly suggest looking ahead to see if their clubs will be hosting any special events in their clubs while you are there.

Why I Like the Hard Rock Hotel
by Myke R.

Why I like the Hard Rock Hotel is because girls here are pretty. When I come here I feel pretty because boys are emo and emo boys are supposed to be cool. But I can beat up emo kids because they like to cry. I like to pull emo kids hairs. Hard Rock has a small casino. It is round shaped. I never win here. But I like to play. Bam Margera had a bachelor party here and he got messed up. That night I won 300 dollars. I was not messed up but Bam was. I like the pool here. There are lots of pretty girls who are easy and wear thongs. You can see them on hardrockhotel.com at the pool cam. Some of them are sluts. That's ok because sluts are people too. The pool is very very nice. It has sand. We have rehab in summers. But I work. So I never get to go. But the pool is big and you can see it online. It smells good. I like Mr Lucky's 7.77 special with steak and shrimp. It tastes good. 
I also like Simon's Kitchen. It's good too. Love Jones gets me feeling special in my "down there". Pink Taco is good too. But it's boring. I like looking at pink taco. There's lots to look at. You guys are dirty. 
The end.

Unfortunately I wasn't too impressed with the HR overall. It's pretty far from the Strip, so we had to take taxis everywhere. The room was OK, nothing spectacular. I have a few complaints about the bathroom: 1. no fan (at least no working fan - the ones you can hear), 2. the drain was not working in the shower, and 3. no hairdryer (had to call to have one brought up). 

It's a fun casino and there are a lot of things to see and do, but after staying at a few other places in Vegas, I definitely need something ON the strip. It just got to be too expensive to bounce back and forth from HR and the rest of the other casinos.

The rooms are great, the casino is cool, the Rehab pool is awesome but the nighttime employees suck! They have no people skills; they're rude, not friendly and expect a tip...really? I'm not cheap, at all but, I really had a hard time tipping these folks. Remember, don't feel that you have to tip just because you're in Vegas. If the service is bad, then save your cash for someone that really deserves it.

I stayed recently for two nights with a few friends. I love the rooms. The decor had a dark and sensual vibe. The beds are comfy. The shower is amazing. The sink can hold like 20 beers. The pool was nice but kind of far from the room. There were some fine hunnies. The casino isn't large so you don't get lost. Check out was easy. Simple as that.

Oh and bring your ID when using card or else they won't serve you at the coffee shops.

I absolutely loved my stay at Hard Rock.  I flew into Vegas just to see Steve Lawler dj, which was totally off the hook.  I stroll in there 8pm on a Wednesday, so of course they had plenty of rooms available.  I got the room so cheap.....and they upgraded me to a deluxe friggin suite that overlooked the pool and the Strip!  I was buzzing off the vibe of the room, and it was already time to party at the club.  I would definitely stay here again.  They had a massive remodel and have an All-Suite tower that looks really impressive.  I love that they gaming floor is intimate and fun, unlike those at Caesar's and MGM.  Pink Taco was delicious, and the pool had a great vibe (didn't get to experience Rehab).  This place is young, hip and perfect for Vegas.

I love this place except for thecircus act you have to go through to get to the pool. Once I made my way there and got drunk I didn't care one bit. Rehab is fun, fun and more sexy fun! The rooms are nice, clean, modern contemporary. Room service wasn't terrible either. Cant wait to come back and stay again.

Husband and I were in Vegas and we ate here. Food was unbelievable!!! I'm going to attempt to post pics but since I'm stoopid they probably won't show up. Bear with me......How do you post pics? Help.....

Checked out what the Sunday Rehab Party buzz is all about on this hotel .  Nice rooms, sand pools, hot dealers, friendly staff, good music mix - house, rock, hip hop, ...  Tasty food and drinks (ie: chips & salsa, fajitas, steak tacos, margaritas) in the Pink Taco restaurant, ...
One downside is the music could get really loud (like concert level) depending on where you are at the pool party.  Just cover your ears when you pass thru those huge tower speakers.

Last time I was at the Hard Rock was when I turned 21.  Now, I'm back again because my little brother just turned 21.  See a pattern here?

Don't get me wrong, I dig this hotel. But there's something about seeing young women throw up on the casino floor, or, get carried out of shows like a sack of potatoes, that is not very appealing to me.  C'mon ladies keep it together!

You know why people are so sloppy at night though?  Because the pool is crazy.  And, it's crazy in a good way.  They play good music and the crowd is young and fun and everyone is just there to have a good time.  And, when you spend 6 hours in 100 degree heat drinking one alcoholic beverage after another, your gonna be pretty sloppy come nighttime.

The BEDS!  Omg, probably the most comfortable hotel bed I have EVER slept in.  White fluffy soft goodness. Heaven in a bed. If you get lucky enough to have a pool view the patio (not that you can really walk out on one at all) is cute entertaining.

A few things I noticed about the hotel that didn't match to my last time:
-No music in the elevators?
-No music under the water in the pool?
-A\/C in room had a cover that kept falling off - annoying
-Drain in room also made mystery burping noise

I checked out Mr. Lucky's 24\/7 (in hotel cafe open 24 hours!), the joint (inside concert venue) for the chelsea handler show, rare 120 (the new in hotel steakhouse) and body english (the hotel club).  All were VERY good and deserve their own reviews - but overall ALL the perks to this hotel rock... no pun intended.

I'll come back for sure.  The "paradise towers" addition is scheduled to open in August and I'm looking forward to seeing the next phase of this adult fun house.

This time I did come to relax and do some partying on the side. This was perfect for my solo spring break adventure. Everyone with the exception of A waitress at lucky 24\/7 has been so kind & pleasant. The staff are about hospitality & that's what you expect when you go on vacay. Got a great deal on expedia for flight & hotel. The pool is so nice & the have so many to choose from. The main pool is closed on weekends for Rehab party but there other options. Mon through fri the main pool is 21 & over so no kids to annoy you. Better grown up vibe. I got a room that faced to air conditioning unit & I'm a fresh air type chick. AC hurts my face but when I open the Juliette balcony it's so loud it's super annoying. I think this is my go to spot from now on. The only other epic pools I saw online is flamingo & the age limit there when I walked in was 55& up. Not quite there yet. Until then ill stay here & sing walking around to all the awesome music blaring throughout the hotel.
Super Hotel zum Superpreis unter der Woche, aber leider ließ die Sauberkeit etwas zu wünschen übrig. Überall lag Staub und die Durchgangstüren zu den anderen Zimmern Westen richtig dreckig.

As a business guy I thought I would check hard rocks reviews....... I was floored that only have a 3 star yelp average.  I come to HRH no less then 3x times a year.....
  I stay at HRH because threat me right.
I don't ask for free stuff stuff. But they always treat me like family 

Only a 5 stars for me

My only complaint, but it ruined my sleep there is at 4am, deep into sleep I heard a buzz go off. So I had to find out what it was. 

Turns out, it was one of their cordless phones in my room. Something I would never use. Apparently, staff unplugged the phone charger. When the battery in the phone died, it starts buzzing. 

Ruined my sleep. I could had stayed at motel 6 and had a better night sleep. 

I complained to the management but they did no compensation for me at all but say they will alert the staff about what happened. 

Not a happy camper.

The Hard Rock Casino is a really fun place to play.  I really dig the youthful and energetic vibe, and of course the music is awesome.  I couldn't help but hum and sing along the background music while playing blackjack, something I'm sure everyone else at the table appreciated.  When it wasn't the music distracting my game, it was the beautiful Hell's Belles.  Good times.

I came here for my anniversary and to see if I wanted to use the hotel to host my company's convention next fall - not going to happen.

We stayed in two different rooms, a suite in the HRH tower and a "Corner King" in the Paradise tower. The phones did not work in either room, and the suite did not have an ironing board and was beat up pretty good. I went down to tell them the phone needed to be fixed, and they said someone would be right up. I stayed up until 3:00 AM waiting for it to be fixed, and they were a no-show.

I lost my valet ticket, and they said they would have to call security and make a report before I could have my car back, and this made us late and missed a $300.00 show.

But the icing on the cake, their maintenance man called my wife stupid when her credit card got stuck in the coke machine. Nobody calls my wife stupid. The manager wasn't concerned and offered me a free drink for my "trouble."

There were a few highlights, but they are not worth mentioning after they insulted my wife.

We (wife and I) have been coming to the Hard Rock since the first few months when it opened, 20 years ago. We have seen it grown from one tower and Mr. Lucky's to what it is today. Our last stay was the second week in July. It was by far the best. 

We stayed in the HRH all suite tower. We arrived around 9 p.m. at the HRH entrance and were immediately greeted by the always helpful and eager staff. At check-in they even assisted in getting the wife's electric scooter, which is kept at the main entrance.

We were given a room on the 11th floor. The room smelt clean, the a\/c was on and all the lights and tv's (2) worked . I called  for our bags and a little fridge for our meds. The bags arrived in a few minutes and the fridge within 15 mins. 

We stayed for 3 nights and four days. The food was great. The room service is always top notch. There is nothing better than sitting at the bar at Pink Taco snacking  on guacamole and chips playing video poker on a hot summer day. Or getting up early and relaxing poolside before the crowd arrives. This is a rock'n roll hotel, there will always be a little noise and loud music. During the summer the Rehab beach party plays loud pulsating music. But it ends early so you can get a good nights rest. 

With the addition of MB steakhouse, Dunkin Doughnuts, the Oyster Bar and the new and improved Fuel Café, you never have to leave the casino. It's nice to just rest in the clean room and rest. You can watch either the TV facing the bed or the one facing the couches. After a long day the extra deep and oversized tub is always welcome. The Wi-Fi is easy to connect to. 

It was a perfect vacation. No complaints at all. The service is great and the place has only gotten bigger and better over the years. The saddest part is always leaving. But we are planning to come back soon. I already booked a few days in September to see a show I have been wanting to see.  The Hard Rock is the best.  

Tip: Use your Backstage Players card to accumulate points for comps, bigger rooms and discounts or free meals. Check the website for good rates. Ask if you have enough points for comps.

I arrived late... 7PM last night. Had booked 'best room available' online through bookings.com (Huge mistake) should be called 'bookings.not!' . Asked if upgrade was available when I arrived at the hotel and for an additional 30.00 a night I got my 'upgrade' ... I didn't care about the price.. I wanted the nicest room they could provide me with. The view was beautiful!  I put my things in the room and left for dinner with my sister in the hotel  (150.00 for two at the hotel steakhouse.. No drinks) Came back to my room so tired... I went right to bed. 
Woke up this morning and in the morning light realized my room was disgustingly unsanitary and I had just slept in it...It had never been cleaned from the previous 'guest'. There was blood in my bed... I saw this first and thought I was hurt.. Realized it wasn't mine and started looking around  there was dried 'cum' on the ottoman, right next to cocaine on the floor and table(see pictures). The room was disgusting but I had clean towels and soap? I had several managers come to my room and they agreed it was disgusting! Promising to do a 'deep cleaning ' because they were 'sold out' and could not provide anything nicer. I told the manager I would be back late so they had plenty of time to clean it. When I got back my bathtub was still disgusting and at midnight had to have soap scum cleaned out. This happened in the HRH Tower... Nicest area available!!!! I hope I don't get sick :( 
Strongly recommend if you are staying here to check your room for unsanitary conditions !!! I took pictures...

Moth Man Prophesies... Moths everywhere. In the hallways. In the room. In the elevator. The worst part is that you don't find out until you're coming back to the room at night. They come from who knows where because we made sure al the doors and windows were shut and secured. Oh, and they are as big as butterflies!! 

We also came it to half eaten box of cookies from the mini bar. I'm certain the cleaning ladies ate them  because one had chocolate on her mouth as she was exiting the room next door. 

We also called the front desk, guest services, and the concierge at 9pm for assistance and no one answered. Lol horrible juuuuust Horrible

More unexpected charges and more terrible customer service resumed on the last leg of our stay at the Hard Rock.

We got the bill for our two teeny tiny mimosas, tortilla chips, and Mediterranean platter: $80... Wow...

Before leaving the hotel, we decided to check out their beautiful pool area. We swung by the bar and ordered a couple of drinks. One 12 ounce can of Shock Top: $8.00. One 12 ounce piña colada: $16.00. Bloody outrageous...

We thought we were in luck when we found any empty hot tub. Yey! Unfortunately, the hot tub didn't get more than Luke warm, but that was fine by me. It kept everyone else who came by out of it after a few minutes. 

After about forty minutes in the tub and having watched a handful of security guards walk by without issues, a police academy drop out douchebag security guard walks up and rudely tells us we can't be in here. Naturally, since there are no signs posted anywhere, I ask him why. He says this is the VIP section in an obvious degrading tone. He then stood to the side and watched us while we dried off and left the area, as if we would go on strike or vandalize things. Nonetheless, I mentioned to him that there might be something wrong with the tub as the temperature is off. He looked at me with pursed lips and shook his head. What the hell??

We jammed, being able to change in the restrooms without a security escort, and won't be back.

Ever since Peter Morton sold this place it's gone downhill. The hard rock used to be cutting edge and innovative. Now everybody else has everything they have and do it better. Rehab and the clubs and restaurants are all down. They have to be back on track hopefully soon with their new management.

I enjoyed my stay here. Going from Circus Circus the night before to here made me feel like I grew up. 

Since I was staying just one night, I got bumped up to a suite! Sweet! The room was a lot more than I needed, but I wasn't complaining. Just cursing myself for being single. The room would have been just freakin' awesome for, well, you know. It was built to have some "fun." They even have some items at the honor bar to assist you. 

The bed was really comfy.

The bathroom was huge. Especially the shower. Enough room for two... or three people. 

There were two flat screen TVs. 

The living room (?) had a huge 20x24 photo of Little Richard that I found very disturbing. I didn't want him looking over me. 

I had a great view of the pool area, which would have been like glimpsing into Heaven if it wasn't 50 degrees and windy.

Internet is extra. 

Checking in was easy and the staff was half the age of Circus Circus'.

Next time I stay in Vegas, I will definitely spend more on a hotel room. Hard Rock's didn't have the stench that Circus Circus did and didn't have what sounded like an animal running around in the room above.

Just came back from 2 nights in Vegas for my Bachelorette party and stayed here!

couple of notes:

- I wanted to take the bedding home, it was amazing! I seriously was about to leave all my clothes there and stuff the duvet in my luggage.
- We stayed in the Paradise Tower. It was nice and modern, but the decor was kinda dark, it was hard to do makeup with the full length mirrors (something important when 4 girls are staying in one room!) One thing though was that our room overlooked the pool and the music was really loud during the day so that was kinda meh. We were playing our own music, so it was like whatever, but just might be something to know.
- The pool is awesome. We went to the pool the day before Rehab officially opened and it was fun to hear all the music and their watermelon mojito was so yummy! Water was coldddd though, but I was able to get my dark tan on.
- It is a bit off the strip, but I didn't mind. I've been to Vegas enough times to not need to explore the strip so much.
- They were really accommodating and was able to find 2 rooms that was adjoining for my group of girls.
- I gambled $20 at roulette and lost. I wish the big baller that came to the table with $1k sharsies with me. lol Pay to play people. Pay to play.
- Also enjoyed the Spa Services there: http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/reliquary-spa-at-the-hard-rock-hotel-tower-las-vegas#hrid:QKgCT_MLzJBvW63K-H54NA
- HH at Pink Taco: http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/pink-taco-las-vegas#hrid:zkmRBgZp-x8_wIi-O1L3HA
- Also, never had to wait too long for a taxi.

Overall I enjoyed my couple days there. Thanks Hard Rock, you will always have a special place in my heart.

Room: bed was comfy, room was good size and view was amazing. I'd give 4 stars.
Pool: crowded but well, it's Summer. Was great to be able to choose from many pools they have and it's great. I'd give 4 stars as well.
Hotel: in general .. very nice. The front desk lady was pleasant and professional. Staff are friendly. Another 4 stars for them.

Why the 1 star?
We couldn't sleep at all! We had a very super noisy loud neighbor of what seems to be a bunch of young boys, maybe they just wanna have fun n party all nite long. But these doors and walls are thin! and they were soooo loud the whole night and morning, didn't give us even a good 5 minutes of quiteness to rest. Called front desk-security, they said they'll have someone come and talk to them but nothing changed. 
So the whole experience of staying here is pretty much ruined by not even a good 5 minute of sleep. Can't function the next day :( need a gallon of coffee.

Driving through on a road trip and it was cheap. It's nice for the price, I don't understand why people have such high expectations when they're paying $60 for a room + resort fee. That's what a motel 6 will cost you in a small town. Our room was clean and quiet. I was annoyed they didn't let us check in until 3. We got there early (along with many other groups) and unless you upgrade your room, you're room "isn't clean yet". They say they'll call when it's ready but they don't. No refrigerator in the room and it's quite a walk from the strip. We used their free shuttle service but of course it only runs until 5. If I did it again I'd pick something closer to the strip, but it's not a bad hotel for the money.

If you have the funds, get the suite. The bedroom and bathroom are very spacious and clean. I stayed in a basic room last time because it was only a two day trip and the bathrooms are older. The bed was nice though. The hallways were dirty. They should update them. The best part about this hotel is that its off the strip and the pool is amazing & relaxing. I would definitely come back to the HRH.

We stayed at the Hard Rock this past weekend...booked through Hotels tonight...got a decent rate.  
we were in the original (older) tower...i guess there are 2 newer towers...
we were able to add a 2nd night (through hotels tonight) for about $50...not bad.  Made it worth it so we could sleep in the next day (seeing that we got in the room at 6 am)
at check in (we arrived at 11 am)..they let us check in immediately for $20.  That kinda sucks since i figure if they have rooms ready they should just let us check in instead of nickle and diming us...oh well..we got into our room and got ready for our pool party at the MGM. 

room was fine...view of the pool...beds were comfy...badroom was nice.. rooms could have been cleaner (particles on the ground, major dust around the vents and I would not have touched that phone.

they have free wifi and free calls...which i didn't use either...it was really just a place to sleep.

we went to the lobby bar twice...first time had a fabulous drink..second time the same drink was quite bleh...and i noticed that the girl used some other vodka instead of the grey goose i had requested...she insisted she used grey goose but that's not what i saw with my own eyes.  we left our drinks at the counter and walked away.  

so at 6 am when we walked into the room...the vent from the AC unit had fallen all over our suitcases! omg! we were incabable of doing anything at the time and went to sleep.

talked to management after we woke up and they offered to upgrade us to a suite..but we booked and earlier flight and decided to go home...
they couldn't refund since we booked through a 3rd party...so they said they would email us a voucher for a future stay...haven't received it yet...we will see.

so pretty good hotel..
nice pool...
rooms need renovation (which they said they are doing soon)
front desk took care of business...
bartender who switched out the vodka sucked.

Check-in\/check-out was a breeze and my room was super clean and the A\/C worked!      I could've spent hours (which I did) walking around downstairs with all the rock memorabilia.  Love this place and will stay here again!

Up until this past week, I would have given the Hard Rock 5 stars.  

The hotel is clean, small, but not too small, and draws in the fun, young crowd. Good.  I like it.  The rockers stay here, and the dealers are usually very friendly.

Then there's this:

On Monday, I checked in to the Hard Rock for a business trip.  I was working until dinner time, then doing some follow up computer work in my room that night.  In preparation for this, I bought a 12 back of bud light for my co-worker and I while we worked.  As I'm walking past the security guard who stands by the elevators, I am stopped.  He tells me that outside alcohol can not be brought into the rooms.  

WHAT.  THE.  FUCK.  Where am I, Salt Lake City?

Here are my issues with this:

1.  This obviously isn't meant to keep alcohol out of the rooms.  There's a freaking mini-bar in the room.  It's clearly meant to force guests to pay inflated prices for alcohol.

2.  It wasn't like I was bringing a massive amount of booze up.  It was 12 beers for 2 guys over two days.  If anything, they should have suggested I buy more.

3.  Whose business is it what I take to and from my room?  Last time I checked, I paid so that I could have a private room, to do anything that I want, within the scope of the laws of Nevada (so basically anything).  Why is a hotel checking to see what I am doing in my room?  Bullshit if you ask me.

4.  Its embarrassing to be stopped by security, especially when they are acting like a strict grandparent.

5.  What's next?  No outside cigarettes?  No outside food?  No outside hookers?  Its a slippery slope, and I'm not letting it happen.  Remember how we gave Hitler Poland?

Bye bye Hard Rock hotel.  Until you concern yourselves with something other than where I purchased my beer, I'm going to stay elsewhere.  

By the way, I just snuck it up in a bag anyway.  You didn't win, you just pissed me off.  

THEhotel, here I come.

Just thought i would point out Upon arrival the valet & bellman was snooty the front desk guy was also a jerk.... That gave me a weird vibe but it was late & the 4 of us girls didn't let it bother us. Our room was on the 10th floor. The rooms at hard rock are all very nice no complaints at all I've stayed in the HRH tower & the casino tower I believe that is it's name, the amount if mirrors is amazing when traveling with a group of girls. The hard rock has a fun vibe to it it's not directly on the strip but that's ok with me I think it keeps the riff raff out. I just stayed at the tropicana and wished I stayed at the hard rock :( only a $20 difference with my hard rock back stage pass. Never making that mistake again.
Overall, we got a great deal here.  Modern hotel and nice room.

This location is "OK".   Rooms can be amazing for the money, not far from the strip, and great service to the airport. However, it seems to be getting outdated with the decor, check in is slow and confirming meeting space, reservations, etc. can take a very long time. Did not fell like we got good or bad service. Eating at hotel is a challenge, as restaurants are small. Definitely a good budget stay.

My fiancee and I stayed at HRH last May. We were pretty stoked since we were coming from a fresh, long winter in Montana and were looking forward to some R&R. However, customer service here does not allow for R&R. For some reason the phone became this insane issue on their part, the pools were randomly closed at the discretion of whomever. The people working in HRH are clearly annoyed by the people who frequent the resort because getting help was an issue. Overall, we will give it a 2 star because we liked the rooms and the pools (that were open). However at this point in our life, saving a few bucks is not worth the commute back and forth to the Strip, customer service was hardly good, plus the crowd is much better at several spots we found during our trip - clearly, our next time will be best spent elsewhere and this June we are headed to the Cosmopolitan. HRH failed to live up to the hype and we recognize this.

I've stayed at the Hard Rock countless times over the last 10 years. I liked several of the dealers as well as the location and size of the casino. But over time, it has changed.

 Some of the staff is just obnoxiously rude.I get it,you work around drunken reprobates and it get's under your skin. So,since you didn't achieve beyond 800 combined on your SAT scores , you probably don't have many other options,especially with your ugly tatts and makeup. 

After playing BJ for $25 per hand for hours with over 1k in front of me, one would think I might get more than .75 Cents on my playing card.  This happened multiple times. Not even a freakn BLT could be spared or comped.
