This totally put my friend in a bad mood and wasted a good hour of our time the first night since the hotel  made her file a report, etc.  They had no problem wasting her time to file a report, but they never once asked if she was okay or if she needed anything.  Luckily she didn't end up with a black eye

3. Saturday at the pool: Hard Rock now swipes your ID for you to enter so if your name isn't listed on the room, you can't go in.  Funny that I called in advance on this and asked again when we checked in, and their uneducated staff told me that all you need is your room key to get in the pool on Sat.  So not the case!  We got up there with our group and couldn't get in half our group because they weren't listed on the room.  We explained we had 5 rooms total under one person and we hadn't added all the names.  They said we couldn't add them at the pool but would have to go all the way to the lobby and come back.  My friend's were pissed and gave up and went back to the family pool where we had a cabana.  Yes, on top of that, we actually had a cabana but it didn't matter.  I complained to another employee near the pool and he went ahead, called the front desk, and added one of my other friend's to the room so she could go in.  So the girl working at the pool was rude and wouldn't do it for us and caused half our group to leave, but the guy at the pool next to her helped one of my friend's out, but it was too late for the other's since they were already turned away. 

4.  Sunday (Rehab) at the pool:  I also called ahead of time before we arrived to make sure that we get two wristbands per room.  We had a couple staying in one room, and they were told that even though they get two wristbands per room and there were two of them, the husband had to still pay to get in since he's a guy.  I have never heard of something so ridiculous in my life!!!!! What is wrong with this hotel?!  It's absolutely unbelievable! So we decided to skip Rehab.  Why waste our money at HRH anyway.  We had a friend staying at Palazzo and the pool was gorgeous, they were welcoming with a friendly staff, and it wasn't a complete fire drill to get into the pool.

5. To top the cake, we called on Monday morning to get a late checkout, and we were able to get a noon checkout free of charge, but 3pm checkout would cost us an additional $60.  My friend politely told them that we had 5 rooms from Friday-Monday, and we only wanted a 3pm checkout for one of the rooms on Monday. The girl wasn't helpful.  I called back to speak to a manager, and Monica, an assistant manager, was rude and unhelpful.  I explained all the issues we had throughout the weekend, and she asked me why I hadn't addressed those issue at the time they happened.  I told her we did address some of them, but didn't get very far.  She asked who I had spoken to.  I told her I didn't make a note of every person I spoke to, nor did I really have the time and energy to devote to taking care of issues that I shouldn't be dealing with to begin with when you are paying to stay somewhere.  I was at a bachelorette party in Vegas for crying out loud.  I'm not a 80 year old woman who has nothing better to do than complain every second the hotel doesn't accomodate me.  I asked to speak with someone above Monica, and she said that she could give me his email.  I told her to go ahead and give us the 3pm checkout and to charge us, and that would be the last fee I pay that hotel as I will never go there again!!!  She did  not care that our group was completely unhappy with our stay.

I had the most incredible hotel stay I think anyone could have. I got a regular room but they put me in a two queen room instead of a king, so when I called to manager said they weren't too busy and would move me to a suite free of additional charge in the HRH tower. Wow, what a spectacular room. They thought of everything from a music touchscreen control to the best bed I've ever slept in. Love the Hard Rock hotel

i didn't stay here so please don't take this review to seriously, BUT, i did go to the bar in the casino and i did eat at pink taco.....yeah i know - big deal - but here's the thing......will someone PLEASE tell me which plastic surgeons (most likely in LA and\/or vegas) are giving out free stays at this hotel with every breast implant surgery?

HOLY HECK!  i mean 90% of the women in this place had those big, round, hard implants and i am NOT exaggerating here

the bar was fair, the crowd was cheesy and overly tattooed.....and OH MY BOOBS - the ladies were top heavy

i would like to go and stay there one time to see what the rooms are like.....and next time maybe i will make it over there on sunday afternoon for "rehab" and\/or go to body english....but geeze....it was like we visited the planet boobie.....ironically enough, i was in vegas for the weekend for a bachlorette party and we made the bride to be wear a specially designed t shirt which read "titties pow" on the back....she's a fairly demure girl so at first the idea of wearing the shirt made her a little nervous i think.....but once we hung out in the hard boobie rock hotel for a while....well, let's just say i think she felt right at home

of course, hers are real!

ta ta for now

I stayed at the hard rock last month for three days for a bachelor party. I was the best man, so I was in charge of booking everything. The hotel itself was great, but the customer service was by far the worst I have ever experienced. I use work in the hotel industry and I know that the lackluster service I received is something that a customer should never have to endure, especially with a group of my size(12 guys) who booked 6 rooms and spent well over 8k on accommodations, food and drink,and on the Rehab pool party. The issue from the start was from a check in error at the front desk. I booked the rooms through booking.com, but since I had multiple bookings, the hotel claimed that there was an error and charged me for extra rooms that I did not book. This issue was supposedly resolved at the hotel, after I spent well over an hour at the front desk during my stay working with a manger, who was the only employee that I have spoken with that was helpful, to take of it. The issue was taken care of, supposedly and the rest of the stay went well, minus the horrible check out experience I received from a rude and inconsiderate front desk employee. Two weeks after I checked, I was charged yet again on my card for rooms that I did not book. When I called the hotel they informed me that it would be refunded to my card immediately. Nothing happened. At this point, I have spent over 3 hours in person, on the phone, and via email working to resolve this matter, and I keeping getting the run around from hotel employees in multiple departments. This makes absolute zero sense because all them have agreed and confirmed that this charge was not suppose to happen. I am appalled at the horrendous service that I have received and at the complete lack of consideration that the Hard employees have for my time. I have requested to speak with a GM and have been denied every time. I have stayed at the Hard Rock locations around the world and have always had a great experience. I am in the midst of planning another bachelor party and was planning on staying yet again at their location in Vegas, prior to this experience. I will never again give any of the Hard rock locations my business again. Hopefully the hotel will work on fixing and resolving such situations quicker and with better service in the future with other guests.

Ya, it's the Hard Rock. Listen this is where AVN is and it is nice to catch up with friends every year. Yes the rock stars hang out here and the wanna be rock stars are here as well. If you like to people watch, you will probably spot a few "stars" if you are into that sort of thing...
Mr. Lucky's is pretty decent for food, nachos are tasty for sure..

I stayed here last year in the HRH Tower, our room was beautiful and the experience was top notch so I had high expectations this time. Turns out they weren't so top notch. 
We were in the casino tower which wasn't as nice as the previous, it seemed like an older part of the hotel. The room wasn't as modern or nice. I will say we had a great view of the pools though. 
My biggest complaint is with the customer service upon checking out we had some big problems.  Our car was parked pretty far away from out room so we decided to take two trips to the car when packing our luggage. Trying to get back into our room at 10am we can't get in. Our key stopped working no lights on the lock even showed up, we asked a housekeeper to try her key and nothing happened no lights or anything. So we went down to the front desk there were only 2 front desk attendants and a really long line of people waiting to check in. 20min later we are helped by someone and they give us a new key thinking that will fix everything. NOPE we can't even get on the elevator with our new key which you need in order to get off the main floor. 
So back to the front desk waiting 30min and the front desk attendant was really rude and not listening to what I was saying and gives me a new new key. All I'm trying to do is check out of my hotel room but I still have things in my room. 
This time the key works on the elevator but not our room. So I use a house phone on our floor to call security they say the batteries on the door must be dead and they will send someone up. 45minutes later and a second phone call maintenance man comes up and no security and the guy helps us break into our room. 
This delay added nearly 2 hours to our departure Let me also say that this was a Tuesday morning it wasn't even a weekend. The way we were treated and the lack of help was unreal I was really disappointed to say the least! Also I had no clue the door key locks ran on batteries that is also crazy.

The Hard Rock Hotel was a decent stay. It was perfect for a four day stay in Vegas. The hotel is decorated in rock paraphernalia and it is very trendy. It's a full service hotel, a restaurant, a bar. My friends and I arrived on our first night. They offered to upgrade our room to a two queen bed for no charge. We tried to tip the reception for their kind deed but they didn't accept it. Major bonus points like a boyfriend sending flowers for no reason. FYI, there's always a reason..ha! Yes..yes...Paradise pool Rehab!! My girls and I went here on Sunday..LOVED it. It was definitely one of the highlights of our trip. Welcome to a land where partying, dancing, and music are truly on another level. Great service, we were never looking for alcohol, it always came to us. We'll Definitely be back. What happened in Vegas stays on Yelp!! Lol!

My boyfriend & I scored an early check in, which is always nice, cause Las Vegas hotels are notoriously slow in letting you check in early. It was our lucky day! Early check in makes me a happy girl :).

If there was one thing I was put off about, it was the sandy pool. It was like sand from Lowe's, it hurt my feet to walk on. Would've rather not had the sand at all. The sand's purpose was to make it SEEM like a beach, but knowing the difference, it only made it silly to have sand in the first place. I didn't like how the sand made the water look murky, not crystal clear. Meaning, the sand disguised a lot of dirt being brought into the pool. I can only imagine the problems Hard Rock has with the filtering system for that pool. I did swim to the center island, and noticed that the water was much clearer & cleaner beyond the island, on the other side. There were other pools, but they were either closed or filled to the brim with people, so we had no choice but the sandy pool the first day. The following day, we tried another pool, and it was a tad better but not a great atmosphere. There is just something missing .

Tip: Get up super-early (even before the pool opens) to stand in line with all the others, to snag your spot when they open the pools. Run...don't walk...to the area you want to sit and claim your chairs by placing your (inexpensive) belongings on the chairs. THEN go get breakfast and bring it out to the pool. It's the only way to get that perfect spot if you plan to spend most of the day.

Pools open early and close early. I never can understand why these hotels can't invest in lights for those who desire to swim in the evening (me). It's not just the Hard Rock that does this; they all do. Most close at 6pm; some at 7pm.

I did enjoy the Pink Taco restaurant, accessible just off the pool area, but it was pricey, even for Vegas. We had 2 beers each and an appetizer. 

Hart & Huntington has been around for a long time in Vegas, and if you are so inclined to get a tattoo while in Vegas, I highly recommend this world-acclaimed tattoo parlor.

While sitting & sunning poolside, we ordered  a bucket of 6 beers. Lying there with your bucket of beers, filled with ice, a couple of chairs located nearest the water, soaking up the sun, with not a care in the world, is a very good day in Vegas. We started a game, rubbing ice on each other to cool off. Once we reached the bottom of the bucket and finished the beers, we took turns dumping the ice cold water on one another ;) *Squeeee*

I must mention that the Hard Rock Cafe attached to the hotel has one of the best burgers I've ever had. There is another Hard Rock Cafe located on the strip, and that location is newer. They have a rock climbing wall at the strip location as well.

Enter the evening and the scene generally gets a little more lively. I didn't find the Hard Rock as lively as I would've liked. This is most likely cause this hotel is located off the strip. We found ourselves getting in the car and driving to the strip, where all the major activity is.

We had a late flight into Vegas and needed a place to stay overnight before leaving early the next morning. We thought that pretty much any Vegas hotel would be fine to crash overnight and ended up here after using Priceline, we were wrong 
Terrible smoke smell throughout the first floor\/check in
Over 40min wait to check in. Some guys in front of us said they had been in line close to an hour
Snarky front desk attendant. 
Everything is designed so you have to walk through the smoky, nasty, casino floor. 
Burn out bulbs in the room
Wifi didn't work well
No coffee maker in the room. You have to walk through the smoky casino floor and spend $4 at Dunkin for a coffee
Ugh
40min wait for check in

I think that The Joint inside the Hard Rock is one of the best venue's to see a concert in. Much more of an intimate setting which I love because the crowd seems to have so much more energy than a big stadium. Love, love,love. I just wanna dance, man.

This is a perfectly-sized Vegas hotel. Good rates, friendly staff, nice rooms, good pool.

"Perfectly-sized," you say? Odd way to describe a hotel. But its off-Strip location meant the place wasn't too massive, and easy to get from parking garage to rooms. The casino was relatively small to walk through - again, just what I was looking for.

The rooms were well appointed, with nice soaps\/lotions and electronics.

I'd give it 5 stars, but I found someone else's hair brush and razor on *top* of the towels in the bathroom. Whaddahell...?

This was my first time visiting Las Vegas and I had a blast! We checked in on Thursday by 4 pm, as soon as we walked into our room it felt as though the A\/C had been turned off. We had to call the front desk because it was not getting colder, she sent someone up and in about 15 minutes the A\/C was working again. We were able to get into the Saturday pool party and the Vanity night club for free since we were guests. Both of which are great for young adults such as myself. I totally recommend this hotel for the young crowd ages 21-35 or so. If not, you may feel out of place. Lots of bachelorettes and bachelors in the house which is very expected in Vegas. Overall it was a great experience... only downer is that they charged me at least $20 per day as a resort fee, in addition to the total price paid on priceline.com. But in the long run it was waaaayy cheaper than hotels on the actual strip and the drive is not too far away. Oh yeah and complimentary valet!

Where to start... This hotel really needs to read up on the basis's of customer service. While thinking about my resent stay at the Las Vegas Hard Rock Casino and Hotel I decided to give you my top eight reasons to not stay at this motel. Here we go...
1. It would be quicker to take a taxi a restaurant and have dinner, good conversation and enjoy a delicious desert then wait for your car at the Valet.
2. Explain what a "non smoking" room means to Hotel guest registration
3. Entering your hotel room without any type of drinking\/water glasses and then asking house keeping for them and waiting four hours for delivery
4. Attempting to order room service and then being placed on hold for 20 minutes
5. Walking downstairs to Mr. Lucky's restaurant and trying to place an order for take out and then being told no. I said what? They said I would have to sit at a table, order food and then have it boxed for take home... Are you kidding me....
6. Calling house keeping to clean the room and having them never show up.
7. Having drinks and gambling with trailer trash, drunk morons
8. Bad service, bad attitudes, bad smelling and a really bad experience 
If your looking for a great hotel experience in Las Vegas stay at The Aria just up the road on Harmond.

I under booked for the hotel we were slated to stay at that week So we had to stay here for one night on our trip in Vegas. The price was right. I got a pretty good deal from Expedia. Even though I'd seen it from a distance I've never been to the hard rock Hotel. Upon entering the lobby was pretty " Vegas"loud, lots of people bustling about and a sense of party in the air. The check in line wasn't super long or super bad. Once we got there the young lady that checked us in was very friendly courteous and efficient. She even upgraded our room to one of the tower sections. From what I understand this is the better newer part of the hotel. A lot of people have said this is where you want to stay if you stay there in some reviews I read. They were correct. Once I get up there in the room it was gorgeous. A very rock and roll themed room. The wallpaper was black and gray but not trashy looking it had a heavy metal Gothic look about it it was cool the view was really nice to you couldn't see the strip but you could definitely see the mountains and it was beautiful the bathroom was great as well the shower was so big two people could actually fit in there at one time (Va va Voom!)  it had all of the great amenities in the room as well refrigerator\/microwave but be careful of the minibar as I said it's very rock 'n' roll themed with lots of different liquor loaded in the room which will cost you extra. The bed was soft and comfortable. The place was clean. The entire hotel had a few restaurants inside which made a convenient also some places to shop on the inside as well. I would stay here again of course in the tower section. If you don't mind and rock 'n' roll theme and seeing a lot of 80s hair band types walking around. (Great people watching there) I would recommend staying here. It's not exactly on the strip but it was nice and it was a fun place. Thanks for the hospitality hard rock hotel!

Really pissed @ these people. I was @ a slot machine for 30 minutes and not one waitress  came by!! I was @ another one for about an hour and the waitress took 15 minutes @ least to come by each time. The drinks were small and I was done with them in 3 minutes!! They had guns & roses playing for an exorbitant amount of $$$. They advertised the heck out of that show but nowhere did I see that the Pretty Reckless were playing!!!!! I love that band, I would've totally gone to them but I had no idea they were there!!! I was so pissed!!!!!!!!!!! Hard Rock Hotel, you're the worst!!!

Not a very happy experience. The service at the restaurants was slow and unimpressive. The systems went down and we could not use a room charge or credit card and the ATMs were having troubles so we couldn't withdraw cash to even get room service in the morning. There was no effort to make up for this inconvenience. Lastly, I tried to extend my stay for just one more night and it was so difficult to do. My name was not on the room so I could not extend the stay without having my boyfriend go down to the front desk. So then I made a separate reservation and they put it under the wrong name so I couldn't even check in to my reservation. We decided to go elsewhere for our last night.

Me and my family came here to rent a hotel at the HARD ROCK hotel and one of the workers just came up to me and basically keep wanting me to show my id many times I felt very discriminated by them. I talk to the AFRICAN AMERICAN security or whatever he is he thinks he owns this place and felt an anxiety from him. I felt harassed and discriminated by this place and I don't recommend the Hard Rock to anyone bad customer service and the staff needs to be retrained.

I'm in Vegas every two weeks for work, so I have stayed everywhere up and down the Strip (and off it, for that matter). As I always start these reviews, allow me this one caveat: I am a business traveler and as such, I'm not in Vegas to gamble or party--- so, my reviews are going to be from that framework. Don't get me wrong, I go to all the restaurants, I like to go to shows, but obviously what I'm looking for is a little different than the crash pad I know a lot of Vegas tourists are looking for. 

Overall, I really do like the Hardrock. Why? 
#1: It's convenient. My office is right down the street from the Hardrock, so it's fantastic to stay on the same side of the Strip as my office and not have to worry about traffic on the 15 of LV Blvd. 
#2: It's clean. Seriously, that counts for a lot. A lot of the less than 5 star resorts reek of stale smoke and sadness. While people are smoking around the Hardrock, it's barely noticeable. 
#3: The wifi is consistent. You'd be surprised how many places in Vegas charge you $16 a day for internet that loads slower than molassas on a cold day. Now, I'm not saying the Hard Rock wifi is going to be ideal for streaming HD movies or anything, but it's great for surfing and checking email without any hiccups. 
#4: Easy in and out. The Hardrock has several parking structures and points of entrance, which is fantastic for someone like me. There's nothing I hate more than being in one of the old casinos in town where you have to park, then wind a mile through the casino to get to your room. The Hardrock is great for ease of access.

I think I've stayed in every room type at the Hardrock except the fancy pants suites (which, if you're reading this Hardrock, I'd be more than happy to try them out to review for you ;) ). So, here's my breakdown comparing:

*Basic casino room: I don't mind this room at all. It's a bit basic, but also funky and fun. Flat screen TV, comfy bed, clean bathroom. What I really like about this room, though? It has doors that open to the outside! This is *huge* for Vegas, because you're usually trapped inside without fresh air. I LOVE opening those doors after a long day in my office building. You can upgrade to a pool side view for more money, but I actually prefer the mountain side-- it's quieter (no thump thump thump bass from Rehab) and I enjoy looking out on the desert.

*Paradise Tower basic room: Nice enough, but I'm not sure I'd ever pay more for it. I usually only get this room when it's the same price as the casino tower. The room has a red theme, so it's a little  . . . heavy? I don't know if that's the right word. Anyway, the bathroom is black, which looks lovely but the lighting can make it a bit hard to do your makeup in the morning. You can also upgrade this room to a pool view, though I'm not sure I would.

*Paradise Tower corner suite: I got upgraded to this room the last time I was there. The room was much bigger, but basically the same as the basic paradise tower room. Lots of windows though, which was lovely. 

*HRH king suite: I really like staying at the HRH tower-- the dedicated valet and check in, private elevators, it's just great. The rooms are starting to get a little threadbare (couch padding is wearing down and getting less comfortable, for instance), but over all, I love the sitting area and bedroom. The bathroom is also phenomenal with a walk in steam shower with rain shower head and a separate soaking tub. Just great. You can upgrade this one to a pool view as well,  but by now you know my feelings on that.

*HRH corner suite: basically the same as the king suite, just at on of windows. Really awesome.

In order of the rooms I'd like, I'd say it goes: any of the HRH rooms, the casino tower, then the Paradise tower. I know the Paradise tower is supposed to be nicer than casino, but I just love the balcony set up. 

Hardrock's spa is also awesome and always running fantastic promotions, so be sure to check their website for deals.

Stayed here for a couple of nights using a groupon. Check in was quick. The whole casino was pretty empty given that it was 4th of July weekend. Rooms were very nice and pretty big. Ours had a great partial view of the strip. No fridge, just a mini bar stocked with overpriced alcohol. Shower door leaked a ton of water on to the floor no matter which way we aimed the shower head. We also called housekeeping for extra towels and none ever got delivered. The cleaning ladies were only able to give us 2 hand towels, they swore they didn't have any bath towels on their cart. This place is farther from the strip then it looks, and it seems like kind of a seedy area. Really the only great things were the room & bed. 2 days after checkout my credit card was charged $94. When I called to find out why, they said it was the resort fee. I was told by the front desk there were no additional fees when I checked in (they took my cc # for a deposit). I won't ever stay here again. Now I know why it's so empty.

Would have been nice to know before arrival the entire casino would be under construction during our stay. Additionally it would have been nice to know the room we will be staying in will look nothing like the picture online. The room looked directly into the parking garage. Barley any sun light in the room during the day. This room should have been pro rated, and we should have been made aware of the construction before arrival. I am very disappointed in the hotel and casino. 
The pools were very clean, lively, energetic, diverse crowed. Enjoyed the time at the pool, but won't be staying at this hotel again.

Awesome room at the HRH tower! We were pleasantly surprised. I would have given 5 stars except for a few things. We weren't directed to the HRH check in area and instead were greeted by a tired and cranky reception girl that didn't really care too much when I told her it was our honeymoon. I feel it would have been a nicer experience for both of us had she just directed us to the HRH tower check in area which we saw on the way to our room.  Room was plush and comfortable . We had a pool view which was nice.  Sucks that the pools were all closed except for two small ones.  Either way I recommend this for a off strip, luxury feel on a budget. :-)

This was my first time in the hard rock, and what a coincidence! Avns are going on. There is all kinds of people watching, from barely dressed girls and well known porn stars to hunky guys with tattoos. It was great! The cab line was long but I didnt care...I had cute guys behind me:-)

So I stayed here for 4 nights. We booked the trip through book it so I wasn't sure what to expect with the room. I initially thought we were going to get a room in the paradise tower. But when we got there they didn't have anymore rooms left in that tower, we had already expressed not wanting to stay in the casino tower whatsoever. So they upgraded us FREE of charge to a suite! 

The suite was beautiful. When it comes to bathrooms especially hotel bathrooms I'm like the pickiest person on earth! Our bathroom had a walk in shower with TWO shower heads, an overhead shower head and a removable shower head. The bathroom also had a really big + deep tub. The tub didn't have any jets which was a bummer but whatever. Also it had two sinks, the toilet had its own little room with a door you can close. 

They didn't have any complimentary air freshener though. 

There were two TVs in the room, one on the side where the bed was and the other on the living room side.

There was a really loud speaker system that I put to use every time I was in the room. You can connect your own music or listen to their library.

The room was clean, room service was really nice. 

However! I did notice that a lot of the cleaners and such didn't really speak too much English. Some of the room service people couldn't answer a lot of my questions because of the language barrier and that kind of sucked!

The pool is AMAZING! It seems like when there is an event going on you don't get to really enjoy the pool because it is too crowded. But if you're like me you should book your stay on a weekday and avoid the weekend crowd.

The memorabilia was by far my favorite! I love museums, so to be able to walk around the casino floor and see small informational pieces was really cool to me. 

There's a cvs right across the street that sells full bottle sized alcohol so don't waste your money drinking the nips they offer you in room. 

Staff was amazing they were more than willing to accommodate me.

They have a 24hr restaurant in there, I didn't eat there but everyone says it's pretty good. Their Asian restaurant is REALLY good. 

I definitely cannot wait to book my second Vegas trip with the Hard Rock.
I like the HRH towers.. the newest part.  Its a fun hotel.. always smells like weed and booze, which makes me laugh.

One of the most exciting, happening spots in Vegas.  Got a room on the top floor overlooking the strip.  We stayed for a few nights and had a blast.  The casino is one big circle which works well.  As you might expect, the clientele is mostly young adults.  Attractive young adults actually.  I don't remember seeing any families or kids.  There really is no reason to leave this hotel since it has cool restaurants-Lucky, Starbucks, Nobu, Pink Taco, etc.  The center bar is a fun place to chill and people watch.  Its also a meat market....LOL  Oh and I didn't even mention the pool area...

It's true,  the Hard Rock is not too kid friendly........but it worked out well. The pool over the hill past the cabana's and down the stairs was the perfect place for my 3 year old to play. The pool is about 1.5 feet deep and there is also a beach entry. The other pools also have beach entry, but I found that this pool was less crowded for him to play in. 

Not a fan of Mr Lucky's restaurant (or whatever the name is). Food was ok, service sucked. I don't expect them to cater to children, but I do expect them to notice that there is another person with me and maybe give him a napkin or silverware or something! 

The rooms are nice. Ours did not have a tub, just shower. There is a mini\/ snack bar on the counter in the room. If you MOVE anything on there, you will be charged. So best thing to do if you have no self control or if you have kids, just throw a jacket, sweatshirt or whatever over it! You will forget that is is even there! 

So if you are looking for a place where all the tattooed 25 year olds hang out and a few 30-40 year olds, this is your place!

I stay here a lot and had such a huge issue when checking in. A girl comes up and just starts saying things to the girl behind the counter helping me and starts typing away on the computer. Saying she couldn't do anything she was trying to get done and was totally rude to me when explaining payment policy. I never had the problem with the method of payment she was presenting to me. She was so rash and insensitive. I asked for the manager and she says very rudely that she was and there was no one else so deal with it. I again requested her supervisor and she refused again. It's such a huge turn off. There was no apology for the construction when I arrived and the room I checked into had wet spots all over the floor. On top of having to wait an hour after the front desk fiasco to even get in the room is ridiculous. For the money spent you would think they would want to accommodate every one for such an inconvenience on all accounts.

At 25 this is the perfect place to stay with my friends and gf sans the family...Rehab at the pool on Sundays is always great times. More beautiful women than you can dream of, most are higher caliber not lower class Playboy wannabe sluts like what you find at Palms. Stays at  the Hard Rock at least once and you will have great memories to last a lifetime.

Unless you are 23 and don't give a shit- Don't stay here. It's a mob scene check in, and virtually no service is offered to the guest because they are s busy and understaffed..

 In a two day stay I went through 8 keys unable to get into my room. It took 3 hours for someone to come and change the battery in my door so I could actually get into my room.

I left my room the first day at 10:30AM - I returned at 4:15PM and it still wasn't cleaned.

WIFI in the room is virtually unusable.
The rooms are nice. The pool is great. The passed out person in my hallway was not what I had expected. This hotel is fantastic for couples. It is however NOT good for families.

This hotel is DARK. I felt like an old lady looking for her glasses as I was constantly fumbling around for things in the room. "Where are my shoes????!?" "I can't find my tank!!!!!!" Everything went missing. We kept on trying to turn on lights and then realizing that all the lights were already on. Each one emitted like a 1% beam which did nothing to pierce the gloomy abyss. It doesn't help that all the furnishings, carpets, and paint are grey or black. My friend actually liked the decor (though she couldn't see either), but it made me feel like I was 80 years old.

Even the front desk is in the dark. Pair that with the super bright video screen behind it, and I'm assuming every person that works here is getting eye strain and headaches. 

We got a room in the Paradise Tower, which is towards the back of the hotel and in the conference section. It was really convenient to the parking structure, but it was a long walk to the front. I also found the card key slots in both the elevators and doors hard to use. I saw others struggling with them, too. There should be some staff walking the main floors as well, since on one late evening\/early morning, I was accosted by this drunk guy who was hell bent on walking me up to my room. 

The variety of pools is a plus, but understand that the main pool is a dayclub 24\/7, so you'll need your ID each time you enter. I made the mistake of not bringing mine the first day, so I had to walk all the way back to my room for my driver's license. Maybe it's obvious (obviously not to me, however), but the hotel should state this in the hotel booklet in the room. I browsed through that before heading down, and it didn't say anything about needing identification.

ok, to be clear i did not love this hotel. in fact, i though it was just ok. why the 4 stars then? well, because in comparison to a lot of other vegas hotels, it's pretty good. it's younger and more low-key than the venetian or bellagio and not at obnoxious as the palms. 

the husband decided this would be the place to stay for my first trip to vegas. (yes, i'm 30 and this was my first trip to vegas. what does that say about me? first, if you're judging me ask yourself how many times you've been and what that might say about you. ok smartie let's move on.) 

our room was spacious and clean and i loved the framed photos of icons. i wasn't a huge fan of their casino area. it's not as well ventilated or as pumped full of oxygen as the bellagio or venetian so if you're sensitive to smoke, it's gonna annoy you. i'm not a gambler tho so i just avoided it. 

the staff is nice and respectful and the pool is pretty cool with a fake beach and everything. you will definitely see girls with fake boobs and in g-strings here and they're always fun to watch as they angle for the attention of the nearest meatheads. we ate breakfast both mornings at mr lucky's which was solid if not impressive. the "rehab" breakfast was pretty good actually. 

also hit up their club--body english--which is free before midnite if you're a guest. thank God, cause being an SF girl i was not about to wait in a line to be judged on the size of my breasts or how pretty i am just to give some asshole $30 to let me into a club full of other assholes. give yourself pletny of time tho. there's a mob scene a at midnite all of them pleading with some ponytailed david beckham lookalike to let them in. body english played pretty fun music and there was great people watching here too. 
 
also they're conveniently located righ next to the airport and across the street from a pharmacy --just in case you need meds or water that doesn't cost $4 a bottle.

This is for the hotel only, but my husband and I had such a great and positive experience! We got a deal on our room using the hotel tonight app, we booked it and checked in about 30 mins later. The front staff were really pleasant and upbeat which is hard to do 9p on a Monday night. Upon check-in the face us a free suite upgrade. The rooms were beautiful and so comfy and clean. Some people said they didn't have an actual blanket but we did. We had a decent view of the pool area and part of the strip. 
There is more than 1 parking garage. They have maps. Ours only took10 mins to get from there to the room. 
Our room made our time in Vegas even that much better!!

Meh. After defending the Hard Rock for being off the strip, I can't really justify coming here in the summer anymore (too hot to walk).  The service was excellent throughout, but the room itself was kind of janky-the shower was a hassle due to lack of maintenance. The TV was a really poor design and difficult to use. Not a big deal and not terrible, but I probably wouldn't stay here in the summer again, given how many comparable options there are in better locations. I wouldn't mind making the walk in cooler weather...but full disclosure, I'm from Southern California so I'm not too tough with drastic weather.

This is for their complimentary wi-fi that does not work!! Disconnects every 5 secs or so and stayed here 3 days. And pool closes early at 7pm. And the room was dusty and found a fries on the floor. Also as i was getting to leave there was a roach on the bathroom. Yuck!!! So many other hotels to choose from will never be staying here again.

i'm not going to lie and pretend i was sober at all during my experience here, i mean we were trashed on the plane there.. no soberness involved. we went to vegas last july for nikki boobie's bachelorette party and stayed 4 days at the hard rock. i think it would just be easier to take you day by day through our adventure so you can fully understand the 5 star rating. 

day 1- we land in vegas, it's hot as fuck and we are not sober. we payed a ridiculous fee to be limo'd over to the hotel. inside the hotel, we check in and dump our bags in the room. we wait around for the rest of the bitches to arrive and we head out for the night. we go to tryst in the wynn and meet up with these weirdo douche bags that had a table there. one guy had an amex black card and spoke of his many trips to the south of france... he was greasy and short. we get charged $15 a shot. time to go!!! we go back to the hard rock and party at body english for free.. much better! then we head over to mr. lucky's for a late night meal. mr. lucky's is the cafe in the hard rock. it's the bomb.

day 2- we wake up and head down to the hard rock pool. rehab is going on this weekend (the biggest pool party of the year) so it's crowded!!! the pool is so dirty you can't see your feet in one foot deep water, people are sloppy drunk and fucktrotting in the pool. it's only 11 am saturday morning. i meet a guy names big b. big b has a cabana and says me and my 5 girlfriends can drink in his cabana. SCORE! free drinks all day saturday!!! we eat at the pink taco. pink taco is hella good! we are hammered by 5 and go to mr. lucky's for dinner. we meet a promoter who promises us VIP in Body English that night. Wo0t to more free shit! We go up to the room to get ready and end up falling asleep. we wake up at 12:30 and decide to go out. we make it to Mr. Lucky's and a quick spin around the casino. we are hit on by forigners and ghetto people. back to the room.

day 3- REHAB!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! YEAAAAA!!!! we go out to the pool. it's more insane than the day before. we meet "married guy" who is from new york and spend the day hanging out with him and drinking out of his cabana. he's cool and will fill his drink and then pour half of it one of our drinks so we don't have to leave to pool area. we pose for the billions of cameras there and we spot ernie.... ernie was just floating in the pool all by himself. nikki boobie and i rescue him and carry him around for the rest of the day. that giant inflatable penis got us a lot of free drinks, so we decide to take him home with us. after a long day at the pool we make our way to the japanese restaurant that i can't think of the name of at the moment. 

day 4- we hit up mr. lucky's one last time and get packed to head back to cali. mr. lucky's has the best omlets ever. omg, best ever after a weekend of hardcore drinking. 

moral of the story... 6 bitches go to vegas for 4 days for a bachelorette party and only wander out of the hard rock for about a 6 hour period. we drink for free for 3 days straight inside the hotel. this hotel is the shit!!!! between the room, the pool, mr. lucky's, pink taco, body english the casino, the bar and the japanese place... we were more than entertained. all these great places located in one hotel... that's why i give the hard rock 5 stars.

The WORST hotel experience I've ever had. 
Place is empty but they still put us in a room with massive construction going on all around. Got woken up at 7 15 to consistent pounding and sawing..Oh and no hot water. 
Front desk moves us (no apology) and at 730 next morning..boom, construction demo 2 doors down.
We are out of here. Take your hard earned money elsewhere. You deserve better!

HRH is convenient to the airport and off the strip.  Parking is easy.  Property is manageably small. Pricing is reasonable.  Restaurants are nice and not too expensive. The rooms are big for the price, and the beds are comfortable.
What I did not Like: 
Computer systems were down and registration was a nightmare with no upgrades or apologies.  We sat around for 6 hours.  No one bothered to text us when they were ready to assign a room.
TV did not work and the lighting is very dim.  
Disney-world Florida style tacky crowd of nearly underage people.  Mostly young, drunk, and dumb. Not anyone I would care to associate with in real life.  Overweight girls squished into tacky tight dresses or ripped up shorts and tank tops.  Tatooed guys and low-wage workers.
This is not the wealthy crowd for sure, but you get what you pay for.
Rehab on the weekends takes over the hotel with thumping loud music and disgusting people.  These girls need to look in the mirror before they pull on that teenie bathing suit.  I rode on the elevator with 6 barely legal girls discussing why women have a higher sex drive than men. Huh?
We were only passing through on the weekend, needed convenience, visting family and so the hotel was adequate, but I would not consider this if you are only there for the hotel and the Vegas experience, and you are over 30.

A recent stay at the HRH Las Vegas prompts this review of my experiences......and i know you can't wait to hear them!

Check In: I stayed in the "HRH Tower" which is an all suite tower and has their OWN check in desk which is immediately inside from the parking garage (Harmon side). You get to avoid lugging your stuff all the way through the casino If you are in this tower. Score! Front Desk staff seemed rather robotic and disinterested.

Room: The room (HRH Suite) had a very different layout from most, but it was sparkling CLEAN 
and had panoramic views and ALOT of window real estate. The bathroom was behind a glass door in the middle of the suite. The shower was absolutely huge which i loved. I cannot mention enough the goose down bedding......i slept like a rock (ironic eh?).

Mr Lucky Restaurant: 24\/7 cafe, the prices were a tad steep, but not as bad as alot of OTHER cafes i have been to and the food and decor were decent.

Center Bar: They recently revamped and reinvented their center bar, it was lively to say the least and the bartenders were very personable and attentive.

Reliquary Spa: Well it $27 to use the facilities, even 1 hr before closing. It was a little on the smallish side but still had every amenity like the big guys on the strip. There is also a unisex common area with a HUGE pool size hot tub so both men and women can relax as well.

POOL: After you show your room key for access you arrive in a desert paradise.....ahh who am i kiddin? The pools are nice, has a sand beach and i enjoyed myself.

See you next time HRH, i'm sure i will be back.

This is a very mixed review...mostly filled with irritable factors. The two stars are for appearance alone. We arrived at the hotel about 1pm and tried to Check in. The hotel looks amazing...you walk in there BOOM there is the Casino,  all the famous articles on display, and a bar right away! So we check in and firstly there was a hidden resort fee that we didn't knowabout because we paid in full online. Didn't like that... one bit. Well then we couldn't get in our rooms because they weren't ready...and check in is usually between 3pm-5pm. So we walked around and ate and looked and shopped for almost 3 hours and they told us they would call or text when a room is available. After seeing multiple people walk away with room keys We had to go back and ask two different people was a room ready before the second said "Oh yeah, we have a couple ready!" Still no text to let us know...

When we finally got to the room...it was soooooo nice! The bathroom and living room area we were perfect. The room had sufficient space for 3 adults to move around and not be on top of each other. We did have to request our room to be cleaned at 4:30pm the next day...wow! No wonder the rooms are never ready..lol. We wanted to go to the strip...and they offer free shuttle service "to the strip" BUT it takes you to the mall! JUST the mall  

Lastly but not least...they have expired candies in a high priced gift shop. I don't think I want an expired $3 Milky Way no thanks! When we checked in we told them we would have a package coming to the hotel the next day...they said cool and it would be at "Keys and Mail"  went to keys and Mail and it was at the business center. Go figure! Why would mail not be in a place that said "Mail" that was too much like right. But I got to the business center and there was another SURPRISE hidden fee of $5 to receive my package! What?! So if I didn't have $5 you were gonna keep my stuff? Smh Also there was a music screen in our hotel room where you could turn up and hook your phone up and what not.....there was an aux port to hook up your phone but NO aux cord!! Whyyyyyy would you have one without the other?! Smh I wont be back Hard rock!

Let's get the negatives out of the way first:

1.  The pool.  By the end of the day, it is DISGUSTING.  Our room overlooked it and when we came stumbling in during the AM hours, we got to see the difference between how it looks pre-cleaning and how it looks post-cleaning.  Cloudy, green and with an oily film on top, it is just unacceptable.  The worst part is, I don't see how it can be avoided considering how many people the pool hosts everyday.. C'est la vie.

2.  The casino area pales in comparison to other hotels.  It's just not very big.

3.  Rooms overlooking the pool.  GREAT view, especially for the gentlemen, but that fucking club music starts WAY too early and vibrates the walls and floors.  I swear to God I must've gained 5lbs of muscle in my arms just from fist-pumping in my sleep.

OK, fuck that negative nonsense, on to the positives:

1.  The rooms.  Spacious, clean, well laid out.

2.  The WOMEN.  Holy balls, spectacular.  

3.  Mr. Luckies 24\/7 Restaraunt.  Good, cheap food.  Ask for the 777 deal which is not on the menu,  Decent sized steak, grilled shrimp, potatos, and a salad for $7.77.  

4. Pole dancers from 8PM-2AM in the casino.  Hot chicks wearing barely nothing, dancing on a pole.  A win in any mans book.

5.  Employees.  Very friendly and helpful.  Kelsey, one of the managers, and Amanda, one of the girls behind the desk, specifically.  Great job, ladies.  Oh and, Amanda? GORGEOUS. 

6.  Location. Easy enough to get anywhere you need to go.


Overall, go check it out, you won't be disappointed.

After reading Yelp for sometime, I signed-up to write this review of the Hard Rock.  Over the years, I've stayed at most of the major properties in Las Vegas and over the past 5 or 6 stays have settled here. 

I can't give them 5 stars, cause it's not a Wynn\/Encore type joint... but a solid 4 they deserve.  I've stayed in each of the towers.  HRH is perfectly upscale and quiet enough get a good night's sleep before a meeting.  The Paradise Tower is also nice, but a bit far away from the action.  The main tower has been redone and now has many of the same features as the newer towers, plus the famous french-doors that open for fresh air.

The hotel staff has always been friendly and helpful to me... you get  back what you put out you know.  Mr. Lucky's food is exactly what I like... standard diner type fare that's always hot and fresh. Pink Taco is great too.  

Just watched the NBA title game last week at one of the bars in the new section.  It was a great time.  All in all, I think you'll be hard pressed to beat the value the Hard Rock offers.

I wanted to give five stars but also could have went with less stars.

Overall, our experience was VERY nice. There on business but stayed a little extra, we enjoyed most amenities at the HR. We arrived on a Sunday, a family with young children, I was not sure if I made the correct choice of staying here. The place was VERY loud and young. People were out of it, drunk and possibly more as we did see someone getting kicked out for selling drugs (one of about seven we saw on our stay). The staff was very nice and place overall was clean. Though the family pool was littered with cigarettes floating and beer bottles. The room was very nice, we did upgrade. The view was amazing. Gambling I was told they are not known for and rarely saw more then a few people around actually spending. I did gamble but didn't win anything. All in fun. The restaurants, especially lucky's was great. Fuel for Americano a must! The art and music memorabilia is to die for. Some really amazing pieces. Had I been younger and single, this would be heaven. With a family, not so much. With kids, even less. 

The main reason for my possible issue, the last night we were there, 2am, sleeping in our room. My daughter wakes me saying she is scared. We all woke up from the very loud hallway party happening. The kids outside the room were very obviously drunk and hanging out. There were many and after an hour of saying to my family let them party, we were once young, it became this is unreal and has to stop. I called the front desk, no answer. Called the bell, no answer. I waited another hour and called the emergency line as I was willing to do anything to sleep. No answer..... I then heard someone yelling in the hallway to break it up and everyone left. Not sure if it was security or not. But that was really bad and had this been a real situation, that emergency line not picking up showed us a lot. Because of that, I would NOT stay here again and it did put a little damper on our stay.

If you are in Vegas and you don't hang out at Hard Rock, then you haven't experienced VEGAS!!!!  Hard Rock is THE place to go to in LV.  Forget the fact that it is off the strip.  Once you are at HRH, you never need to leave.

My friends and I decided to go on a trip to Las Vegas to celebrate a very special occasion. We decided to go on May long weekend (May 16 - 19, 2014) and stay at the Hard Rock. 

I booked my flight and hotel well in advance - in November, 2013. I booked through Expedia and paid in full for both my flights and my hotel room. I received a confirmation from the Hard Rock within minutes, saying that my booking had been accepted and my credit card payment had been processed. There was nothing left to do except continue to plan our event and get excited! 

However, things took a turn on May 3, 2014, when I received an e-mail from Expedia informing me that there 'may be' an 'urgent problem' with my room at the Hard Rock due to 'sudden, unforeseen circumstances.' Expedia asked me to contact a 1-800 number to deal with the problem. 

 I contacted this number immediately and was told that the hotel had 'overbooked' and that my room was no longer available. I tried to explain that I had already paid in full, over six months ago, for my room, and received a confirmation from the hotel, so I did not understand how this was happening at this time - not even two weeks before my scheduled departure date. I also tried to explain that I was going down with a group of people, who were all staying at the Hard Rock, for a special occasion. I did not want to move hotels. 

The woman at Expedia's Lodging Support Services was very cold. She simply told me that it was "...too bad..." and there was nothing she could do. She told me that I would have to "...come to terms with the fact that I must relocate..." and that I could not stay with my group at the Hard Rock. She told me that I should be happy that she was offering (what she deemed to be) comparable lodging at the 'South Point Inn', which is a small hotel WAY off the strip and in the desert. It goes for about $50.00 a night. Keep in mind that I had already paid more than double that - per night - for my room at the Hard Rock. I was obviously extremely upset. I ended up speaking to three different people at Expedia, who all told me the same thing. But I refused to give up.

At that point, I decided to contact the Hard Rock directly. I was able to speak to the manager of reservations. He told me that there had been some kind of a mistake at the hotel and that it had accidently overbooked itself only a few days ago. I told him that I had already paid for my room, more than six months ago - in full!!!!!!! - and that I did not want to move hotels. Again, I got no answers and no apologies. The hotel seemed to be treating this like "...no big deal." I was told that a "....hotel is a hotel..." and I should just take whatever I had been given. No one seemed to care that I was travelling for a special occasion and that I had planned to stay in that hotel for that purpose and did not care to be separated from my group. I was just told "...to deal with it..." and I was brushed off. 

I am leaving for Vegas on May 16, 2014 - four days from now. I have still not received any further confirmation from the hotel. No one has contacted me and no one seems to care about me or my group or my event. I have never been treated so poorly by a hotel - or any business for that matter - before. I am absolutely shocked by what has happened and it has ruined the entire trip already - not just for me but also for my group. We feel like complete garbage. I just want what I rightfully paid for. But that seems like too much to ask for when it comes to the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino.

Bottom line - This hotel will just take your money and kick you to the curb.

The good: great food, great people, great hardscape and pools and all. 
The bad: we stayed in the HRH tower 1. An upgrade to a suite, 15th floor. When we entered our suite the first thing that came to mind was the term 'road hard put away wet'. Yes, the room is dated. Everything very dirty looking. Like putting lipstick on a pig. It's still a pig. On the last day as we were searching for everything possibly misplaced, my wife found a used condom under the dresser (Lol!).  Married, not ours. As far as the stains on the couches, I will let you figure that one out. Had to place towels on the couches to sit! Our saving grace was family staying at the Mandalay Bay. We spent most of our time there.

My stay at the hard rock was by far the worst experience I have ever had at any hotel. I booked new year eve in Vegas two months in advance, upon checking in the hostess explains to me that half way into my trip they needed to move my room because they was work being done on the floor. I was not happy about the fact I was not told about this prior but I didn't make it a big deal, checked in and went up to my room. When I got into the lights were all out. I called downstairs and they sent someone up to fix it.  On New Year's Day I had to wake up at 9 am, pack all my stuff and move it after going out the night before. Once checked into the room, I hear someone trying to open the door. Finally the key unlocks the door and two strangers walk into my room. They double booked my room and gave someone a key!!! If I wasn't there who knows if these people would have stolen all my belongings. When I called the front desk they didn't even care and barley apologized. The service is horrible and the employees could care less about you. If you are planning a trip to Vegas I strongly advice you do not stay the hard rock!

My boyfriend and I drove out to Las Vegas for our first vacation together and were could only stay one night on the strip so we were hopeful that we would find something that would suit our tastes.

The biggest draw back to this hotel is it is not directly on the strip and the shuttle stops at five.  This was certainly a disappointment. And you want to have a nap in the afternoon when they are having one of the pool parties, it was very difficult to do so.

That being said, I actually really loved that hotel.  It was right up our alley, very cool and rock and roll. The photography was stunning and the music taste was top shelf, as one would expect.  It was full but never so crowded that we couldn't move about the casino.  Our room was beautiful. The bed was absolutely heaven, it is a wonder I'm not still there rolling around in it.  We didn't have much of a view, but we prepaid on a discount website, so that is to be expected.

The room service was fantastic, anything we needed was provided promptly and politely.  The customer service was truly top notch and I really appreciated it.  Good hotel workers know that not everyone is able to get away very often and it was wonderful to be treated so well.

Just got back from an awesome three days at the hard rock. Stayed in the paradise tower on the 10th floor and my room overlooked the rehab pool.
Here's the rundown:
Get a cabana worth every dollar.
Do not order smart water mine was 15 dollars a bottle. Total rip off. Get a rehab cup and get that refilled for free. 
Go to mr luckys and pink taco both are awesome. 
Service was excellent in the whole hotel felt safe everywhere.
Don't worry if your not 25 you'll still like it if you can appreciate rock and roll. I love it and the music playing was a bonus.
Awesome hotel I'll be back.

I'm a local born and raised and I've been frequenting the Hard Rock since it opened on the mid-90's.  This place has always been a Vegas gem, especially with all the diff things to do in Vegas.  If you like good food, clubs, pool parties, concerts, shows and great rooms then this is your place.  Nobu for sushi, Pink Taco for Mexican and the steak house is amazing.  Hart & Huntington is here too.  Which is where my wife got her latest tattoo.  If you like partying at the pool and seeing so many hot chicks in bikinis that your mind may explode than go to Rehab.  It's the longest running and most outrageous pool party in Vegas.

My son went to The Hard Rock for his 21st Birthday present from his mother. While in his room, he handled several items from the Convience bar, (nothing was consumed) Hard Rock charged his credit card for nearly $400.00 and refuse to credit his account. They claim that too much time had passed and they have no record of the inventory. Funny how they hadn't returned our calls for several weeks to let us know of their findings. 
I WILL NEVER SPEND AN F'N DIME THERE AGAIN. 

WHAT A SCAM.......

After Hard Rock refusing to correct their wrong, we decided to dispute these charges with the credit card company. The funds were re-instated into my son's account. 
SCREW YOU HARD ROCK.

My friend and I stayed here during the majority of our trip.  We booked a king bed, but ended up with 2 full beds with a nice view of the pool.  Thank you staff!

When I booked the room, it came with coupons.  Such as a free daybed, free drinks at Vinyl, some coupon deal for Mr. Lucky's during a certain time period, etc.
The daybed had a catch to it.  You get a free daybed but you have to spend $100 on food and drinks.  I ended up not going down to the pool because I was enjoying the bed and A\/C so much!  I didn't realize Rehab was at this hotel until I saw posters.  I did enjoy the music that was played nonstop throughout the day.

The room was really nice, and the beds were fancy looking.  But the walls are kind of thin.  We could always hear our neighbors walking into their room and they were sometime singing\/karaoke'ing too.  One night we had a neighbor smoking weed in his\/her room, and the smell was seeping through the crack of the door into our room;  I guess that would be a good thing for some people who like to second-hand smoke it for free!

Every time my friend and I went out at night and came back to the hotel, she ordered room service.  Such a waste of money.  She ordered a full pizza and chicken wings.  The order came out to around 40 something dollars.  They make you pay a $3 service\/delivery fee and 18% gratuity etc.  And if you touch any of the drinks\/food in the room\/fridge on the sensors, you will be charged a lot.

The women who clean the rooms were very nice and friendly.  Every time we asked for more towels, tp, toiletries, we were given ample.  And if you book a room here, you get free wi-fi with good connection.

So our trip was supposed to go from Tuesday til Friday, and so we extended our checkout to buy us time.  In the end, we just booked another night because we got so hammered the night prior.  We slept all day and night.  The beds were so soft and comfortable.

Stayed here for a couple of days.  It is a nice place for a music fan. Lots of memorabilia and instruments on display in the hotel.  The gambling is good. The room was comfortable.  I recommend it if you are staying in LV.

I had a good experience overall at the hotel itself, but it wasn't until I got back home where I then suffered. I contracted Giardia from the hotels pool. Giardia is a water born parasite infection. I was in the hospital the week after my visit to the Hard Rock Hotel here in Vegas. Such an awful experience. I am still experiencing the sickness. Going on week 8 of this!!! They need to clean their pools better with the high volume amount of people that go in and out of it daily. So gross!!!!

Stayed here in a suite this week for a corporate event.  For me, this place failed on most counts.  

I'm sure that when the place first opened, it was the "happening" place to go.  Now, it seems more like the place where wanna-be's dress up for their Vegas experience.  Throughout my stay the word "skanky" seemed to come to mind quite a bit.  

Most of the decor is dated.  The coolest part of the place is certainly the music memorabilia, but I think the hotel hopes that if you see all of the showcases, you'll miss how cheap and dated the rest of the interior looks.

Then there's the suite.  For a suite in the HRH tower, you would think that it would be pretty cool.  Instead I was treated to ottomans with suspicious stains on them.  Once I saw those, I avoided sitting on any other furniture then the bed.  There was a large bathtub in the suite, with small curly hairs on the interior.  I had to sweep the bathroom floor with a towel, as I could see where small shards of glass were.

At 5:45 am I got a call from the front desk, telling me that there was a problem with my credit card.  Who wakes up a guest at 5:45 am.  The guy knew my name and room number.  I suspected a scam so called the front desk myself.  They said there was no problem.  Since I hadn't bought anything, even drinks, at the hotel, I suspect that someone inside the hotel must have given my information to someone to try and scam me out of my credit card info. 

Our company's done a few events with Hard Rock.  I'll be an advocate of trying something new the next time.

For my first time in vegas, I'm glad I made the decision to stay at the Hard Rock!  Even though the hotel itself is off the strip, I enjoyed every part that the Hard Rock had to offer.

Upon check-in, we were upgraded to one of the rooms in the casino tower without knowing!  I remember we got there and we were in awe...was this really what we booked?! I absolutely was in LOVE with it!  I loved how we had a view of the pool, which, was disturbing during the weekends when all you want to do is sleep.  The music carries up into the rooms and sometimes, in the early AM, they do sound checks for their speakers...which sucks.  But, on the flip side, it was the most awesome way to wake up on the weekends, especially if Rehab is happening downstairs!  While I am sad I did not have the time to attend Rehab, I loved being able to rock out in the comfort of my own room to the DJs that were playing (and for the weekend I was there, I was excited that it was two DJs that knew how to get the party started!)

Anyway back to the rooms.  The beds were super comfy!  They were better than the bed I have back home here lol...and even right now, as I type this and remember the awesomeness of my room, I get a little "homesick".  The room was decently sized, it was large enough that when we had a few guests over everyone did not seem like they were cramped.  

I am sad that during the course of my stay, that I did not have the time to visit all of the Hard Rock's many restaurants.  The next time I come back, I will defiantly make reservations to try out Ago or Nobu.  Happy hour at the Pink Taco was awesome and I recommend checking it out!   Overall, my stay in Vegas wouldn't have been as much fun if I had stayed anywhere else.  The music selection through the hotel lobby and the casino's made the experience there even more phenomenal...I remembered many moments of just stopping to sing along to the songs as we walked to the car on a night out on the strip or on the way back to the room to get rest for the following night out!  The vibe, atmosphere, and staff made my stay memorable and on my next adventure to Vegas, I will remember to book once more with the Hard Rock Hotel!

Worst check in service I have ever experienced ever. 2+ hours to check in and a separate line to pick up the room key!?!  Seriously?  1st time in vegas and will never stay here again.  Has already put a damper on the whole trip.

This is my first review I have ever left in the entirety of my life. The hotel stinks. Literally. My friends and I walked through all of the hotels and they are all beautiful. All other hotels smell of regret but the hard rock smells of regret, desperation, and smoke! They haven't put a proper ventilation system in yet. I've stayed at 4 different hotels in Vegas and this is the first one to hide it's resort fees until you checkout. Wouldn't it be nice to know what your paying?? Don't even touch the mini bar items. They will charge you $9.25 for triggering the sensor of the snickers bar. In fact we picked up several items to get a closer look. $145 later - as we were also tacked on a late night pizza trip that we never made. We were forced to venture downstairs to the line of sadness. 

Prior to a 5 hour drive back we waited in the check-in line in order to get this taken off our credit card. The line was filled with pissed off adults wanting to go home... we weren't the only ones that had this problem. We were greeted by a human that is trying his best to support the company he works for but clearly has been dealing with this all too often as the lady before us had the same thing happen!!! He was really rude but you would be... this would suck to deal with every day!!! The problems start in management at the hard rock. He was merely a product of his environment... . 

This place sucks. Stay far away!!! 

Paying strip prices to be a mile away. Resort fees that include below average facilities.

We are locals who enjoy a staycation every now and then so when a great rate was made available through a third party we took advantage and booked it as we have never stayed at the HRH. 
When we first arrived there was absolutely nobody waiting in line to check in. It was dead. A desk clerk and her colleague were busy making "jazz hands" and "spirit fingers" that they did not even acknowledge us. I had to ask her if she was available. Already a bad start. 
I didn't realize that my account with the third party had my maiden name and credit card with maiden name linked to it. Maritza, the jazz-handing desk clerk rolled her eyes and asked if I had any other ID to prove that was me. I showed her every single card in my wallet but she wanted my passport...like I mentioned earlier we are local so I don't carry my passport around with me while I'm in my hometown. I asked her if she could ask a supervisor and she walked away to do so. When she came back, rather than empathize with us she told us we would have to make a cash deposit, which we didn't mind doing but she made it seem like it was such a hassle to her. She went on to make some random phone call talking quietly but I heard her say my last name. She handed us our keys and we went to our room.
When we arrived at our room it had 2 double beds instead of the 1 king that was booked. In the booking options we were given multiple different choices and I specifically picked King, non smoking. I called front desk from the phone multiple times with no answer. Finally I called a different department and asked to be transferred. That worked, wonder why? (Sarcasm).
The supervisor David or Davis (can't remember) took my call, I explained how our experience had been horrific from the beginning and now to add insult to injury we got the wrong room. He apologized for me "not reading the fine print" where it states HRH does not guarantee any room type or smoking option! How's that for customer service? He said there were no other rooms with a king bed available for the night. Which I found hard to believe considering the hotel was barren. 
I went on several different booking websites which all showed king bed option still available that night. Which means either I was lied to or there would\/could be a lot of angry guests expecting a king bed and not getting it. 
We decided to leave, forfeiting our money but booked last minute with Planet Hollywood -same price but extreme opposite end of the spectrum in terms of customer service. The staff at PH make you believe they value your business and the rooms and amenities far exceed HRH for the same price. Do not be fooled by the name. Go elsewhere for a better experience.

The ROCK AND ROLL!!! details are so cheeeeeesy. But what's not cheese in this town? Room was comfortable enough and surprisingly spacious, although a fan in the bathroom would have been nice. Really big flat screen tv was also a pleasant surprise (but cheesy). A younger and edgier crowd (although still cheesy).

Of all the places with at least a decent reputation, the Hard Rock was the cheapest when I booked my trip. And it was pretty cool in the end, so 4 stars.
Pretty cool, good service, decent rooms, and good food. An overall good experience. Biggest problem is the distance from the strip.

Absolutely horrible service. The machine at center bar glitched and they refused to watch the cameras for proof of it. They told me "since the hand is played, they can't do anything" How am I not supposed to play the hand when I'm playing blackjack and the book they give out on it says I should hit? DO NOT STAY HERE. Complete rip off. Stay at the Bellagio or The Venetian. Forget about this horrible place.

We came to the Hard Rock to see Britney Spears' BABY ONE MORE TIME schoolgirl outfit that the Hard Rock should be thankful to have such an iconic piece in their possession. Oh my word.

The casino floor was pretty remarkable. Beautiful and clean, the Hard Rock boasts a pleasant place to gamble and sight see and dine!
I wish it were a tad closer to the strip, I would stay there.

Pretty disappointed with the hotel. We checked in on a Monday. I guess we were in the main section of the hotel, on the 11th floor facing the pool. We headed out pretty much immediately. Came back to the hotel around 9 and our room was extremely hot. We thought we just had the air on the wrong setting, so we fixed it and headed out again. Got back at 4 am and our hotel room was around 80 degrees, so we called maintenance. They responded right away, checked out our unit, and said the air was working properly. At 6 am, all four of us woke up, miserable. We went to the front desk to change rooms but were told every room was full. Our only option was to switch to an upgraded room the next day in the HRH tower, but we would have to pay for the upgrade. They refunded the day fee ($24) and we switched rooms the next day at 11. The new room was improved but I still find it unacceptable that we had to pay a $80\/day upgrade when their room was the one with the issues. If they didn't have an equal room with a working air conditioner, we should have been upgraded free of charge. While we were able to salvage the trip, I will never stay here again!

We found a great deal and stayed at the Hard Rock which isn't exactly that convenient for the strip but since i knew that going in, I didn't mind.

We got a voucher for the cabana bed at the pool which is awesome since the pool there is pretty famous with rehab and all. I had a good time watching the most ridiculously drunk people try to hit on each other. One guy literally fell flat on his face then got up and tried to talk to me. I wanted to tell him he was a liability at that stage but I thought that word might have to many syllables in it so I just moved slightly to the side.

The drinks were pricey poolside but the huge margaritas were delicious, although I felt like I wasn't getting drunk.

Our room was nice albeit there was no view but for what we paid, it was to be expected. The diner there had some tasty deep fried business although they got the order wrong but c'est la vie. I would stay there again if there was a similarly good deal as you do end up paying for cabs to most of the venues although there are some fun places to go in the hotel itself.

I'm the travel coordinator for my company and we send a group of employees (from the multi-million dollar founders of our company all the way down to our warehouse guy) annually to a very large event and it's usually housed at the Hard Rock in Las Vegas.  It's always complicated to get my rooms reserved and prepaid for, but this year...  well this year was just a nightmare.
  
So instead of telling you about who dropped the ball, I'd first like to tell you who helped pick it back up and that would be Norma in reservations and Todd the front desk manager.  These two individuals were absolutely stellar in helping me.  The issues seemed to stem from somewhere beyond Norma and Todd, though that part is still a mystery.  

Ok, now back to the story - way back in August of 2016, I was advised to deal with Michael Rowland, Executive Director of Group Sales.  This was the first year (out of 9 that I've handled this show) that a Hard Rock director was involved which I thought was weird, but I did as I was told.  Michael simply doesn't respond.  Send him emails or leave him voicemails, doesn't matter because he's not going to respond.  I kept getting pressure on my end to get the talent room rates so we could make our contract negotiations and Michael simply would not answer any of my communications.  Days later he finally emailed me this 8 page long contract that was so confusing that I couldn't make heads or tails of it, and then of course he refused to respond to my questions. The only thing he would talk about was some sort of credit card compliance issues that they were having...  He left me a voicemail about it.  I'm sorry, but how is that in any way my issue?  Beyond it not being my issue, I wasn't even trying to prepay for any rooms at that point, I was simply trying to obtain pricing.  I never was able to get anything useful out of Michael, so I ultimately had to give up on him all together.  When the time came for reserving the rooms I didn't even bother trying to deal with Michael again, I just reserved the rooms myself.  I guess this is a shady way of not having to discount any rooms at all for any reason?  That's certainly what it seemed like from my perspective.  For him to hold an "Executive" title of anything is staggering to me.

After the third night in a row of being called by my employees having problems at the hotel I was ready to cry.  I mean, who needs this level of stress?  Las Vegas is supposed to be a fun place to do business in, but none of my employees had any fun.  It seemed that none of my payments were actually applied (despite me calling and verifying every single room and writing down who I spoke to, the date and the time) it just did not matter.  Nothing was enough; it seemed that all of the hotel accounting had simply ground to a halt on the back end. 
 
This entire event was maddening to me because it erodes the faith my employees have in me being able to make their travel flow smoothly.  One of my senior level people had a hotel staff person knock on his door and ask him to leave because of the payment issues... His room was fully prepaid before he ever even got to Las Vegas!!  This makes me look like I can't do my job!  So thanks Hard Rock Hotel, thanks for causing me to have to apologize to a room full of annoyed people, thanks for multiple late night phone calls from my employees, thanks for making huge accounting messes for me to try to figure out and thanks for dropping the ball in every possible way.  FAIL.

If had the chance to stay in your car or Hard Rock Hotel stay in your car.  Wifi didn't work, safe didn't work, front disk and 
Manager  extremely unprofessional.  When I called to complain she was trying to make a believe that with removing resort fee everything will be Better. I won't be back to this establishment ever again.  Not even for free.

While there is a nice pool party and nice restaurants here I found the fact that the refrigerator is filled with items you must pay for sickening. You can get a refrigerator and microwave for personal use at any hold in the the wall but for some reason they fall extremely short in this area and in my opinion was the biggest failure of my visit here.
