The oyster bar was to die for. I literally went to eat oysters every day. My next stay in Vegas will not be at this establishment but I will visit just for oysters during the day while staying somewhere else. Paying to use a refrigerator seems very nickle and dimeish to me.  With the revenue they are generating there's simply no reason for it. 2 Stars just because of the oyster bar. Otherwise it would have been 1 star.

I wasn't a big fan of the hotel. My husband and I just had a long weekend getaway to Las Vegas and we decided to stay at the Hard Rock Hotel because it looked pretty updated and trendy online and the price seemed decent. While I did really enjoy the room decor and super-comfy bed, my experience over all wasn't so great. 

The hotel lobby and casino was one of the smokiest of all the hotels we visited while in Las Vegas. Once you walked far enough past the casino for the cigarette smoke to dissipate, we were hit with the constant smell of what reminded me of someone scorching leftovers in a toaster oven. The smell was present our entire stay and even visited us on all the way on the 7th floor.

Although I enjoyed melting into the down-filled bed, the room was far too dark to even dig through my suitcase. The walk-in shower was big enough for a party, but they were stingy with the towels.

We ordered room service for breakfast one morning. It was mediocre at best, but it set us back $70 for some chewy pancakes and coffee.

Another issue--although a completely personal one that I will nonetheless share with you--is that I didn't feel cool enough to stay at this hotel. Everyone walking around, young and old alike, was wearing head-to-toe black or at least a black band shirt with ripped up jeans. I'm all for however you wanna dress, I just felt like a total "never-been-in-a-band" outsider.

The hotel staff was nice enough, but they definitely weren't going to bend over backwards to help anyone--that may have broken their bad*** character (all decked out in their matching Mötley Crüe shirts I might add). **This is in comparison to being turned around in one of the bigger hotels on the strip where a nice gentleman took the initiative to ask us what we were looking for and gave us directions to our lunch destination.

I think that since the Hard Rock Hotel isn't directly on the strip, it needs to work even harder to take care of its' guests. (Also, seriously--drop the $20 per day fee to use the fitness facilities).

This is where we decided to spend Christmas this year. 

...And I was not disappointed. This is a very unique hotel experience. The casino is small and cozy, decorated with TONS of rock and roll memorabilia, and great tunes playing throughout. They have a dozen rock-n-roll type stores with a tattoo parlor, spa, gym, and several stylish clothing boutiques. 

Our room looked out over the "rehab" pool and onto the strip. The room was also "oversize" with a huge flat screen, modern furnishings, and french-doors. It's only a $10 taxi ride to the hottest spots on the strip. This is also close to the airport and will save you bucks on taxi\/shuttle rides if you fly in.

Rooms can be had under $100 on priceline.com

I am scheduled to be here the next couple of nights and my disappointment with the staff and room was far less desirable the minute I checked-in.  

They will nickel and dime you to death; and the cleanliness of the room is substandard.  I waited over 15 minutes to pick up the keys to the room after an argumentative check-in process, inconsiderably given a room - what felt like a mile away - with an 80-year old disabled woman, and to my surprise, I walked into a bathroom with urine and hairs on the floor behind the toilet fixture, water marks on the toilet seat, holes on the walls behind the shower faucets, and mildew around the sink faucets.  Disgusting!

Wish I could post all the pictures I took of the overall condition of this room.  Sadly, Hard Rock Hotel and Casino will not take responsibility or try to accommodate your needs if the reservations were made through a third party.  

This has been an extremely disappointing experience.

If you are looking for a family friendly place than this isn't the place for you and I'm not a fan of the standard rooms but the HRH tower is great. Comfy bed, large room, and great restaurants. Great atmosphere for a fun night but if you plan on leaving you'll need a taxi because its off the strip and not walkable in heels. It was a great staycation.

I was in town for the investor relations conference earlier this month and got a great deal on a suite in the all-suite tower here. I really didn't feel like staying at the Bellagio and with the deal I got I knew at the end of each conference day I would have something to look forward to. My only complaint is the smoky casino but that is how all casino floors are. Once you go up the elevator its no problem though. The style of the room is slick modern and moody. Huge flat screen. Really nice bathrooms. Comfy couch. I like how the tv was available to watch in bed or on the other side of the suite in the living area. Lots of cool touches and not super feminine or macho so it works for couples.

I came here for a business trip with the missus.  Ever go somewhere think it's great then get your happiness dashed when things get worse?  Started with Ms. Happy at check-in, who however turned the page when we were polite and upgraded us to a bigger suite.  We get there, door is screwed up, call help desk "we'll send someone up"  I know that tone, it's a "we're not going to send anyone up, Im feeling lazy and I hate my job".

Then for my job, I need to have a direct cat5 connection can't use wifi for security reasons, cat5 doesn't work, they don't have an IT department, instead they use a cable provider who knows nothing about the equipment, finally after a 2nd call to desk about the stuck door, this time we get someone to come up.  The engineer helps me, great guy, we find a work around however I determine it's an unsecure network so I can't use it.  I go down to the useless Business Center where miss lazy pants who gave me mixed feelings, lazy but big huge beautiful eyes, like a Japanese Magna cartoon, didn't know anything other than the rates ($100 an hour).  Basically if you're a business person, you shouldn't go to this hotel.

Plusses, the slots are loose.  Sensing I was having a bad day, I was worried about losing my job because I couldn't do my job, she fixed my collar, I was a hairy mess walking through the hotel like Hunter S. Thomson, she gave me a drink, that alone gives this hotel a star.  The museum that is spread around the hotel is great, and the pool is perfect, it looks dirty because of the reflection, I took a brief swim...don't, it smells like armpits, just keep your head above water.  

Ok correction, pool AREA is perfect, you can lay back in their very comfortable chairs and snooze and take an occasional dip or hang in the over 21 place and scream stupid things like "I am soooo drunk, omg omg, I'm an animal yes, hear me scream arrrrgh arrrrrgh!"  Meanwhile those of us who can handle a drink, with a more mature mind that comes with age will be elsewhere.  

Last sting and final fu to me was the last day where before we checked out, went down to the store by the elevators and picked up 1 package of little donuts (they're sold everywhere), and one package of coffee cake, and a soda.  It came out to $9.50  She charged $3.50 for the drink of which I can get upstairs for $2.50.  

They have "free shuttle" service which is only every hour, but here's a tip, you don't even have to go on the dreaded traffic heavy Las Vegas Strip... go out of the garage, take a right, take another right go down harmon?  Anyway just park in Palazzo and have fun, screw the shuttle.

Love HRH tower but my Vegas experience was lousy. Most of the people at HRH hate their job and you can see it off their aura but it's still a nice hotel with some cool shit in their. Make sure you eat a luckys cafe, that place is affordable, efficient, and the food comes highly recommended.

Let me just say how AMAZING of a time I had in Vegas because of this place. I went for my 21st birthday and the vibe was exactly what I was looking for. The employees were extremely nice and helpful and the pool was incredible! They have a free shuttle service to the strip (limited hours so check with the front desk first before you plan your day\/night). I would definitely stay here again!! I highly recommend it.

My bf and I just got back from a 3-night stay at the Hard Rock.  We had been here a few years ago and decided to try it again on this trip.  I am SO HAPPY that we did!

Our stay began with the most excellent customer service from Larry at the check-in desk.  He gave us a free upgrade to a corner room in the Paradise tower that was beautiful and had an AMAZING view of the entire Strip.  The room was large and clean, the bed was nice and firm and the pillows made me think of fluffy clouds.

The casino is very nice.  Lots of Rock & Roll memorabilia everywhere, it's clean and spacious.  I didn't win this time, but not due to a lack of effort!

We at twice at Mr. Lucky's and the food was good and the waitstaff was very attentive and friendly.

Some people complain of airport noise....well, duh!  The cab ride was under $10 from the airport, so what do you expect?  Anyway, by the time we got back to our plush bed every night I was too exhausted to notice any noise if there was some.  Who goes to Vegas to hang out in their room?? 

Hard Rock is now going to be "our place" in Vegas.

I've never actually stayed at this hotel but I visited the casino during my last visit. There is a lot of cool stuff to look at. Made my way around the whole casino area looking at the awesome displays. The restaurants looked pretty good also. If you are looking for a cool place to stay off the strip this might be your place.

So disappointed. Arrived to a hotel with next to no casino, low key music and a room toilet filled with feces. Went in search of the ginormous pool we remembered only to discover it's been chopped up between a small family pool and the fee-only Rehab pool. We used to love coming here. Never again.

I love the Hard Rock. I've stayed here five times since the beginning of 2013. Multiple times last year as well. Rehab is one of my favorite places on Earth, seriously. Haha. I tend to lean more towards attending the clubs in Vegas, but for a couple of drinks, I would recommend the Circle Bar. Love Todd the bartender that often works there.

4.5 stars.

I stayed at the Paradise Tower last weekend for my BF's birthday and the Guns 'N Roses concert.  It was probably the most beautiful and quietest room I've stayed at for the price.  

Yeah, you heard me---a QUIET room at the HRH.  A place that caters to the people you've seen on The Dirty blog and Jersey Shore. 

The shower is spacious as hell (ADA compliant or ideal for sexy times?  Or both?), and the furnishings are very nice.  The bed is very comfortable and the room is very clean, all things considered.

Downstairs, there's a Nobu AND a John Varvatos store.  The birthday boy was very happy about that!!

Since we used the VISA concierge service instead of dealing with the HRH staff directly, we got better service.

The casino itself is very smoky, so proceed with caution if you've got asthma or sensitive allergies.
I kind of forget about Hard Rock since it is off strip but, it is great spot to see the younger crowd but it is not as crowded as the strip places. Good music also and very hot girls everywhere.

Been here lots over the years, seen this place change in so many ways.
Seen the renovations taking place before my eyes, love the new parking garage and additional casino space but they could've added one more bathroom on the casino floor.
I've gambled and won, I've gambled and lost.
I've eaten at Mr. Luckys and Johnny Smalls and the Hard Rock Cafe out front both pretty good. And when Simons use to be here, yum.
I've stayed in their rooms, nice.
Swam in their pool and gone to their poolside concerts, both can be very crowded, rowdy, and gross at times a depending on the crowds, the poolside shows aren't like they use to be, so I haven't gone at all this year.
Bars can be busy, drinks can be strong, you may even get a deal...all Jack Daniels drinks while the rodeo was in town were on special! JD Honey is where its at.
I liked the old Joint, the new Joint is nice but doesn't have the same intimate feel. But I still go, they usually have decent shows. That's why we were there recently...to see a show, had a good time. The show was pretty empty and the scene in the casino was a bit dead especially for a Saturday night, no eye candy like I remember (guests or staff) , maybe its the time of year, who knows.
HRH always draws me back for one reason or another.

Employee Janice in reservations has THE WORST attitude and customer service skills I've ever encountered! Horrible experience because of that! Spoke to her supervisor, who didn't seem to care much about my complaint. Thumbs down!

Worst casino staff in Vegas. Not sure you can find a more depressed, bitter, life-fucked-me-over group of people then the casino employees at Hard Rock Hotel. Not the waitresses and bar staff, the dealers and pit bosses. What a miserable group of people. They're lucky there aren't any other Casinos in Las Vegas. Oh, wait.

This place is super disappointing nowadays. Been coming since 2005 when it was the spot to be. Checked in today, room wasn't ready until 5pm and when we got to the room it just felt dirty. The maid staff does not give a shit at all. There was a booger wiped eye level in the shower and I couldn't quit looking at it. Whoever runs this joint nowadays is a major let down.

We walked thru the hotel lobby but our mission was to visit the HR store.  The place is frequently by mostly young men in their 20's, 30's who more than enjoy the "drink until drunk" lifestyle.  Rock music loudly echoing in the hallways and I mean loud.  At a nearby cafe, a cluster of dudes were hanging out and as 1\/2 naked babes would walk by, you'd see a their heads turn simultaneously and then they'll laugh and high-five each other.  
The store is smaller than the HR on the Strip, but they sell the usual t-shirts and pins not found in their 2nd store.  The store looks dated now, it's been there for many years, but the hotel is right next to the store so it probably keeps it alive. They have a HR Hotel store in the hotel which only carries the HRH pins, you have to exit the building to the other parking lot for the cafe and cafe store.  Lots of guitars and rock photos adorn the walls and display cases in the HRH casino.  Loud, bring your ear plugs.

Lets just run down what happened at the Hard Rock Hotel Tower in Las Vegas.

Check in is supposed to be between 3 and 4 in the afternoon.  We arrived at 4:20pm and I was told my room was still not ready.  They told me it should be "inspected" in the next 30 to 40 minutes.  I was then supposed to sit in the lobby with my wife and wait.  Not the way to start a trip.  There should be no reason why all the reservations can't be ready by the 4pm check in time.

Our room was very nice with one feature that was really cool.  Music piped into the room with a pretty cool selection.  Dimmers were not available on any of the lights.  They are either on full blast or off.  Not a good design.  Also no free Internet which I think in a suite this should be standard.

We went out to dinner had a nice time in Vegas and returned to the room around 1am.  Hard Rock has a new club called Vanity that was pounding music 4 floors bellow us.  It was so disturbingly loud in the room we thought, "this can not be happening."  I called the front desk and was told the music would stop by 4am.  WHAT!!!.  I was also told they could not move me as they were at capacity.  By 3am I was so over the noise I would have paid a premium to be anywhere else.  We couldn't find a room and I didn't want to loose what we had already committed by signing the room contract at HRH.

I called the desk again at 3am.  The woman told me they would move us first thing in the morning and she was sorry,  and to come down early to get it handled.  Now its Sunday morning and Rehab pool is about to  begin its music soon (we had a pool view room), so I got up early and tried to have the situation fixed.  I asked for a manager at 9am.  The woman told me she could help (not wanting to get a manager) and would see what she might be able to do.  She apologized and said she could move us but not until 11 or 12!!  I was not happy.  She then offers $50 dollars off for "breakfast".  This is insulting but I take the $50 and say Ill be back by 12 noon.  

We go to lunch.  Hang out wait half the day and come back to the HRH Tower at 3pm.  I ask for the keys for our new room.  A new front desk employee (with a horrible attitude) tells me the room is still not "inspected" and it will be another 30 to 40 minutes, I've heard that before.  Now I am ballistic.  I ask for a manager right away.  The GM will not come out right away.  He's busy and she says "he will be out in about 20 minutes."

In the mean time the original girl comes walking back from her break (the one I spoke to at 9am). I explain to her what is happening and she goes behind the counter, looks in the computer and says "your room is ready."  We move and a GM never comes out to talk to me face to face.  I'm"m told he or she will call me.  I get to he new room and the GM has left a message on my new room phone.  A great way not to have to talk to me.  I call her back and am told she is busy but will call in a few minutes.  She never calls.  

The next morning I ask about talking to someone, like the GM who called me last night and left a message.  I'm told she is now on military leave and is not available.

Long story short we fly home and at 11pm Monday night I get someone on the line and tell them my story.  He gives me $150 off and sends the confirmation in an email that say's "do not respond to this email."  I promise I wont respond ever.

Morgan's Hotel group you now have the two worst hotel experiences I have ever had HRH Tower in Vegas and the Hudson Hotel in NYC. 

I promise to never stay at any of your facilities again.  Get some better costumer service or get out of the hospitality business. You guys are the worst, the absolute worst.

Soley writing on the bar. We were in town and thought we would stop in to check it out. It was my first time in Vegas so I wanted to see the different places and see where to come back to. Sat down at the bar, several empty seats at the bar and at the tables behind us. Two bartenders working our end of the bar. One walked away to the other end, the other female bartender looked right at us walked away. Then when guys walked up on my right side and my dates left side she helped both of them while still not saying a word to us. Waited another five minutes while she helped others that walked up without bothering to acknowledge our presence. We got up and walked across the street the Firkin on Paradise and had a great night!

I really don't understand all of the recent negative reviews of this hotel. Maybe it was my lucky night when I stayed here, as the service and pricing were spot on for my stay. I would upgrade my rating to 5 stars if the hotel itself was as modern as its rooms, and if it didn't include a resort fee. At least with the resort fee you are provided ample parking and WiFi access for your wireless devices. The front desk and room service employees were very friendly. I paid $45 for a tower suite with a strip view on a Friday night! The suite was very modern looking and offered more cable channel selections (including HBO) than most Vegas hotels I have stayed in. The room service was pricey as to be expected for any hotel on the strip, but the food was delicious and the delivery was quite fast. I was also able to grab to a pretty tasty and filling breakfast sandwich from Fuel Cafe for a little over $7 with tax right before I checked out.

Don't waste your time. Get one elsewhere. Typical Las Vegas bs.  Smells bad and the food sucks. Bars have bs happy hour they don't honor. Great background music though .  Never gave 1, or I would have.

Casino layout that does not make you want to die, ie, you can walk across the floor and find the bathroom or the sundries shop where you can buy some overpriced batteries. 

Won 150 dollars at the nickel slots. The beginning of a 24 hour lucky streak. Thanks, Hard Rock!

The place looks nice at first but It's located right next to the Airport so forget it you won't be able to sleep! But anyway it's Vegas, there are others things to do at night. Oh wait this is 35min walking from the Strip!  You may be tempted to book this hotel because of the coupons if you book directly but you will in fact never use it. In the room nothing is free, but this seems to be the standard in Vegas. Just a positive note :The pool party are nice even if it Could be more classy...

Saw this Casino on Entourage (Season 3: Vegas baby, Vegas) and the movie 21. Always wanted to visit this casino because of its appearances on these shows. I came to Vegas for four days, and stayed at Mandalay Bay, but almost stayed at the Hard Rock due to the lower prices. 

Upon visiting the Hard Rock to gamble (blackjack), I noticed that the casino was not as busy as other Casinos (I know, it's not on the strip). But I thought it had a pretty sweet design. As far as blackjack tables, they did not have any under $15.00 per hand. However, I was able to sit at a table with one other person for approximately two hours, and was able to walk away with an extra few hundred dollars. Also, the blackjack is played from a shoe, and not from a continuous shuffler. Great bar service, and enjoyed man free drinks (don't forget to tip!)

One thing my family said, is that there was a lack of stores for them to shop at, and varity of areas to walk around while I gambled. I thoroughly enjoyed my time at this casino and am glad I went. Would not mind staying here in a future vegas vacation.

first ever bad experience here & it was all about the check in process & rooms not ready. they made us wait indefinitely & the first ever RUDE experience with check in staff. won't be coming back but it used to be cool here :(

I'm writing this review so that people can be realistic about their expectations.  Hard Rock is not the nicest, or the best, or even one of the best, hotels in Vegas.  But if you are looking for a good hotel with a great price that does the job - Hard Rock is it.   We booked through Expedia and our trip included our flight.  It was a good deal.  My friends booked through a Groupon and stayed in the HRC tower, which is nicer, but I think we got the better deal.  In the Casino tower, which is older, our room was awesome, the bathroom was nice, the bed was super comfy and the view totally sucked.  It was a full view of a roof area with a wall.  We only saw a sliver of sky.  But....because our view sucked, we were able to take a nap on the Saturday we were there and our room was nice and quiet!   (Naps are necessary in Vegas.)  And who spends tons of time staring out their window in Vegas anyway?  Our friends, with their fancy suites in the HRC tower, with views overlooking the great "Rehab" pool party...their rooms were super loud.  Like, major bass and really obnoxious.

We went to Vegas to celebrate our friend's 40th birthday.  We had a great time, we were there for less than 48 hours.  Hard Rock totally suited our needs.  We ate at Pink Taco for Sunday brunch and were very happy, and the other restaurant there was great as well.  The bars and drinks were ok, and the gambling was pretty average.  I'm taking off a star because checking in (on a Friday afternoon) was kind of a mess.  Long lines, not enough desk agents, and our room wasn't ready by 5pm, which was really crappy!  Check in is between 3-5.  Give people their rooms on time!  When we complained about it, we got a 'I'm really sorry' and that was it.  So...we just got screwed out of some time and no one really cared.  But other than that, pretty awesome trip!  (I wish I could give a 3.5 score, but I'll round up)

(If you really like gambling - stay somewhere else.  Other casinos we visited were way more happening and fun, with more options.  HR is old and off the strip, so the casino wasn't a draw for us.  And if you like a major club-scene pool party - Rehab is it.  It's both weekend days and from the looks of it, people were ready to PARTY at the pool.  We are not into that scene, so we stayed at the quieter, free pool, and had a lovely time.  Although, unless you pay for a cabana, lounge chairs are hard to come by.  If I could do it again, I would just splurge on that.)

Would rate this Hotel a 3.5. Would be a 4 but I didn't realize how far away it was from the strip. About a 10-15 min walk. When we arrived there was a huge line and the staff didn't seem to be in a hurry to help with customers. My girlfriend and I waited for a while before we could check in, with only 2 people working the front desk. As soon as we got helped, the process went by fast though. The cleanliness of the hotel was okay, not great, but okay. Our room was pretty cozy, was clean as well. Enjoyed the decor. Didn't like the weighted snack bar though. Seemed like I would accidentally knock something over and get charged for it. When I do go back to Las Vegas though, I will be staying at a hotel on the strip. It was a real inconvenience staying here off the strip. But other than that, was a good stay!

I love this hotel. 
Always a good deal, and the staff is exemplary. The casino is clean, the restaurants are solid, and the housekeeping is on point. 
Check-in is sometimes CRAZY busy, so when I stay here I try to arrive around 4pm or so. The weekends always have something going on: concerts, AVN, bachelorette parties- seriously, everything.

Hadn't been here for 15 plus years. What I like is it's not the MegaPlex Casino's like the Venetian that are like small cities. The staff were friendly and helpful in my opinion. It's off the strip and they make you walk to get their shuttle. It's crowded and has one drop spot. They don't cater to shuttle riders to the strip and they let you know it's just an annoyance. I never saw anyone winning anything. The rooms are dated and the TV outdated. The internet connection\/WiFi sucked so badly. Horrible. Starbucks is 10X better. I know they want people out and about to spend money, but with crappy channels and no Internet worth a damn...just feels like they're punishing you for being in your room. Pools are hot and not refreshing in the summer heat - no wonder those ClubRehab kids get so drunk and unruly in that heat - at least if you're on the River you can dunk in and cool off. Jump in the 90 degree water of these pools and get out into 110 degrees,,,,you're going to be irritable. With all the money they make, they can't have one pool that is cooled down? If you're trying to do any business on their WiFi - your boss is going to kick your ass when you get home. Lots of overpriced cheesy wannabe rock stuff. Lots and lots of Hookers (got hit up 3X at 8am) If that's your thing, you'll find a wide selection to choose from. Not my thing. Vegas is a worldwide destination and they know people from other parts of the world sometimes don't know they're being BONED. It's in the food, the drinks, everything. Not just HR it's pervasive all along the strip. That's the Vegas of today. Destination SHEEP!

Been here for 4 days. Haven't even seen the pool because some assholes booked it the last 2 days! Very disappointed and angry!  Don't even bother playing the slots! 7 will LOSE!!!! cool hotel, but sucks to b u when u can't even enjoy the pool...and guess what, we saw,NO ONE at this sooooo important private party for ppl more important than us the entire time the pool was off limits to everyone else! Idk if I'll stay here again because of this. Like I said,  cool place, great ppl but I really wanted to take a swim but wasn't on the A list. It's not ok to block off the entire pool, especially when nobody even shows up for your stupid party!

Didn't stay in the hotel but from the casino to the clubs, it is a good place for younger people rather than old. It is just the energy that I get off from the casino. Also a little out of the way from the strip that can be a plus for a little privacy without too much hustle from drunk tourists.

dp

This hotel is full of rock n roll memorabilia and has two great restaurants: Pink taco over looking the pool and a Steak House. 

Not on the strip but pretty close if you decide to hop on a cab takes about 8 min. Also very close to the airport.

You can get a tattoo on your way up to your room, talk about rash decisions! The Hart & Huntington Tattoo parlor (famous from the Inked reality show) is right there at the tip of your nose. 

The beds were super comfortable. Some of the rooms look towards the pool probably a better view and others towards the strip\/parking garage.

Hope your not looking for good customer service because it's not happening here.    Book a king room, confirm at checkin only to arrive to double queens.   One would think if you want to the concierge they would happily take care of that as you are trying to run out to your dinner reservation elsewhere.    Hell no we were told we should hurry and go tell the check in because it wasn't there fault they are having computer problems and otherwise we would probably be stuck with our room.   This place can shove it as far as I'm concerned.   This is the first and last time I will be staying at this place if this is the way that the customer service operates around here.

If you're looking for a hip and fun place to stay in Vegas, this is your joint. I mean it's got a friggin guitar shooting out of the building. It's also a good place to catcht he occasional rock star or celeb and they have a Sid Viscious slot machine. I mean, hello. 

The rooms are kinda modern (not normally my thing) and the room service is top notch. Only peeve I had was that after a night of rolling around and a clear and apparent screw ball going as we answered the room service door wrapped in a sheet, they still felt the need to come in and do their little here's your food show. Leave it at the door next time and I'll slip a $20 under it for ya!

Other than that, a great place to stay, especially if you can hit it on an internet savings deal. Otherwise it's a little pricey for being at the far end of the strip.

OMG If I could live here I would!
I love everything about this place from the casino,shops,to the restaurants

Stayed here with my gf for thanksgiving weekend because we were sick of the whole turkey\/family thing & I am sooo glad we did

I booked a room there in the paradise tower for almost a week for a little under $300, once we arrived the girl at the front desk upgraded our room to the top floor with a view of Rehab(NICE)

Everyone working there was so nice from the valet to the maids
I honestly do not have one single complaint while staying here

Not to mention they were also filming the tv show The Real World while we were there the enire time, I've loved that show for as long as I could remember &  to see it being taped in front of my face was crazyness!! I saw the cast & crew pretty much every night we were there 

HRH is definately the place to go to if you want to have the time of your life.. Soo many memories 

This is my one & spot in Vegas for sure

This place is way overrated!!! I stayed there for the first time last fall & it was terrible. First off the front desk people are worthless. You ask them questions and they stare at you for a minute & then follow it up with a smart ass response. What is it with these "hipper than you" places?! They act as though they own the fu#%ing joint! First off, after staying at this hotel it truely baffles me how they can charge the amounts they do. The rooms are shabby and run-down. I had no hot water in my room (in a hotel??) and it took them an hour to come up to my room. The chaise chair had cigarette holes in it, the bathroom fixtures were rusted and practically falling off, and the lampshades were bent. Now, I know it sounds like i'm being extremly diva-ish but this place throws a "security" fee for $150 a night!!!! Can you believe that! I've stayed at nicer\/classier  hotels on the strip that don't dare smack on outrageous fees like this! I was told that it is because some people have thrown furniture out of the windows & actually started fires in their rooms! WTF!!! And people think Downtown LV is bad?! Actually they are really improving Downtown a lot! But that's another story. Anyway, about this place........oh yeah and they have a sign posted at the entrance of the casino that says "Dress Code after 8pm"....dress code to gamble?! To go to the clubs & restraunts maybe, but to hang out?! If any places should have signs like that you would think it would be at The Bellagio, Wynn, or Caesars....not here. Overall, the rooms suck, staff is pretty shitty, and the casino is small & crappy. If you go to Vegas to hang with wanna-be rockstars & future Realworld  hopefuls then this is your spot. If you like to gamble & get your drink on.....go elsewhere!

I couldn't really understand\/enjoy Vegas the first time I went there, mostly because I was 14. But on that visit I could appreciate the stylish decor and top-notch pool at the (then nascent) Hard Rock.

Now legal, I've had the pleasure of an on-us long weekend at the Hard Rock, and I can happily attest that I had good taste even at a young age.

If you have the urge to strip-crawl, the Hard Rock may not be for you. Alternatively, if you'd like to have world class Japanese (Nobu), excellent steak (Simon's), and some exxxxxxxcellent mexican (Pink Taco) downstairs, welcome home. We all know the pool is killer, and the venues (Body English and the Joint) get great performers.

The single downside, as I see it, is that the casino will be insufficient for serious card players (and hold'em band-wagoners)--there is no poker license there.

Not the 5 stars it used to be. The rates were fantastic, but cost-cutting efforts are apparent. I don't like to see a jigger used when my drinks are made. The removal of double-down and splits on video blackjack takes away my game -- went elsewhere to play. We had no drinking glasses in the room for 24 hours (we did get red plastic party cups upon request). There were no in-house discount coupons in the room upon arrival. It just felt cheapened.

The staff was extremely friendly. This is my favorite hotel to go to when I stay in Las Vegas, and I have stayed at many of the hotels throughout Las Vegas. The condition of the room was perfect and an awesome view overlooking the pools. The front desk team always remembered my name and were extremely nice to me. This hotel is so much fun, I don't mind staying off of the strip as long as the place is a good time with great staff. I highly recommend staying at the hard rock due to the service quality and friendly staff.

Rooms:
We stayed in the HRH Tower and had a corner suite, which had spectacular views of the strip. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room itself was huge with the bathroom being the focal point. There was no mini-fridge in the room which was a bummer as we wanted to have a drink or two in the room. Missed revenue for them. The shampoo and conditioner left a lot to be desired.

Service:
Loved being able to check out from our room and avoid lines at the registration desk. All the staff there are really nice and want to go the extra mile in my experience. We were very pleased with their level of service.

Food:
We ate at NOBU the sushi restaurant and it was really fresh sushi. A little pricey but not bad for what you get. Pink Taco was just OK and left a lot to be desired. We did like the sangria and champagne drink they have on the menu. Every morning we ate at Mr. Lucky's which had a great breakfast menu and would recommend eating there. Overall, the food options are pretty limited compared to other hotels in Las Vegas but good enough to get you through your stay.

Overall:
This is a great spot to stay for the younger crowd or the young at heart. It does get pretty wild but we expected this during our stay and it was a lot of fun to people watch. The pools are great and are probably some of the best in Vegas. But stay in the new towers if you are going to stay here, worth the upgrade.

It's good, but nothing spectacular. First off, it is a true walking distance from the strip. But that's on me since I didn't look as clearly when I booked. 

I did really appreciate all of the music themes and memorabilia. There are tons of outfits, guitars and other items from many different celebrities that have made a mark on Hard Rock and it was cool. 

When we checked in, they did not have the room we requested available, so we were forced to choose between a smoking room or a suite with an upgrade fee. We picked the upgrade, and the front desk lady said she would take off a day's convenience fee, how nice! But it was not taken off at the final billing. I called later and they said they would refund me, but they still haven't. 

The pool is cool, but only one of them is accessible for free as a guest, which is weird. 

The casino had everything that you could ask for with the slots and tables so it was a fun time there. Nothing to complain about there. 

I didn't have a bad time, but next time I will most definitely look towards a hotel on the strip!

Best casino and hotel in Vegas! Hands down!!  Most comfortable beds ever!!! Always clean!! Always fun!!! These crazies saying it smells like smoke...all the casinos do.  Unfortunately it's not a law in Vegas!!  This place is the best

The plus and minus side of the hotel are the same, that's why 3 stars. It's small, it's intimate, and that works for and against it. 

Easily can walk by your destination because the circle is so small and if you get busy talking, you'll have to back track, or just keep walking the circle! I like the Casino and lobby, didn't really like the joint, and body english is decent. 

The bar is fun, cute intimate bar, a circle of course, plenty of flirty guys. Not this weekend but at another time I sat at an empty table and it  filled up fast once i sat down, so don't be afraid of an empty table! 

The food places are a grill, (forgot the name) nobu, and AGO. I skipped nobu, but ate food at both other places. And both are good. One of the chefs at the grill sent over some sundaes, with a wink. very sweet! I lost my phone at AGO, and the cutey bartender got a flashlight, and on his hands and knees found it for me! Everyone is nice nice nice! 

Hard Rock has the friendliest, funniest and most accomodating employees. Everyone from the bodyguards to the taxi fetchers are funny and flirty. 

It seems as though there are more men than women there....so girls take note! And they are some friendly bunch of guys. 

i didn't stay at the hotel part, but there is security to prevent non-guest from going up to the guest rooms. 

Interesting displays of rockabilia, so check those out! Over all, a decent, intimate and interesting off the strip hotel and casino.

Second time staying at the HRH. Our "non-smoking" room had the strongest smoke scent when we entered. The room never felt CLEAN, the entire stay I was never confident as to how clean the room\/floors were. The TV remote didn't work and there were no controls on the actual TV. Housekeeping would come in after knocking ONCE. Both times it happened, I told the lady that we would be leaving in 10 minutes and asked her to come back later -- both times, never happened.

I received an email about the $45 rate for the Wiz Khalifa concert. After changing my hotel accommodations to utilize this special, I was sorely disappointed upon check out and having $70 extra in "resort fees and room revenue." Ruined my entire experience. Truly...everything I have listed about the cleanliness of the room, etc. I was fine ignoring because EDC had just passed and I figured everyone was slammed with crazy guests and a lot of mess. But when I had to check out and found out the extra charges had occurred (and you're not even allowed to use the REFRIGERATOR for free! What is that?!), it definitely took all the little annoyances and made my stay regrettable. Won't be returning.

I did give it an extra star because the pool was nice, free and not too crowded with some music in the background.

I would have to say that for being off the strip, I really like being at the Hard Rock. Over the past two weekends I have been there (NYE and AVN) I have been quite star struck as of late :-)

But what I like most is that the few times I have stayed here now, I have booked last minute through HotelTonight app on my iPhone for just over 100 dollars. And both times I had an awesome room - 1 in the south tower that was a suite and one that was in the Casino tower overlooking the very cold and uninhabited rehab pool (it IS winter you know). 

The bar down in the middle of all the poker tables has this special architectural feature to it that when you are sitting there.... you hear everyone else's conversations as if they were participating in your own... so mind you, watch what you say if you are actually gossiping about someone across the bar; or don't if you actually want the hot chic across the way to know that you think shes slammin :-)

I have had some good times at Vanity and Body English; I have seen Tiesto from the tables at the Joint and I heave enjoyed every evening I have ever experienced in the whole that is Hard Rock Hotel. Budget friendly if you are on your P's and Q's (HotelTonight & Hotels.com)

I would maybe give this hotel 4 stars, but there was a few areas that could have much improvement. 
We arrived early, and was greeted by Mariah, at pre check in - super friendly and sweet I really liked her. She offered a room upgrade for $30\/night extra, and so we said why not. Unfortunately bc we were early we were not able to be given a room until later on that day around 2-3pm, we were contacted that our room was ready.
We were given a room in the corner of the Paradise Tower which gave us a beautiful view of the strip (especially at night). I really love the style of the room, dark and very rockish like, which is my bf and our style anyways so we enjoyed it - seemed like a lot of guests didn't. Loved the king size bed, and the walk in shower, and big bathroom counters. Make up mirror was broken - didn't stay up on its own. Also just know that there are planes that fly directly over the hotel (didn't bother us, but see how it could bother other people). A lot of the furniture was run down, and broken. 
A lot of people had said they had issues bringing their own food\/drinks into the room however, we didn't have any issues like that. Quite the opposite, we handed the bell hop our bags and a large paper bag filled with food and drinks and they could have cared less. 
Another note is that it's off the strip. This wasn't an issue for us bc we don't drink & have a car but it seems it would be a pain if u were drinking and didn't want to pay for a taxi.
I think I may stay here again, however it will be in a HRH suite.

Was unsure after reading the reviews on what kind of service I was going to receive when arriving here , arrived here a little bit later than expected , they told me my rooms were taken fortunately but in order to keep me happy they upgraded my room free of charge , which I greatly appreciate . People Shouldn't go off what other people say about this casino or write , come here and experience the great Service and hospitality

Vegas pretty much blows (hey, I spent a considerable amount of my childhood there so I sort of know) BUT if you must go (or maybe you like to go) AND if you must stay at a hotel (or you like to do the hotel thing) the Hard Rock Hotel's the way to go. I was there for a great friend's birthday sojourn extravaganza (his choice, not ours) and, surprisingly, had a blast.

My room was amazing - 9th floor, view of the pools and mountains, super clean, quiet, not a cigarette scent about. I love this hotel because they have really cool tour posters, random outfits (Stevie Nicks' black lace bodysuit from the 70's...whhhaaatt?!!!), great guitars (ZZ Top = yeah!)...yes, it's just how you remember the Hard Rock Cafes from the 90's (the ones that you may have ventured into as a kid) but in addition to the burger and fries you get the big fluffy pillows and a super comfy bed to rest your Vegas weary bones upon after an evening of Vegas overload (mortifying buffets, weird cab drivers, pricey drinks, the Fremont Street Experience, white Reeboks). 

If you don't like Vegas and you must visit, you should definitely stay here. It's a quiet from the storm that will make your stay less depressing and traumatic (plus you'll see great rock photos and memorabilia along the way). I also recommend you head out to Red Rock Canyon for hiking, Cold Creek to learn how to truly live off the grid and Lake Mead for a little lake tube floating. Good times.

I purchased a Groupon for two nights at HRH. The reservation process easy-peasy and I thought I got a steal with only paying $240 for two nights (Thursday\/Friday; Feb 7-9). When I arrived to check in the front desk staff was rude and the attendant reprimanded me for not having my Groupon printed out. I showed her the purchased Groupon on my phone and it CLEARLY stated 'No Voucher Necessary'.

Once we were finally checked in, we went to our room on the 11th floor in the Casino Tower. Although we requested a non-smoking room, we opened the door and our senses were bombarded with the fumes of paint with hints of smoke. Apparently they had been working on repairs in the rooms, because the smell of paint was evident throughout the entire floor. Upon further appraisal of the room the décor was fitting for the room, but the cleanliness was appalling and down right disgusting!! The bathroom was filthy, there was still remnants in the shower from the last guest and the sink and countertops still had heavy soap residue all over it. The toilet looked dirty, especially the back of the toilet (gross) and there were some questionable stains on the walls. I walked into the room and the beds looked clean, but there was stains on the night tables and vanity (clearly not wiped down at all). The floors looked like they hadn't seen a vacuum in a while! I called down to the "friendly" front desk staff asked for another room and I was told the hotel was booked due to an event and nothing else was available...that`s it! No apology, no offering to call housekeeping, nothing! I walked out of the room and tracked down a housekeeping attendant and asked her to freshen up the room. She was very annoyed, but got down to business.

Pros:
Décor is fitting for the hotel concept
Decent variety of eateries

Cons:
Resort fee..REALLY!?!?! Why isn't this included in the room costs??? This fee is unnecessary and the "perks" for paying it is NOT worth it!
Rude\/lackluster customer service from the point of contact personnel (front desk staff)
Run down..at least in the Casino Towers, and a bit unsanitary (based on the room they were going to allow me to stay in)

I`ll go elsewhere next time.

Two complaints.  
1- We booked through hoteltonight and the reception guy spent 30 minutes relentlessly trying to up sell us to another room, add strange fees to inflate the room cost - including the "extra bed" fee.  The clerk kept saying "Third Party" with a tone of "you are scum" - like he could barely utter the words.  My tip to the hotel, when hotels are EMPTY, is if they are going to enroll in hoteltonight, don't crap on people when they actually use it.  

2- The resort fee is total nonsense year round - but especially so in the winter when you can't actually use any of the resort features.  Most hotels have free wifi, gyms and a pool - so don't act like its a big deal - ESPECIALLY IN THE WINTER.  The pool was closed.

Anyway, I would call the hotel and ask about these things before heading over.  It was nonsense to go $50 a night OVER the quoted price.  In the end they put us in the WORST room they had, which was on the administration floor, next to a high traffic admin office when clearly, the hotel was mostly empty.

OMG!  This is the dirtiest hotel I've been in my life. No cheap at all. Same price range as any other in the area. The sink was clogged. We called front desk who sent a guy that was 1\/2 hour dealing with the sink. Left but still clogged. No smoking bedroom with smoking bedroom towels. You can see the dust over the desk.

Hard Rock?  Not that bed!  Soooo comfy.  We checked in for 5 days, first week of March.  Mentioned to the desk clerk that it was my birthday so she upgraded our room for free!  Corner king with a pool view on the third floor.  Walked into the room in Paradise Tower and it was huge!  So much space.  That view though... Opened the curtains to see palms.  Just... Palms.  I could kiiiinda sorta see the pool.  The pool was closed the entire time we were there it seemed, so that pool remains a mystery to me.  We had a huge walk in shower, but it was all dark fixtures and really poor lighting - very slippery and who knows if it was clean?  The bed was fabulous but they only have down comforters.  Down pillows will be on the bed unless you request hypoallergenic- tip to all of my allergy sufferin' brothas.  It's a real journey from your room to the casino, but worth it.  I had a blast checking out all of the memorabilia.  All in all it was a decent experience.  Not convenient unless you have a rental car as its off the strip.

This hotel is the home of douchebags, especially on the weekends and in the summer. When you have a tattoo parlor and an Affliction store on site, there is no question who the HRH is marketing to. As a result, the staffs of the hotel and businesses there treats their customers like douchebags, providing curt service hoping that a pained smile would make you go away.

The hotel rooms are beautiful although the cleaners are not very thorough in cleaning the bathrooms. I spent time in all three towers. The casino tower is the oldest and smallest, the paradise tower is further away but has nicer decor, and the HRH Tower being full of suites. The penthouse suite there was incredible having a bar in the middle of the suite plus and indoor and outdoor hot spa, a library, and three bedrooms with their own bathrooms.

The prices of the rooms are reasonable since the hotel is off-strip, and the multiple businesses nearby make up for the overpriced dining options inside. However they do charge an 18 dollar resort fee per night which you have to factor in. Basically they give you wifi and shuttle service for this fee so you basically have mandatory wifi which is rather slow since the entire hotel is using it.

I got a room on the airport side of the hotel. The noise was terrible and was repeating every 3 minutes. Hotel manger refused to change room at night and next morning keep pushing the change . Had to check out and find another place. Terrible customer service will never stay here again.

Here's a good one for you. ..construction starts outside at 9pm and continues until midnight. ..none during the day. ..9pm -midnight. ..if you're planning to stay here make sure you are a hard sleeper or stay on the strip. Better hotels and better costumer service. ..STAY AWAY !!!!!!!

Was looking for a change of pace, so decided to look for a hotel a little off the strip. We found this hotel, and so glad we gave it a try. Checked in late on a Friday night, and got an upgrade to a suite. The room was VERY spacious! Bed was soft and fluffy. And the view was beautiful. The employees are also kind and attentive. Definitely coming back.

Got a great deal on a room by signing up for the backstage pass players card. Upgraded to a pool view in the paradise tower for free. Yes, the paradise tower is a little farther from the main area of the hotel but barely! And it was quite nice. Our bed was incredibly comfortable! Like a big cloud. And the shower was nice and big and sexy. The bathroom is a little dark but it works ok. 

We had heard that they give hotel guests a discount to rehab but that was not the case for us. We had to pay to get in, which was frustrating. 

Overall we would stay here again. It's nice... For being off the strip

Stayed here in 2014 for EDC week. While the hotel room was wonderful, the guests next door to us were extremely rowdy and loud. We understand it is EDC and people are going to rage and party, but they were noisy as early as 4AM! We called the front desk multiple times and complained about it, only for them to tell us they would take care of it and never did. We were very upset and I contacted the manager to complain about our stay. He was apologetic and offered us 2 free nights as a condolence, as well as a dining credit. Heck yes!

So we came back June 2015 for 2 free nights and 2 paid nights. It was MUCH better. We stayed in a different Hard Rock Tower this time, and had an amazing view of the pool area and strip. The room was nice too but the only complaint being that the bathroom in the previous room was much nicer, with a walk in shower and rain fall shower head. The second room had a tub with grip bars for the elderly. Doesn't exactly scream Hard Rock vibe.

Other than that one small thing, our stay was great. HR is off the strip and about a 15 minute walk. They do offer a daily shuttle that drops you off on the far end of the strip by the shopping center. We enjoyed gambling (with free drinks when you play!), the food at Pink Taco which has amazing diablo nachos, and the pool, which is especially nice because it has sand where the lounge chairs are, just like the beach which goes into the water too.

Thanks again to the manager for redeeming our faith in the HR, we definitely recommend staying here, HR has a really cool rock and roll vibe to it, unlike the other hotels which offer straight dance music mostly. It's also nice to check out all the cool music memorabilia as well!

We told them when we made the room reservations that we had minors in one of the two rooms. Yet there was alcohol, e cigarettes, sex toys, hangover kits, porn and adult channels available with no restrictions. Really? I know it's vegas, but not cool. First and last time I will stay here. The M is classy and you don't have to walk a mile to check in then get to rooms.

My first time in Vegas, so I don't have anything to compare it to.  I liked that the hotel wasn't so big that it took forever to get from your room to the pool or front doors, etc.  I stayed here with a group and they put the majority of us in the same tower - bonus!  Plenty of casino action and bar\/food choices right in the hotel.  It was close enough to the strip to walk if you wanted, or a short cab ride.  I wasn't impressed with the front desk staff.  They were unorganized and short on the customer service skills upon checking in and checking out.  Upon checkout, the receipt was folded in 3 and handed to me with no explanation of the larger than should be total at the bottom, quickly calling the next person over from the checkout line.  Ummm...not cool.

I have never stayed here before, opted to try Hard Rock over our traditional stay at Marriott. The guest experience was awful, from the arrival to the registration desk. The room is awful, basic...I can now understand why Priceline had the room at a 50% discount. I would have paid more at Marriott. Never again will I come here. Marriott brings a guest experience, a level of professionalism that Hard Rock Management should learn from...

I only got to spend one night in the new HRH All-Suite Tower but for my next trip to Vegas, I would definitely stay here again!  The side entrance allows for self-park, valet, and bag check and there was virtually no line any time!  The staff was very helpful and our entrance and exit were so much faster because we didn't have to go all the way through the main HRH casino entrance.  

The room was fantastic...super spacious tub for relaxing, awesome in-wall iPod sound dock with touch screen controls, sizable sofa for lounging, purple and gray color scheme...loved it!  The best part though...the comfy bed and pillows.  Seriously, my head hit the bed and i slept like a cloud was wrapped around me all night.  I even called back after my stay to find out what kind of mattress it was!!

My only regret was that we didn't have time to check out the pool - it was a non-stop party I would like to have gone to...next time, Vegas, next time!!

If you're in the mood to party, this is the the casino to stay at.

I LOVE gambling and am a married woman...so this hotel is not exactly catered to someone like me, but my friend is single and talked us into staying here for a recent trip with all of our friends.  The room is comfortable and nice and the pool view is amazing.  I love the music they play in the casino and bar area, and actually, although it's small, I did very well in the casino.  I won a decent amount and played all weekend.  The verdict is still out on how well they comp you for playing...all I know is I better get a free suite the next time I come!  

Back to my review.  The room is very nice and, as I said, the pool view is amazing, BUT the music starts seriously bumping around 9:00 a.m., and considering we were on the 3rd floor with a pool view room, we were NOT going to get to sleep in or take a nap, which is no bueno when we roll in at 6:00 a.m.!  My friend was upgraded to a suite in the casino tower and the view of the strip was absolutely amazing!  The room was nice and the room service was pretty good (we ordered breakfast).

They also have a decent selection of food\/restaurants here...Pink Taco and Johnny Smalls are my fave!

I am somewhat partial to the MGM casinos because I love my rest and love to be on the strip, but if you're in the mood to party there is no doubt that this is the place to be!
Stay here for a convention. Thought the room was nice. The casino are a great place to gamble with beautiful ladies walking round in the evening.

My third trip to Vegas and this hotel is the nicest one a far. $50 a night (found a deal) and rooms are nice, modern. The only complaint is that they get you with the high prices for restaurants and other services. Especially since this hotel is a little out the way from the strip. I like that they have a John Varvatos store in the building. I love their stuff (for my husband of course:) I'm not a rocker but I really like this hotel.

My fiance, a couple of friends and I all stayed here last year. I've decided to review the last three places we've stayed at in Las Vegas. We stayed for two nights and paid approx $450.00. The room was no were near like The Signature, but it wasn't bad. I think we were more disappointed that we had heard it was one of the best places to stay at, and were expecting better than last year. This room was a good size, and the bed was still very comfortable. The bathroom was about the size of the one I have at home, so it didn't impress. I'm not really sure which room we stayed at because our friend booked the rooms, but we were told it was one of their newest rooms because they had recently built that tower. We did find it funny that there were shoe prints on the ceiling, we got a good laugh out of it trying to imagine how they had gotten there lol. Over all the stay was comfortable and the customer service was good. However I'm giving them three stars because it was more than I would be willing to pay for that room. If I got a deal, I would stay again.

Family review:
Traveled with 2 Tweens... Got a great deal so we decided to try it out. Had a fantastic stay. Every employee from check in, mr. Lucky's, nirvana pool to housekeeping was extremely kind. Room was clean. Traveled T-Th. Nirvana pool was fun and family friendly. Did read a lot about hard partying but weekday was calm. Heard planes during the day, didn't notice at night. Not near the strip, no problem if you have your own car.

Rehab. 

Possibly my favorite thing to do in Vegas.  It's where I always wish I was when I'm at Shadow Lounge, the EndUp or Bambuddha on Sunday morning\/afternoon in SF.

This was my first time staying at this hotel.  The location is about a mile away from the Strip, which is not that bad if you don't mind the walk.  My initial impression of my room in the Paradise Tower was positive, nicely laid out.  The bathroom was fairly cramped, but overall decent.  The housekeeping service was a bit lame.  I stayed 3 nights and had to call for housekeeping to clean the room the day before I left.  That may be policy to not clean unless requested,not sure, but I felt that was a bit lame.  I also took advantage of their Backstage Pass, but was disappointed with the failure to provide the Dining Credit as claimed.  It was my fault for not reading the instructions clearly, but I think it is poor to have the customer go to a cashier cage and provide a pass that you then give to the restaurant of your choice.  I charged my meals to my room, why not just apply the credit at checkout time.  That would be better customer service.  The restaurants I went to, Nobu, Mr Lucky's, Pink Tacos and Pizza Forte, were all very good.  Though I think Nobu is a bit overrated, Sushi Takashi, off the Strip, is far better.  Finally, the casino.  I played each day I was there, it was not bad, except for one night.  I like roulette, and the only table available did not have the digital display of numbers working.  Why not open a different table?  Just not very customer focused, in my opinion.  Given the options available, that will be my last time at this hotel.

I stayed at the HR June 15 and 16, 2014 and unfortunately it was a regrettable experience.  The hotel has become a bit shaggy and worn with a commensurate lack of  concern for customer service. 

 i checked-in at 2:00 pm (their regular check-in time begins at 3:00 so granted, i was early) and was told my room wasn't available and in the very same breath the desk clerk asked if i wanted to upgrade to a corner room for another $40 per night extra.  I figured "what the heck" and agreed to the increase\/upgrade.  Bad move.  The upgrade was anything but.  I did get a "view"but it was of an empty lot housing a few dozen bedraggled palm trees and and unvisited parking lot reserved for maintenance vehicles\/staff.  Next, the room was not fully serviced and there were no cups, amenities, etc.   I had to ask the cleaning staff three times for a cup and three times i received nothing.  I also waited until the next day at 6:30p for the room to be serviced for the first time since I had checked in.

In any event,  this place is truly between a "rock and a hard spot"(chiasmus intended) and i would advise fellow yelpers to avoid it and opt for the strip hotels for a first rate experience.
so terrible. They charged customers for resort fee after we prepay at priceline without any notice in advance

Lame!  I'm fine with the resort fee in addition to my room which was clean & comfortable. However not having ANY seats at the pool unless you PAY for them is CRAP! And a minimum bet for free drinks, again, CRAP!  And they only have BUDWEISER products at the pool, headache. I will not be back.

It's a damn cluttered place that doesn't hide the fact that it's a casino.  In this sense it can be considered better in my book than the other resorts and hotels (with the exception of the Wynn).  

It gets PACKED here at night and I got up-close and personal with some celebrity clothing behind glass, including the coveted Christina Aguilera ass-pants from "Dirty."  Oh hell yes.

Came the week after Memorial weekend..we got a Groupon so was excited to use. Check in was alright, we checked in 2:30pm when check in was 3pm was little line and didnt mind to wait. Checking in was easy, by the time we saw an employee it was 3pm and got all situated, until she told us our room wouldnt be ready till 5pm?! Unless we took a smoking room (which we did because we didnt want to wait two hours with our luggage in hand).
Room was OK nothing special, bed was comfy and we opened up fridge to see our goodies and boom fridge door broke all drinks on floor. We called right away to make sure that we wouldnt get charged for it, two hours later someone finally came into our room to check on the door and didnt say much and left. We stayed three nights here, so far fridge door broke, our bathroom light didnt work 80 percent of the time (no one ever came to fix it the amount of times we asked were insane), and the light on the right side of the bed was basically falling off wall and wasnt attached.
Good thing--Check out was simple easy and fast. Valet was also friendly and eager to help always.
Dont think we will be back again.
Nice place if you don't mind being off the strip. My only complaint is that housekeeping is not very good.

I booked a room with two queen beds and got two full size beds.  There were homeless people in the casinos all night and the place smelled like urine.  Food was terrible and overpriced.  Not how I wanted to spend my weekend.

My wife and I went down for the Halloween bash. We were too late for tickets they were pricy. The costumes that showed up were fantastic. There were so many I couldn't count them all. We took pictures and talked to other couples. It was a great time

When was the last time you heard rock-n-roll blasting through your speakers? I know  right? Its been awhile.  Look no further, the Hard Rock will fill that void! Came down to Vegas for my annual CES trip and had a Hang Over style time as always.  ;-)

You will never ever hear hip-hop or edc here.  The suite I got hooked up with was sweet! I walked up to Registration to check-in and the gal that helped me was top notch.  Knew my name before I even said anything.  Probably because I was wearing my CES badge, but hey, that's why they are getting a 5-star from me.

Everything was a pretty smooth sailing.  The suite we had was pretty stellar for this Vegas caliber hotel.  The only things that was lacking were a fridge and a coffee maker.  While those things were pretty trivial, they would have came in handy.  The suite was decked out in modern rock-n-roll fashion-edgy tiling and art throughout the spacious bathroom and living room.  This room was equipped with LCD TVs, drawers, and plenty of closet space.  The bathroom was super spacious like a fancy master bath.  Walk-in shower stall with rainfall shower head and hand shower head.  Toilet had its own door.  Dual sinks.  

Separating the bedroom and the bathroom was a glass wall with curtains, luckily, since I was sharing with another friend.  Pretty cool for the most part.  Beds were super comfortable.  Housekeeping was very friendly and courteous.  

For my entire 3 night stay, I truly felt like a ROCK STAR.  Since I did not get to gamble here, I can only speak for my sleeping experience.  The distance to the strip was a short distance, so its not bad if you want to take a quick ride via Taxi.  If I ever get a deal here again through Kayak and such, I definitely would not hesitate to book another stay.
This is my go to spot when going to Vegas. The staff and hotel treat me, us, very well! They have upgraded me for no reason other than to be the kool hotel they are. The Pool Villa is awesome!!!

To start off with, the check in process was too long and tedious.  They need to keep more front desk attendants on staff, especially right around 3-4pm which is their CHECK-IN TIME.

While I was waiting in line to check in, my friends were waiting with our stuff and we very clearly had 2 cases of beer with us, which one of the valets helped us get inside the hotel.  Like I said, check-in took a while, so they sat there for another 20 min with this beer.  We carry it all way into our room in Casino tower, then down and over to their room in Paradise tower, only to be stopped by staff saying "You can't bring that in here".  At that point I said screw it, we brought it in anyway.

The room was awesome and the best was even better.  We were in the Casino Tower over looking the pool and it was beautiful.  There wasn't a fridge so we (mistakenly) pulled some items from the mini bar and put our beer in there to get cold.  Replaced everything before we left, didn't actually consume anything from the mini bar, but upon check out had been charged for everything we moved.  Probably my fault for being naive, but they could have put a sign explaining that.  The guy said anything that's moved and not put back within 15 seconds will be charged.

Everything else went pretty great until 2 days after we left.  My credit card was charged for $25 and I called asking them why, they said that I rented two movies during my stay.  First, being frustrated, I said "Oh, because that's why I go to Vegas. To watch movies and get a lot of sleep", but when I actually contested they took them right off.

TL;DR: Nice hotel, GREAT bed, sucks you can't bring in your own drinks, just make sure you check the bill when you leave.

Very disappointed in the Hard Rock on this trip.  We booked this trip back in December on one of their promotions.  BEST WISHES 2017 package.  This was a great package and came with a bunch of stuff, plus a great room price.  We went their for my wife's 40th birthday so I wanted it to be special.  Upon check in the   promo code was no where on the reservation and all those coupons had expired.  Really expired when the promo said you had to travel by June.  We even gave them the promo code and said my boss said the best we can do is off a $25 food and beverage credit.  Hard Rock is just not the same as it was 4 years ago.  After just staying at Aria 2 months ago, then was a complete let down.  In addition apparently there is a shortage on shampoo as housekeeping failed to get us more for the first two days and had to call down to have them bring more and to top it all off housekeeping took 4 of our Rehab cups.  Even the lady at checkout did not even ask us how our stay was.  1st hotel I think I have ever been to that did not ask that upon checkout.  Sorry Hard Rock don't think we will ever return.

The stay at the Hard Rock was enjoyable but nothing amazing that would make me want to stay here again.  The check in process took forever, they had a huge line and only a few people working.  Check out of course was easy.  The hotel is large and if you are in the Paradise Tower the walk to your room is fairly long.  The hotel has many restaurants and bars, all of which are pretty good.  They also have some stores, a tattoo shop, gym and a bunch of pools.  I know in summer this is the place to be for hanging out at the pool but in winter only one is even open.  The room was nice.  The room was dark and rock star like which is cool but I wish the bathroom had more light.  The bed was very comfortable.  You are off strip but if you don't mind walking it only takes about 15 minutes.  The Hard Rock Cafe is outside of the hotel right in front.

Mind you I travel like a local in Vegas, I've been coming here for 30 years, my folks lived here etc., that being said here are the facts:
o   Check in is between 3-5, we finally got in our room at 5:00, several people were waiting to get in they're rooms.
o   No coffee makers in the rooms.
o   They use heavy perfum on the carpets throughout the hotel, bad for people with allergies.
o   The gym is small.
o   If you want good band width you have to pay for it.

Self parking is easy, and it is off the strip which is a bonus, but I will not be returning.

This is my fourth stay at the Hard Rock in six months.  The customer service has always been very friendly. You can't assume all hotels are that way.  Another Las Vegas hotel treated me very poorly, and the contrast was night and day.  The Hard Rock staff are fantastic!

Rooms are nearly perfect.  A bit of wear and tear, but it's even better than my house, so I can't complain.

If you book a king bed, odds are they'll upgrade you if you complain (although they didn't offer last night).  All rooms are great.  Four of the five nights were perfect.  Last night, some idiot in the room next door started blasting music at 8 AM.  Called security who was very friendly, but they also didn't fix the problem.  Oh well, by then it was nearly nine.  Not really the hotel's fault, but like any casino hotel, sometimes the other guests are inconsiderate.

The mini bar is terrible expensive and weight-activated, so don't even breathe near it.  Can't connect HDMI to the TV to watch Netflix (but that's common for most hotels).

Clean facilities.  Excellent staff.  Overall, I'm very pleased and will certainly stay here again.

I wish I wasn't staying here. That's really the bottom line. 

For the most part, it's just your typical Vegas hotel and casino (mixed with the Hard Rock Cafe type decor, of course). The problem is that the "amenities" are $28 per night extra at check in, and you definitely don't get what you pay for. Pool hours are too short, spa services are incredibly spendy, wireless is constantly dropping and so you have to repeatedly sign in, housekeeping is horrid, and room service doesn't take away their trays (my neighboring rooms' leftovers are still sitting out in the hallway after 13 plus hours). There is a shuttle to the strip (the Hard Rock is two plus miles away), but that only runs until 5pm.

Housekeeping especially needs to be touched on as my room was gross before I even checked in. The shower curtain had obvious microbead shower soap goo all over the inside, but it took speaking to three different people to get a clean one. The hair dryer and that bag that it hangs in are both spattered in crud, the carpet had clothing stickers on it from the previous tenants (center of the room, so pretty obvious), and there's a cleaning rag left in the corner. It really makes me think about what other less obvious gunk has been left behind.

Plus, I have a room with one of those adjoining doors between me and my neighbor to one side, which has no sound proofing (let's just say that I know to much about a stranger's intimacy preferences now).

There are several other things that could be improved upon, but I'm sure someone else's review has touched on them. The issues I listed here are plenty enough to leave me an unhappy customer without having to list them all.

My only time in Vegas was for work and we happened to stay at the Hard Rock. The week day crowd is completely different from the Thurs-Sun people. 

The Hard Rock is not located on the strip, however the main bar area is probably one of the best spots to grad a drink while in Vegas. 

The night club is your typical dull, get drunk and try to hook up with someone in Vegas nightclub. The atmosphere there though makes it more of a prime hang out area and being off the strip gives it some uniqueness to it.

The surrounding neighborhoods are pretty shady and there is a horrendous strip club that looks like it has the same strippers since the 50s still dancing.

I guess I could offer another star for our comped room and food.. but I really don't think I can.

We stayed in a new tower - Paradise Tower. Which, let me warn you, is about a mile long hike to get to. You go from the front desk, back towards the elevators, but go alllllll the way down the hall, past Pink Taco, around the hall, down the ramp, past the (not so) ironic Affliction store, past the steroid meat market (gym), past the Starbucks that is always ass packed... Continue walking past the doors to the pools, which includes REHAB - a huge pool party for those of you living under a rock. Mind you, there are about 12-18 doors for the damn pools, and most of them you cant use to get into the pools anyway. Useless much? And on the days that Rehab cracks, the halls are wall to wall with people trying to get in. Anyway, keep walking... walking... Walk past the deli on your right that seems to be good for sammiches, drinks, and small breakfast things. Walk around another corner and you're FINALLY there. 

As much as I like this place, as a casino and for Rehab, the rooms are smallllllllllll and DARK! The bathroom is honestly ridiculous. There is no room to stand in the separated toilet and shower area with the door open. Its almost impossible to CLOSE the door to that area when you're inside of it.

The rooms are darker (in this tower) than any hotel I've ever been in. Dark wallpaper and carpet calls for better lighting. Even with the drapes open there wasn't sufficient lighting. Maybe that was because it was gloomy out? But I really don't think so.
The only mirror you could actually SEE yourself in, was in the bathroom. The other two mirrored doors were covered in a "smoke effect". Weird..

Sure, the beds were hella comfy, the room service was prompt and polite, and the housekeepers didnt come knocking at 9am. But the room itself sucked. I may go back, sure if its comped again. But Id rather pay for Venetian, Caesars, or something ON the strip for a little more

If I wasnt comped, I'd be pissed.

A VERY NICE PLACE!

*I LOVED all the really cool decor! 
I thought it was an overall really nice looking and clean hotel and casino. Not too smokey or anything like that.

*There are multiple options for cheap food and drinks inside the hotel.

*Although I encountered 2 or 3 dealers that were rude, most were really nice and really helpful.

*The little sports-bar restaurant there was awesome.
Good food and nice place to watch a game; there is even a mini sports book in side! We watched all the games and got really good service (even though we sat there for like 2 hours after we were done eating). Don't trip, we tipped her fatty ;)



*4 stars and not 5 only because:

1. It's kinda too dark in some places (like in the bathroom and shower)

2. It's not very close to anything.

3. Some of the dealers were really just straight up dicks.


*SIDE NOTES*

*GO DOWN AND CHECK OUT OF YOUR ROOM IN PERSON!
I didn't like how they tried to charge me for a bottle of wine I didn't drink from my room's minibar, but they removed the charge as soon as I mentioned it, no questions asked.

*We paid $40 a night plus the $24 "resort fee" (in January) so overall I was extremely pleased with the value. Definitely worth looking into if you are on a budget but you still want to stay somewhere nice.

*I was really impressed how they handled my drunk friend. We left him alone while we went to see Cirque Du Soleil and instead of calling the cops on his drunk ass, like I would have done, they just escorted him back to his room LOL

Now I actually like this casino. I like that it's off the strip. I used to win here. The slots used to be loose. Now they aren't. And the bets are higher. :( I like staying here. The rooms are decent. The prices are okay. The guys in front like valet or whoever they are, they need to quit being such _______. Insert your own word. They really make coming here to enjoy yourself miserable. I have to go there again for a concert in Tuesday. I'll re rate them if it's a better experience. Rehab is not good anymore. It used to be.. overall I feel like this is a has-been casino.

Wow have things changed here over the past few years! We paid good money for a suite, and had to jump through hoops of fire just to be able to lay by the pool.
