Although the shower handles were a bit old and were falling a part, and the heating system didn't regulate the temperature very well, the hotel was nice other than those two elements. Oh, and the bathroom and bedroom lights are perfectly adjusted so that they don't blind you first thing in the morning. Also, there are blackout curtains which really great as they help you sleep in! 

The jacuzzi bathtub is a really nice addition. 

The view from the hotel was very nice as well. We could see the strip! The elevators moved very quickly and smoothly. 

We were upgraded on the spot which was very nice. The customer service is very good. And this entire hotel is great for the price you pay to stay there.

Upon first glance the room was pretty nice but after looking a bIt deeper some areas of the room we're caked with dust and grime. The bathroom only had half a roll of t.p. There's no coffee pot in the room because they want you to spend $7 on two coffee's downstairs. Some of the staf we're very rude and not helpful. Not only did there entire computer system go down leaving you unable to use credit cards in shops but they lost our baggage. The best part was when they over charged my card by adding everything in the mini bar to my tab. I used nothing.Be careful of the wind and don't knock anything over o you will be charged. The hallways we're full of trash too. lovely! I am sorry but just because you want to stay at a cool rock and roll hotel with atmosphere does not mean you want to live in filth or be treated poorly. I would avoid this place!
Off the strip yes, never fails to be a nice time. Did some gambling and made some money. Drinks came fast and free. Nice decor.

Disclaimer: This is the most critical review I've ever written.  I am conscious of the negative aspect of internet culture that allows people to make unduly harsh comments at a high rate.  With that in mind, these are my honest feelings about my stay.  

As soon we arrived, we were hit with 80's hair metal cranked to 11 with no place to escape, except our room. On every inch of the hotel prepare to enjoy Dokken's greatest hits, and that deep cut from Warrant.  Our sleep this weekend was interrupted by the person who thought it was wise to decorate the hallways with actual drum cymbals.  I'm wondering if anyone during the design process considered the possibility that some guests might try to show off their drumming skills on the way back to their rooms after a night of drinking.  Needless to say, there were a lot of John Bonham wannabee's staying on the 9th floor.
 
Keeping with the theme of sleep deprivation, we were couldn't sleep due to the blinking smoke detector installed right above our bed.  When all the lights were shut off, and the black curtains were closed, the blinking smoke detector lit up the room like the lamest rave imaginable. This could go on for pages, so I'll continue with a shorthand checklist of problems:
- Guest Services was terrible.  I had to call 5 times to get an engineer to the room to fix the air conditioning.
- There were no responsible adults to be seen on staff.  All the employees are either in Motley Crue shirts, or working valet.  I really felt like if I complained about anything, they would shrug their shoulders and say "sucks bro." 
- There is no place to relax in the hotel unless you want to pay 25 dollars for the spa.  The pool is a giant party filled with cellulite and Bro culture. 
- The food tasted cheap,  like it was cooked by the gallon and over-sauced.

At least the bed was soft. 

Don't stay here unless you miss your freshman dorm.

I love this hotel! My husband and I stood in the HRH Pool View Suite for a 3 day anniversary get-a-way. The rooms were very clean and the bed comforters were so soft and fluffy , it literally felt like we were sleeping on clouds. Our view of the strip was very nice , I'm sure the corner suite views are even better as well as breathtaking. The hotel room has a built in speaker and AUX connection so you can literally pre game before you hit the bars and casinos. This hotel is a mile from the strip , we first walked to the strip and took about 12 minutes to get to Planet Hollywood. At first we were a little hesitant in booking a mile away because we didn't wanna miss out on the party Vegas experience, luckily we are now very pleased with our decision. After walking the strip and casino hopping , we just felt the other hotels didn't compare to Hard Rock, the themes of the other hotels just seem so dated , Hard Rock is very contemporary, we love the theme and still got to experience what we wanted! We just booked the same suite for a family week vacation to come back because we were so pleased , next time we visit we will save $$ so we can experience the corner suites.

Stayed here on coworker's recommendation during a large conference.  I had reserved the room on Expedia, and when I got there to check in they told me they were needing to upgrade me to a suite because the room they had originally planned to give me was unavailable - thought I had hit it lucky!  Unfortunately, the suite left something to be desired.  Lights were dim or unavailable, furniture had cigarette burns in it (they had some sort of loveseat thing that looked like it was straight out of a low-rent porn video - did not sit on that one).  No plugs for charging your cell phone near the bed!  Also found a broken charm bracelet type thing sitting next to the bed, and the sinks were leaky.  Bed was OK and seemed clean, but I had some doubts... Really disappointed and wouldn't stay here again.  Staff was pleasant and OK to work with, but place was really a low-rent option in Vegas.
It's been awhile since I've been here but it's pretty nice inside. I like that it's not on the strip but has enough stuff to do at the hotel.

From 11\/19\/15

We came to the Hard Rock for a show at Vinyl. My impression of the casino itself was pretty good; you are immersed in the rock atmosphere. This place had a bunch of venues like the Joint, Friday Night live at the pool, etc. 

There's  shopping, restaurant. There is a tattoo place just in case you feel impulsive and or drunk after a concert- feel free to get tatted up- YOLO!

 I would have to say this place is pretty dammed awesome!

I used to love the Hard Rock. When I used to frequent Vegas years ago, this place was a must visit. 

Back in the day, it was chill and cool. Used to see celebrities left and right. We even rolled dice with Bruce Willis..

I recently was in Vegas for a few days, but didn't get a chance to drop by Hard Rock to reminisce.  I did see a billboard with Pauly D on it. Damn! What's this world coming to. Guess Hard Rock is on the decline if it has to stoop to Jersey Shore. 

Probably not visiting for a long time.

My boyfriend and I stayed there July 1-4th and we have stayed at many hotels in Vegas and wanted to try the Hard Rock this time.  It was the WORST hotel ever!! The hotel is modern, and cool with the rock n roll stuff yes, but the customer service was terrible and the non smoking room was dirty.  There was black mold in several places in the room (Casino Tower) and the power went out several times on the 1st night.  So the hotel was running on generators so very little AC was on.  The electronic casino games would turn off and under NV law, you are SOL if you are playing on one when that happens.  You then have $zero!! Our room's temperature was in the mid-hi 80's.

We had dinner on night #1 in Nobu which is a very classy and expensive japanese restaurant and after our appetizers we waited 40 minutes for the waiter to finally come back and tell us that from the power problems, the gas lines were also not working...so no dinner, no discount. Just pay and leave now please.

Day #2, still no AC.  The front desk said "if you don't like it, you can check out".  There was a message on our room's phone and they said there was a problem with the authorization on the credit card.  My boyfriend went down to the front desk again and it was a mistake.  There was NO problem and the manager did apologize for the the mistake.  I went back to our room to take a shower and security was pounding on our door and order us to vacate immeadiatly and they were locking down our room for the lack of credit card authorization!! My bf told them we were just at the front desk and it was a mistake.  They didn't call to confirm this, and made us pack up right then and get out...my hair dripping wet but they didn't care.  My bf rushed again to the front desk and demanded the manager again....she apologized and placed us in another room.  No comps for the mistake and no upgrade either.  This new room had even more mold in the bathroom too.  

Day #3 As hotel guests we were told the charge for Rehab would be $100 for men, $75 for ladies.  The lounge chairs on the DJ side were an additional $200 per chair or $100 on the side without the DJ + a $100 minimum per chair for food\/drinks.  Insane!!! We later found out from others that they were only charged $25 per person to get in!!! Oh yes, we finally got AC!!

Also, security wants to see not only your hotel key but also your ID to get on the elevators to your room which makes no sense as your name is not on your hotel key.  

We were treated so poorly by the hotel personal and not comped in any way for the terrible service and lack of AC.  They could've cared less.  

They get actually a minus stars here, but that wasn't an option.  I will NEVER stay at this hotel ever again.

I like!! It's a very classy hotel and casino, in a rock star kind of way, not at all snobby and pretentious like most others you'll find on the strip. 

For the price, the rooms are great and very clean. i've stayed in both Casino Tower and Paradise Tower, and the rooms are essentially the same. Our stay in Paradise Tower was great, but in Casino Tower, we had a bit of trouble with the shower - the water was lukewarm and didn't start getting hot until the end of the shower. Wah I need my hot showers (minus 1 star). The tubs are also small. You also can't come home with leftovers; there's no fridge space and you can't move things! But the beds are SOOO COMFORTABLE!!! Huge down pillows and comforter and nice soft sheets. 

Being off the strip, the area is quieter, yet the casino is still bustling. The drive to the strip is very short too! I love the location, and it's great for avoiding traffic on the strip. 

The casino is my favorite part. Hard Rock is the best place to play. The music is always good. Nowhere else can you play BJ to such great rock music! In my opinion, the dealers here generally have better personalities, and the company is definitely more fun! Honestly, even though I end up losing money, I always walk away having had a great time.
Wish I had known what a douche pit this place would be before we booked.

We came here recently to the Joint to see the Crue, and didn't actually stay here, so this isn't a review of staying here at the hotel.

HRH is a smaller hotel that's a little ways off of the Strip itself. We fully expected to wait for over an hour after the show to get a cab (with the massive wall of people), but our cabbie on the way in told us to go out thru the side entrance into the garage and there wouldn't be a line. He was totally right! 

The casino floor was amazing and was truly a trip going around viewing all the rock memorabilia and the cars and motorcycles. Not to mention all the side shows walking around the floor. It was truly a great place to go around and people-watch.

We definitely wouldn't mind coming back to a show here and ever staying here!

Very bad experience with staff pertaining to an ADA issue. I was denied re entry to a music show in the hotel by a guard because I left to take care of my disease (I'm in a federally protected class.) Brett, supervisor, was nice but let me know my experience was mostly tough luck; I let him know I was sharing it and reporting to the Feds (already done.) I'd steer clear of this venue if you have ADA issues; shameful conduct!!!!

I love this hotel. It's off the strip by just over a mile, and I personally love a good little stroll. The pool is amazing and rehab pool party is hosted here.

The rooms look newly remodeled AND they are dog friendly!! Big win!

Did I mention they're more affordable than most other hotels, especially when you consider how nice the rooms are!

First visit.  Not my favorite place.  A lot of people who look rode hard and put away wet.  Lots of REALLY drunk people.  One woman I ran into in the bathroom who could barely stand was sitting (as if she fell) on the walkway outside ready to toss her cookies.

I guess "Hard Rock" is for a different crowd than what I prefer.  I wouldn't go back unless it was for a great show or something.

Undoubtedly the least classiest place I've ever stayed at in Vegas.  I saw a 20 on 20 all-out-brawl break out on the middle of the casino floor at 3am.  I also got a cab at the front once.  An Asian taxi driver pulls up (I'm Chinese).  The door man opens the front door and proceeds to give her directions by saying "Ching ching chong dong", then looks at me and gives me a smile.  He was white.  The driver was Vietnamese.  Most racist thing I've ever experienced.  You would be foolish to bring your family here.

We have always wanted to stay at HRH . This past weekend we stayed at the HRH tower . From the moment we arrived , we were treat like royalty ! DID NOT meet a staff member who failed to be polite and friendly . The suite was gorgeous and exceeded our expectations . The staff at the desk in the HRH tower was top notch. NEVER have I stayed in a hotel where the staff knew my name when seeing me on sight . LOVE this treatment .

I'm 34. That said, if you are 22, by all means this is the place for you. Lots of eye candy, trendy, and fun. If you are 32, you can do better. The rooms (in the casino tower) themselves are 2-3 stars. They tried to clean the carpet, but there were lots of stains, the faucets were so old that the finish was worn off, and furniture\/fixtures were cheap. Like the cougars downstairs, this hotel has been ridden hard and left out wet. It needs to be remodeled. The staff is generally aloof, prefering to be cool rather than hospitable. I realized I was beyond this, when the room next to me blared their stereo until 4am and the noise from outside penetrated the windows easily. Reasonable quiet in your room may not be possible here. This could happen in any hotel, but is more likely at the hard rock. sooooo.....if you are don't care about the above notions, stay, it's a great scene downstairs. If you do, do yourself a favor, just visit the hard rock and stay some place nicer for the extra dough.

I typically love this hotel however after this experience I may think twice before staying here again. My boyfriend and I have been working a lot and we decided we needed a vacation to get away and have some fun so we came to vegas. We reserved a standard room and was put in the newly "renovated" Casino tower. Not sure what they renovated because our bathroom door had peeled paint, the bed was old and could really feel the springs, and there was dust all over the bedside tables. But whatever, we didn't plan on spending too much time in the room anyways, I was wrong. Went down to the pool the next morning, there were no workers at the towel stand and not towels put out, we asked multiple employees where we could get towels and were sent on an egg hunt. Finally found two towels and went to get a chair by the pool. As soon as my boyfriend stepped in the sand he stepped right into gum. GROSS! We stayed by the pool for maybe an hour before going into Pink Taco for some lunch, this is where things went bad. I ordered the al pastor tacos and shouldn't have because I ended up getting food poisoning. We were stuck in the room for the last part of the day and almost the entire night in extreme pain. At around 10pm I could finally get myself downstairs to try to eat some food. We went to Lucky's diner and ordered some chicken fingers and pasta. The servers were confused as to who was responsible for us, but finally we got Clay. He barely came around but spent a lot of time chatting with the table next to us, at the end of our meal he came over with our check, we put down our cards only for him to come back for signatures after charging our cards the other tables bill. They had order shots after shots of Jameson so very quickly we noticed how high the bill was all of a sudden. We flagged him down and he corrected it and was apologetic but now we have two charges on our cards and have to wait a few days for the wrong charge to be reimbursed to our accounts. Over all I'm just not impressed with this hotel anymore which is unfortunate because I used to praise this place.
5 stars just for the vanity mirror!!! This should be mandatory in every bathroom in every hotel\/casino in Vegas!

This is my first time staying at a hotel of the strip in Las Vegas and it was a great stay. First off, we got here pretty late (11:30pm) and the line for check in was pretty short. We booked through Expedia so I was nervous if anything were to happen. The lady who checked us in was absolutely wonderful, her name was Alexis I believe. She switched our room from facing a parking garage to the poolside which was awesome since it was my boyfriends first time in vegas. After she explained how to get to our room we headed off. Our room was in paradise tower which was a bit of a walk from the entrance of the hotel. We had a non smoking room which was very nice and very clean. We ended up with two queens instead of a kind but that's okay because the view was totally worth it. The room was pretty clean and fully stocked with toiletries(shampoo ,conditioner , body wash , lotion). It was also stocked with plenty of towels. The beds were very comfy and clean it felt like sleeping on a cloud. Free tv channels was a nice touch as we got to see some of our favorite shows on our down time. I highly recommend signing up for their backstage pass rewards as you earn points towards things at the hotel. Plus anything you purchase here you earn points for. You always get a free $5.00 to gamble with so why not? Overall it was a great stay and I definitely recommend this place if you love music and friendly staff. If you are sensitive to smoke, this might not be the place for you.

This place doesn't have good sound insulation. We were on the 10th floor and we could hear the music playing at 4 AM in the morning, and it sounded as we were in club. We could hear the neighbor playing pool. We could hear the neighbors above us walking around clearly what their footsteps in the middle of the night. If you are looking for a place for a good night sleep, I will not recommend this place to you. I will probably not stay there again. However they do have excellent services.

We stayed here in the HRH tower after we did a "drive thru wedding." The suites are huge! It's a perfect spot for gathering a group of friends. The bathroom was my favorite with a HUGE shower and tub. The beds were fluffy and comfortable. We had a corner room so the view was spectacular and it was quiet. If you have the cash, I'd recommend staying here if you can!

I have stayed here 3 more times since the review and it will probably be my last.  The first time my room did not have an iron and I waited 30 minutes until they found one in someone else's room.  

The second time there was an iron but no iron board.  Same wait time and I had to be somewhere.

Last week there was no iron again.  No one answers at housekeeping.  Front desk said they will take care of it.  Had to call again.  Also no bath towels in my bathroom, just the small towels to dry off with.

I am sure they know they don't have enough irons or necessities but money must obviously be tight.  Go elsewhere unless you want to work and spend time chasing what you paid for.

The prices at the Business offices posted online are false.  The rude girl in the business office makes up the price based off the size of the box but they post by weight.  I paid ups $12 to ship box to Idaho but the girl in the business office wanted $25. To give it to the ups guy. It was a 3lb small box.  According to the Hardrock hotels web site I posted pice here.  Should have been $8.00   The box was not huge it fit in a everyday backpack.    I talked to the great manager at the front desk he explained that that was a rented space he couldn't do anything for me.  

So be aware of the rude girl making up prices in the hard rocks business office.   Wish they would fix the web site would be nice maybe say the business office is not owned by the hotel or get the misleading information off the site.  

I have stayed at the hardrock every month for a year I would think the service in the business office outside of the new conference center would be better.  

The front desk staff pinktaco and 35 stakes all provide awesome service. 

This review goes to the business office. To warn people in conference that need to ship in a hurry.

there is a reason why this place hosts so many great musical events & entertainment !!
they know how to treat people who attend concerts. they understand that people who attend concerts may not be there to gamble their lives away but are just there to have a good time. they are not nazi about patrolling the venue entrance to ward off average people who may want to trade a ticket or 2. and the way ticket sales are setup, the scalpers can't make a living off of jacking up ticket prices anyways so knowing the difference between the average person trying to have a good time & a money grubbing scalper is what makes the staff at hard rock smart about how they treat their guests. it's not the best hotel casino resort in vegas but it is the best place to attend concerts & that's why it makes sense that there are so many events there all year long.

If you get room 10300 in HRH tower....RUNNN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I booked a double-queen in the paradise tower, called ahead to let the front desk we were gonna be arriving late due to fires in the LA area.  Finally arrived only to find that they had given our room away and only had a king bed for us.  Well we had 3 large males and only one bed.  They told us they would fix the situation the next morning.  Of course, the next day being a saturday (who checks out on a saturday?) they were unable to fix our room.  So I complained to guest services, and the guy was rather nice.  So they in fact "upgrade" us to the HRH-all suite tower.  Were given room 10300, which just happened to be the room located right above their new night club The Vault.  And i do mean RIGHT ABOVE.  Music was thumping until 4 in the morning!!!!  It became obvious that room 10300 was the room they give to people who complain about their own room, and try to trick people in to thinking its an upgrade.   Worst hotel experience I've ever had.  I will never be staying here again.

It's been long while since I've written a 1 star review :(  Where do I begin?!...

Let's start with the good.  The lady who checked me in at the front desk was nice and the lady who later gave me my room key was funny.

Now for the shit list with beautiful asterisks:

*That pool.  If you took a look at Rehab from up high, you wouldn't step in that dirty cesspool.  You can see a ring of filth around the edge.
*Dark dingy hallways wreaking of cigarettes
*Run down rooms
*People smoking in the casino
*People smoking in the casino sitting on the ground in the hallway in front of The Joint. Classy clientele.
*Rude housekeeping - not just to me, but to 2 other people in my unofficial group
*Got charged for a mini bar item that probably got knocked over but not consumed so their sensors just charged me for something and I didn't feel like contesting the charge
*This wasn't the hotel staff but when you have retail tenants who are calling your guests "stupid fucking strippers", that potentially hurts your business, too. 
*I was there for a convention with workshops in different rooms of the Muse and Artist halls.  Some of the rooms were not fully partitioned and you could hear loud distracting talking and music coming from the adjacent room.  I asked the convention organizers never to hold it there again.  It was at a different and better casino 3 years in a row prior.
*I checked out of there yesterday and I have not received an itemized receipt for my stay.

Now, I've stayed here before a couple times when it was actually nice.  It just has not been well kept and there seems to be no service standards.

I will say that The Joint is a nice venue for shows but that's not enough to warrant another star.

This "resort" is in some dire need of love...and not the kind that housekeeping is going to skip over.

The Hard Rock Hotel has some pretty sneaky practices. I am especially peeved with the pool staff. The lovely young poolside waitstaff are quick to offer you a drink, very VERY slow to actually bring it, in a big damn hurry to clear it away if you leave it for even a few moments and 100% unwilling to reveal drink prices. My Dad would never have ordered a $55 pitcher of Sangria, never. My stepmom's vodka rocks? $17, billed as "Grey Goose shot". They didn't have the Arnold Palmer I requested, probably because the 20something server didn't know what it was, and then was told it didn't contain alcohol so they must try to upsell me on something else. I ordered a lemonade& vodka, which was $19, in a tiny cup and 90% ice. When the bill came for our food and bev, it came to $300. There were 5 of us. There was a gratuity already included, but then there were "additional recommended gratuity" calculations, and my Dad, frazzled with the death of his brother (yes, we were in Vegas for the first time for a funeral) and the care of his 95 year old mother, ended up accidentally tipping $100 for service that was, frankly, worse than lousy.  

In our rooms, there were mini-bar items, but no immediately visible warnings that touching any of them led to an immediate charge for them. This rendered the fridge useless, as an attempt to put anything in it moves the items the hotel has stocked, so you are charged $$$ for sodas you didn't drink if you try to store that half-sandwich from Mr. Lucky's you didn't finish. There were no in-room microwaves, nor coffeemakers, and I ended up feeling as if HRH is out to squeeze every customer for each and every dollar they've brought. I'm VERY glad I didn't give any of my dollars to their casino. 

To avoid an entirely negative review, I will say that the bed, covered in crisp cotton sheets and a feather duvet, was quite comfortable.

Stayed at the HRH in the Casino Tower this past Sunday thinking the crowd from the recent fight would be gone. Just to find out that there was an event at the HRH with Nelly making an appearance. Therefore the crowds did not die down as expected. 

Oh well, did not affect us getting our reserved room. The room itself in the casino tower was adequate enough for the night. The bed was heaven... pillow-top heaven! That is probably the norm now here in Vegas, but it has been a while since I've been back. 

Though I do have to say, since the casino itself was crowded for the event. It affected the queue to the lucky 24-7 cafe downstairs which made us go outside the casino for a midnight meal. 

Overall it was a your standard Vegas room, albeit in the older one of their towers. Would I stay here again? If I got the same deal again... Definitely!!

The hotel is just very rundown and dirty. The TV in our room didn't even work. The counters were very dusty which is pretty gross since these rooms are suppose to be cleaned daily. It is too far away from the strip. It's a $10 cab drive to most places on the strip. You would think that since they charge a $20 resort fee they would fix the hotel up a lil bit. It's just not worth it. I would never stay there again even if it was free. The only reason they get two stars is because their mattress was very comfortable but that was the only highlight.

Bad service for two night stay. Room needed rehab help (casino tower 972).  Remote, shower, ironing board and iron did not work.  Gave feedback and even left a hand written note with iron board on bed and no action.  Insult to injury was long check in wait and difficult find thae bell captain to keep bags for the day.  Too many other choices to select Hard Rock again.

Stayed here last night & have positive & negative feedback! 

Positive: The price of the room was good. The room was very clean & nice. Valet parking attendants were prompt & friendly. Most of the front desk staff was pleasant. Beautiful pool area. 

Negative: Booked a room with a king bed, but upon check in, was told there were none available. I asked how none could be available when that's what I booked & was told having a king bed was a preference, and could not be guaranteed. Paid a $20 resort fee for free wifi, and gym access, but when we tried to use the wifi, it prompted us to pay $14.00. 

After paying for taxis & resort fee, it would've probably been worth it to stay somewhere like Aria, on the strip.

I came here for a conference and dealt with many different aspects while I was here...so I will break it down accordingly.

5 stars for the conference staff - the event planner, caterers, catering manager, etc. were all exceptional to work with and really worked with us to make sure that our meeting went exceptionally well

5 stars for the business center woman being AWESOME and friendly. She was super helpful when I was trying to print things last minute for the meeting.

3 stars for the conference room (Monterey) - the acoustics made it difficult to hear at times but microphones made up for it. 

5 stars for the hotel rooms. Super modern, trendy, and reasonably priced at $69 a night for our group rate.

2 stars for my check-in experience. Had to go to 3 different check-in desks before I found the right one. Some of the staff had no idea what they were talking about and kept sending me in circles.

Great experience overall - I wish this hotel had been on the strip but really enjoyed the amenities and staff here. Great event and rooms!
Tv connection in all the rooms is a joke. Dirty bathroom, over priced room service food and average casino. Look elsewhere for this price range.

We stayed at the HRH Paradise Tower Sunday and Monday nights and liked it a lot.  We did wander off to other more extravagant hotels to play but felt most at home at the HRH and the machines paid better. I had a great time entering a Texas Holdem Tournament which lasted a long time for just a $60 buy-in.  Good food and service at the Pink Taco and the hotel staff were all very friendly.

This is probably my favorite hotel in Vegas.  Off the strip means less randomness.  The people are here because they chose to be.  It definitely feels higher end and rooms are way more modern than most.  I like the vibe.
The rooms are pretty trashed here, so it's good if you watch the price line.  I wouldn't pay more than 50-75 a night, if you aren't there for a really special event.

I stay at a good amount of hotels. It's not the worst but after being here for 4 days the cost is 100% not worth the experience. I'm here for a conference and if I could have I would have stayed at another hotel. The WiFi is the absolute worst I've ever experienced- and the bull of having to pay for the "good" WiFi ticks me off. the room is nice but not even slightly worth the 1100$ I'm paying in total. It's clean and spacious but there are weird things that get overlooked- specifically hand soap in the bathroom but that's not the end of the world. The staff is pleasant but 4 people couldn't explain to me why there is a very large charge from the hotel on my card because it's not in their system. That charge now has to be disputed by my bank and I'll be in overdraft when I check out so I'm beyond not happy about it. I take credit for this decision but I don't love that the casino is in the lobby just because I have lung problems and have gotten sick since being here... not the hotels issue It just contributed to the weekend not living up to expectation in the slightest.

This place is off the hook from when you walk in.  Rock music blasting.  Dancers are beautiful. The circle bar is fantastic.  The drinks are expensive but that is Vegas - just gamble and tip the cocktail waitress.  See a show here, any show!!
Music wall to wall...I dig the vibe here, always. Ready to see an excellent group.. The Foreign Exchange

I was disappointed at this hotel. Nothing much going on compare to the rest of the hotels in Vegas. Over all the room is just average. I mean you do get a big plasma TV. But come on who goes to Vegas to stay in a hotel to watch TV in their bedroom? No interesting restaurant inside of the hotel. 
I will not pay more than $100 dollars a night for this hotel

Went to Vegas this past week for work. Stayed at the Hard Rock and the room was phenomenal. I had no problems. Only recommendation to the room is to have better lighting inside the shower. The tiles are all black and the light is so minimal. Beds was very comfortable. Wish there were better restaurants. I went to Pink Taco which was ok and service was bad. When I checked in and out, guest services were very prompt, professional and nice. I will def recommend this place. I also went to the Rehab pool party. Had a blast!

Hard Rock Hotel & Casino (2017 Yelp Review #232)

Back in day, the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino was where I stayed the most when I was just a visitor.  The hotel is located away from the strip, the rooms are comfortable, and the conference rooms are affordable.  With the exception of Saturday night, the room rates are around $100.  If you're a gambler, then the Hard Rock is not for you since there isn't a ton of tables or machines.  As for great restaurants, you will not find that here.  If there's a huge plus with the Hard Rock, it's their fitness room.  This gym is stacked with real weights and a view of the pool.  Rehab!!

Hotel staff was very helpful and friendly especially front desk. Rooms are very nice and modern. I was very happy with the over all hotel. However it is a ways from the strip and will require a ton of walking or a cab. For us that was fine but many are surprised at how fat back the hotel is. I would recommend this property to those who are looking for nice accommodations good gambling but not wanting to wonder to strip very often.

PROS: Usually good rates on rooms during the week. The best spot to see\/meet celebrities, as they all stay here. Rooms are super comfy. LOVE LOVE LOVE the restaurants and gift stores.
THE BEST POOL IN VEGAS, PERIOD! includes music under water, swim up bars and poker tables, as well as EXCELLENT service. The cabanas are also the BEST in vegas. I love the vibe of the hotel. Casino is nicely sized-not too big. Great decor if you love rock n roll.

CONS: I HATE HATE HATE REHAB! TOO MANY TOOLS AND STUPID DRUNK PEOPLE! I WILL NOT STAY ON REHAB NIGHTS HERE!
prices have increased over the years with the expansion of the hotel w\/2 new towers :( parking can be a nightmare, depending on when you're staying. Avoiding summer\/spring when rehab is happening at the pool is your best bet if you want to avoid drunk idiots, chaos, and a ton of noise. Also, if you are all about staying on the strip, then hardrock isn't for you. I personally enjoy not being on the strip because I can suit all my needs @ hardrock.

I rate there suit rooms a 5. But the coffee shops prices are to high.  3.99 for a cup of coffee!!!!
14:99 for ham and eggs!!!  Wow!!

I like the Hard Rock, but it is a little overrated in my book. The events are what keep this place on top. Great concerts, the Rehab pool party, and trendy spots give the HRH a great, hip feel and make it a fun place to be.

The casino is decorated in musicians outfits and instruments. It is loud and loose. The restaurants are good.

The rooms are small, dark and look like they were furnished by IKEA. 

This is a great place to gamble, dine, drink or just hang - but I suggest sleeping elsewhere.

It's not a vacation unless there's a Hard Rock stop involved. No matter where you travel, you can find one. And find one you must so that you can get a Hard Rock shot glass from whichever city you happen to be in. Well, for me, anyway.

In all honesty, most of the casinos in Vegas look the same after a while. Sure there are bells and whistles that they add in order to try to outdo each other. But at the end of the day, they have the same things: a building with lots of lights and a potentially weird shape for its gimick, casino, mostly naked women, clubs with obnoxious cover charges, and expensive restaurants. 

But Hard Rock stood out just a little bit to me. Maybe it was because they had the only bartenders who carded me the whole weekend. Maybe it was because the craps dealers were a lot of fun and kept calling me "Lady Luck." Maybe it was the hot, but not impossibly hot pole dancers who didn't make me feel bad about my own body. But it was most likely their hard rock soundtack, something you would expect from the name sake. It was very refreshing to walk into a casino that sounded more like a spiffed up and updated dive bar juke box rather than like a bad day at Movin' 99.7* like the other casinos.

*Please know that I hate Movin' a little less since they wised up, saw a brilliant opportunity, and hired on Fernando and Greg.

I stayed in the new HRH Tower this past weekend and was extremely pleased with every part of my trip. The room was not quite ready when we arrived but the front desk lady said they would call my cell phone within an hour. I hadn't even got my beer from the bartender when they called and said the room was ready. Our bags where in our room about three min after we walked in and the bell hop was very nice in showing us how to use the built in touch screen stereo and i pod dock. I usually stay at The Hotel tower at Mandalay bay, but will be returning to the Hard Rock for now on.
I just love our room! Got an upgrade for a lux suite! 20dollar trick works!!

I'm tired of this hotel. Almost everytime I come to Vegas, I end up staying here. I was here this past weekend and service was horrible. I was here with some friends and we asked for towels and an iron and it took at least one hour. We told them we need a room with 2 beds and we only got one the first night. Next night, they told us they will upgrade to a suite and we wind up with a one-bedroom suite. Better stay at Hilton!

This is a review for HRH:
This place has definitely gone down hill. The front desk staff were rude and unwelcoming. The rooms have always been a good size but have aged quite a bit. The rain feature in our shower didn't work, the iPod dock didn't work, and they never bothered to come and clean our room (even though we called for housekeeping before we left the room). At the end of our stay they messed up our bill and then accused us of making the mistake! The rooms were suppose to be comp'd but they said that I requested a double upgrade so that's why they were charging me $300. I had to sit there and argue with the front desk lady until FINALLY she said she'd call someone. So when she called someone regarding my reservation, she figured out that I was right and the rooms and resort fee were suppose to be comp'd! So WHY couldn't she do that in the first place instead of accusing of us of making the mistake automatically?!? No apology was given, hence the 2 star rating. 

Room size: 5 stars
Room quality: 3 stars (broken shower and iPod dock)
Front desk: 0 stars

Tip: If they assign you to the 3rd floor, don't bother going up! Go get a different room automatically. The whole floor has a creepy wind noise in the hallways and the rooms.

The new poker lounge at the hard rock is actually quite nice. Wednesday night ladies tournament for $20 was a blast. Dealers are fun (and most are hot might I add), atmosphere is great, and the players I met were awesome. I will definitely be back.

Minus one star for trying to charge $3 for redbull\/energy drinks.. screw you guys for that.
Hard rock cafe has very good burgers. I've been to the one in San Francisco and the one in Vegas has a much better vibe.

DON'T EVER STAY HERE! I had a Do Not Disturb sign on the door, the cleaning people still came in. $420 was stolen from me. Valet also stole ray bans out of my car. I filed a report with the risk management department and they will not call or email me back. TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! Don't waste your time here. Also, after we checked into our HRH suite, the handle on the bathroom literally fell off. All I did was open the door to use the restroom.

We stayed here when we saw Underworld perform nearby.

I loved the look of it from the outside. The casino is amazing and 'The Joint' is fabulous. Hart and Huntington Tattoo was awesome to see.

The room was a regular room and it wasn't anything fancy. You could have told me it was a Holiday Inn Express and I wouldn't have argued. It worked for us because we were out all night anyway. Location was key for us. I don't even remember walking back to the room to be honest.

Also...the circular venues and rooms and etc downstairs is confussing. I kept getting lost (not because I was drunk) but it was just confussing. I think if I were drunk and without my man, I could have gotten into trouble...

We'll be back I'm sure and we'll try something new.

We had a ~39 dollar groupon deal at HRH and headed out to Vegas to meet some friends.  We arrived at the hotel a bit after 2:00pm.  Sad Trombone...check in time is 3:00.  And, YOUR room probably won't be ready until 5:00pm.  The guy at the desk starts to suggest "upgrading" to a room with a view of the Strip (more on that later).  He has a tablet with lots of great pics to aid in the upsell.

My wife agrees to the upgraded room, and suddenly the desk guy springs the mandatory $30 per day "Resort Fee".  This allows us to actually use the amenities at the hotel.  What is the point of staying at a place like this, if you can't use the pool?

When we get to the room in the Paradise tower, we quickly realize that the only view of the Strip, is if you put your face against the window and look toward the window frame.  The room faces south and the strip is due west. 

The next day, we head off to the pool.  There are several pools, so we just to walked to the nearest.  As I walked through them door, a hulking, pierced "security" guy blocked my path.  He suggested that I go to the "family pool".  I later realized that this was the Rehab High Energy Party pool.  No old folks allowed!

That night, we went to dinner and a show.  We got back to the hotel after midnight and our room door would not open.  There are no house phones, so we trudged to the front desk.  The attendant was rude...long story, rude help...hour wait to get into our own room.

The Hard Rock seems to have a lot of horrid reviews on here but my experience there didn't line up with a lot of what I'm seeing, so I feel compelled to put in my two cents.
Keep in mind, I only stayed one night, but I'm very picky. Very anal-retentive about cleanliness. and VERY intolerant of loud, drunken people carrying on and demanding attention from anyone that will give it to them. That being said, I didn't experience any problems with said possible grievances. 
We booked the room for a night for only $70, which I think is great because I'm used to $150-$200 a night at shabby hotels in no name places Virginia. They placed a mandatory $50 security hold on my card but as soon as I checked out, the hold was immediately dropped so don't worry about that.
We got a free room up-grade and were facing the pool. Yeah, I didn't really care either. 
The room itself was very clean and sleek. It had a sort of loungey vibe to it, everything was grey, black, and red. I was expecting your typical beige and green floral bull that every hotel seems to go with. The bathroom was a little small, but the shower was gargantuan.
The bed was by far the most comfortable bed I've ever sleeped on. I can't sleep in hotels. I'm always in pain, laying awake for 90% of the night and I get headaches from the slightest discomfort in any pillows. The second I laid down on this bed descended from the heavens themselves, I fell asleep within minutes and woke up in the morning pain-free. 
The only cons is that there was no hair dryer. It's okay. I brought my own. But what if I hadn't? Just saying. You never know. Also, there's a LOT of walking if you're staying in the Paradise Towers. The casino and concierge seems like it takes forever to get to.
The hotel is a little far from the strip but still walkable. Maybe 3 blocks or so. It's a good deal if you don't care too much about being right where the action is but still not missing out on too much. HRH has it's own casino, nightclub, and some restaurants which I did not check out so I dunno how those are. 
ALSO OUR ROOM HAD PICTURES OF THE CURE IN IT. AND THERE WAS TONS OF CLASH MEMORABILIA ON THE WALLS AND DURAN DURAN STUFF AND AND AND PLEASE LET THAT SINK IN.

Bend over and grab your ankles if you book here. Our third trip to Las Vegas. Resort fee high, and not able to use hot tub. The pool that has that has not been open. $50.00 fee per night deposit. When we called to report missing item from what they leave for sale in room, we were told we had already used 2 things from the stocked bar. We had just checked in! We had used nothing. Get itemized bill and check it closely. Today went to business center to print something out, they wanted to charge me $8.00 for 10 minutes. They don't want you to bring in outside food or drink, yet they charge $4.00 for a diet soda from a machine. We requested to speak to site manager. We will see if they respond since we are stuck here until the 16th of September. We miss the Tropicana. Tropicana waived resort fee and deposit since we are Hilton members last time we were here. We had to change travel plans at last minute due to Irma.

Terrible and unprofessional customer service. Security for lost and found is terrible, their own staff doesn't know their own operating hours!! I hardly see any of their staff smiling, they all look depressed and unhappy. Overheard one guard complaining about someone falling asleep on the job. So disappointing for the other Hard Rocks I've been too in America were amazing, full of jazz, and so outgoing! This place was by all means zero customer service!

Was für ein geiles Hotel - sorry für die Wortwahl aber anders kann ichs nicht sagen. Man fühlt sich wirklich wie ein Rockstar, die Zimmer sind der Hammer für einen Spottpreis (ich glaub so ca 30 Euro pro Nase), das Hotel hat ein eigenes Tätowierstudie (!), diverse Restaurants und Shops, ein Cafe und natürlich ein Casino. So macht Las Vegas einfach nur Spaß. 

Wer nicht auf Rockmusik steht sollte dennoch woanders hingehen denn die spielts natürlich den ganzen Tag. Auch das Personal ist teiweise nicht übermäßig freundlich, ich hatte aber trotzdem so geniale drei Tage hier dass ich fünf Sterne vergebe.
Clearly they do not care about their patrons. 1 1\/2 months later & I haven't heard a thing from anyone, like I was told I would! Too many other great hotels in Vegas to waste my time or money here!!

Probably one of my worst hotel stays in Vegas and I travel monthly here for work.  My company paid for a non smoking room in the paradise tower, non smoking rooms were not available in this tower when I checked in.  They offered an upgrade for one night in a suite but I would have to move for my second night or a non smoking room in their older tower for both nights.  I opted for the older tower, moving mid stay is ridiculous.

Second, room service was awful.  I ordered the French dip, the sandwich wS reheated, partially burned, and the fries were stale.  On top of this, they didn't include a glass of water, I ended up paying $7.50 for the water in the room bar.

I left this review at 2 stars since the room was still clean and the service workers were not rude, not spectacular either, more luke warm, 2 star quality.

All style and no substance. 
Starting at practically $200\/night (on their site, on a concert night- there are deals to be had but far from good ones IMO), the rooms here best be swanky- and they are. But given the location, there's really nothing nearby to go to other than the businesses inside this casino unless you have a car or want to constantly call taxis. I'd rather stay on the Strip proper given this alternative, and I'm not a fan of the Strip in the first place.

I came here for a concert, and the Joint venue here is a good one- but after visiting not one, not two, but THREE different restaurants (happy hour, dinner, and coffee), I was underwhelmed by the both the service and product at all of them, I can't really recommend this place, even for a staycation.

Also note their insane "outside food policy"- if this were genuinely intended for safety, they would be targeting coolers, alcohol, and possible ways of bringing in drugs. Not confiscating candy bars and bottled water.

Hard Rock vegas is crappy to say the least..it's always been crappy no matter how many times they add to it or renovate it..it's in 1 of the crappiest area in Vegas..like the saying goes "you can't polish a turd

The Hard Rock Hotel has a slightly inconvenient location off the strip, so my boyfriend and I decided to stay here only one night.

Nonetheless..

I loved the layout & modernness of our HRH Tower Supreme King Suite!

The room is very spacious, furnished with plenty of couch space. Two TVs, one on each side of the small wall dividing the lounge area from the bedroom. King bed -- SO COMFORTABLE! My boyfriend thought it was a little too squishy.. but for me..being swallowed whole into the center of the bed surrounded by the plushness and fluffiness..so soft and snuggly.. PERFECTION. 

I love rooms with a decent sound system.. gotta have that pump up music. There is a touch panel jukebox + iPod dock embedded in the wall, and there is one, maybe two, alarm clock radios with iPod docks -- can charge two or three iPhone\/iPods at the same time.

The bathroom is separated by a glass wall and door, revealing a bathtub, a shower with no door, a separate fogged glass door to the toilet, and his and hers sinks. However, if you are concerned about privacy, there is a curtain that will cover up the entire bathroom area.  

Few problems..
#1: The rainfall showerhead did not work :( Luckily there was a second showerhead (the kind that detaches), because our schedule was too busy to complain.
#2: Iron was missing, and we had to wait about a half hour for them to bring one up.

Just details. Overall, we enjoyed staying here. We asked for an extra hour to check-out and went down to RELAX Mondays.
Construction all over the casino floor,,,   the hotel charged extra fees for no reason,, the food was just ok,,,,overall a just ok Hotel,, nothing like the Hotels on Las Vegas strip...

A few friends and I recently stayed at the Hard Rock on a road trip out to the Rose Bowl. Despite the little time we had, it was an overall pleasant experience. 

We didn't arrive in Las Vegas until 11 p.m., so we had a late check in. When we walked up to the front desk, we were told we were "upgraded" to the HRH, the newer hotel. I wouldn't call it an "upgrade", just a newer hotel, which I'm assuming was cleaner and nicer than the other hotel tower. The beds were great and comfortable. The room or the floor did not smell of smoke at all which is a major plus. The only thing I wasn't thrilled about was the bathroom door didn't lock. Good thing I was comfortable with everyone I traveled with. 

The only down fall was the 4.99 steak 'n' eggs breakfast at the restaurant off the casino. One friend and I ordered our steak medium rare and did not feel so great later on. There was a more expensive steak 'n' egg option (leading me to believe the steak was not too sketch), but hey, you live you learn. It's also far from the Strip, but we were really only there to crash.

Would definitely stay here again.

I'm completely ambivalent when it comes to this place, and now that I have actually stayed here, it's still confounding as to what to say.  My boys and I were here for the Fetish and Fantasy Ball, which was an incredible experience in and of itself, but here's everything else:

+5 for the room itself.  Comfortable, useful, lots of space, although not nearly enough mirrors (when you're one girl staying with three guys though, I guess there's no room for complaining).  Pillows were a bit too soft for my taste, but the boys sleeping on the floor loved the comforters :)

-1 for the shower curtain.  What the hell?  Water all over the bathroom floor = not a good time.

-1 for the pool music being blasted at 9am even though nobody was there.  This happened two days in a row.  I never want to hear Katy Perry hung over ever again.

+1 for the security at the elevators.  I'm sure things get crazy and whenever he wasn't around, some drunk lost insane person always managed to sneak in to the elevator with us.

+1 for the bitch dealers in the middle of the night\/early morning.  I'm in love with you (even though you took all of Craiggers' money).

-1 for the cymbal lights in the hallway.  Sorry Jared, but I'm pretty sure my drunky friends were some of those people banging on them in the middle of the night\/morning.  Cool looking, but dumb idea, especially when your head is pounding.

-1 for the in-room toiletries and towels.  Seriously, for how much you charge for your rooms, the least you could do is provide higher quality towels and soaps\/shampoos\/etc.  Big disappointment.

Hence, three stars:  A-OK.

Should of read the majority of negative reviews. Not so nice business practices, far from a pleasant stay, don't think I would come back here again based off of the customer experience solely. Hire workers that are willing to exceed the needs of your customers and who put customer experience first.

OMG. If you get the opportunity you must stay in the HRH suite. It is super nice. I loved staying in that hotel room. It is the best. I plan on staying there again and again. By the way this is not a place for the kiddies which is what I loved about this hotel. This is definitely a party hotel! Enjoy

I like this hotel during the week, so it isn't that wild. The vibe of this hotel is what I like. It is so hip and cool. I also like that it is smaller, and not on the strip. All of the restaurants are AMAZING! The staff is also very friendly.

Not sure when this changed, but now you have to pay for your drinks even if you play video poker at the bar. They will throw in a couple freebies, but I always thought if you were playing, they were buying...Huh. Doesn't matter because I am not a big drinker or gambler.

The rooms are nice and plush. The bed and pillows were super comfy. The only thing about the rooms I didn't like is the water in the shower never got super hot.

Anyway, I would absolutely recommend. And it is much quieter mid week. The pool rocks too!

Check in was pretty easy and their slots are loose! Won $350 on the penny slots. Room was a double queen facing pool...LOUD music while Rehab grand opening going on. Then some kind of construction noises going on bright and early. No fridge in room and $20 charge per day to get one. On the plus side we had dinner at 35 steaks. Filet was yummy and cocktails were on point. Just no real "presentation" Buuut I must say the wait staff were super friendly and attentive. They brought us a free dessert since they knew we were celebrating an early Mother's Day.

I would love this hotel if it weren't for the constant influx of junkies that just hang out in the lobby harassing people for cigarettes, money, telephone calls to get their dealer\/pimp to pick them up...... it kind of ruined our stay and we checked out after one night and went to the SLS instead. The room was large, clean and comfortable, but the bed was too soft for me. Nice bathroom with separate tub and shower.

Planned a fabulous vacation from monday through thursday a couple years ago in May. Stayed in the Paradise room, the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in, like being devoured by a huge marshmallow. The room was made of sexy blacks, reds and greys something i really liked. The shower was huge my only complaint no where for me to balance my foot and shave properly. I'm a fan of the hotel,check in was quick so much to look  at I love rock so I was in awe. They had Coachella photos all over the wall ( RHCP, Rage, etc) which I went to that year and it brought back memories. It was quite a walk to our room elevators from the lobby but there were many stores around coffee shop, little market, restaurants. The one thing I didn't like was Mr. Luckys 24 hour restaurant we arrived at 2am and were seated only to wait a long time for any service but I noticed everyone else being sat after us was greeted right way so we got up and left. Ordered some room service but the food wasn't very good we got a reuben sandwich, cheeseburger, quesadilla and a fresh baked brownie. Everything tasted average, the brownie was like a store bought one and the room service charge was 18% so our bill was $80, wish we would've gone to an actual restaurant for that price and quality. Other than that would definitely look forward to coming back!

This hotel sucks! I would never ever stay here anymore. 6 o clock in the morning, construction workers outside, noise was terrible and smell awful! Also is a flight path, so lots of planes...far from the strip..worse hotel I stay in Vegas!

Hard Rock is an Experience. Visited Here in 90's Up To 2013. Will Stop by in Future Visits. True Rock Themed Casino is Awesome. Its Off the Strip & Car is Recommended. I Have Ate & Played Here, But Not had the Pleasure of Staying Yet. Its a Little on Pricey Side for a Hotel. I Bought This Highly Collectible Biker Bear in Mid 90's That's Now Rare at HR Souvenirs Shop Back Then. This Hotel Casino Resort is Sometimes a Hotel Choice of Certain Movie Stars Actors\/Actress & People in the Biz I've Witnessed.

This is my Off the Strip Spot.  Infodiva was here.  Pink Taco is cool.

I stayed here after Christmas in 2003. What a blast I had. I love the big expansive, modern spacious rooms. The amenities were luxurious. I had a room facing the pool area. Since it was December it was closed.  I ate at Pink Taco, the 24 hour cafe. I love the circular way this hotel is designed.  

What better way to party than to get drunk at one of the Hard Rock discos and then stumble to your room for an after-party. Gambling is a little pricey....  $10.00 min to play Black Jack. I forget what drinks cost. We had a bar in our room. Gin and Tonic.  I kept drinking Mudslides also.  

I like staying off the strip sometimes. The traffic and parking is less stressful.  Here is some info on the Hard Rocks...  We stayed here prior to the sale.

The Hard Rock Hotel and Casino is a hotel-casino located in Las Vegas, Nevada. The property has a 646 room hotel and 30,000ft (3,000m) casino. The hotel will undergo a major expansion to be completed in 2009.

The Hard Rock Hotel and Casino is an expansion of the Hard Rock Cafe franchise.

It is known for its youthful appeal, elaborate swimming pool area (home of Rehab), and exclusive nightclub Body English. Along with The Palms (another off-strip resort) the Hard Rock both appeals to the 21 to 30 crowd and those who enjoy the Neo-retro feel of Las Vegas.

The hotel was opened in 1995 by Peter Morton, a co-founder of the Hard Rock Cafe franchise.

On June 27, 2002, John Entwistle, the bassist of The Who, died at the hotel from a heart attack.

On April 6, 2006, professional skateboarder Danny Way acid-dropped off the guitar on the cafe into a quarter pipe setting a world record.

On May 11, 2006, Morton agreed to sell the property to Morgans Hotel Group for $770 million. The sale and transfer of ownership was completed in February 2007.

Address  4455 Paradise Road
Las Vegas, Nevada 89109
Opening date  1995
Previous names  none
Casino type  Land-Based
Theme  Rock & Roll
Owner  Morgans Hotel Group
No. of rooms  670
Total gaming space  30,000ft (3,000m)
Signature attractions  The Joint
Body English
Rehab
Notable restaurants  NOBU
Pink Taco
A.J.'s Steakhouse
Mr. Lucky's
Years renovated  2001
Website  Hard Rock Hotel

I am heading back to LV 2008. I will have to check out how the remodeling is affecting the hotel. I am aiming for a package deal. Air +Hotel wish me luck.

We checked in around 8 at night and the nice lady upgraded our room to a executive suite free of charge. There was a drake concert that sold out when we stayed here. The room is very spacious and modern looking. The room decor was so my style and I slept like a baby on the comfy bed.

My one night stay was amazing. Resort offers everything. Love the food choices and the rooms. Minor construction going on at the time but nothing to the extent of noice or dust. Loved the memorabilia. Would definitely recommend!!!!

please, don't ever stay here.

long story short, and with all fairness in play. 

do you have any problems with the way your rooms are being charged to you? guess what? you can't get the money back for any transaction fee errors that they fucked up on. they will fucking play dumb to everything you are talking about and try to hang up on you. 

i thought this was a nice place to stay, but i was dead wrong. do you like your money? then STAY OUT of here.

i am beyond dissatisfied with the services here. by the way, it takes 14 hrs sitting around to upgrade your room?motherfuckers.. the fucking fuck!

So my wife & I came here for our anniversary we well I drove 7 1\/2 hrs.We got here super early about 1130am check in isn't until 3pm they already knew it was our anniversary & i mentioned my wife is sick.So I finished paying for the room we left & went to CVS to get her medicine about an hour later they texted me saying our room was ready how cool is that letting us get the room 2 1\/2 hrs early. My 3 biggest complaints are the sweetest concierge lady had promised me my wife & I would get bath robes & 24 hrs later we still haven't received any 2 we are missing a glass cup we only have one supposed to have 2 & 3 the second shower head doesn't work.The hotel though is bad ass cool music memorabilia  ( Kurt Cobain my favorite) staff is cool & friendly just wish we had gotten those bath robes.Our room is the Supreme Corner king suite I highly recommend it!

Good:
Location is slightly off the strip, which was nice for us because there was a CVS across the street and local food spots were never slammed busy. 
Valet guy RICHIE was awesome. Woman at the front desk (cant remember her name sorry!) was awesome as well. All staff members we spoke to were wonderful and accomidating.
Food inside the hotel is good.
Bed is comfortable.
Rooms are clean.

Bad: 
We were on a nonsmoking floor, but half of the time our room \/ hallways stunk of cigarettes and weed.
Lights in room only work at certain times of the day. 
Rooms are small
Hotel is FREEEEEZING

Don't seem that people go out of the way to help, got a room key that don't work and and stood in the key line for a bit and nobody helped me out, finally got someone to talk to me and they told me to get into the long check in line, no thanks. Came back later and a nice lady helped me out and got me a new key.
I ordered a single bed king size 2 months ago, instead i got a 2 bed queen, when I asked about that I was told to talk to someone else. Nice parking garage view from my room with alot of car alarms and horns nice. The rooms are dark and thats ok if your into it.
I wont be staying here again, the strip is a long walk away and the shuttle that runs from here to the strip stops at 5pm so a cab was in order.

They do a REALLY good job filtering cig. Smoke. 
After staying at south point and it felt like you were in a cave of smokers Hard Rock was awesome. I always get sick after Vegas due to the smoke & I did not this time. 

It wasn't as Grandeur as I expected - we stayed at HRH (?) and the room was huge \/ clean \/ awesome. 
Staff was super friendly !! 

I like the restaurants in the hotel - and their 24 hour diner type place - Mr. Luckys had REALLY good food & HUGE portions. Their spaghetti & meatball was actually more like spaghetti & arm sized meatloaf. 

Would stay again ! Yay for great filtration!!

Disappointed that a nice hotel casino only caters to people under the size of Large in clothing! I'm a big man, but I ain't no fat slob! It sucks not to be able to purchase shirts or tank tops, even shorts because you don't match up body wise! 
How does the word DISCRIMINATION sound? Vegas discriminates against people of size!

I love this casino... probably my favorite casino in Vegas.  It's all the way across town, but I still find myself here at LEAST once a week.  The Joint is a fantastic venue with great acts always coming through.  The dealers are friendly, and the supervisors always remember me.  They recently added go-go dancers to the table games pit, so you have something to watch while they take your money.  Hell, even the center bar is always packed, and the prices aren't bad either.

One of the reasons I like the Hard Rock is that they're one of the few casinos in town that actually mail me stuff I can use -- free bets, food credits, free rooms.  I don't gamble THAT much, but not many other casinos hook me up.  Hard Rock does.

Best part is that they FINALLY opened their poker room.  It's a very nice, well-run room, and I'm happy it's finally here.  Now if only I can actually not get unlucky and win money in their poker room, I'd really love this place.
Great room love the leather walls with the brass tack trim but the view from our room was of an alley. Wish it was a great view of the pool or strip

went here on a sunday to eat at ago. walked around the casino for a few minutes, which was very small. it's basically a big circle. 

walked over to ago and had dinner. the service there was pretty good, but i wouldn't be going back. the food wasn't all that amazing. 

what gives the hard rock a 1 star review from me is the experience we had when trying to leave. we were trying to make it back to the palazzo for jersey boys. we figured we had left ourselves plenty of time to make it back (about 45 mins). we get outside and the line for cabs was enormous. the guys outside are yelling 'no taxis tonight. take a towncar. $45! $55 for this lexus! $85 for this limo.' 

they run a scam with the hard rock to make money. because we were in a rush and had already waited about 20 mins, we took the  $45 town car. it was a $10 cab ride over. absolutely ridiculous. on the ride to the palazzo, we kept hearing over the radio 'hard rock to base. we need two suvs ect...' the guy who drove us told us they paid the hard rock $5 for every ride they picked up there. 

because of that, i will never go to the hard rock again.

This was my first time in Vegas and the last time I will ever come to the Hard Rock Hotel. My experience was the worst experience I have ever had on vacation. I expected a lot more from a Hard Rock Hotel.  The room was very dull and smelled of old, musty cigarettes. The bathroom was dark and very small (like something you would find in a cheap motel).   
   On our first morning there we decided to go to the pool that we had heard so much about. We went downstairs, were searched, and wristbanded before we were allowed outside in the pool area. It turns out we had accidentally entered the VIP pool section (there were no signs indicating this was the wrong entrance) when we tried to put our towels on a beach chair we were told that it would be a $250 MINIMUM to reserve these chair!!! Are you kidding me!!!! They informed us that anything you spent in food or drink at the pool would come off this fee, but there is no way I am going to drink $250 worth while I am at the pool for a couple hours!!!!! We were then told that we needed to go to the "commoners" pool on the other side of the pool area to find free chairs. As we were walking past the cabanas to find our way to this other pool we stopped a gentleman to ask for directions. When we told him what had happened and that we were trying to find our way to the other pool he replied "We usually don't let GA's walk through here but since it is early I guess I can let you through". Was he serious??? I couldn't believe he had just said that to us (and yes, he was serious). It was like 10:30 in the morning and there was no one in the cabana's yet anyways. That made me feel like I was cheap and worthless. These people were being rude and outcasting my husband and I because we were not going to pay $250 to have a pool chair to loung in?!?!?!?!?
   HRH is also know for their "rehab" pool party on Sundays. This is a bunch of rowdy people (mainly college students) that get drunk at the pool all day. I am 26, so I'm not too far from the average at at the party, but even this was too much for me! While my husband and I were in the taxi line to go to a show and a nice dinner for our last night in town, we had to wait in line with all of the drunk, rowdy kids. I got bumped into more than once by drunk girls that could not stand up straight. This, ontop of the yelling and cussing was extremely frustrating and not how I wanted to spend an elegant date night with my husband. 
     Finally, the worst part... Our last morning there, my husband decided to use the TV check out from our room to save us the time of waiting in line downstairs. We still had a little packing to do after he checked out so we were going to be about another 45 minutes to an hour. Before we were finished, a girl from housekeeping knocks on the door and asks why we are in there because the room was marked as "vacant". We explained to her that we checked out on the TV and would be finished packing in a few minutes. 5 minutes later she knocks on the door again and starts getting a nasty attitude with us. THEN SHE CUSSES AT MY HUSBAND!!! She tells us how her manager is on her to get the "f''ing" room clean. Pretty much yelling at us as she says this!!! I could not believe that housekeeping just yelled and cussed at us because we were still packing our belongings. Under NO circumstances should this EVER happen. 
   My husband called from the airport that afternoon to complain and all we got was, "I'm sorry, let me credit you a day of resort fees" which was a whopping $18!!!! Are you serious??? That's all the corrective action that you can afford to do after all that???? I don't think we ever saw that credit either. HRH can keep their money and they can also make sure that I will warn everybody about how horrible we were treated while we were there.

My first trip at the Hard Rock in like 1.75 decades. Wow how have things changed!

My room was a little tired with a view of the hotel rooftop. It was older and needed a refresh but who can complain with the $46 a night deal I found on the Internet. I was in Vegas to watch my daughters B-ball tournament over the weekend so I really didn't care about the accommodations.

They have the coolest rock & roll memorabilia hanging on every wall. From Slash in my elevator lobby to an old Black Sabbath T-shirt in a hallway. I was overwhelmed looking at all the cool rock paraphernalia everywhere.

Had a few hours gambling and didn't feel like playing at the tables but I found this cool game from the movie The Hangover (classic Vegas) Movie, I played it and laughed my ass off. Recommended! 5*****sar game.

I ate at a couple of restaurants at the HRH  but didn't try the 2 gems. Nobu or 35 Steak as they both didn't fit my schedule. I did however eat at Pink Taco and Mr. Lucky's a few times.

The day light and night time party here is off the charts, with a rehab pool party  and the Nightclub (Vanity) made me  I wish I was 20 years younger.

I'd go back!

Was extremely disappointed with the Hard Rock. I've stayed at the MGM and Palazzo but decided to do more of a lower budget trip this time. Turns out I should have splurged.
-all restaurants served overpriced poor quality food with even worse service. 
-was given a room with dysfunctional shower and sink
-room service would not come until I had to call and complain and ask for an accommodation, in which they gave me some mini shampoos off of their housekeeping cart. Wonderful.
-asked concierge recommendations of some restaurants and she was very condescending. As if I asked her to do something that wasn't within her job description. 
-guests were vomiting on the carpet of the casino 
-was charged a $22\/day service fee for a free shuttle that was not worth the use. 

Only positive: the beds. It sure was nice to sleep off all of the blood boiling this hotel had done.

Circa 98 Edition.
Before Rehab, no villas, no luxury condos, body english, room reservation nightmares w\/ mandatory weekend nights.

Back then....

-W Hotel like rooms.  Green & Purple dominated.
-Pool side was still the day time attraction.  Baking in 100 degree weather while being served by a lovely bevy of beautiful cocktail waitresses.
-Casino Bar which was the "it" place to hang all night.  Grab a drink, mix & mingle.
-"THE JOINT" concert theater, where every seat was great, yet, comming and going was a nightmare.
-Babys was thee CLUB.  Dark, crowded, hot female bartenders w\/ sterling silver bottle cap openers lodge behind their backless outfits.
-Thee place to hook up, hang out, and party like a rock star.  It was hip, cool, and fun.  Booze, women and drugs..... It was oh so good, yet oh so wrong, cuz you paid dearly with a hangover the size of mount rushmore.  

Havent been there in years, but these were my memories.  Some of the best times ever at this joint.  Hard not to smile when you think of HRH.
Thanksgiving weekend only 1 pool open. Crowded. No smoke free environment. Good pool weather and no way to really enjoy it despite the 5+ pools advertised.

HRH was cool!

We stayed between two places.     Compared to the Palazzo - this place was younger and cooler in my opinion.  

If you are looking to be close to the strip - this place is not for you. 



The Pool:
HRH - has a huge pool and music throughout the complex.    I highly recommend renting a cabana if you are with a group.    We had 6 guys in our group and had the cabana all day.    The pool provides a sand bottom in some areas as well as the traditional pool floor in other areas.    

The Gambling:
Preferred the Palazzo.   Not as cool or good.   You can lose your money at both places easily.

The Food:
The Palazzo has more options but I really enjoyed Mr. Lucky's Diner.    Pink Taco was okay \/ nothing to rave about.    

Enjoy your time... you are never in the hotel room anyway.

Who doesn't love vegas?   

Who didn't want to be a rock star for just a little bit? 

Party like a Rock star at the Hard Rock!!   Here for a bachelor party, we had one of the most amazing suites I've been in.   ( I shant give away the secret location.. so don't ask) 

I won't go into the pool, or views, or anything like that because if you can't imagine a vegas pool (ie Rehab)... you should either book your flight today or join a convent.   

The VIP staff and hosts were simply amazing.   Mike F.  and Trehy really hooked us up when going to the club.  Six bottles and an entire corner to ourselves later - we had an amazing night.   I truly have to give it to our waitress, Rachel, for what became one of the most memorable nights ever.   I would never go here again if I wasn't able to have her to hang out with.  (She was genuine, funny and beautiful)   

The actually "casino" is a bit small, but what do I care - I only play craps.   

Although there was no Buffett at the hotel, they did have an "all you can eat" tapas restaurant which wasn't bad.   

Pink taco - the mexican place - was really really good!!!   Although the computer went down, the waitress forced us to go to the ATM - PAY THE FEE - so that we had to pay her in cash.....  Which was complete BS. 

But you're in vegas, and several ... (several)....  thousand dollars later - this was by far the best vegas trip I have ever had.   - and i have been there more than a dozen times.

We stayed in this hotel with my husband on our honeymoon. We booked and paid via Booking.com and on arrival we found surprised to pay extra for "service use" and of course tax, which increased the price by half of what we had already canceled. Furthermore on arrival there were no available rooms with king size bed and got a room with two beds. Yes, on our honeymoon ... Not good. Against this, the desk person was not kind to us to tell our displeasure.

Upon reaching our room I found a dirty bathroom and very bad toiletries. The truth is that being a Hard Rock thought the experience would be quite different.

After going down to the bar, the bartender was not all cocktails available as we had said. And he was angry with us because we commented that!!

Finally, the location is quite far to walk around, so you should always add outputs by taxi between $ 25 to $ 60USD.

I do not recommend anybody to stay in this hotel, if you want to see the musical attractions puden do so by visiting the casino but to sleep in any way. Surely not return.

I've been to this casino a few times for shows at the Joint--both the old and new versions of the Joint.

This is not my go to place.  I don't fit their demographic at all.  However, it is nice to stop by here every now and then and watch the beautiful ladies as they head hither and yon.  There are some fine looking women.

I stopped at the Hard Rock today to have breakfast at the Pink Taco.  I parked in the new garage and I saw how the casino was expanded when the new tower and garage were added.  It's not the small, circular casino it once was.

I did take a few minutes to look at some of the rock memorabilia especially the Jimi Hendrix things near the doors to the garage.  

It's an OK place but it's not for me.

This place is awful. It says hard rock but it's more like "we're running out of money, and by the way we're hitting rock bottom while censoring your speech rock". The AC was out today for many hours and the power went out randomly and then, while talking to my friends at the craps table, I was told I can't say Fuck. They are actually censoring my first amendment speech right! The hard rock is doing it! This country is going to shit along with these awful relics. FUCK this place!

I would give 4.5 stars if I could. I was worried after seeing some of the reviews on here but after spending the weekend at the Hard Rock I am happy to report that a lot of them are unfounded. Nice, clean room, comfortable bed and decent bathroom in the casino tower. The staff was friendly for the most part except for a couple bad seeds who just don't have the time of day for you at all. Saw a concert at the Joint which was fantastic, and it's so great to be able to see big name acts in a nice place like the hotel. My only gripe was with the blackjack tables - a lot of them only pay 6:5 odds on blackjack instead of 3:2, and it's not well advertised.

But overall, extremely awesome affordable place for a younger crowd and I would\/will definitely stay there again.

Check in took forever. 5 people at the front desk, one was on the phone, two were training or counting papers or something, 2 actually checking people in. It was also a weird experience as the employee's are in a pit below you and you have to bend over to a 3 foot table to sign forms and whatever.
