They have a couple of pool areas, but the Rehab beach is the place to be. Be aware that if you choose to sit in a chair at Rehab, you will be charged for it (like $50?). There is lots of security, especially on the weekends. I saw a couple fights break out.

The rooms are nice. The beds are extremely comfortable.

Be aware that they charge you a "resort fee", even if you have a Groupon or some other rate. This covers all the facilities and internet.

There are several restaurants on premise. Be prepared to pay. We were staying 3 nights and by day 2 I had found several great eateries in the shopping square across the street (especially the Kazen sushi place).

I am 44 and my body is not out of a magazine, so I felt extremely uncomfortable at this resort. I saw they had a dress code in the evening for the casino - which to me means dress nicer. In the case of the Hard Rock Hotel, it means you have to go change out of your swimsuit.

This would have been an amazing place to go when I was 30. Now, not so much.

We decided to go to Vegas for the ling weekend.  My hubby did his usual price search for the "best deal" and we ended up at the Hard Rock.  We had never stayed there so we were looking forward to it.  The casino was not very busy when we checked in and although the hubby asked for a room with a view he was misunderstood and we got a room that was new.  The view was of the roof.  Whatever, it was nice and clean and what's more they had smoking rooms!  How long has that been?  Also a fridge but no coffee maker which really rankles.  It means you have to go down to the coffee shop in the casino.  I don't like that.  Anyway, yhe room was very nice and some mighty comfy beds.  The casino itself was fun with all the rick memorabilia and the games and slots there were not busy and the usual fare.  We had a nice time and dis get a good deal.

WOOT! Special 100th review of the Hard Rock!!!!!!!! Well slap my ass and tell me it's my birthday.

I like Hard Rock because it's vibe is different. Cooler, hipper but still accessible, full of pretty people... And they have AWESOME go-go dancers! Normally, the sight of young girls gyrating on a pole for money makes me feel sorry for them. I think to myself "how much would this poor girl rather be doing something else for a living?" And I typically watch in muted horror as they shake their wiggly hips and bend in ways that must've served them well when they had aspirations of being a ballerina instead. The girls at the Hard Rock, however, made me feel otherwise. I watched as they danced the night away -- captivated by one girl in particular with short, pixie-styled dark hair, who knew how to WORK a ROOM. I swear, based on my attentiveness to her performance, every guy there must've thought I was a lesbian (I'm not), but it was just so refreshing to see a dancer who (a) actually knew how to DANCE, (b) obviously liked to perform and didn't look pitiful, and (c) was beautiful and alluring without being skanky. Good for her -- I give snaps!

Other than the show, Body English was stupid... We were supposed to be on a VIP list for entry, but because we came at 12:15 (and not 12am) we were told lists were no longer being honored and we'd have to wait in line and pay the cover like everyone else. Not to be a traitor to my gender and all, but it was a bespectacled snooty girl who apprised me of this snafu -- I have a feeling if I'd been dealing with a guy, it wouldn't have been a problem. For whatever reason this girl had decided she didn't like me and was going put her flat iron of a foot down. So we said 'thanks, but no thanks.' 

What happened next wasn't Hard Rock's fault, so I can't really take off stars (though it would've been nice if their response would've been quick and with concern), but the high point of the evening had to be when I got thrown up on whilst at the ATM near the cashier. There I was, innocently standing by in my pinstripe skirt and T-strap "CFM" heels while my boyfriend used the ATM, when a lurching Drunky McDrunk-Drunk stumbled over to us (holding on to the wall for dear life), and proceeded to vomit all over himself, the wall, ATM, floor, and me.

Puke once, shame on you. Puke twice, three, four, or five times, slip in your own vomit, fall down in its pool, and splash my legs with it... shame on me.

2 stars, Why 2 stars?  (#1) customer service. When we checked in We were told we have to pay $40 extra a night, because our reservation was for a king bed and not two queens... Which was incorrect. The suite We reserved at the HRH tower was for two queens. Then we were offered an upgrade(poolside view) for additional $20 a night. CRAZY! Lucky we printed our reservation, We did not pay the extra $40 a night and definitely did not upgrade to poolside view! (#2) I think it's ridiculous that you can't bring any outside food\/drinks. (#3) intermittent wireless connection. 
3 stars for our room. I've read some reviews about the rooms being dirty... blood stains on the sheets. When we walked in, I was expecting it to be dirty... I swear I checked the sheets right away :) Our room was pretty clean, no blood on the sheets. The mini bar was missing an item, which I let them know right away. Could not take that chance, so much shady reviews about the mini bar and the whole place. Housekeeping did not knock on door with the "do not disturb" sign ;) 
Our stay was not bad, but I wish I read the reviews before we booked. They need to quit trying to get more money during check in.

I love the memorabilia at this location!  They have the best than any other Hard Rock location I've seen around the world.  The casino is nice and not over done.  I personally go here just to get to the Pink Taco :-)

Eh...I guess the luster has worn on me a bit, this was a place for years that I loved and HAD to visit during our annual pilgrimage to Vegas.  

We did find an amazing NEW restaurant named Culinary Dropout and WHOA - it's incredible.

Otherwise - eh.   Maybe it was just the vibe wasn't there that day, not sure.

Don't waste your money here! From Check in to Check out, horrible customer service and management.

We booked a room that we had prepaid for in the main tower. After a delayed flight, we go to check in and the guy states oh we booked up that tower already, we are putting you in the Paradise tower that is clear across the the property! We were pretty upset, seeing as we had already paid prior to showing up and then find out it was a different room than what we had paid for! But wait it gets better...

We go to the room, spend the night and go about our work meetings all day for the first day. We get back around 6 or 7pm exhausted from the day, only to find out our keys didn't work? The front desk said oh if you put it by your cell phone or any other card it deactivates them. Wow, great to know after the fact and after we walked all the way back to the room and finally after security came by and let us in we find out the room was never cleaned and we had zero towels. We went down to the lobby and told them the room needed to be cleaned and we then we were going to go for a swim. Oh, the pool was closed prior to 7!? We asked the front desk guy and he claimed all the hotels close the pools around this time.. hmm.. so I called the hotel across the street and guess what?! No, this was a lie because they were open till 9pm there!

Disappointed even more, we then head to dinner, go to get their 'backstage pass' card that gives you a small discount here and there at the hotel restaurants from the 'money cage' because that is the only place you can get it. There is only one person helping people and after 30 minutes of waiting we gave up.

We head over to Nobu for sushi and it's closed for 2 days! Ok, next try.. we go to Pink Taco and the only highlight of this place was the bartender was awesome and probably the only guy that gave us good service at the hotel.

Next we go to ask the front desk, has the room been cleaned and the girl without even checking says oh yes it has... hmm.. we go up and of course it was not cleaned! We called and now spoke to a manager - Hector, who said he's send someone up to clean the room and bring towels etc. someone showed up only with towels! The poor guy had no idea our ordeal and we asked he have housekeeping sent up. Finally, now almost midnight, we get our room cleaned.

The manager offered no discount or comp to our room, even after his incompetence. I'll never go back here again and will recommend everyone stay far away from this place! I was hoping to relax a bit in between my work trip, but they completely killed it!

LOOSE. SLOTS. This was the only place in Vegas where I won any money. Let's say that I spent $20 and walked out with $1500. In about an hour. Play those Wheel of Fortune slot machines, that's all I've gotta say. Start on the pennies, work up to the quarters, then try your luck on some dollar and five-dollar machines.

Also, the Hard Rock has an all-you-can-eat tapas place that is simply amazing. So.. good casino, good food... It's all good and I think I'd probably stay here next time for those two reasons. Sure it's not on the strip, but who walks around in Vegas anyway? A cab ride is a cab ride.

I just got back from a two day stay.   I won't be back to the hotel but  I won't tell you that you shouldn't or discourage you from going.

Aesthetically, there is a very nice feel throughout the entire property, and the rooms were top notch for the price.  I felt comfortable and the bed was among the most comfortable I've slept in.  Granted, sleeping is about the only thing that I did within the walls of the resort.

The things that make me hesitant to stay again are that... while I don't mind paying a resort fee for things that I use, I don't like paying a resort fee for things that I don't or get denied use. I'll elaborate.

1)  We paid the $17.00 fee for valet, shuttle and fitness center, but were denied use of the valet service because they were "too backed up".. twice.

2) We didn't need the shuttle due to driving our own car.

3) We didn't use the fitness center because.... we just didn't.


Aside from that.. the only other tidbit of annoyance stemmed from being interrupted by the IT service man because there is a router in every three rooms, and mine happened to be the one in which the router was malfunctioning. 

Take from this what you will.   The service was good.  The attitude was professional and courteous and it is it's own bubbled paradise. 

Infamous one sentence review of Hard Rock Hotel: 

"It may be the most rad place that you'll stay in Vegas, but it just wasn't for me

Really disappointed :( Booked my room months in advance for Memorial Day weekend. Came early and the suite we booked doesn't have a view (paid for and requested a high floor). The room also needs major TLC. This was my favorite hotel.. 30th Birthday and super disappointed...

We came here specifically to watch a fight on PPV... but were disappointed that we couldn't find the place that we had reserved a table with a credit card for.  It ended up working out, but we also gambled here a little and all lost... the vibe was a little weird on the casino floor and it didn't seem like there were a lot of people there.  Maybe since it's off the strip and there are newer places to go to there is less of a crowd?

The one cool thing is all the music paraphernalia on the walls.

This place is sweet. They take care of any complaints you have. I've been here many times. This last visit I didn't like my room cause of size. And they put me in poolside suite for 50 bucks extra. Also I like how I walked in my room at casino tower while being cleaned and Varsha checked my ID even. Pretty nice to feel the saftey

We were looking forward to staying at the Hard Rock Hotel in Vegas for some time.  The websites and reviews looked like it would be a fun place to stay.  We arrived on a Sunday when parking at the hotel was chaos due to the Rehab party.  We paid some extra money to upgrade to a different tower with a room available.  Trying to get to our room however was a disaster.  The paradise tower is the same location where people line up and get to their rooms.  I was manhandled through security to get through with our luggage.  It would have been nice if there was a line for hotel guests to pass through the check in to get to their rooms.  The fitness center was nice and the gambling casino was entertaining.  One morning I walked out of our room and there was a black out on the floor.  The elevators were working but it was pitch dark trying to get down to the lobby.  The rooms were nicely decorated with the exception of the fact our next door neighbors smoked weed which drifted into our bathroom vents.  The bathroom water had an odd smell to it.  Needless to say, we won't be coming back.

I did a couple's massage here. It was great. I got a regular Swedish massage and my bf got a deep tissue. Both massages were amazing and the shower area is beautiful. They had us next to each other in a romantic room and gave us the choices of four different aromatherapy scents. (I think the extra scent would have been $20\/$25, so we declined any of them. It all ready smelled fine in there.) 

They have a great sauna area and most of what you may need before getting ready (razors, shampoo, combs, etc). 

Make sure, if you're a local, ask which days they do local's discounts! It makes a big difference!

Amazing!! I'm not sure as far as the hotel goes. I'm doing a review on the club! There club is amazing!!! I had an awesome time. If you're a woman you get in for free and drink for free till 1am. Awesome right? I had a fantastic time. The music was great, the bathrooms were clean. Staff was on top of everything. Very friendly and professional. I recommend this club.

I just got back from a fun weekend celebrating my friends 21st birthday at The Hard Rock, and it was great!
About 14 of us stayed in 3 rooms in the Paradise (one of the new ones) tower, and the rooms were super nice. There was an ipod dock so we could blast our music, plenty of closet space and enough room to dance. The hotel staff was super friendly and accommodating, even when I needed an extra blanket at 4 in the morning. 
The only dislikes about the hotel would be that the pool was closed and that it wasn't directly on the strip. And also, the shower was nice, but it didn't have any shelfs or anything, so it was really akward trying to shave my legs in there.. 
I would definitely stay there again, it was awesome.

Fourth and LAST stay.  The HRH has become a big fat scam...check out the reviews on TripAdvisor - I'm so not the only one with this experience:

On our third day at the hotel, we were told wristbands to enter the pool would be $20 each, which I thought was ridiculous - there was no special guest or live show, so it made no sense.  But, $40 wasn't enough money to argue over, so...whatever.  Then at the desk, she said it would be $100 each.  To enter the pool at a hotel we were guests at?!!  ok, that was enough to argue over.  She said she was sorry and that they are supposed to inform guests of this at check-in - - but, they hadn't, to which she replied again, "sorry".  Oh well!  sorry we didn't do our job.  You'll still owe us $200, though, if you want to use the pool.  EXTORTION - plain and simple.  The only option was to check out on a Sunday afternoon, pack up our stuff and move to another hotel - so I paid the money and we went in...and the pool area was basically dead.  Nobody there....pathetic really.

Come to find out, the new policy is to charge you extra for the pool if you book through a travel site (i booked through expedia).  Not to mention, the pool fee changes at their whim.  One minute it was $20 - in 5 minutes, it was $100.  It says nothing on the expedia site or on the hard rock site - I guess they're going to inform people of this new rule one disgruntled guest at a time.

I've seen some of hard rock's responses to these scathing reviews of their new way of doing business - and I'm sure they'll respond with another "We're sorry...there are many options in hotels when visiting Las Vegas"  And you know what?  They're exactly right.

After a couple of visits to the Hard Rock, I now know which rooms are the ones to stay in (pool-facing and HRH) and will keep that in mind to get the most out of future experiences. The Hard Rock is a really great hotel with good restaurants and shops, a great room service menu, and several nice pools. The rooms are spacious and nicely decorated (total rock 'n roll theme) with contemporary bathrooms, but not as noise-blocking as some other Vegas hotels. We don't gamble, so the small casino isn't a big deal to us. The prices are super reasonable and more than make up for the distance from the strip. They do have a shuttle that goes there but it ends at 5, I believe, making it more or less pointless. I also like that it's smaller than a lot of the strip hotels, so you don't feel like you're trekking across the country just trying to get to your room. I'll definitely be back.

This review is for the casino.  The new expansion is pretty nice.  The Hard Rock is definitely one the epicenters of "hip" in Vegas, but has always managed to get by with one of the smallest, if not the smallest, casino floor out of all of the high-profile properties in town.  With the new expansion, the gaming floor is much larger and more on-par with other casinos of its size.

The circle bar was shut down for renovation. This was the only bad part of our stay.  Everything else was great! My group stayed in the Paradise section of the Hard Rock. The rooms were very clean and did not smell of smoke.  Also as you walk out by the elevator they have a small shop selling Pizza for $3.00 per slice.  They also had $1.00 mystery meat hot dogs for sale during day near the check in area.  I'll take $15 worth, thanks!

Stayed in Paradise tower 5th floor, the theme is dark black guess its called rocker which is okay for me, not sure for others. It's a bidding result from Priceline under 4 stars hotel, quite a deal on price, can see the hotel is trying to improve the reputation. Love the Rehab pool, a nap in free daybed without waitress keeps coming over to wake you up is so free and relaxing.

Nothing special. Not nearly as nice as Hard Rock Hollywood\/Fort Lauderdale. Good casino to lose at machines. Nobody seemed to be winning. Def not me. It's more like a long hallway than an open casino. Not impressed.

Hard Rock Cafe was definitely a great stay and a remarkable hotel! The hotel is huge and has serveral towers. It is off the strip and it was my first time staying off the strip this last time but it wasn't so bad. They have a shuttle that goes every hour that comes from 10am-5pm and drops you off at the north side of the strip at the fashion mlall. We did it once but I recommend Uber or Lyft because the drop off point is far from evwrywhere else on the strip. The rides cost like $10-15 a ride. The hotel is grand and has amazing memorabilia from all of musical legends like Elvis, Michael Jackson, Beyoncé lol and more. Our suite was large and spacious with over 700 square feet which was great for a bachelorette. We have two queen beds and a huge living and bar\/kitchen space.  Our suite had its own check in and concierge which gave it a more exclusive and VIP feel. The customer service was great and we got there early in the morning so we were able to give our bags and explore the strip. I was hesitant about staying off the strip for the first time but  enjoyed it!

Stay: 3 Nights ( Added third night because we had not been to bed from the second night) Our room was cool and I really liked that the French doors opened for fresh air and a view, The view of the strip from our elevator lobby was awesome.  The casino is nice and easy to navigate.  

Recommend: Have 2 credit cards with triple balance of what your rate, resort fee and deposits will be TRUST ME, however you get what you pay for :) Book a daybed or cabana at Rehab, it is well worth it!  Pay the fee to have a Refrigerator brought to your room $21 a day and load it with bottle water, also if you are driving make your own bar in your room from Costco & Bevmo, snacks are wise too for more than a 24 hour stay.  Pay for early check in at 9am its also another $25 fee, Pay for late Check out as well $25 fee.  Culinary Dropout is a Fox concept and is really fun!  I love the fondue.  I like the Vegas location better than Scottsdale. 

GO TO THE SPA!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Pay the $25 entry fee for hotel guests or book a treatment, it is AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!  If you are an early riser like me, fighting a hangover can be rough, I recommend taking your phone, ipad, paper, book, go in PJ's and slip into a warm robe, claim a private Turkish daybed built into the wall, close the curtain and relax...take a warm dip, a steam dip with an ice towel, hot sauna to cold shower and then do it all over again until you feel human finish off with nap then go to the juice bar just outside.  Enjoy the standard spa fare; citrus water everywhere, bottled water literally everywhere, fruit and snacks and light snacks like nuts and cereal.    

I have stayed in Vegas 24 times but this was my first stay at Hard Rock and I love it because it feels like a real resort like you would find in Cabo or the Bahamas.  Head across the street over to Rumor when you got bored and hang out in the GIANT purple chair by the pool.
Also The Piranha Nightclub is around the corner and is open 24 hours a day.  Gets pretty crazy in there, go to a diner for breakfast after you drag yourself out and bring sunglasses, TRUST ME

When we got there we were a few hours early and they graciously accomodated us and let us check in early without an extra fee. However the minute we stepped off the elevator we smelled skunky pot. It was overpowering. The room was very basic with paint chipped off the walls and scuffs everywhere. We went to the Venetian and were blown away by how classy the place was. Hard rock is def not classy. We asked if there was anything they could do for us and they moved us to a corner room for a small daily fee in the paradise tower with a view of the strip and the pool. However the pool dj was really loud so we heard super loud music all night. This tower is newer and def nicer though. We ate at pink taco and 35 steaks and they were both great. I can't complain about the service, just that the vibe is young and loud and it wasn't really a good fit for us.

I had a great time gambling here one NYE circa 2005 or 2006. Charged by these positive memories I booked a deal on Travelzoo for 2 nights. I booked a Sunday-Tuesday trip and made the mistake of requesting a room with a pool view. The reason why this was giant misstep on my part is because it was August and when we arrived around 5pm on Sunday Rehab was still going strong. We dodged drunk zombies while making our way through the casino and over towards the Paradise Tower elevators. Upon walking into our room all we could hear was the loud thumping bass and music from the pool even though our room was on the 16th floor. We didn't think much of it since we figured the pool would close at sundown that would be the end of the loud factor. WRONG! At night, the nightclub's music was blaring....and at 9am in the morning on Monday and Tuesday I was awoken by the music again. When I can sing along to what's playing at the pool while I'm in bed on the 16th floor that's beyond lame. 

Apart from all the obnoxious drunk people stumbling around because of Rehab and the fact that napping or sleeping in was out of the question. The rest of the hotel was acceptable.

There are numerous pools (but enter at your own risk because you might catch a disease, I watched some of the debauchery going on in those pools from my room), there's a nice gym, they offer a free shuttle to the Fashion Show mall on the strip every hour, self parking was easy, pink taco had 99 cent margaritas and tacos and HH specials, Mr. Luckys was open 24 hours and had food specials too, I liked the music the casino played, the staff and security were pleasant (there's definitely a lot of security here compared to any other hotel), we spotted Ronnie from MTV's Jersey Shore, I liked the decor of the room, and people feel the Paradise tower is too far from the casino and restaurants, but that never bothered me. 

I think the only way I'd ever stay here again is if I could be guaranteed a quiet  room facing the quiet parking lot during the winter when pool season is over.

Loved making this place a regular hangout!  The staff there was super friendly, and always recognized the regulars.

Was glad they had a policy allowing brushes\/dealers on dead tables to hop in games to get them going, plus they never just folded around.

Nice and convenient, next to the parking garage, and the decor is nice and swanky.

I feel the other reviewers harshing on the felt quality... and it only got worse once they started putting the promotional felts down, but you could get used to it.

They always did a great job of listening to the player, and their involvement on 2+2 allowed them to get great community feedback and immediately implement it in the room, like the trash talk tuesdays etc.

We booked the Hard Rock Hotel because we are coming into town for the Police Baker to Vegas race, and that's were Downey PD is all staying. If the hotel is anything like the ladies who answer the phone and the room reservation operators are it's going to be a great place. So many times people behind the phone are unfriendly, but so far so good. GREAT customer service so far!!!

I really enjoyed my trip to the hard rock. I stayed in the casino tower and my bed was super comfy. Idk what the aroma is that they have in the hotel but God I'd love to have this scent. It gives such a relaxing smell in the casino where most hotels can smell like cigarettes. It's like a vanilla jasmine smell so if any worker can tell me the name of that scent I'd be really happy. My only gripe is getting there at 3 and my room not being ready till 5:30pm. After a six hour flight I was exhausted and just ready for my bed.  Upon checkout my flight wasn't until night so they held my luggage in a locked room for hours free of charge which I thought was awesome. Overall I had a great experience and will stay again.  Please get me the name of that smell

I reserved my room in Expedia and stayed Tuesday and Wednesday. Expect to be in the Casino tower unless you allow them to up-sell at an additional $60 per night to the HRH tower--doubling the rate. I've stayed in both, and the Casino tower isn't nearly as nice. With regard to my room, the wifi never worked, the bath sink was clogged, and HBO was garbled and unwatchable. The coffee shop on the first floor is a joke as I paid $7 for two plain coffees.  The espresso machine didn't work (am 19 March 2015).  On the bright side, I like the rock theme and casino decor and the parking is free. I'll look at other hotels next time I'm in Vegas.

When my beloved Texas Longhorns were playing the Mobilehoma Sooners a few years back, the press had decided that OU would beat my team.  As victory was apparent for the Longhorns in the 4th quarter, those of us in the burnt orange and white were able to cheer "OVERRATED.....OVERRATED".  That is pretty much what I want to do every time I walk into the Hard Rock.  

I enjoy partying in Vegas just as much as the next person, but everytime I go to the Hard Rock, it gets a little more thuggish and a little less tolerable.  Last time I played craps, I was the only one playing while everyone else was playing the Field.  Ugh, nothing worse than Field betters.  Anyway, for my trendy, fun, young hotel experience, I would pick the Palms anyday.  We are officially finished with the Hard Rock.

We nabbed a great deal for a suite at the Hard Rock, as in $89 per night for a King Suite, fully equipped with discounts on spa, drinks and gaming...I figured, hey when in Vegas.. do as the Vegans do, and roll the dice..

Luckily, our suite was in HRH Tower and unluckily, our cabbie on the way over didn't care so he dropped us off at the main lobby.. big bummer, I thought as I shuffled into a line of about 50 other people and no offenses to anyone.. but do you really need to bring your crying 2 year old and 12 pack of Bud Light to the Vegas Strip??! Did you really think that the booty shorts with cellulite combo was an awesome look this morning when you rolled out of bed, or was it still dark? Yeah, the long line was a bummer and I thought for sure this hotel stay was going to be a disaster, especially when the front desk clerk tried to put me in a double queen room.. or have the option in staying in a smoking King suite room.. I took the smoking room and asked for a credit, which she eagerly agreed to. 

Sweet suite! The room was nice and roomy and the bathroom was sleek and modern; large tub, large glass shower with double shower heads and a double sink. It seems like they recently remodeled the HRH Towers and they did a great job with the rooms. The views were nice and the feel of the room was subdued rocker.. The room did smell like fresh ganga, but hey it's Vegas; at least there wasn't a dead hooker under my bed or something. 

Aside from the room, the casino was a little lackluster and it seemed that most people were staying in their rooms and slugging back the 12 packs they brought along with them.. There were some booty shaking girls hanging on poles in the casino, so that was nice if you are a guy...Im not, so I opted to go elsewhere to drink and dine...and roll dice.

Overall, not a bad stay and I liked the room and for the price it was a great value.. The downer for me was the small casino and lack of night life or any life at all.. the food was very mediocre.. but the spa services were great.

My husband and I have been coming to this hotel since 2012 and I am sad that I have to give this hotel three stars. 

My husband and I used to adore this hotel, restaurants, the people that work here and the ambience that this hotel used to have.

I have noticed a huge decline in the customer service. The quality of the employees that work here is simply horrendous. When you go to eat in the restaurant at the hard rock hotel the staff that works in the restaurants, don't make you feel welcomed. They seemed to be burden by the guests that come there,  they seem unhappy that they have to serve you. The bartenders and the hostess have nothing but attitudes and they have no problem expressing it right to your face because they will give you strange looks and roll their eyes are you right in your face lol ) . 

 my husband are extremely friendly and out going we like to carry friendly conversations with bartenders or waitresses or servers and the fact that it was very rare to even come across an employee that made you feel welcome to be at the hard rock was extremely disappointing. 

The hard rock hotel really needs to look into hiring a better quality staff, or look into people that are huge in hospitality. 

I'm not trying to be funny, sadly I think the cleaning lady that cleaned our room during our stay was the most friendliest person we have come across in this establishment.

The hard rock hotel used to be one of my favorite places to stay while visiting Vegas I'm honestly heartbroken to even admit that now I will be definitely looking into a different hotel to stay the next time I come to Vegas.

We've been to Vegas several times before, but this is the first time staying here. The reason they're receiving only one star is that upon checkout they added a $24.64 charge PER DAY resort fee. I know this may be a common (shady) practice on and near the strip in Vegas, but I've since found out that the Hard Rock in particular is known for burying this fee: www.travelandleisure.com\/travel-blog\/carry-on\/topic\/news\/trip-doctor-what-is-a-resort-fee-and-do-i-really-have-to-pay-it

When checking out, it was the first time I was told I had to pay this fee. They said that I had signed for it at check in (it's at the bottom of the fine print you have to scroll down and it's near the end beneath where where you sign your name on the credit card machine,) it's in the fine print on their website, and it's in the sleeve that holds the key cards. They also said its part of the script upon checking in, but all they mentioned was that there'd be a $50 per day hold against room incidentals. 

The resort fee is a way for hotels to publish low room rates, but then tack on an extra 20-30% or more. 

It's sad that we ended an otherwise enjoyable trip to have the last few coins wrung out of us. Very short sighted, as those will be the last few coins you'll see from us, Hard Rock.

This hotel has certain qualifications that would elevate its status, if you're particularly into the scene, but over all, it gets three stars.

The Hard Rock was originally a joint venture between Peter Morton (founder of the Hard Rock Cafes) and Harvey's Casino in Lake Tahoe (itself later bought out by Harrah's Entertainment), opening in 1995.  I started staying at the Hard Rock right after it opened, and have stayed there dozens of times.  Just two years later, in 1997, Harvey's sold its stake to Morton, who became the sole owner.

The original Hard Rock featured only 340 rooms, and maintains a still small by Vegas standards (30,000 square feet) casino.  For all its high energy rock music and lively crowd (it has gone back and forth, trading places with casinos on the Strip and also with the Palms, for being "the" hot spot for the young, hip crowd), the Hard Rock's casino is not the greatest.  The rules on their blackjack give the house an undue advantage, and they limit most players to a $5000. max on most games (I was allowed to bet $10,000. due to my high credit line).  As well, especially during the Peter Morton years (he sold his stake in 2006 to Morgans Hotel Group), the casino really sweated any high end players (or any players at all), who they thought might be counting cards or were winning too much for any reason.  At the Hard Rock, look for constant shuffling by dealers if they think someone is being too lucky at any card game.  After a certain celebrity at the casino was tipping out too much at the table games (dealer tipped money goes out of reach of the casino for good), Morton implemented a paltry "$25. maximum tip per hand rule" to keep money on the table and within the casino's greedy grasp.  That sort of hard line rule to keep the money with the casino is representative of how things are at the Hard Rock -
they absolutely don't want you to take much money, if any, home.  There really aren't too many tables of anything running at the same time (and only one Baccarat table), so your choices are limited to switching tables if one starts running badly for you, which is detrimental to serious gamblers.  All that said - when the Hard Rock is packed, it provides a fabulous casino atmosphere of scantily clad hipster or wannabee hipster females, and cocktail waitresses, that presents a high energy, trendy crowd.  But on a Sunday when few are in the casino and everyone is losing, the circular casino resembles, in many ways, a dark bus depot.

As far as comps, you will get more for your gambling money here than at the highest end Strip casinos, but less than at the downtown casinos.

Until Morton remodeled the suites, and later owners added the Paradise and HRH Towers, the suites were only so so, as far as luxury.  While all suites included a great sound system, the bathroom floors were linoleum and the showers not even marble until about 1999, when everything started getting more like in the Vegas strip suites.  Nowadays the all suite HRH Tower, and Paradise Tower, are nice.

If you do stay at the Hard Rock, whatever room you get, especially in the original Casino Tower, get a room POOL SIDE because these both include balconies and are slightly larger than the rooms not facing the pool. 

The Hard Rock does have a nice spa \/ weight room, that includes some free weights, and a great steam room.  The pool is great too, with cabanas, and a weekend (Fri, Sat, Sun, during all but winter months) event called "Rehab" for people to relax, swim, gamble pool side, take in the bikini clad girls and in general recover ("Rehab") from the night before.  You can get into all of these, the spa, and Rehab, free if you gamble enough, but otherwise everything costs extra at the Hard Rock.

The Joint features some top bands, and is a close up intimate venue. Again, all free if you're a gambler, tickets available for most events for anyone else. I've seen bands like the Rolling Stones, Offspring, Lenny Kravitz, and many others there.  I was at the casino in 2002 for The Who, but the show was cancelled when John Entwhistle died, in Room 658, a suite in which I have stayed several times.

The Hard Rock does not utilize the usual stretch limos to drive around their VIPs, but rather purple Cadillac Escalades.

Some of the great restaurants at the Hard Rock, such as AJ's Steakhouse (very old school, Rat Pack era style), and Ago, are closed, but the Pink Taco (started by Peter Morton's son, Harry), and Nobu are there, and are good.  The late night Mr. Lucky's is not bad at all for an all night place.

You may buy Hard Rock memorabilia at their Hard Rock Store.

Basically, you go to the Hard Rock to have fun and relax.  It is not a serious gambling casino, so don't try to break the house there because more likely - it will break YOUR bank.  Nor is it ultra luxury, but if the rock and roll vibe appeals to you, it's definitely worth a try, and after staying once or twice you will know whether this place is for you, or not.

First time staying here and I was impressed.

Price- We got comped rooms here so I'm not sure how pricey it is generally. 

Service-  Excellent.   Even the pit boss and dealers were very friendly.  We had ordered food at the Circle Bar.  They lagged a bit getting us our food and ending up comping our food and a round of drinks.  

Mr. Lucky's-  Not the greatest, but always open. 

Location-  Off the strip but a cab ride was a mere $9 with tip.  Most of the time, we spent gambling\/drinking here anyways.

Casino\/Crowd-  $5 tables for black jack and craps during the day.  $10 is the cheapest I saw at night.  Music gets very loud at night where you have to yell to be heard.  However, the music selection is pretty good. Varies in age, but very hip and energized.

Rooms-  Guest room with a view of... Not sure what it was because of the construction.  Construction starts Mon-Sat early in the morning.  I heard they are building more towers and another pool.   At night, someone checks your room key at entrance.  Rooms are very spacious, flat screen tv, Bose system (no ipod player though), modern furniture, plush towels and sheets, fluffy pillows and comfy beds, fully stocked mini bar, and Gilchrist and Soames toiletries.

Sports Bar-  Horrible.  Incredibly small and little seating.  Go to Mandalay instead.

Pool- Closed when we were there.

Really on the fence about giving this place 3 or 4 stars.  I've stayed here multiple times, in every type of room and for me it's pretty comfortable.   I usually prefer to stay here rather than Vdara or one of the on-strip hotels, but only because I always have a car.  I've had mixed experiences with the staff & service.  I've never had anyone give me a comped upgrade even on a Monday when it's dead.  

THE GOOD:

~ Comfy beds in every room, no matter which room you choose
~ Contemporary, large, nice looking rooms & hotel
~ Gorgeous pool area with multiple pools and a huge "beach"
~ Fun crowd, not many kids or elderly people

THE BAD:

~ Off strip location
~ Daily Service Fee really adds up ($25ish per night + taxes)
~ Not a big fan of the restaurants, but the pink taco was good enough
~ Weird pool rules and restricted areas that I never really understood
~ Check in and check out can take some time 

Overall, if I get a good deal on the room, I will stay here.  Otherwise, probably not.

More Details....

----ROOMS----
All of the rooms are nice, but the HRH tower rooms are the nicest except for the luxury\/specialty suites.  I've stayed in every tower and there is something to appreciate about each one.  The casino tower has doors you can open, if you like fresh air.  The bathrooms are older but the room size is very nice and contemporary in style.  The paradise tower has gorgeous pool views and a very fresh feel with a more modern bathroom.  The elevators are great and super fast.

-----POOL-------
The pool area is massive with lots of places to go.  I've never really understood the rules or how it works with all the different closed sections so I just make my way around and pick a spot I like.  Last time I got a cabana and it was really lovely, but BEWARE, the prices on the menu are very high!  I had 3 glasses of wine and 3 buckets (5 each) of beer and the bill was $200.  Also, the gratuity is included so be careful not to tip twice when you're to wasted to notice.  

------FOOD------
There are several restaurants with different styles and price points.  
35 Steaks- Very disappointed.  I ate here several times and never loved it.
Mr. Lucky's- Had breakfast here.  Wasn't impressed, but it did the job.
Pink Taco- Much better than expected.  I was not impressed with the 99 cent tacos or margarita's (pure sugar) but the regular menu was great.
Nobu- Japanese Cuisine, never ate there

-----CASINO---------
The casino is filled with everything you could want for.  I like it!  All tables and games are offered.

~~~NOTE~~~

One thing I would like to make a note on is that room cleanliness is VERY IMPORTANT!  I have read several reviews on here about the lack of cleanliness in these rooms.  I never noticed anything obnoxious enough to mention, the rooms always looked fine to me.  But I would strongly encourage management to make this a TOP PRIORITY~!

I have stayed at this hotel several times and have had an issue each time.  My latest stay was less than two weeks ago.  I was attending an event, and a friend ended up crashing in my room.  She was not added to the room as an authorized guest.  The second key stopped working while I was off the property and the hotel just issued her a new key with only verification of my cell number (if they had my cell number, one would think they would just call and ask if it was okay).  Emails to management about this have gone unreturned.  I didn't bother to mention it to front desk staff, as they had little interest in addressing other issues I've had there in the past.  It is most unfortunate for the annual event I attend, as I will not be returning next year, because this hotel is the absolute worst.  I feel like handing someone a key to my room is akin to giving them my ATM pin.  It was a complete violation and their lack of response is forcing me to complain on social media, which only infuriates me more.

This place has went to the dumps. Was there on fight weekend for Canelo vs Triple G. Went to the bar in the front and was surrounded by prostitutes just lurking everywhere. Horrible. Felt so uncomfortable.

The hotel is okay, however too far off the strip. Also you can only play with the room card on the slot machines. No cash.
They charge 22.5usd fantasy fee (resort fee), which is absolutely worth nothing ("the front desk can order you a cab \/ limousine service to the airport" - this should be standard at any hotel).

The fee negates the cheap offers from booking.com. The receptions excuse for everything: "well, that's Vegas".
 If I would come back to Vegas I would book a hotel directly at the strip.

I love the Hard Rock, it has the best pool for partying. No kids, just adults and good music. Good mix up girls and guys.

The nicest unpretentious place in Vegas.

Rooms are modern, clean, and big.

One of the best places that you can spend New Years Eve in Las Vegas, which is exactly where we (as locals at  the time) decided to spend our N.Y.E. in 2014.  The atmosphere was amazing, the drinks were flowing a plenty and didn't skimp on the alcohol at all like some bars like to do (although i think that had to do partly with the fact that the poor bartenders were overwhelmed as the night drew closer to the grand finale of midnight) . 

We gambled, we drank, we people watched.  Time seemed to go by pretty fast here.  Lots to look at in the casino area alone from all the memorabilia they have even when you aren't gambling. Very friendly staff as well, no one made us feel as though we had to tone anything down, obviously as long as we weren't ruining the vibe for every one else.

When the time for midnight drew near we made our way to the top level of the parking garage as did a lot of other people.  This in my opinion is the BEST spot to view all the fireworks that the strip has to offer!  You could see every single strip casino's fireworks from the top floor of that parking garage. Much better than the previous year of spending N.Y.E. on the strip where you are packed like sardines and basically rubbing your whole body against complete strangers........with no bathrooms in sight (since the casinos on the strip close their doors for about a half hour before and a half hour after midnight if i remember right)

  If we are ever in Las Vegas on N.Y.E. again, we will definitely  be spending it at Hard Rock Hotel and Casino! Best N.Y.E. EVER!!!!!!!

We seriously left this hotel ONCE in 3 days. There was no need to go elsewhere. Hard Rock has it all: great restaurants (I ate at all of them...fantastic), awesome rooms\/bathrooms\/beds, non-stop party, best pool in Vegas, hot people, great music\/things to look at, the list goes on and on. The place is ALWAYS packed whether it be 4am or 2pm. I loved every minute of it, THIS is the place to do it all in Vegas (Trust me, this was my 8th trip!)!

When staying at the Hard Rock don't expect to get any sleep. If it isn't the all day pool party with window rattling music, marshmallow soft mattress it's the rude immature guests partying in their rooms until sunrise. It's no wonder everyone looks like a zombie...no one is sleeping!

Hard rock is overly frugal with accessories as well,one bar of soap for both the shower and vanity. Not a pen or letterhead to be found either. The once acclaimed high tech accessories are as dated as the NASA moon missions. No HD on my vintage flat screen. Oh and cocaine residue the cleaning staff overlooked..geez.

The casino area is lean on eating establishments... unless you want to wait in line for the latest fad food.

I chose the Hard Rock this time around for the value. After this experience I'd rather pay double at a flea bag for a decent nights sleep.

The HRH tower is worth the extra! Stayed Thursday-Saturday. Upon checking in we were notified that our friends room (king suite) got down graded to a room with 2 queen beds. We showed the attendant the reservation, and she was quick to point out the fine print that any reservation is a "preference." Myself, never having heard of  paying additional for a suite and being downgraded I expressed my disappointment. With an attitude the attendant asked me "what do you want me to do?" Luckily a manager was available, and he offered to "move around some reservations." Although the rooms weren't readily available to us, we were told to come back at 3:30. We were told this was the check in time, despite 3:00 listed on their website and in the reservation. Also, if you need to check in your bags, know the bell desk will not check in any coolers. I brought a soft case cooler with me with some drinks and snacks and had to lug it around until our room was ready.

Overall once we checked in we had a average experience. The year round pool was open, and heated. Restaurants Pink Taco, and Culinary Dropout were really enjoyable, affordable by Vegas standards, and it was nice to have good food options and not have to leave the hotel. The memorabilia throughout the grounds are with the stay. I recommend grabbing a cocktail, and taking a lap. If you do hit the strip, its a short cab ride, under $8.00.

Check out was easy, staff (with the exception of the front desk) were friendly. Avoid getting an wakeup call, ours never called us. Good thing we didn't have a flight to catch!

Bottom line- you get what you pay for. This place is a good option if you have champagne taste on a beer budget.

This is my third visit to Las Vegas and the farthest I have stayed off the strip. The entire hotel is a giant smoking section, which is normal for Vegas. But I have never seen people smoke directly out of their rooms. Also all the lamps in our room where unplugged and the phones didn't work. So we had to go down to front desk to ask for more towels and request our phones be fixed, as all 3 of them did not work. The tv in the living area had a DVD player attached, but the tv switched to the hotel channel every 2 minutes. I was tv savvy enough to move the chords around so we could watch a movie using the player provided, but others won't be. All in all it was not the worst room I stayed at, but for what they are charging it's worth staying somewhere else.

Stayed here for a quick getaway after our daughter's wedding. In short, very overpriced especially for a resort that is under a massive facelift! Got in late so we were really tired.

First room we stayed in was atrociously bad! Rips in old sprained and dirty carpet. Broken lamps, non working phone, broken and non working faucet in bathroom, torn and stained curtains, broken down and uncomfortable mattress, really old pillows and much worse! This is the worst hotel room I have ever stayed in.

Complained the next morning and talked to a manager. We were moved to a remodeled room. Much better. Really nice renovation job. I recommended to the manager to stop customers staying in the old dilapidated rooms. The old rooms give this place a very bad reputation!

Next, the restaurants. So overpriced! Even the coffee shop was so overpriced! Bacon, eggs, toast and hash brown potatoes for $12! Ridiculous! The steak house was much worse! $139 for a steak alone! Side dishes were extra! 

Won't stay here again even after they moved us to a better room!

First time at this hotel and I won't stay again.  The week day was not busy at all and I got a room with the road just below me for nice noisy traffic.  So I asked for a better room and they gave me a room looking straight out into the parking garage.  

I was tired and to get to the room was a major hike, so I stayed in it but after 2 nights I couldn't take it and left.  

How do they justify giving, on the 2nd try, a worst room than the first when the hotel was half empty.  They said it was because of my room grade, whatever that means.  It was a standard room with 2 queen beds.  They probably had hundreds of rooms available like that but they decided to give me a room with this lousy view.

Plus the room had broken fixtures, worn furniture, and too soft lumpy beds. And I love turning on the shower.  You have to stand in the stream, which will  come out cold first.  That will wake you up.

I will not stay here again.  Good luck to you if you do.

Ugh, do not stay here if you want to do anything on the strip. I booked this hotel for my first trip to Las Vegas. I ended up leaving after one night and going to Paris Las Vegas. It is literally a mile from the Strip. In the 24 hours I was staying at HR, we spent close to $75 on taxis and uber rides. They said they had a shuttle when I made the booking, a shuttle that was SUPPOSED to run late and make frequent trips to and from Las Vegas Blvd. Well turns out, the hotel shuttle picks up once an hour, and runs 10am-5pm. Completely useless! We had a junior suite in the HR Tower. It was nice room and the bedding was very comfortable. One little perk in the room, you can play your music through their built in system. If you want to go to their Rehab Pool Party, I would recommend staying at another hotel on the strip and grabbing a taxi.

Wow, well this last time we stayed in the tower and had a queen suite here that was pretty cool.  There were several things I absolutely loved about this suite compared to others.   First off their beds are invitingly comfortable.  The living room area was pretty functional, and could be closed off from the rest of the area.  Loved their wall controlled sound system, and the tower seems so much quieter than the rest of the hotel in general, which meant I had a great nights sleep. But the best thing is the washroom area, which was very spacious. I loved the shower and the over sized soaker tub.  There was so much space in the entire bathroom area, it made getting ready very easy.  I loved that the washroom wall was glass and if you wanted more privacy you could just pull the curtain.  Very much enjoyed my stay here.  The layout of these suites was very resourceful and felt spacious.

In the zoo that is Vegas, this place is terrific. The rooms are so cool...spacious and sleek and just plain cool.  The deep jacuzzi tub and the rain showerhead were  a nice touch, as were the bathessential products. 

Located off the strip I could still see the sunrise over the desert mountains from the room. The casino was cool wih excellent music blaring all over the hotel. That and the usual rock star paraphanalia (the Johnny Cash display was really cool) makes this place a nice place to crash if you are in Vegas, and the rates are really really reasonable considering the size of the room. The Pink Taco is their signature Mexican restaurant, and folks come over form other resorts to eat there. Maybe its the name, right?

The 24 hour room service menu will satisfy anyone, and they have a great menu called "The Morning After", loaded full of hangover fixes.
There is loads of nightlife here, Body English nightclub and more. I might add that I hate Vegas (was here for family reasons) and hate the casinos, so my review is based on the Hotel, and the room and the food.

If you ain' into the rock scene, go for the room. Great space.

Worst hotel I've stayed in in Vegas (I've stayed in a lot).  When we checked in at 11 p.m., they told us our room was not available.  How is that possible?  Check-in starts at 3 p.m.  After waiting 45 minutes, they finally gave us the keys to our room.  When we get to our room and open the door, there is a man without a shirt on in the bed.  They gave us the key to someone else's room!  That wasn't even the worst part.  While leaving our room at about 9 a.m. the second morning we were there, we walked outside and it smelled like feces.  That was because there was a passed-out homeless man who had SHIT HIS PANTS right outside our door.  We notified the staff about this when we got downstairs, and they seemed pretty nonchalant about it, as if it was a common occurrence.

Don't ruin your vegas trip - spring for a nice hotel, don't stay at the Hard Rock.

I went to a party in their King Suite a few months ago and it was amazing! The backyard has a beautiful area to sit, a fire place, and a TV. You can also leave the backyard area and walk to the pool which is very close by. The inside of the room was amazing and the bathroom was huge! I like that the living room section was in a different section than the bedroom area. Since there's no real wall though, you can see someone in the bedroom area through the glass ceiling. Sometimes that can be.. An awkward thing. I love the inside of this hotel as well. It's just beautiful and really cool for musicians! They have multiple different pools so it was cool to have the different options.

Stayed here a second time to attend a conference because the room was comp'ed. OMG , why did I not learn my lesson the first time around?! The service has gone down the toilet. They blast music by the pool all day long, planes fly by starting from 6am in the morning, the toilet didn't flush, the tv in my room couldn't turn off (had to call maintenance), nobody ever answers the phone at the front desk, I get a call at 3:30am (some dumb ass prostitute prolly dialed the wrong room number)... I've had a better experience staying at motel 6. For the crappy location, they don't make up for it in any way. All the conference attendees told me the casino here is a black hole. Nobody wins. Oh wells, nobody to blame here but myself.. Will stick to staying on the strip next time!

This review is long overdue. We stayed at the Hard Rock for my girl's bachelorette party back in July. Thinking about the wristbands to Rehab that come with staying at their hotel, we all figured this place would be more than accommodating to our group of girls.   

Unfortunately they were the extreme opposite of that. We reserved 2 joining suites, however one wasn't ready and cleaned until the following morning after we checked in!!! (WTF?!)  Can you imagine 10 girls in one suite overnight????!!!

As if that wasn't bad enough, they freakin' still charged us for that suite stating that they had offered us an available suite on a different floor. "Ok.. great, but that's NOT what we reserved a**holes!"  

And then management tried to redeem themselves by offering us one more wristband to Rehab.. but what good is that when we already had enough for our group..? (Of course we took that wristband anyway and sold it.. = P )

Anyhow, to sum it all up the customer service was extremely poor at this property.  Their front desk people didn't seem to know what they were doing!  Management handled our room dilemma with zero consideration of our bachelorette party plans.  The female manager insinuated that we were just trying to get out of paying for a one night stay.  She was full of it... not realizing we were ready and willing to drop some serious loot at their property.  Big mistake... 

It was evident that they devalue their guests simply because their business flourishes for being "Hard Rock", a world renowned name.  I plead with you all... NEVER stay at the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino in Las Vegas.  There are plenty of beautiful properties in Vegas with way higher and exceptional customer service.  

1 Star = for giving us a place to shower & get dolled up...

I've stayed at the hard Rock hotel twice, and both times we had an absolute blast.  I wouldn't recommend this hotel to people who aren't looking to party; the crowd is younger and generally more of a drunken spectacle. The reason we stayed here was for the pool scene, which is the best in Vegas in my opinion. We went to rehab on one of the visits,  and while it was fun, it was overrated.  You can have just as much fun at one of their regular pools on the premises.

First time staying here. I thought it was really great. There are a lot of negative comments about cleanliness, location, service, wifi..I didn't have these problems really. Not everything can be on the strip, and there is a shuttle. Most casino hotels here have a tired feeling, some more than others. I didn't think HRH was that bad. I had two rooms, and both were clean. Beds are amazing! No problems with wifi. The speed was great. Service is a bit weird. Some front desk people definitely need to learn to smile. HR makes a point to have peppy, easy going people and some staff definitely lacked that but not all. I stayed in the HRH tower (Harmon) and the service desk down below (not registration) had no long lines. Love the toiletries too. I'd stay here again, though I might not make a point about it. I was here on business and I like to try a new one if possible. HRH is definitely better than NYNY. Only downside - I had my 9 month old so I needed a place for a bottle. I took two items out of the fridge for it and learned later that under no circumstance can I be refunded, and a fridge was $20 a day. Really? For babies I can't get refunded? Oh well. Lesson learned. If she is with me again I won't be staying here.

My dark lords and masters occasionally put me up here. It's not a bad location, there's a bit to do and eat and see in the area. The pool is a destination in and of itself, and you never know what sort of improbable heels and barely covered bodies you'll see in the casino areas. Usually they're worth looking at, and won't require mental health assistance to recover from. 

The front desk staff are effective and friendly, although it can be hard to hear them over the loud music and casino noise. My last visit brought a free upgrade to a 2Q suite, which made it a much more enjoyable stay. The line can move slowly when it's crowded, especially when you're in line behind  people who have never checked into a hotel or used a credit card before. 

Speaking of which, the difference between the Casino Tower and the HRH Tower is night and day. Loved the huge bathroom with separate two-person tub and huge shower. Plenty of room to spread out, an iPod dock with touchscreen in the wall, two TVs, and pretty good wired and wireless Internet access. 

The room I had in the Casino Tower last year was okay, but felt a bit dark by comparison. 

On the downside, there's no in-room coffee (although you can get a small pot brought to your room for about $6 + $3 fee + 21% gratuity + 8% tax). The minibar and snack tray have sensors in them so if you pick up an item (i.e. to see what's in it, or what it costs), you get charged for it. I was warned in advance so I didn't have this problem, and I'm told the front desk can clear up accidental charges for the $25 two-condom pack. 

I only got refreshments at the coffee shop (Fuel, I guess) last time, but my most recent visit involved two breakfasts at Lucky's 24\/7, the (obviously) always-open diner. If you're alone, they suggest you sit at the counter, and service is intermittent. You'll eventually get served but it felt like I was in the way, although politely so. The coffee was mediocre at best, although the chocolate chip pancakes were very good. 

If you drive, the parking is copious and pretty easy to get around in. Note that parking in your tower's garage is going to be more convenient than just getting the first spot you can find. I parked one day in the Paradise structure and had to cross the whole hotel to get to my room in HRH. On the other hand, first day I parked in HRH and had to cross the whole hotel to get to registration. 

My work hotel choice is usually based on what's available at corporate rate when I book, so while I prefer our other hotel for non-upgraded rooms, I won't feel too bad about staying here, and I'll just try to get there early in the week and hope for a free upgrade.

I stayed at Hard Rock hotel to celebrate my brother's 21st birthday with my family. The rooms we stayed in were nicely remodeled, but our bathtub and sink were broken. Every time someone took a shower or washed their hands, the tub and sink got clogged and water took a long time to drown. Not to mention,we first came in to our room and the bathtub was already dirty. The hotel didn't even clean it. The soap was unused and unwrapped. Cleanliness was not a priority. We called twice to have it fixed and no one came to fix it. Also, we tried to call for help several times and no one answered the phone. As a hotel, they should ALWAYS have someone handling the phones. The customer service was horrible. When we finally got lucky and someone picked up, the ladies on the phone were rude with attitude. Exceptional customer service should be mandatory! If customers are extremely polite, there is NO reason to have attitude when answering a request. For a positive note, the pizza place in the casino was tasty and like mentioned earlier, the remodeled rooms looked great. I've stayed at many hotels in Vegas, including Planet Hollywood, Elara, Palazzo, Circus Circus, etc, and I've NEVER experienced such horrible customer service from any hotels except Hard Rock. Two stars.

So-so experience... We checked in and they offered to upgrade is for an extra fee per night. Ok fine, but then discovered in our room the phone didn't work, the lamp was broken and the clock was missing from the room. I was able to get it all fixed, but without apology or some sort of incentive for our inconvenience - this is Vegas, right?!?  So I was a bit disappointed by that and we had to pay for an upgraded room that was not that great. The room needed to be vacuumed in the worst way and it was looking a bit shabby - it needed a little TLC. Would rather pay a bit more to stay on the strip.

I never gave this place a review after $2,000 dollars worth of property was stolen from my locked bedroom after room service entered during a 15 minute window of me getting coffee from the lobby. 

My property, nor reimbursements\/comps were ever issued and I was answered with "there are no cameras" from upper management after a two week long investigation. I even had a police officer tell me that this type of incident isn't uncommon. What does that tell you?

I have such strong disgust with this hotel's lack of integrity and professionalism that I would gladly pay the difference in costs for my friends to NOT stay here. The physical filth on the property isn't the only thing that's horrible about this location.

Its been awhile since I've been to the Hard Rock. They've made a lot of changes. The place looks great and there's even more options now. I had some friends (and their kids) come into town and we were at the pool, which is still awesome!  The service was excellent! All the staff we dealt with were friendly and were having fun, which made our time out there even better. I would especially like to thank Bryce Willis and Marc Hunter, they took great care of us, kids and all.
it's better than the one in San diego...or shall i say...it's just bigger. Would i STAY here again?? probably not...i'd just go for REHAB.

I visited this hotel for an event and stayed in one of their rooms with my family. I reserved a suite for my family and when we got to the room it was a regular small 2 bed room. No fridge no hair dryer (good thing I brought my own). I had to ask for everything. When I called the front desk the lady said " the person who checked you in should've told you we ran out of suites. We will comp you with 100 dollar food credit"   We hardly ate there because the restaurants were not kid friendly or that good with the food. Pink taco was ok at best. I'm so disappointed. I am planning another trip her in November and I will not book here again. Not good customer service. Event was excellent

Worst hotel I've ever stayed in!!!! DONT GO HERE!!!! staff is obnoxious and unhelpful, made us wait hours to check in. Treats you as if you're staying at a motel 6 if you haven't upgraded to the most exspensive tower. When we finally(6+ hours later) checked into our room, it smelled like shit and there were BEER bottle caps on the floor from the last tenants. Not to mention you only get one day of free wifi. Very disappointed, and will never ever stay here agin.

This is my favorite place to stay in Vegas. Here's my main reason- the beds. They have down mattress toppers, lush pillows, and the smoothest sheets ever. I felt like I was at home! The room service is always great, the room we got was $200 for 2 nights (STEAL) and it was really nicely decorated with a plasma to boot. I hate staying in rooms in Vegas that look like they're from the 70's. Won't name any names. But it's honestly refreshing staying somewhere hip and fun. I love the fact that Pink Taco and Center Bar are just downstairs and the crowd is always young, no 80 year olds playing slots that I saw at least, people that I wouldn't mind seeing when I'm getting back to the room at the wee hours in the morning looking like I need a week of sleep. Let's just leave it at that ;)

We stayed here for three nights and got upgraded to a room in the Paradise tower. There was nothing to actually complain about but there are a few things worth noting:

The hotel is not on the strip and getting a cab will set you back 10 bucks each way. The shuttle only drops you off at the north end of the strip, a bit of a walk away from all the action. And the shuttle only runs during the day until 5pm on top of every hour.

The walk to your room from the lobby to the Paradise tower is quite long.

Facing the pool area, the room does get a lot of exposure to the music that plays during the day until the evening. Not good for people who want to get some sleep during the day after a long night out.

No fridge in the room, you are explicitly told not to remove any items from the mini bar to store your own stuff.

Our room smelled of weed when we checked in. People smoke inside the hotel a lot, this may be offputting to some.

I found that the reception was understaffed at busy times.

Well we decide to give the place another try and this time was not as good as last time.  Booked the room two months in advance and when we showed up they told me it would be at least an extra hour to get a room unless we wanted to take a smoking room. Since I'm not that picky about the smoking room I begrudgingly took the room.  We booked a Poolview Paradise Tower room which is what they gave us... Sort of... More like a parking lot view room and you could sort of see the pools off to the left. This alone was not a dealbreaker but all the other little things added up.  Here's a great idea...if you tell me a room is ready, make sure it is.  We got to the room and there were no toiletries to be found...had to go find a maid and ask for them.  Mirror lighting was broken and toilet had no pressure...had to request they fix these things while we dined out...btw I had to go downstairs to make this request because the phone was also broken.  Then there's the shower... They need to put some sort of sweep or gasket on the shower because it leaked all over the floor including onto my luggage in the sink area.  The tv didn't work too well either...sometimes the picture would get pixelated, and other times the sound would remain from the previous channel or the thing would just plain freeze up.  Now we get to the pool situation... One of the main reasons we stayed here was to take advantage of the rehab pool party, which they told us would be open during the days we were there... Wrong answer! It was open for the remainder of the Sunday we arrived, but not the other four days we were there after that. We ended up going to the pool which was all ages but not the other four days we were there after that. We ended up going to the pool which was all ages.  If I wanted to hang out with a bunch of children I would go stay at Circus Circus. Anyway we were a bit disappointed with HRH and I don't think we will be back.  You guys need to quit letting the place fall apart and quit over booking rooms so that people can get in on time... I'm sure if I just decided to stay an extra hour you would not like it, so don't waste my hour when I show up on time to check in. By the way the two stars are for Mr Lucky's because at least the food was good, but it's not enough to make me come back.

I'm happily to provide this hard rock with five-star The moment we stepped in we upgraded to the new towers which is called Paradise. I must say the HardRock is one of the best hotels I have stayed and I don't understand why this hotel is not considered 4 1\/2 or five stars. The first day we spent the day in the pools bypassing rehab for a little peace and quiet.  The hotel is loaded with artifacts from previous artst. On the low the hard rock in Vegas got my attention and I'll be back
First night here, it's 1:30am, and I have a maintenance guy in my room because the A\/C doesn't work.  Not a good start to my stay.  Not to mention, I have to be up in 5 hours for a conference.

This is my last night staying at the hard rock and I am deciding to write when emotions are fresh. 

What irritated me:
-we didn't receive maid service two days in a row. So we came back after a long day and no towels were to be found. Both days we left early in the morning. I called and complained and was offered no compensation or explanation. 

-one of our sinks busted all over the counter and got all over my makeup and products since there's no drawer. A nice maintenance guy fixed it while we were still in bed. I've never had something like this happen at a hotel and once again no apology or offer to make it up to us. 

-the cost of taxis is not worth it to stay here

-booked for the pool. Be aware rehab is only open a few days a week. There was no hot tub and we felt bombarded by children at the one pool that was open. It also closes very early in the afternoon. 

-cocktail service is an absolute joke. We got our drinks about 20% of the time even though it's not busy at all down there. We can blow our money elsewhere at that rate. 

The good
-love the memorabilia around here. If it wasn't so far from the strip I would say come to see it because it's like a free museum. 

-most lobby furniture is restoration hardware. Helps class the place up. 

Will I stay here again? No way. Will I recommend to my friends? Lol.

Have stayed here the past few times I was in town for a Vegas trip.  We stayed in the casino tower, and had a room that overlooked the pool and part of downtown.  I still like staying at the Hard Rock when I come to Vegas.  They even expanded a bit so there is a casino area with tables and slots next to Mr. Lucky's.  

CON's
Door Man at the Elevator - Make sure you have your door key with you, as this door man does not have a "list".  No key, so elevator ride to your room.
Valet - Gets filled on busy nights, but where isn't this a problem?

PRO's
Loud - The hallway in general can be loud, but since most of the people staying here are partying, I expect it.  Hell, I welcome it!
Beds - Very comfortable, I can always get a good nights sleep when I hit the sheets here
Pool View - Excellent view of the pool and strip.  We were on the 11th floor, which made for a great view
Gaming - This past time out, the limits on the tables weren't that bad.  I was actually stoked to see there were $5-10 tables available.  However, we only gambled in the wee hours of the morning and not the prime time hours.

We stayed at hard rock for an all girls trip this weekend. Hotel casino is nice and clean - doesn't reak of cigarettes or smoke which is awesome. 
It's a far walk through the hotel to get to your room tho- everything's super spread out. 
The rooms are decent\/nice. Not super fancy or up to date. There's no fridge, microwave or coffee maker. Boooo... and our ice machine never worked on the 14th floor. Annoying. We tried several times every day and it never had ice. 
Lame. But other than that not much complaints. Just wish the hotel had complimentary shuttles running to strip. 
Rehab pool party was great- gets packed, and was freaking hot! But the pool set up is cool. Played great music, good dancing. Biggest complaint is the ground gets waaaay too hot. The sand burns your feet. Ladies' do not come in heels.... you can't walk in those In sand!

My favorite place to gamble for sure. The staff is friendly and they keep a youthful, upbeat vibe going. Ridiculous fun and the dealers are helpful and maintain a great energy.
Great clubs and good food. I'm a fan of pink taco and eat here almost everytime I visit. Thank you sister for introducing me to one of my favorite places.
I will return again and again(as long as I'm winning).

Awesome rooms. Still not enough staff - resulting in late check-ins, having to wait for the room you paid for, room service taking forever etc. The rooms are amazing so I decided to try this place again even though last time I waited 3 hours for my room. I took a later flight and got to the hotel at 6pm. I figured by then I wouldn't get any of this "your room isn't ready yet" business. Surprise! "Your room isn't ready. If you want two queens in a smoking area we can give you that."  All I want is what I paid for: a king in a non-smoking. I have an allergy, the non-smoking is important. I said as much and that I had purposely arrived late to avoid this issue. Guy: "You can wait until a king is ready, it could be an hour or so." Seriously?! Me: "Is there ANY WAY I could avoid this in the future. I just want the room I paid for to be ready at a reasonable time when I arrive." Guy: "No. There isn't anything you can do. It happens sometimes." Me: "It happens every time. Last time I waited 3 hours." Guy: "We could put you in a queen tonight then you could move tomorrow." Me "No. I am not going to move rooms." Guy: "If you do that we could wave your resort fee for a night. I'm sorry but there aren't any Kings available at this time. Again, you could wait." Me: "I just need my room. The one I paid for."  Guy: " I could wave two nights of the resort fee?" At this point I again ask myself: WHY AM I HAVING TO NEGOTIATE FOR A ROOM I RESERVED AND ALREADY PAID FOR?!?! And for the second time. This time I tried to arrive late. I would even pay more money, if they would let me, to not have to deal with this $#@!. What do I have to do to ACTUALLY reserve a room at this resort? Apparently booking and paying doesn't count. Eventually a room "popped up" once I said that I would wait and started making my way over to a couch. 
This morning I wanted room service: after being on hold for 15 minutes they told me it would take an hour. I tried to call the front desk with a question. I kept getting sent to the operator who kept transferring back. After 20 minutes of no one answering I gave up.

HIRE MORE STAFF. Clean your rooms in a reasonable amount of time. Have the room ready that people reserved and paid for. Find enough people to answer the phone.

The positives heavily outweigh the negatives.  In fact, there is only one negative -- the casino is very small, but ample enough to do damage.

But I have a hard (as a rock, get it?) time coming up with anything wrong, when so much is right.  Let me list the ways:

1.  First and last impression, valet, is terrific and quick.
2.  Check-in desk could be shorter, but they are as nice as pie, and helpful as nurses.
3.  Rooms are super nice, modern, and sexy.
4.  Price of room, midweek on Travelocity, was $32 (with a $22 resort fee).
5.  Room was quiet.
6.  Wi-Fi signal was strong, and access was easy.  The resort fee includes access.
7.  Wonderful restaurants and bars.  From Culinary Dropout, Pink Taco, and Mr. Lucky's (a 24 hour diner), and others.
8.  The Joint, is a deluxe music venue.  Great.
9.  Vinyl, is a more intimate venue.  Also great.
10.  The pool is as sexy as it gets.

While there is bound to be more I can expand upon, it's way worth it.

Our first visit! Check in only took about 20 minutes.  She was nice but tried to tell us we had booked run of the house and had two queens and we could get a king room for an extra $25!  I pulled out my booking form that showed a king form and a supervisor miraculously found one for us.  Turned out to be a nice corner room with a view of the strip!  Nice and spacious and the a\/c worked great.  Decor is dark,  as is the rest of the hotel.  No coffee maker and the minibar is on a senor -- be careful.  Being at the end of the hallway it was very quiet so we slept great!  The shower is tiled all in black so the bathroom is very dark.  All in all a very nice and comfortable room.  We did not eat in any of the restaurants because we had show tickets for another hotel that night.  Later we came back and the casino was pretty quiet.  We did enjoy the music they played and it was nice to see the celeb displays.  All in all, it was a great price and we'd be fine to come again.

I can't say much about the casino but my room was AMAZING.
