The by the third call it was already past mid night. We asked to speak to the bellhop manger. Hector told us our luggage was sent to the wrong room. We would have to wait for them to find our luggage and then it would be sent up. In the meantime my family member needed to take her medications due to health issues. We explained this to the HARDROCK staff and no one seemed to care or understand the importance of having misplaced luggage with medications. Finally our luggage arrived at two am , three hours after our initial check in. The bellhop was very apologetic.. Didn't catch his name though.  We called down and spoke to Christian a front desk manger. He said he would give comp our room for Thursday nights stay. He also said, he would give us a call Friday morning to see if there were any other accommodations he could do. He did not do so. We spent 2.5 hours being told we would get to speak to a manger . Finally around 3pm we spoke to two Risk Mangers. They said we were already compensated for and there was nothing else they can do. We mentioned we were placed on the fourth floor right next to Rehab . Which would have been fine if we would have got to bed at a decent hour after our ordeal with our luggage. We were told we could move to the 16th floor and the opposite side of the pool party. The female risk manager, asked if we were ready to move right now , we said yes but still waited 2 hours to get moved to our new room. When called to front desk to find out what was going on during that two hour period , we were treated poorly yet again. Finally the bellhop arrived and he was quite friendly and apologetic. 


Our second issue occurred at a in house dining restaurant at Mr. Lucy's 3\/26\/16. I ordered the $9.99 steak & egg special. The food quality was poor , the steak was like beef jerky and the toast was like cardboard. When I reported my issue with the quality of food , the waitress  proceeded to say well it is a $9.99 steak. The waitress said I could change my order. I ended up ordering bacon , another stale piece of toast, and over easy eggs that were very runny. Overall the food quality was very poor , so the waitress told me they would refund my comp card with $50 dollars . That did not happen. 

Third issue was with our room . The lights went out in the bathroom . The shower was very nice and had great water pressure , but the shower drain was clogged. We called and maintenance came right away to fix the issue. We then had to call and have house keeping disinfect the shower after a plunger was used. It took house keeping an hour and half to come up. Once there the house keeper went above to make sure the bathroom and room was cleaned up. 

Our friends also had issues with their stay.  They didn't have blankets on the bed , yes  I said blankets. They had to call housing keeping and were given fuzzy brown jail house style blankets. They also , didn't have a iron in the room. They called house keeping several times the day of their brothers wedding to retrieve a iron. 

Last but not least .. We wanted to use that $50.00 comp we were told that would be reimbursed from Mr. Lucky's. We went to Pink Taco on our last day at the HARDROCK 3\/28\/16. We were told by the waitress that their was only $3.00 left on our comp card. Embarrassed we got up and left. We tried to resolve this issue with the cashiers office. We were so fed up we just decided to leave take our business somewhere else. 

Overall I really wanted to like this place . The customer service skills are just not there. Like other reviewers have said..they really need to hire a hotel management company to come in a re-work their system. I wouldn't stay here again and definitely wouldn't recommend it to friends\/family .

We just stayed at the Hard Rock over Labor Day weekend. I love the scene at the Hard Rock. Loud music, young crowd etc. but I was so disappointed in our last stay. When I booked with them we asked for a pool view. Upon checking in the gave us a "mountain side" view. No mountains just the back of an ugly building and roof. We asked to be moved so they upgraded us to a pool side room. They did not inform us however this would be an additional $25 a night. I thought I had already booked a room with a pool view?!? We get to our new room and the view of the stage is amazing we are so excited, only to get changed to go party and notice puke all over the room (lamp shade, floor, even ceiling). They made us wait there for a housekeeping manager to come inspect it. She apologized, but didn't really care. They moved us for the 3rd time in an hour to the last room at the hall with no pool view again. It was so frustrating!! The manager told us she would give us a $50 food and drink comp and wave our resort fees. We said great, thank you!! Upon checkout there was no manager to be found and we had to fight with the checkout host to get about 10 random charges taken off of our bill. We were charged for Jack Daniels that apparently was set off by the motion detector, upgrading to different rooms, the resort fees and food and beverage that they said they would comp. We tried to explain to him what had happened, but he said because there was no manager he could only wave one resort fee. I find it hard to believe that there is not one manager in the building to speak with. We ended up paying a huge bill and I had to deal with the whole mess when we got back. The hotel is very fun, but the Hard Rock's level of customer service was disappointing. We came to have fun, spend money in their casino and any chance they got, they tried to rip us off upon checkout. As much as I enjoyed my stay the first time at the Hard Rock, we will not be going back again. What a headache!!

I am Currently a guest at the hard rock hotel.  One of the reasons we selected the hotel was the expedited access to the Rehab pool events.  Today, we find out that management has taken away this perquisite and there is no distinction or benefit of being a hotel guest and getting access to the rehab events.  In the words of the very articulate box office rep, hotel guest have access to Rehab 'not no mo...we took this away last Sunday..'  Needless to say, this is very disappointing.

Hard Rock for Cowboy Christmas was a good deal on Groupon.  I can't imagine staying here during the summer when the pool is open and the place is full of rockers. I love the memorabilia though!  The Pink Taco Restaurant was great too.  Large portions, good food and great atmosphere.  The wait staff was great too.  Great margaritas!  However, avoid the Nobu Sushi restaurant, it's a No Good!  Ridiculously priced for the lame sushi.  And the Russian waiter had such a bad attitude.  Yama Sushi on Flamingo is a way better deal, all you can eat for $24 and so worth it. Excellent sushi, fresh, everything you would expect and more.  Back to the Hard Rock, it's not that convenient to get around if you don't bring a car, but the valet is great if you do.  They always had our car ready before we got downstairs. Our room was nice, black, dark, but the bed was comfy.  I suppose the Hotel Staff was on a skeleton crew because we had to wait for everything.  All being said, I am glad we stayed there, love the music 24\/7 but there are so many places to stay in Vegas, I think we'll stay somewhere else next time.

I had a really good deal for this hotel. It actually wasn't terrible at all. The customer service here is great. Everyone is friendly. We got a room near the pool area and the music was loud, which we didn't mind at all. I was a little sad we were unable to get an early check in and that we weren't allowed to go on the pools on certain days because we had to pay. I guess I assumed it was part of the hotel stay? The room was great, very clean, nicely decorated. Downfall was that it was NOT on the strip, not even close. I probably should have looked up the location before buying. All in all, it wasn't a bad deal and this was a great hotel. They give good prices and the customer service rocks. Everyone in the hotel seemed friendly and there was good vibes all around. So if you don't mind staying off the strip to save a couple bucks definitely check out the Hard Rock.

One EPIC FAIL from start to finish!!!
 
So, I called the hotel at noon on my day of check in to let them know that I would be there at midnight. Our drive from Newport to Vegas was quick and painless, got some In and Out and was ready for a fun fun night in Vegas. We pull up at the hotel at midnight and guess what... go to check in. "Oh we're sorry, the hotel is sold out. We'll give you this non-HRH room plus $200 food and beverage and waive your resort charges". Fine, FAIL! Go to the room and what a scary sight. Like something Hunter S Thompson stayed in. Dirty room, next to an elevator, next to a ice maker. Too bad the good Dr Gonzo didn't leave his magic suit case for us! The Either or some pills would have helped us sleep considering "Ding" elevator "rubble, rubble" ice machine every 20 minutes! FAIL#2 Complained some more and got nowhere. Sucked it up and made the best of it considering they said they'd move us first thing tomorrow morning. 
 
Ahhhh, if it was that easy. Tomorrow morning rolls around and no dice! Couldn't get a hold of the front desk to save my life! FAIL#3 Phone rang and rang, finally called for the manager. She apologized up and down, said give her "an hour". We went down to the ReHab pool, sacked up and spent $200 on 2 chairs. I confirmed with the pool attendant that the seats were ours for the day. "Yes" and he gave me a receipt. Go back to the room and 2 hours after my initial call my new room is ready. FAIL#4 "OK can you please send the bellman to move our bags?" "No they are too busy". WTF! Really?? FAIL#5 We finally get into our new room...WOW, HRH Suites are super duper nice. Thanks for putting salt in the wound given the disgusting room we stayed in the night before. 
 
What ever! Go back down to the pool, the security guard decides to be Mr Big Man with a small di#@. Tells my girlfriend she cant bring her purse into the pool. Really, I was able to 2 hours ago? Whatever, FAIL#6! So she goes back to our room and I go to our chairs by the pool. GUESS WHAT!?! They moved our stuff; "we weren't there..."FAIL#7! Moved us to the back pool and the pool attendant must have compared his junk to the security guard and was all butt hurt because this guy didn't care where I was or what happened. "This is the best you're going to do". Glad I came down early and got a good seat...nope. Pool gets 3 highlights; Amber our waitress, super nice. Ian, who said he'd help us out and make up for it and then Courtney, who actually took care of everything, thank you. 
 
Things are looking up for us from this point on, in fact had a very nice dinner at 35 Steaks. Really enjoyed the Beet Salad and my Ribeye. Following dinner we went to the bar anticipating the real reason we're here. Fitz and the Tantrums. Oh, FAIL#8 is right here...I spent $90 on 2 tickets, I'm dumb, cause there's a voicemail on our room phone and some girl walking around the casino handing out free tickets! Darn it! Wasted that money. Show was AWESOME, love those guys. Really, if you get a chance, go see Fitz...just do it somewhere other than the Hard Rock Hotel. 
 
After the show, headed into Vanity Night Club, with thanks to Courtney's business card, we would have never gotten in without it. You should have seen the "line" actually it wasn't anywhere close to a line just a mess of tarded looking people trying to get into the club. (Tangent here: Hey Big Girls, I know someone loves you, but don't wear that dress! Wow!) Zero organization by hotel security. Almost a fail, but we got in with some elbow grease by my partner in crime. Had a great time at the club! Big space, fun music, I like the out door area to get away for a bit. Finally the night is almost over, we went back to the room to order room service...wait for it...it's almost here...yup, FAIL#9: Delivered our room service and you'll never guess...brought the wrong food! Love it, not the failures the irony of it all! We eat what was there, booze makes you do crazy things. Went to bed and thought we were done.
 
FAIL#10!!!! Went to check out and the bill was wrong! They didn't waive the resort fees. Really, had to wait on hold for Manager (got to know the management staff well on this trip). They fixed the bill and I was done! 
 
Back to our management encounters, all of them. Matthew, Courtney, Ian and 2 other front desk managers. All super nice all said "Sorry" way too much and all need to stand up at their next management meeting and fix the system, the hotel and the way things work and most of all the bell desk and pool attendants attitudes towards hotel guests!...You guys are in a service industry, pretend to be nice and friendly, you don't know who you're going to be rude to, he may be some guy who has too much time and likes to yelp.

I think this place likes to believe it's a real hotel.  Got stranded in limbo at front desk because bell guy refused to check our case of water, due to it being:  "food".  Checked in to our pee-stained "executive room" and checked out our spacious view of cigarette butts on the roof.  I wanted to get a closer look and take in the encompassing rooftop view, but alas, the French doors would not open to the veranda.  Weird, because the descriptions of the rooms on the website say the doors open.  Then again, they say the King rooms provide something to the extent of breathtaking views or something like that.  OK.  In all fairness, if the doors WOULD open and I COULD take in the air, my breath may have literally been "taken" by the smell of the cigarette butts on the ground entering my room.  Who knows...

Advice:  Learn how to run a hotel, Hard Rock.  It would be wise to hire an outside company to teach you the ways.  

I got here at 11.  It's 3 now.  Still room moving.  

Go Hard or Go Home.  

But probably 

Go home.

Just sat for 30 minutes in the elevator stuck the emergency alarm does not work no security came ringing the bell for 30 minutes nobody answers at the front door no manager comes to the front desk worst hotel ever don't stay here still waiting for a manager at the front desk to get moved hotels will not stay here avoid at all cost you will die in elevator one!!!! Horrible customer service after being stuck in the elevator they asked us to please move to the side and wait for someone this is in sane

They should have listen to us now they have a Nother group of people stuck in the elevator fire department is on my way

This is the best hotel and casino for adults aged 21 - 50, who are looking to party.  Almost everything here is reasonably priced.  

If you book far enough in advance, it's about $100 per night for a low end room on the weekend and half that on weekdays.  You can get Kettle One vodka cocktails for $6 at the center bar.  The cocktail waitresses will even bring you complimentary grey goose if you're gambling. 

Most of the restaurants here are pretty good and they have a Mr. Lucky's 24\/7 where you can eat breakfast, lunch or dinner items anytime.

The decor is one of the things I love best here.  You will find authentic music memorabilia from hundreds of legends.  For example: Johnny Cash, Queen, Guns and Roses, Nirvana, The Beatles, Tupac, Ice T, Lil Jon, Bob Marley, etc.  You almost feel like you're in a museum here because many of the music exhibits are so robust with memorabilia.

There are also beautiful people everywhere here and little to no children.  This is my favorite aspect.  Hard Rock invented the "pool party" with Rehab, and you will regularly find an abundance of these beautiful people packed into Rehab during the warmer months.

Finally, the biggest downside of Hard Rock is the location about a mile off the strip.  So keep in mind you will have to cab everywhere or walk for a half hour just to get to the closest of the big hotel casinos on the strip.  If this place were on the strip, it would get 5 stars from me.

I love this place. Hate the resort fee, but love staying here with the girlfriend.  Wish I could live here.  Everybody extremely friendly and restaurants are descent. Lost a lot of money but what better place to make a deposit.  Free breakfast and lunch tomorrow . Front desk needs help but they don't get paid much so I will forgive.

This review is for the casino but I did not stay at the hotel.

I really liked this place. The casino was pumping while we were there. The music was pretty good and was louder than the usual casino soundtrack. The drink service was excellent, the girls came very frequently. We had dinner at Ago while we were there. Beautiful restaurant, very modern but not stuffy or too fancy. The food was really great. The only downside is the off strip location.

One unusual thing about the Hard Rock. There are signs in the restrooms telling people they can't have sex in there. Maybe I'm not very observant, but I don't think I've ever seen that in a casino before.

My daughter and I went on a Mother\/Daughter trip Las Vegas to see Bon Iver this year at the Hard Rock Casino. The venue is very big and the floor is angled in a way that resembles stadium seating so that the person in front of you is "lower than" you are, other than the general standing room area. The line to get drinks moves slowly, there are only about 5 bartenders tending to customers. The Lyft\/Uber drop off pick up area is far to get too, Overall a good place.

Food - 2\/5
Service - 2\/5
Price - 5\/5
Atmosphere - 4\/5

Best Dish: 7\/7\/7 Steak & Shrimp

With all the gambling, partying, and shopping that happens in Vegas, it's only natural to try to find the best deals. This to me is a hidden gem. Inside the Hard Rock (which is off the strip), there is a restaurant called Lucky's where you can get a plate of Steak and Shrimp for $7.77, salad and mashed potatoes are also included. That's pretty much the best deal in town, especially if you consider a big mac on the strip is about 5 dollars.

My fave Casino this place rocks i love it the place just has an exciting feel to it all the rocker memorabilia the drinks are measured out so they are just perfect not to strong not to light my room was cool the Pink Taco and that Cool Hookah bar in it were really great i had a wonderful time here from what i can remember it was a wild night

What a joke..booked the HRH tower suites, and from the description it looked perfect, the place looked clean, modern, surround sound speakers, and big for a great price. I decided to stay off the strip because of the room. When I get to the hotel, they tell me, "we over booked and don't have a room available for you in the HRH tower." They then offered me a "celebrity suite" in the casino tower. Sounded great to me. 

I unlock my door, holding all my bags, and the room is pitch black. Im feeling around the dusty walls for a light switch, couldn't locate one. I turn my phone flashlight on, not a single recessed light in the place. Only dim laps that you need to walk around to individually and turn on. The place looked like a gross 90's porn set. The hotel was built in 1995 and I can guarantee you this room hasn't been touched since.  

I go down and speak to the receptionist, the supervisor, and call the 3rd party company I booked through. All of them said the same thing to me, "but sir we upgraded you to the celebrity suite", "Sir we can waive the $25 resort fee". This was no upgrade, and the more they kept calling it that, the more disappointed I got.

I finally give up and realize they aren't going to comp me my room, so I ask if they could at least help me out on a price for an additional night in the original HRH tower I booked. At this point I'm thinking I will give them one more shot to make
It right. Supervisor says "no problem sir, here is the price we can do for you". I go on my phone and find the same room cheaper online. 

You call that bs customer service. Never coming back. Never getting near this hotel again.
Nice place for gaming. Good vibe & music and fun people with professional staff.

The room is a basic no frills room. It is dusty as hell though! There's a layer of dust on everything! Stayed in the Paradise Tower and the room needs updating. Cabinets are all beat up, shower fixture is breaking, one lightbulb is out.
It's dark in here!
The view is good though.
The pools are neat with the sand and all. You can't bring your own drinks down to the pool unless you buy their HR Rehab cups.
Not bad for $39 per night though.

This was a great place to stay.  I loved the layout of the hotel.  The room was nice and had a nice view.  Even though it's so far off of the strip, it has enough to do there without having to go to the strip.

I have to say the highlight of my trip was when I had to run upstairs to grab something from my room and shared an elevator with Dave Navarro!  My husband was screaming my name to make sure I saw him so that when we both entered the elevator he was very cool and just smiled at me.  On our ascent he casually said, "What's up, Tina?"  I responded with a casual, "Nothing much.  What's up with you, Dave?"

That's what is great about the Hard Rock.  There are celebrities everywhere and they are mostly pretty cool.  I would definitely stay there again.

Fourth night here for a work conference, and it's still not growing on me. If anything I dislike it more and more every passing day. We checked in and believe got a "suite" instead of the actual room that was booked, but even in a suite we definitely dont feel like the quality of our room is good to give this hotel a good review. 

The mattress is not firm at all, if you happen to lie on the edge, you'll realize in no time that the whole bed is tilted so make sure you're always situated in the middle. The sheets are scratchy and make too much noise when you move around. Bf actually developed an allergic reaction so he has to cover himself up to sleep. If you arent careful, you could bump your legs against the bed frame too and it would hurt. Walls are thin; you might even smell weed or hear people going at it in the next room regardless of what method you use to block it out. 

Surely vegas is a city that never sleeps, but if you're not here to play, maybe opt for a different hotel.

Very disappointed as I used a Groupon and paid $200 for two nights then paid $30 x 2 resort fee plus a $15 x 2 upgrade for a strip view. After getting to my room and checking prices online, I see that I paid nearly $100 more than they are currently charging directly on their site. That doesn't seem right. I call thinking maybe they'll at least give me the upgrade back and the person I spoke with wasn't willing to do anything for me. My fault as I should have researched more beforehand. Still bummed that customer satisfaction wasn't the least bit important to them. Room is alright...a bit far from the strip. Don't touch any of the goodies or alcohol in the room unless you want to get charged an arm and a leg.

Decided to take a Staycation with The Better Half and saw that the rates for the new HRH Tower at the Hard Rock was $90 per night.....sold!  We booked it online and headed down to get away for a couple of days.  Here are some highlights of our stay:

- The tower is new and has a ton of room in the suites.  There's a separate bedroom & living room, very spacious.  (see pics)
http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/oakaMw79ChXM8NllHjgLNg?select=IBebLmeBXfFVUzg5ybHSEA
http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/oakaMw79ChXM8NllHjgLNg?select=NgMh_-U4F58muEyYbyVJjg

- The beds are very comfortable.  The pillow top mattress is soooo soft we melted into the bed.  We didn't want to wake up in the morning....LOL

- There is a $15 per day resort fee.  For that you get access to the spa among other amenities.

- The bathroom is huge!  Large, deep tubs.......large shower with rainfall shower head.
http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/oakaMw79ChXM8NllHjgLNg?select=QRXtpTSeupCvCrnahXg07w
http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/oakaMw79ChXM8NllHjgLNg?select=RhCKWzs4vQXFtBUv1vE0bg

- The mini-bar is motion activated.....which means if you take something from it, if it's gone for more than 2 minutes it will automatically be charged to your room.....be careful not to remove anything unless you really want it!

- The toiletries were awesome.  Soaps & shampoo were good quality.

- The lobby of the new HRH Tower has a ton of new memorabilia in it....worth checking it out.

Some QUICK TIPS:
- Parking for the HRH Tower is on the south side of the building.  Park at the parking garage or valet which is off of Harmon.  If you go to the other parking area, it's far from the new tower.

- You get $10 in FREE Slot Play when you check into the hotel.....use it, it's FREE money.  The Better Half redeemed it but didn't win anything.

Overall, we had a great time at the Hard Rock.  A nice little staycation in our favorite city!

Return Factor - 100%

Hard Rock's come a long way since its appearance in "Honey, I Blew Up the Kid" when it was just a cafe. Now, it's a full on hotel and casino with entertainment venues and several restaurants. Rooms are usually affordable, and it's not too far from The Strip. However, I'd think twice about bookin' here. 

An event brought me to the Hard Rock, so I booked a room for the night at a bargain rate. My room was located in the Casino Tower facing the pool. Instead of the deluxe king room that I originally reserved, I was given a double queen because it was one of the only non-smoking options at the time. 

The Casino Tower has got to be one of the oldest parts of the entire property, and I wouldn't recommend staying there. Although rooms in the tower have received contemporary updates, mine felt dated with its lackluster hardware, dirty vents and walls, and a high bathtub with a slippery floor. The beds were comfortable, except I noticed one of the comforters was dirty. 

Walls are THIN. I heard a whiny lady next door complaining to her dude, toilets flushing, and loud music playing downstairs -- just classy. But really, none of that irritated me as much as the loud noise in the pool area and the construction work I heard late at night through 7:00a.m. Originally, I thought there were some drunks trying to open the doors to the faux balconies that the rooms have, but on and off I heard a loud humming noise from outside, jack hammers, sawing, and hammering from downstairs -- thanks for the heads up, front desk. 

I called the Hard Rock and narrated my woes to a staff member, who assured me that my $28 resort fee would be credited back to my account. I'm grateful for the compensation, but my unpleasant experience screwed up my entire day.

What a surprise!! Small enough casino the new Hard Rock Hotel Tower is awesome.  The suites are spacious, view is great, luxury for a great price.  Love all the memorabilia throughout the Hard Rock Hotel.  The service has been awesome.  Great vibe and the floor has a lot of crazy ass people.  A bit of a ways from the strip.  In the floor at the casino while playing cards there are awesome pole dancers for your entertainment.  It's definitely a place to check out.

Hey, they get good bookings for concerts, Nobu Restaurant in da house, beach and cabanas, good veggie burgers at the beachhouse restaurant. Away from the over done strip. Small enough and big enough to keep it good for quickie--two day one night.

So disappointing. 

This was a place I always used to recommend to my friends and anyone aged 18-40 who came to Vegas to have fun, meet cool people and relax. It's right next to the airport, clean, comfy, stylish, inexpensive and had the cool crowd. Only downside was that it's not on strip, but that's a plus for me because you don't deal with traffic!

However, I was extremely disappointed with my visit this week. I made a reservation and pre-paid on the phone. The reservation agent never asked me about a nonsmoking room. When I got to the hotel, they told me they only had smoking rooms and wanted to charge me for an upgrade. I spoke to manager Hector who could not do any better than that. 

I ended up staying in the smoking room after he waived one night's mandatory resort fee, and it didn't smell much, but was woken up in early morning by drilling noises just outside. 

I used to LOVE this place but customer service has declined. I think they are getting squeezed by competition and not making as much as they used to.

Awful customer service at checkin and checkout. Bar staff quality was very inconsistent. One guy try to over charge us $22, we weren't that hammered:-) best staff are the housekeeping people and lucky 7, super helpful and funny. Never staying again. The front desk manager is chronically lacking in resolving customer issues that were created by her people. She had arrogant attitude and tried intimidating us with security of all things. Amazingly bad.

I found the staff courteous and reliable, managing complications in checkin with aplomb, and speeding checkout. The room was clean and well-appointed, though it lacked a fridge. The linens were a big coarse, but the bed itself was soft without being saggy. I also appreciated the very large tub. Catered food was pretty decent, and I'm a little hard to please culinarily. The swamp cooler fan thing made waiting for a cab more tolerable.

But indoor smoking is just gross, even with good ventilation. I always wanted to move through the hotel as quickly as possible to get through it, and a little while waiting near the central bar to meet up with coworkers before heading out left me feeling a little sick - and I wasn't the only one. Definitely next time we have a meeting in Las Vegas we'll make sure it's a non-smoking venue.

I had read the reviews prior to coming to the Hard Rock and was a little concerned.  However, I really enjoyed it.  Actually, I enjoyed my stay here more than a recent stay at the Bellagio and I would rate the Hard Rock equal or above many of the other Casinos I have been to..  I stayed in the Paradise towers and the ooms are very nice.  As others have stated, the beds are very comfortable.  I enjoyed the atmosphere.  At first, I was disappointed in the casino but later I found it to be perfect for me.  It is off the strip but only a $10 taxi ride there if you want it.  To my surprise, I found I enjoyed staying off the strip.  The restaurants are very good and they have live music in some of their clubs which is something that is no longer easy to find in Vegas.  I look forward to my next visit.  Oh, and the Sports Book is great!  Best I have seen so far.

The other complaints aren't all that far from the truth, but I do think it's possible to stay here and have a good time.  I've stayed here 5-6 times in the last 5 years and only once did I have a bad time.  Stayed here for work, a bachelor party, thanksgiving and just recently HRH offered me a free night to come back.  They had new management and I do think they are making a concerted effort to provide better service.  The restaurants are completely fine and Nobu is a very nice option to stay in and dine if you want to have a fancy meal.  Everything else is serviceable, which is exactly what i w=prefer when in Vegas considering all the other ways money flees my wallet.  

That being said, I really love their pools and I've always had a good time there.  Some people may complain about the resort fee, but if you use the pool the way it's supposed to be used then it's worth it as it is well taken care of and the other patrons of the pool are friendly.  It also doesn't hurt to have good dj's playing and good drinks.  Anyway, I'd totally stay here again and if you don't like the size of the casino or the restaurants then go somewhere else...that's what Vegas is all about after all.

If you are in vegas for the pool party action then this is your five star place. That's the only reason we were in town, for rehab(see my review on that) and it was perfect. Our room opened up to Rehab 7 stories up so we could hear the music pumping from the room and it made for a big time party suite. To be honest, the casino is definitely not something special and the restaurants there are not great, except for the outdoor\/indoor one by the other pool that has a glass bottom pool as a roof. Really sweet. 

The hotel pretty bare bones but the pool is like no other place in this world and a $300 room comes with two $150 wrist bands so it makes a lot of cents. Pretty far from the strip though. The beds were to die for too. So soft and comfy. Like a cloud!

RUDE AND UNPROFESSIONAL STAFF. NOT WORTH IT.
This post serves as a formal complaint on the completely HORRIBLE experience we had this past weekend Oct. 22-24th, at Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Las Vegas that ruined my bachelorette\/girls trip. From the moment we stepped on to the property, we encountered RUDE, UNPROFESSIONAL employees. Very rude female front staff at the HRH Registration desk who was too irritated to provide directions to the main hotel registration after informing us in a "matter-of-factly" nature our original HRH Tower suite reservation was redirected to the main hotel.   Plus the decietful male desk staff (including the male manager) at the main Hard Rock Hotel Registration\/Check-in who repeatly told us that our reservation information was wrong and implying that not only we were lying about our reservation but that we were trying to get free upgrades. If you book through an online site (like Travelocity) the staff will disregard your orginal reservation and treat you like a lower guest as if that is a punishment for not booking directly. Your reservation will be as invalid as if you just walked in without any reservation at all. We were not the only party having issues with third party booking sites. We called Travelocity and they were just as confused as to the manner the hotel was dealing with the reservation.

 Amongst the long list too numerous to name here, the low-point of our weekend was after dealing with our reservations with the front desk for over an hour, they provided us keys to a room which was ALREADY OCCUPIED filled with guests' valuables such as a guitar, laptop, luggage AND a sleeping guest in the bed! Rather than apologizing for the situation, they blamed the guest for not checking out as indicated on the computer and took no blame. I couldn't believe how lightly they responded to that situation, not even concerned for the guest we walked in on. Since it had been well over 2 hours dealing with our room situation, we settled on a room that we didn't want.

To top it off, eating lunch Saturday afternoon at Mr. Lucky's we encountered a female server who repeatedly rolled her eyes when we asked questions on menu items and curtly served us our drinks. We were so frustrated and completely in shock with the continued bad encounters with staff, we decided to purposely leave the hotel for all food and entertainment purposes because it was so bad. Rather than finding relief in your hotel, we literally cringed everytime we had to walk through the casino back and forth from the room to taxi. 

We had a VERY unpleasant experience. It seemed that the majority of staff we encountered had a very bad attitude and forgot they were in a hospitality business. I highly discourage anyone to stay, let alone waste time & money at this property and instead spend your money at a resort with polite staff that actually smile and appreciate guests. DO NOT STAY HERE!

I don't have any tattoos, I don't wear Affliction MMA gear, I don't ride BMX or motocross bikes, and I don't smoke....but I do like to live like a rock star & gamble like one (once in awhile)!!! 

The Hard Rock Hotel & Casino has been on my wish list of hotels to stay at for a long time now. I'm always played and dined here, but never had the chance to stay here. Well, wish fulfilled 11\/2010! Although it wasn't as grand spectacular as I had imagined\/hoped, it was a great two days with my lovely Jackie!!! 

We had a nice Paradise Tower room over looking the famous Rehab pool, which was unfortunately closed for the winter season. The room was clean, stylish, and functional. 

It did lack some things: hand moisturizer (hello, we're in the desert!), broken make up mirror lamp, rain shower leaked all over the bathroom floor, and a lack of towels. 

The casino is far...really FAR from the Paradise tower. Not even joking! It was best for us to use the self park garage rather the valet because it was right next to our room tower and elevators. And since I'm on the Valet guys, it's best if you want to earn tips ($$$) if you aren't in a cluster fuck chit chatting while paying hotel guests need a little direction where to pull up for valet and check into your employer's hotel!!! 

Casino: it was sadly empty. Only 2 craps table and 2 roulette tables open. It must have been a slow night. I'm glad I walked out ahead $500+ Thank you!!! 

PS The new MTV Real World Las Vegas show is secretly filming there right now. We also ran into them at the Venetian Gondola rides. Filming a documentary......rrrright!

So I'm writing this review strictly because of the casino hosts. I wrote a review last time about Nicholas Palazallo but this time I wanted to rant and rave about Michael Ferrulli! These guys are just awesome and go above and beyond to make sure their guests are HAPPY. I've stayed at the Hard Rock 3 times this year and I usually like to stay at different hotels but these guys keep me coming back. I used to work in the service industry so I can really appreciate good service when I see it. 

I love the rooms especially the comfy beds! The pools are great and I kind of like being off the strip.  I don't have to deal with the crowds or traffic. I've always enjoyed my stay here and will continue to be a "happy guest" at the Hard Rock:) Thanks Nick and Mike, you guys truly are the best!!

I have only been to Vegas twice (both this past year) and I'm in love with the HRH! The service is great, the staff is super nice, and the overall tone of the hotel is down right rockin'! 

I love that the lighting is dim (you'll always look good in low lights) and that the colors of the casino are all dark purples, oranges, and reds. It is a sassy atmosphere with a hint of bad-ass. The dealers are all very nice and are very helpful if you have questions. The cocktail waitresses are all very beautiful and very accommodating. They don't always come around when you want them, but wait a little bit and you'll find a cute little number asking if anyone wants drinks. Be quick though! You have to order pretty fast because they go to all the tables and try to get everyone's order. I was skipped over a few times because I didn't speak up. 

The clothing shops there borderline the L.A. look and what Criss Angel wears. I was uncomfortable when I went into those shops because the staff took a look at me and kind of turned their noses up. It was fine with me because the clothes are definitely not my look. If you like heavily designed and decorated clothes and you wear your hair quite spiky and hair-sprayed, then I'm sure you'll be in heaven.
You can get a tattoo as well! There is a tattoo parlor that take appointments as well as walk-ins. They are always busy, so I'd definitely call before you go.

The hotel rooms are spectacular. They have three towers and all three of them are amazing. The rooms have super comfy beds and flat-screen televisions with iPod compatible radios. The showers are huge and very nice.

The pools are all outside and I don't recommend going in them until the busy seasons. The off seasons they heat one pool to about 80 degrees, but honestly, it feels more like 50 degrees.

It is a little bit off the strip, but it is only about a $10 cab ride to the strip. Walking isn't bad either, just make sure you have a buddy to walk with. 
I heavily recommend you staying here. Honestly, I don't think you'll be let down.

The difference between an on the strip hotel and off the strip hotel... Valet won't take food, drinks, and ice chests.... Leaving me to struggle with it all by myself while they watched. Real nice Hard Rock. Haven't even checked in yet and know I won't be back. Bullshit service. Too bad I can't give zero stars. Unbelievable.

This place is awesome! More of a party type atmosphere which is what I love! Tons of places to eat. Bars spread out all over ther place with decent prices. Defiantly have some of the better looking cocktail waitresses in Vegas. Got the see one of my favorite Djs in one of their bars, CB Shaw. The pool has the be the best in Vegas for sure! And I would definitely recommend a room with a pool view. The rooms are pretty cool and straight forward. Awesome  bathtub. And I loved the fact that the double doors in the room opened up to a view of the pool and the Vegas strip. Staff is really nice and polite! Parking is free and available!

ED HARDY'S FAVE HOTEL. LIKE WASSUPPPPP!!!!

There are a lot of very good, and very bad reviews for this hotel. I kind of read them like "idiot", "brilliant", "idiot", "brilliant", and so on...

That should tell you something.

I almost feel like writing, "trust me, stay away" and not go into all the miserable details of a completely lousy Vegas experience at Epic levels.

- no soap or shampoo available. Nope. you must pay 24 dollars for that cleansing privilege.

- check out is at 11. If you are late, or you want to stay in for an extra 30 min, or 5 min, or 1 min, they charge you 100 bucks an hour if you can believe it. Wow. Even the prostitutes that hang out at the bar have better rates than that.

- they charge around 15 bucks to your bill for...well...nothing...hotel service fee. The lady at reception said it was how the hotel brings in more revenue. Uh huh. I get that. But how in the hell does a hotel charge me for nothing? I mean, 15 or 150, the principle is the same. Complete scam job.

- tiny, teeny, weeny, little towels. Enough to cover my leg. One of them. Again, no bloody soap!!! not even a bar. Sick. Even motel 6 gives you soap. And now I'm naked with no towel and dirty as sin!

- food all around mediocre. Nobu is the biggest joke on earth. Oh, I'll save that review for another time along with the silliest fake-Italian restaurant. Mama mia, e bene - says the large fake-Italian man who should compete with Adam Sandler for who can do a worse accent.

- Service: well, think what would happen if the same people who were part time prostitutes\/drug dealers\/musicians\/Ed Hardy fans, etc. all got jobs in the service industry running a hotel and now you know who you will be dealing with at the Hard Rock

- Clientele looks like they all just broke out of Arkham Asylum and\/or an Ed Hardy fan museum.

Seriously, this is a fun place to hang out at for 20 minutes and then your head starts to pound from the drugs someone dropped in your drink and you wake up pregnant in a 3rd world country as a love slave. At least that's what happened to me. Please, Mom, if you're reading this...save me. The guy who has me wears a trucker hat with swarzky crystals...

STAY AWAY. Big waste of money hotel, hiya Tai-Pan. Me thinks you wanchee go elsewhere hotel no lying, hiya? Like Motel 6 where they have free soap and towels! Yay.

Hard rock is an okay place, if you plan on staying in the hotel for your whole entire trip. There's $18 resort fee per day and they also put $50 on hold per day on your card.

We spent $65 per day on cabs, going back and forth to the strip and to the hotel. We were on a budget, but ended up spending more money at the end of our trip. 

Also if you think about walking it to the strip, good luck to you. You'll have to walk by a busy high way street with bums hanging out on the side street.  It was just really hard to get around and have fun because everything was too far.

My advice is to spent that extra $50 and stay in the middle of the strip. You will thank me later.

I gave them 2 stars,

1 star for $15 hidden fee, 1 star for the mini bar.  DO NOT PICK UP ANYTHING more than 45 SEC.  Yeah, 45 second got it?  or you will get charge.  

Check in was quick and the staff was nice.  The room was nice but TV didn't work, so i picked up room telephone and tried to call the front desk, hmmm no dial tone, the phone not even worked.  So I went back down to the front desk, she asked if i want to switch room or had TV and phone fix in next 5 to 15 min.  I was tire and lazy to move, so i agreed to had them fix.  I was suprised that someone shown up 5 min. later, bravo for that.  He fixed the TV and said will be back for the telephone.  I agreed and i know he won't be back.  If you in technical field, you will understand it is not just simple as get a new phone and plug in the wall.  Their telephone more complicated than that, it required reprogamming to match the room you are staying.. bla bla bla.  

I love rock music, and I think this Hotel really fit me.  I just hope they would improve their services by listening to what people were complainning about such as more up front about the $15 hotel fee, the mini bar can only access using the room key, less confusing in parking area.
Was at the pool for atmosphere concert. tho it was a bit packed service was good at bar. After wards did a bit of gambling. great fun place

Suites are very nice looking, but wait.  NO refrigerator?  No coffee maker?  $7.50 for HRH Water in the room?  

I understand hotels need to make money, but seriously, they can do away with some of the expensive Hard Rock eye candy downstairs and give each expensive "SUITE" a $10 coffee maker.  Geesh.

By the way, telephone did not work, and instead of bringing me another, they tried to change batteries and wait for it to charge.  It still didn't work.  I arrived a bit early, but wasn't able to check in until after 4:00 pm.

Spoke with the general manager.  His response without apologies, "would you like me to tell the engineer to replace the phone?"  I presumed that was a rhetorical question.  A simple "I'm sorry for your inconvenience would have sufficed."  I'm downgrading my rating from 3 to 2 stars.

As many previous Yelpers mentioned Hard Rock Hotel (HRH) didn't live up to my expectations either.

- lopsided bed, $15 hidden resort fee, no free wifi, smokey in hallways (should separate nonsmoking area from smoking), Starbucks cost 2x as much, Mr. Lucky's restaurant promotions don't work on holidays even though they promoted it that way, dimly lit bathrooms, poor electrical wiring (light switches didn't always turn on lights and some turned off all), fan blew directly towards bed and not able to be changed direction, insulation not well because we could hear our loud neighbors, direction of check-in is terrible (didn't realize there were several towers with different check-ins and parking garages).

+ TV wasn't blasting loudly when you first turn it on, comforters were extremely comfortable, rock and roll decoration and photos.

Targeted towards a specific crowd, tattooed, 20s & 30s. Across the street, you can get really good German food! It's actually not that close to the Strip as you think it is. It's at least 2 miles. (I measured it when I drove). So it would be not recommended to walk, unless you don't mind the distance and have time to spare.

I will not stay here again nor recommend it.

I've stayed here on more than a few occasions, alone, with friends, with the wife, on business and for the occasional bachelor party! This place is just fun. The roulette dealers are nice, even when taking your money and the waitresses are pretty good about coming in with your drinks if your playing at the tables.

Among my group of friends, this is the place to host a Bachelor party. They totally leave you alone as far as noise and the aroma of herbal joy emitted from the room. 

There's a liquor store across the street, so buy beer there and take it to your room. Bring it in early, past 6pm they'll not let you bring it to your room. 

The Suites are large enough to hold about 30+ folks and 6 strippers and have ample room to still play cards, hangout at the bar as you listen to Bay Area beats....oh the memories. I haven't partied in any other room other than the Celebrity Suite so I can't vouch for those, but the Suite we party in costs $1,200 for 2 days, you can talk them into letting you stay just for Saturday night at $800 but it takes some work.

Nobu is downstairs too, that place was pretty tasty. I had hamachi sashimi w\/ jalapenos and a miso\/soy sauce and a kobe beef dinner. I'm not sure how much it was cause my wife paid for the bill from our home in Cali. That was one of the best birthdays ever. Checked into the Hotel, they said there will be a slight delay, I didn't mind. I go into the room and there's a card written by her telling me dinner is already arranged and taken care of, a few bottles of Fuji water to help with the hangover and a chocolate cake with a candle in it to celebrate my birthday day. Much love to that woman I married. 

Oh and for my bachelor party she had a Full sized bottle of Johnny Blue sent to the room...damn gotta love that woman..again! LOL

Maybe I should write a review on her....LOL

I visited on a weekday night, after a long hiking trip in the grand canyon. I surely felt out of place checking in wearing my dusty hiking gear and smelly clothes! There were beautiful people walking around in their bikinis-- the pool is a very popular place for sure! I loved that the beds were SO comfortable! We stayed in a corner suite in the paradise tower and it was so nice. The bathrooms are very well lit and the shower is massive. There is a hair dryer, it is in the closet in a little bag. 

We played black jack at the casino downstairs and minimum bet is $15. We had fun and even won a little money! We lounged at the pool the next morning and it was beautiful, relaxing and fantastic.

The downside: everything is so expensive. over-priced! Although, it could just be vegas. But seriously, $35 for sunscreen? and $9 for skittles? skittles! come on! and $17 for a club sandwich and $45 for a veggie and hummus platter? There was no one at the pool and they wanted to charge us $500 for a cabana that no one was using. I could understand, maybe, on a weekend when there is a demand for that, but there were maybe 10 people in the entire pool. It was just plain ridiculous. Well, what do you expect, Vegas isn't really a "budget" vacation.

I am really only writing about Rehab, the all day pool party on Sundays...   MAN!!  That s*&t was crazy!  Luckily my BF went ahead and scoped things out for us.  My friend and I arrived, went straight to the front of the incredibly long line, and were whisked in.  We had lounge chairs reserved, set up right on the "beach" of the pool.  The pool is not a hard bottom, but sand.  It certainly wasn't cheap.  To get the prime real estate you have to order two bottle (they were at least one hundred dollars, maybe two, it's hard to remember).   PLUS you are expected to tip out the guy arranging it for you three hundred.  So worth it!  This place was insane.  People everywhere in bikinis and trunks dancing and drinking.  All the bad kids, the bachelorettes, and loads of dudes were there.  I think it took three seconds before some guy was asking who I was with.  LOUD music all day long.  A couple of minor music stars.  I am really glad that I went this year.   At thirty three I was about 7 - 11 years older than most of the crowd.  By the end of the day, we could all probably have gone to the real rehab!

I am not sure why people care to stay at this place.  The rooms are cool nice 60" Plasma in every room- cool decor and nice bed ok and cool toiletries.  Out side of that?  small gambling floor. A grungy TRL crowd of clientele.  The restaurant options are scant.  The Pink Taco is good and tasty.  They have a 2fer night on Tuesdays at the bar.  Tends to be a lot of locals since the weekend crowd has already left.

The front desk staff was hit or miss.  I was not pleased with the ATTITUDE from some of them and the late fee for checking out an hour early they tried to hustle me with.

I am giving 3 stars as I always love the memoribilia and the decor.  The Zidjan symbols as hallway lighting shades was a cool touch.

What a disappointment. I think they may be having cash flow issues. Checked in at 7:30pm in to the Tower suite @ $500 \/ night with confirmed reservations. The room was not ready!  They had a similar room with double beds rather than King. We took that. 

Got to my room. It's dark. Three bulbs are out!  Went to dinner (had reservations) after 15 minutes no water or even a glance  Appeared they only had two waiters working the section (and it was packed). Had to get up and ask the hostess to grab a waiter  

Got back from dinner. Bulbs fixed. Laid down to watch a little TV. TV is broken. Turn AC to 68 to go to sleep. AC broken. Could not get lower than 73 all night. 

Went to a show in their main theater. Sound was so bad we could not understand a single thing that was being said. 

Gambling wasn't any better. Very hard to find a chair for Black Jack yet many tables were closed. 

I will not be going back there ever again. We ended up checking out early and went to New York. Now that's a fabulous place.

For $70 on a Tuesday night, it was fine.  We've stayed at the Hard Rock Seminole in Hollywood, FL and absolutely loved it  -  we thought Vegas would be just as great.  However, we were suprised when the front desk told us that the properties had different owners even though they looked identical.

The room was spacious, although the lack of space in the bathroom, especially trying to close the door without having to squeeze in between the toilet and the tub, left much to be desired.  The bathroom also needed scrubbing in between the tile grout and around the fine edges (remember, I am germophobic and cannot help but notice and be bothered by that kind of stuff!)

The bed was comfortable but squeaked when put to serious use =o) Being crisp white, the bedding and pillows were ultra lush and didn't give me heebie-geebies.

The lcd tv made us feel at home and we loved the BOSE sound system - especially the reggae station!

All-in-all, it was worth the $70 bucks.

Hard Rock Hotel has some of the best beds i've ever slept in.  I stayed at the hardrock in chicago prior my most recent vegas trip and i remember the beds being the highlight, so i knew the beds were gonna be AMAZEBALLS.  Sure enough, these beds are pure heaven! It's like sleeping on fluffy clouds of marshmellowy softness.  You lay down, sink in and just wanna stay in bed ALL DAY..

But this is vegas, you don't come to stay in the room, you come to gamble, drink, party, shop and more.. This is why i can only give the hard rock a 3 star rating.. I love the hotel, its chic, clean and the rooms are sick, but there is just nothing around it.  You really need a taxi or a car to get to anywhere that isn't the hard rock.

The casino is decent, however I don't recall seeing a poker room and that is a major draw back for me since i am a POKER fanatic!

The restaurants are decent, the night life seemed a little dead when we passed by, however i cannot speak for pool season as i hear it is amazing..

Bottom line is that there is good value here if you are looking for a nice room with some of the best beds you will ever sleep on.  If you are looking to cruise las vegas boulevard without having to cab it everywhere or drive everywhere then you may want to stay at a casino on the strip....

**PS the showers in the room are SUUUUPER DOPE!
Our experience at the hard rock was amazing the hotel didn't smell like cigarettes very clean friendly staff oh and also pink taco restaurant the bomb highly recommended

I've came & conquered Las Vegas all while staying at the legendary HARD ROCK Casino & Hotel and live to tell about it.

All that's happening is here if you want it bad enough. Gambling, booze, women & rock n roll is what the Hard Rock Casino & Hotel is all about in you in Las Vegas. A vice for everyone to pillage, plunder and indulge to extreme excess. 

Now should you spend all your time in your room, THE HRC has some of the best rooms on or off the strip. Everything from dual TV's to I-pod connectors built into the wall. Some room's have life size images of your favorite rock n roll band along with huge bathrooms for the time when you & the porcline god decide to give up the drinks your consumed hours before or simply bath your sin away. You simply don't wanna leave your room, but then again your journey doesn't start until you actually leave your room. 

The path to destruction starts with your first drink and roll of the dice. You may think that gambling is all the HRC has to offer and your wrong. Some of the best concerts I've ever witnessed have come to THE JOINT. Artists are starting to do residency's at the venue. Guns & Roses, Def Leopard and coming soon KISS. Or if you have pool side needs then the Rehab Pool Party will be filled with 90% naked bodys, booze and THE POOL! Just in case you really need help they have a wonderful spa and massage rehabilitation area for those that let Vegas beat them down to much.

Well, now that FRANK has your attention I'd say forget THE STRIP, it's time for the Hard Rock to create a special sin package for you. Remember folks The Hard Rock Casino not responsible for your rehab to recovery centers after party meltdown so please don't send Dr Drew's bill to the front desk!

I have always loved the hard rock and this time was no different. Friendly and helpful staff, smells great, away from the chaos of the strip, wonderful pools. I could go on forever. The only drawbacks were 1- They charged me full price without taking into account the deposit I had already paid (although to be fair I had made changes to upgrade our reservation so things get lost in systems, no biggie) but I'm sure they'll take care of that during check out.... 2-figuring out which pools are open takes some research but far from a difficult thing to do if one isn't too lazy :-). Love it and will return!!

For how much the room cost it was horrible.  I've had more comfortable beds at Motel 6.  The towels were thin sandpaper like Motel 6.  Complete lack of a fridge for guest use was unbelievable, but great mini bar fridge completely stocked full of crap that we couldn't touch without being charged to try to put our stuff in there to keep it cool.  Had to use trash cans full of ice for our "guest fridge."  Absolutely unbelievable.  The whole room experience was crap.  Check in and out was standing in line for 45 minutes both ways.  The registration staff was slow and\/or they needed to double up staffing when the line gets more than 20 guests long.  Will not be staying here again.

First time I'm disappointed by the HRH :

I'm a regular to the hard rock hotel Las Vegas, by regular I mean I come here at least every year and I even stayed 1 month in the HRH suite.

But this year it's the first time I'm disappointed.
We (my gf and I) booked 6 days via bookingdotcom as my Backstage Pass didn't work on the HRH website and since we weren't sure about the dates (17th august) of arrival we had the possibility to cancel the reservation.
When we arrived on Monday we weren't sure about the room we reserved (King Casino Tower) and wanted to get a better room, so we decided to upgrade to a HRH suite (also the rate was the same on the website.)

But it looks like if you ask to upgrade at the front desk they are going to give you the crappiest room available like walking a mile to get there, stains everywhere, used furnitures, the shower hose was broken and no offers to get to parties and restaurants even if you're staying a week. 

We also stayed 2 hours playing in the casino @2am, and the waitress was just snob, she passed (looking the other way) by us 5 times without asking if we wanted to drink something ...

The best part of the " best Pool of the year 2015 "  was closed during week days to get cleaned up for the (dirty) Rehab, which didn't leave a lot of place to stay around the others swimming pools.

Maybe it was a bad week, but the service wasn't as high as a couple of years ago at the same period.

Be careful and don't expect too much if you plan to go there, might be good for young people on budget and first timer in Vegas.

Even if I love this casino resort I might plan to try another one next time on the strip with better nightclubs and services.

The Hard Rock reached out to me following my first experience and made a genuine effort to make things right. I'll be back soon to give them another shot.

One thing I failed to mention in my earlier review was the food. Culinary Dropout and Pink Taco were both great. Hopefully my room this next time around will hit the spot. They are putting me in another tower. I don't think I'd give the Paradise tower another try.

I am a local. I live across the street from here.
And every time I come here it takes an hour to get a cocktail waitress to get a drink and it's not like I'm sitting away from the bar I'm sitting right in the area around the bar on machine and it's not like it's once every blue moon it's every time I'm in this place they need to hire some more cocktail waitress or teach them better service

WHY CAN THERE NOT BE A ZERO BUTTON.  this place was so bad.  I stayed for one night. the people at the front desk are not nice.  They do NOT take cash and would not help us check in.  we had to  have a credit card and no matter what they don't take cash so this was our problem.  then we asked to see a manager the girl at the desk walked away and about a minute later came back and said that she would be right out.  Ten  minutes later no manager. no help.   
  I left a bag on the front desk and I called down to see if they had it and they said no to talk to lost and found and then theytold me nope...nothing here, then hung up the phone.  
No one had any idea what customer service is and no one cared.  I will not be going back ever.

Beautiful rooms; comfortable beds.
Friendly staff. 
Amazing memorabilia.
Super friendly valet.

How is this hotel still in operation? By far the worst hotel still left from the old Vegas era. Perhaps this hotel can be torn down and moved to Reno or better yet New Mexico desert.

The staff stole my wifes bikini bottoms!!! Oh and someone left a terd in my hotel room toliet with the toliet brush still in it!!! .... As if it was me...ya, like I would carry a toliet bowl brush with me in my suitcase, would use the bathroom and then not flush?! WTF...seriously. 

I left the sign out not to disturb\/no houskeeping and that exactly the opposite of what happened. I awoke to some maid riffeling through my open suitcase. She said it was in her way of cleaning and that she was moving it out of the way. After speaking to the front desk, they said they would get us free VIP passes to their stanky run down club. Has anyone seen this 'nightclub'? OMG what a joke.

Run! Far away and dont look back. Did I mention I saw pest control in hazmat suits going into an apartment 3 doors down? Yikes. Scary

$8 for a bottle of water at a concert is overkill. The Joint is the bomb! The sound system is great, the sound is great, there is a lot of room to roam around and the staff is very friendly. Just go there w\/out needing something to drink it's so expensive, unreal. I saw Kelly Clarkson last week and Rise Against yesterday - love this venue but not the prices.

Yet another horrible experience. I attempted to give this place another try after some time and it's still a major disappointment.  Insects crawling up and down the walls.  Deon, the front desk manager, said there is no higher to be spoken to and there was nothing he can do at the time but spray some bug spray.  Very poor customer skills and told me "what he said 3 times already".  Very unprofessional way to speak to members.

I usually dont write bad reviews but im really disappointed in this hotel. I went to Las Vegas for my Birthday with a few of my friends from July 6th-10th We got to the hotel late because our flight got delayed so by the time we get there they said they didn't have our room anymore and they had to give me a room at the Casino Tower with only one bed which was wich was not convinent for me because it was four of us but that room was great it had a balcony with a pool view. The next morning I went to get our original room which was at the HRH Tower with two queen beds so they did give us that room, we got there and we went straight to the pool after where we spent all day, the pool was great by the way, then we went back to the hotel and showered and got ready to go out we went to Vanity a night club at the Hard Rock Hotel which was nice we got out of there late and gambled for a few hours at the craps tables lost a few hundred but had lots of fun! we got back to the hotel room around 8 in the morning slept for a few hours and went back to the casino to play and hung out at the strip the whole day bye the third night we slept there I kept waking up because I was very itchy and a kept scratching from all the itching all over my body I asked some of my friends and they said they felt the same the fourth night we were sleeping there It got worse everyone was itching and scratching and my friend even had bumps that look like a rash to me it was BED BUGS!! the next morning i told the supervisor in the front desk he gave me his card his name was Mathew Risher we were already checking out beacuse our flight left that morning back to LA so I wasn't able to make a complaint so he told me to call Risk Mgmt which I did two days ago I left a message because when they transfered me no one answered and I still haven't received a call back. This Hotel was actually a good hotel for the pool and gambling but the rooms having Bed Bugs really ruined it for me and especially because no one did anything about it. I planned on going back in the last week of August but now I will definetly choose another hotel and I suggest that if anyone does stay here, dont let the BED BUGS bite!!

HRH? More like Eta Rho Eta. If you like being surrounded by drunken rapist frat boys with faux-prison neck tattoos, then this is the hotel for you. Or if your idea of "luxury resort" is to be treated like errant children by heavy handed staff, then don't let me talk you out of the Hard Rock Hotel. All others, avoid.

Two stars instead of one for the poolside cabanas. The cabanas are great, but reserving one is a chore. Every step of the way, the process is riddled with staff giving you attitude and telling you to call later or that it's too late to get one ("getting a cabana is like winning the lottery" -- actual lame quote from Jim, the beach club manager) or come down in person or ask someone else or "they're filling up fast, better get one quick!". In reality, there's never a shortage, and it's easy to walk up and rent a cabana at any time during pool hours.

It's all about hassling the customer so you can feel some illusion of staying somewhere "exclusive".

One of the worse hotels I have ever stayed at in Las Vegas.  Per many of the other complaints, the staff is lame.  just incompetent.  STAY SOME WHERE ELSE.  go there for a show but again stay some where else!

Not too impressed thus far. Looks like a nice hotel until my girlfriend and I went back up to our room for bed to find our sheets were dirty and pillow case had dried blood spots on them. Took house keeping over an hour to come up and deliver new bedding . Very frustrating after a long days drive and wanting to get some rest
We stayed in the newer towers think called HHR and the place is amazing.  The stay was always super nice and friendly and we had a blast.

I stayed here for 8-9 days and I really think it's the best off the strip hotel to stay at. It gives you the full vegas feel without it being too crowded or overwhelming with the smell of smoke and everyone is super nice. 

The older part of the hotel has really spacious rooms, enough to throw party's in, and the bath tubs are perfect for sharing. Our neighbors had a jacuzzi!!! 

I had a few problems with housekeeping but when we checked out they gave us the resort fee back to us on the days we had problems.

Overall this place is awesome and I would come back again.

Paid in full for a 3 night stay in advance for my son's birthday. When he arrived, the hotel was "oversold" and his reserved suite was not available. I left a message & sent an email asking for an explanation. No response. I've never stayed here but it appears they need to work on customer service

I expected much more from this hotel based on the good reviews, but our experience fell short from what others experienced.  We checked into an HRH suite on Monday around 3PM. When requesting a non smoking room the lady at the front desk said we could have a better view if we checked into a smoking room. Being non smokers we opted for the non smoking room so our suite did not have much of a view. We were very excited to stay at this hotel since it was our first time and we have pretty much stayed at every hotel on the strip. For starters, there were many things not working in our room, the shower being one of them. For clarity, the hand held shower head did spray water out of it, but it was broken on the part of it that connects it to the shower head causing water to spray out the side of it, we were unable to move it and had to shower standing in the corner of the shower. The overhead shower head did not work at all. The jukebox everyone talks about did not work at all. The cable tv had minimal channels that worked, the others had poor reception and did not come in. The sheets on the bed were ripped up and had holes in the side, the room was "clean" but had marks on the lampshades and the walls, and a weird greasy handprint on the glass in front of the tv in the bedroom area.  
The bed was comfortable and had no bedbugs which was a plus. The bathtub was also huge and I appreciated being able to take a bath in the morning when we discovered the shower not working. 
My husband was in Las Vegas for work and while we were here we had to have a package sent to the hotel which we picked up at the business center. When we arrived to pick up the package the rude lady at the front told us "we charge for packages and you owe us $65" when my husband questioned "$65?" She did not explain why we were being charged this amount. While looking on the actual hard rock casino business center website, we were overcharged for picking up the package. The package was in a small 12X12 box, weighing 18 pounds and had been held by the casino for less than 3 hours. The price quoted online would be $45, so that was a little odd and we were not thrilled but needed this package so my husband could finish his job out in Vegas. 

This casino is far from the strip, 1.6 miles to be exact, so for us it was walking distance but if you're not used to it, may be a little far. 
The hotel is filled with rock star memorabilia, some of it is really neat, and some of it is really gross, like Jerry Garcias hair! Who wants to see that?! 
All in all we were unhappy about a few things in our room and the service at the business center and probably would not pick this hotel again in the future. For the money we spent it is definitely worth it to look into other hotels on the strip that are more accommodating and have friendlier staff.

Awesome hotel, great casino, fun club.  The beds are super cozy. Seriously!  Great spot for the younger crowd.  Don't miss the pool.  And check out the restaurant Simon.  The owner once won as a challenger on Iron Chef America.

We stayed here for the Mountain West Conference (quite convenient walk to the games!). We bought a Groupon deal for a 2-night stay over the weekend with $40 voucher in food and slots, so it was a good deal. 

There's not really any fast food places to eat at inside the Hard Rock, just FYI. 

The rooms were decent. The only problem we had was with the TV.. our remote control didn't work. But it's a nice TV lol

hotel not very family friendly

rooms are comfortable but no coffee or hot drinks available nor complementary water(should be proposed for the price)
pool is nice but not quiet

wow...where do i begin?? is there an option for zero or negative stars?? 

OK, first day we were booked into a handicapped room, no big deal, BUT i feel that they hotel should have upgraded us since we booked our room a month in advance and they should have kept a room for us. whatever. the girl at the front desk was a little snobby, but bad customer service is something I'm used to. 

second day was fine. 

third day, my husband woke up to find that all the money (about $1500 cash) was missing from his wallet along with my driver's license. he immediately went down to the security desk and reported that someone had been in our room while we were sleeping and stolen the contents of his wallet. security was very blase and really didn't care about our plight and stated there was really nothing they could do. wow. we certainly weren't expecting a hand out, but it would have been nice if they had at least pretended to care. 

the rest of the day was tried to make the best of it, went out with what little money i had in my bank account and pretty much just walked the strip and ate cheap appetizers, because that's all we could afford. 

that same night we returned around 1am and i noticed my jewelry box had been overturned on the bed. we looked around the room and saw all of our suitcases had been ransacked. they had stolen about $2000 worth of jewelry, my husband's new clothes and even his new pack of BOXERS! we immediately went to security and they came up to our room.we asked if we should call the police and the security individual told us the police were already involved and would be contacting us regarding our statements that we had given him. the whole time he was in our room he was just as blase as the first gentleman, joked about it, and said it was our fault for not utilizing the safe. we then realized that when the first incident happened, they had stolen the cash, license, and our ROOM KEY. so they had the balls to return the next night and really clean us out. 

i feel that if the first security person had cared or helped us AT ALL they could have re-keyed our room and the second incident wouldn't have happened, but again THEY DID NOT CARE. 

the next day, we went to a manager for a follow up, but were given the run around and more attitude as if we were bothering them by getting burglarized. while we were speaking to the manager, we saw a cockroach on the floor that was at least 6" long, which the manager discreetly disposed of. he then gave us a different room after we told him that we had to barricade the door with chairs and slept with one eye open fearing we could literally be attacked at any moment. he acted like he was really doing us a favor by offering safety in his hotel. 

we finally left this god awful place Monday and called that afternoon for an update. we were told that since we didn't file a police report, there was nothing they could do....if you remember, the security guard told us the police were already involved and would be contacting us regarding our statements, A TOTAL COMPLETE LIE! why would he lie to us?? 

all this was reported to hotel complaints to no avail. 

we took up the issue with risk management we were told that 'an employee was not involved in the break in'...um OK? we never suggested that but now i think we'd be right to be suspicious. when i kept asking the risk management guy why no one cared and why NOTHING was being done and why an apology wasn't offered HE HUNG UP ON ME!! great customer service. wow. 

THEN i check my bank acct a day later to find that 3 more nights had been charged on my acct!! when i called to complain and have it removed, they again, offered no apology and had yet another attitude. 

i have never been treated so poorly in las vegas or ever. the whole weekend was absolutely unbelievable, just an absolute nightmare that is still ongoing because the HRH refuses to take responsibility for the gross lack of proper security, cust service, and follow through. what are all those cameras there for if we have to sleep with chairs up against the door?? 

un-freaking-believable!! 

and the icing on the cake is that we were there for 4 days and our room was not cleaned ONCE!! are you kidding me??
Love this place for penny slots. I would not have expected this from this place but so far the loosest slots at least based on my experience.

We come to Las Vegas for business and pleasure at least 3 to 6 times a year.
We usually stay at The Bellagio or Mandalay Bay ( MB) as my significant other ( SO) is a Platinum MLife member for years.  The hotels  are both very different, but we enjoy them both.

In September 2016 my SO stayed at MB and was very disappointed that his host. Nick Gordon had left for The Hard Rock Hotel & Casino just prior to his stay.  He was not pleased with his replacement MLife host and really liked Nick so, this last trip 7-10 Oct 2016 he booked with Nick Gordon at The Hard Rock Hotel & Casino.  I was a little hesitant as we had never stayed there before and I knew it catered to a younger crowd.

We were there for The RISE Lantern Festival NE of Las Vegas and had a blast.  I highly recommend it.  We got to the hotel about 11 pm Friday.  It was hopping and as I expected it was a younger crowd and the music was quite loud.  I wasn't feeling well and the line to check in was long, but Nick showed up almost immediately and whisked us away to the VIP check- in area.  What a difference!!! Luxurious check in area which was quiet and has a separate entrance for valet parking.  It took us no time to check in and I really enjoyed checking out all the music and costume memorabilia well displayed throughout the hotel.  It is something the hotel is particularly known for besides the great live concerts and RxRehab Pool\/Party venue.  Nick offered me Spa services, but I passed this time.  I will definitely check it out and review it for you then.

We had a Standard Suite on the 14th floor ( perfect for two) with a view of the Wheel,  Strip and pool area below.  The suite was nicely appointed with a huge, comfortable L shaped couch.  The living area was separated by two separate sliding doors to the bedroom which had 2 extraordinarily fluffy and comfortable queen size beds.  A glass partition with a pull back curtain separates the bedroom from the nicely appointed bathroom.  The tub was huge and big enough for two large people as was the shower.  The shower head had a rain style shower head and a separate shower head with pull out handle nozzle with great water pressure.  There was also a built in large seat.
The convenience store next to the VIP area has milk bath salts in a large glass container.  I highly recommend them.

 I was sick and ordered room service at least 4 times while we were there.  Everything I tried was excellent even the chicken noodle soup was fantastic and I was very grateful they carried it on the menu.   
Don't miss the chocolate covered strawberries on the dessert menu.  They were so fresh and decadent!  The room service menu was very large and available 24\/7.  Larger than either the Bellagio or the Mandalay Bay as well as fresher and MUCH faster delivery!  The service staff were all friendly, responsive and professional.

Nick had sent up a special guitar box and huge cheese and fruit platter ( see pictures).  Everything was so fresh and delicious.  The cheeses were very high quality and there were more beautiful chocolate covered strawberries!  We snacked all weekend!
