Nick checked us in for Fri-Monday am which gave us a lot of leeway as to our departure time so we didn't feel rushed in the least and left late Sunday well after traffic.
Nick made our stay so special.  We felt like we were his only clients!  The VIP suites were exceptionally quiet.  There was some louder music coming from the pool area during the day.  If you plan to sleep in then I'd bring some ear plugs for comfort.

I napped several times on the large suite L shaped couch and wow was it comfortable.
The weekend was so relaxing for me.  My SO gambled to his hearts content and made enough points to earn a Gold card.
Nick checked on him often to see if he needed anything.  He was so professional and  efficient without hovering and always available.

On Sunday I noticed that the Casino seemed a lot quieter after many of the weekend crowd had departed.  I was thrilled to find out that Nobu, one of my favorite resturant's was on site and Nick made our reservations.  The food was fantastic.  I think better than Nobu at Caesar's and felt more intimate.  Nick came in and said Hi and asked if everything was to our liking. 

We both travel a lot for business and pleasure both domestic and internationally.
I put our stay and Nick's service at the top of my hotel experiences.  I'm so glad we decided to stay with Nick and give The Hard Rock Hotel & Casino a try!   We will be back soon!

Oh dear, lesson learned....I booked a special at the Hardrock fro $41 a night for 3 nights....well, we weren't allowed to check in until 5:30....yea, 5:30....so to make up for it, we were bumped up to a poolside room instead of mountain view....well, my bill ended up being $324!!!!! I may be bad at math....but not that bad....$41 a night does not equal $300+!!!! Not only did they charge us for the upgrade, but apparently the soap,shampoo and conditioner are for sale....not complimentary like every other hotel....even Motel5!!!! Yes, $50 mini bar charge for soap and shampoo!!! I will NOT be back at the Hardrock unless someone else is paying and dealing with this absurd hotel!
Should have learned my lesson last time....
The pool in spring and summer is off the heez.  Rooms aren't huge, but you shouldn't be spending time in your room.  The Center Bar is money; Nobu is ridiculous; the pool and cabanas are perfect.

If I could give zero stars I would. Upon checkout I was surprised to find nearly $20 in DAILY extra charges for "service fees." After waiting in line at checkout to ask about these charges, the front desk person said these were automatic daily "resort fees" added to every guest's bill even if they prepaid their stay in full on their booking site. The fees supposedly entitled me to a free shuttle, gym usage and long distance calls during my stay. Too bad no one explained any of this when I checked in so I did not use any of these services. When I explained to the manager, Nataya, that it's abnormal for a hotel to add these extra fees, and that no one had explained them to me at arrival, she flatly stated that I should take up the issue with my credit card. Apparently these charges are explained in the fine print when you sign in so I was stuck with them. WOW! I have never been treated so shabbily by any hotel, far less a top-tier Starwood property. What a crappy way to end my first and LAST stay at the Hard Rock. All I can say is that I hope the $40 in charges were worth a pissed off customer who will never return and will convince as many of his friends on Facebook, Twitter and Yelp to avoid this place like the plague.

Stayed at the hard rock for a vacation w\/ friends. I so enjoyed this hotel. The pool is a great scene and it had plenty of available chairs during the weekdays. The rooms have such fun decor and the staff (although appears very vegas) was always helpful and polite. We grabbed quick bites quite a few times at the Pink Taco onsite and i really enjoyed the Cal-Mex fare they offered. We also grabbed lunch at the cafeteria a couple of times, but nothing stands out about the food there. Our stay also included passes to Rehab Sunday w\/ seems to be a hot ticket in town. The hotel was a bit distance from the other hotels that seemed to have all the other attractions but we were able to cab it there without any problems. The front desk staff here is just great to us!

If you want posh\/classy, this is not the place for you.  We went for my boyfriend's work and everything was free for us.
The rooms were okay, but for me what happens on the first floor is paramount and of the utmost importance.  There wasn't really a classy bar to sit at.. very geared towards the football crowd.  Rowdy crowd.
The pool was nice, but definitely not the spa- laid -back experience. Young crowd waiting for a party to happen.  
My boyfriend and I went to the the pool and left his new cell poolside next to our chairs.  
We discovered an hour after we got back into the room that we had left it.  
The 3 boys that were sitting in our chairs, when we went back to the pool, didn't own up to taking the phone.  It was after we played a trick on them (my boyfriend rang the phone and I kept a close watch) that they then turned in the phone to us.  
A bit disheartening...

Definitely exceeded my expectations. I booked my stay at the Hard Rock Hotel through Expedia and got a killer deal. For the price, this is probably the most modern and well-maintained room you can get in the area. 

I've seen older reviews and people complaining and posting pictures of rooms with outdated and ghetto looking bathrooms and such, but perhaps I was lucky to have gotten a super modern and sleek washroom. The sinks and shower had an extremely unique touch to it and reflected the monochromatic theme greatly. Even the telephone had received a modern upgrade and was a sweet low-profile cordless docking phone, a huge difference from the old yellowed corded phones you see in most hotels, even in the big-names along the Strip.

Pretty much everything was spotless except for a few unwipeable smudges on the couch and a few black streaks along the white ceiling, but I really can't complain when every other hotel I've experienced within the sub-$150 price range have, for the most part, been MUCH worse.

From my years of vacationing in Vegas, the Hard Rock hotel has surprised me the most and has provided the best bang for my buck. For a budget friendly option and those who don't mind being a few blocks away from the strip, I would very much recommend staying here!

I've played at the casino at the Hard Rock and was not impressed.  Pretentious is a nice word for the employees and the trash that frequents the place.  Simply google Ludicrous pool fight to see the type of trash and thugs they allow in to this supposedly "up-scale" hotel.

My husband and I had a great stay-cation last year for my birthday so we came back a 2nd time to the HRH for our 11th Anniversary.  We enjoyed the comfortable beds with lots of pillows and the nice-sized shower in our Paradise Tower room.  We upgraded to a corner room over-looking the Rehab pool and watched quite a party from our stunning floor-to-ceiling windows.  All of the staff from the time we checked-in to the time we checked-out we very knowledgeable and willing to help with any question we had. "The King" at Mr. Lucky's cafe was amazing at 2am after enjoying the newly-renovated Center Bar. We'll definitely be back for another celebration!

I'm going to go ahead and give this place a 5 stars. Every time I come here, I get great service; never a bad moment. 

I love how this hotel isn't on the strip. The vibe of this place is non judge mental and everyone here is down for a good time. 

The rooms are kick butt and rocker style. Just how I like it. The pool area is also great! 

Will keep returning!

The staff makes the place, old Vegas - Rock and Roll style. Stayed in the original tower - room overlooking the pool and loved it! Sexy cozy decor - easy access - definitely staying again. Be prepared for the noise and fast vibe downstairs - takes about a day to get used too.

What a disappointment. Came to see Def Leppard for my birthday with my 15-year-old son. Paid a premium to stay close to the venue. This place is misleading. Remote! Their "shuttle" operates between 10 and 5 and dumps the lucky 20 who can get on in a dirt lot behind Fashion Mall. Gym? Not if you're under 18. Wi-fi? Doesn't work on the 11th floor. Neither did our shower. They did fix the shower but it messed up our morning. Manager Mark was nice but his "solution" was to waive the resort fees- so we basically didn't have to pay for what they failed to provide, anyway. Do not stay here. The rock memorabilia isn't worth having your trip - especially a special occasion - ruined. You'll have a better time, and you'll probably pay less for it, on the strip.

Came to visit just to see the memorabilia on the walls. Was not disappointed, almost felt like I was in a museum! Many instruments, and cool outfits. The staff was nice and didn't mind me snooping around to take photos in the tower lobby lol.
Love their beds!!!!! Never rated a bed b4 but omgoshhh even the pillows R super comfy!!!! MEMORY FOAM!!!! Can u say 10 starsssss

First time being treated like an idiot. They did not accept my coupon for a special gift from Hard Rock Rewards. Then no one in the casino knew where the shuttle to Fashion Mall was--only the valet guy knew where the shuttle was. And then to top it off, there was no New Years 2013 pin. I will be contacting the international office.

Smaller casino, great music.

The Pool is the only place for Sundays.  Get a Cabana for like $250 or $300, it can accomodate 8 and has a locking fridge, cable, a phone, and chairs and lounges.  Worth it.

Drinks are marginal at the pool so pre-party or sneak in a bottle or six.

Hot bodies, cool waters, recline in peace.

We've stayed here a couple times, HRH tower. Can't beat the price. It's always fun to wake up to rock stars. We were bummed to find out Chemo is no longer at the Circle Bar, he was our favorite bar tender.

Beds are comfortable and restaurants are great. It's a good atmosphere for a younger crowd. Not recommended for kids, but there aren't a lot of hotels in vegas you'd want to bring your kids too. Great place to stay for a quick overnight trip.

After a long 3 day weekend in Vegas we decided we were way too tired to attempt the drive home to LA. We did a quick rate check and Hard Rocks were good and Sunday low. We arrived at check in and thought we hit the jackpot when the girl working the desk handed us a note saying she was putting us in a huge suite instead of the regular room we had booked ** 5 Stars for her being a cool chick! The room itself was beautiful, separate living and bedroom areas, massive multiperson shower etc, etc. 

My problems with this place are: 

The Casino because, its tiny and lame, its the Casino that nobody I know ever seems to win at. Its filled with puking 21 year olds in affliction gear that make talking texting teenagers in movie theaters seem like a pleasant dream. The restaurant selection inside is awful, no matter what you go with, your basically choosing the lesser of two evils, ie. Denny's vs. IHOP, who wants either one? Not me ever, and especially not in Vegas. 

And the POOL. Since we were there on a Sunday we decided to check out the infamous Rehab, its free for guests and the non Rehab side of the pool was filled with the little screaming kids, who brings their kids to Vegas, especially to the Hardrock on Rehab Sunday no less, I don't know and honestly I don't think I want to... but I digress........10 minutes and two ridiculously over priced Mai Tais later we realized we were better off with the screaming kids. At least they are kids and their screams make sense. The rehab side was filled with the same 21 year old douches that had been puking in the casino the night before, pounding more shots to ensure more puking and scantily clad drunk girls, which I don't have a problem with at all, I love to see my girls having a good time, what I do mind is a girl in a thong with half a chichi hanging out screaming at the top of her lungs "OH MY GOD BITCH" and "AAAAAAAH I THINK SOMEBODIES TRYING TO GRAB MY ASS" really? really? really? no really? I know your drunk but you were probably sober when you slid into that dental floss- it didn't occur to you then that wearing it to a pool full of drunk men would be a problem? 

At first I thought I was just getting old and crotchety, but then I realized, I love to party, I love drinking, and I even love drunks. I just like drunks that can handle their liquor and still have a good time. Being at the Hardrock is like when you have a party at your place and one of your friends brings some blow hard date that nobody knows, he runs his mouth all night, brags about how many shots he did last weekend, shows off his tribal arm band tattoos and then he throws up all over your living room floor. Nobody likes that guy, He's a total buzz kill and so is the Hardrock.

This review is for the hotel room it's self!!! We booked a deluxe "suite" room. The room is very pretty especially the bathroom. BUT!! The carpet in the entire place was filthy , there was a make-up stain on the bed sheets, and a lipstick stain on the curtain. I don't know if I was going crazy but my legs were itching in those covers. The TV volume keep going out, and the lights in the room just completely stopped working from 3am until 7am. We originally booked a two nights stay, but ended up checking out early !! Don't book here!

Checked in late due to delayed flight. Got to the hotel and was told we couldn't get the deluxe King room we reserved over a month and a half ago. Had to either have a smoking room or two queens. Ended up with two queens room. Had to get two sets of keys and have security come up just to get into the room. Apparently you have to put the key in just right and then pull they key out as slowly as possible for the door to open. 

Once in the room the beds were uncomfortable and hard as a rock. The bathroom was run down. Shower curtain was completely wrinkled, the floor looked dirty, the drain to the shower was broken in and the wall was exposed around the shower head. Once you got the door closed you got to see how the painter who painted the room didn't care as there was paint splashes and smears all over the door. 

Went for an anniversary trip and paid $200 a night to have a deluxe room. This room isn't worth that price with how poorly the room is. And we have a view of all the construction they are doing outside as well. 

Will never come back.

Casino with FREE PARKING and 5 minute ride or 20 minute walk to the strip! 

As a local i often go for concerts so it's nice to be able to park for free. It's also conveniently located across the street from a few great restaurants and bars such as ferraros and hofbrauhaus as well as a walgreens for any toiletry needs at non-strip prices! 

Restaurants and bars are really convenient and pretty affordable as far as vegas goes. The Goose Island pub is a great spot for drinks before a show as well as the center bar! You can also snag an inexpensive beer in their pizza by the slice shop. And of course dunk in donuts never fails late at night!  

Pools are awesome in the summer, they also have pool concerts in the evenings during the concert series. I prefer the regular pool over Rehab.

My husband and I have stayed at the Hard Rock previously and had a good experience so we decided to try it again, this time in a suite in the HRH Tower. When we arrived we were told that the king was not available and we were offered two queens. Also, a fridge was not available in the room. I need the fridge for medical reasons and was really upset because I had made several calls beforehand to ensure this would not be a problem. Then we arrive in our room and discover filthy sheets speckled with sauce and other food particles. I requested the sheets changed but it did not happen. They just remade the bed and replaced some of the very bad items. After making the discovery I requested a new comforter so I don't have to sleep in filth and have been waiting over 30 minutes. To make it worse the attitude from the front desk implies I am overly demanding for expecting a clean bed. It's 10:30 and I just want to go to sleep. So much for this being an easy place to stay while traveling for business. If you value cleanliness do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere.

Worst hotel experience ever! The room we booked was suppose to be for a king sized bed. Their website said check-in was at 3. The lady at the check-in desk said that our room wouldn't be ready til 5 because check-ins from 3 to 5 which was bs because when we talked to the manager she said that she shouldn't of said that. That's not all though. The iron was missing and the tv didn't work. They're lucky we didn't come to vegas to watch tv. It still would've been nice to be able to watch a little tv while we were in the room though. On top of that you have to walk the whole casino just to get to your room. The rooms were allright, but I honestly would've rather stayed at motel 6 because of all the inconviences I had here. At least their rooms are ready when you get there and they have tvs that work.

This joint would have gotten more stars if we hadn't seen the PUSH hookas there after they messed up our IVs.  From now on anytime I see them somewhere when I'm in Vegas I'm giving that place a low score.  Take care of your guests by keeping these f***ing tricks off your property!  Nobody wants IVs from hookas.  If we want an IV we want people who can really do IVs.  I'm still mad about the money they took from us.  HOOKAS.  Hard Rock keep the PUSH HOOKAS out and people will like you more.

Great casino and hotel!  Lots of food to eat, lots of games to play and lots of music to hear.  I love the decor....pictures of bands that played there along with memorabilia such as guitars, jackets, etc etc.  This is a happening hotel in the summer where everyone attends the pool parties. Love this place.
There was no air conditioning in the room.  We had to leave at 1 AM because we couldn't take the heat anymore!  They charged the full rate for only staying at the hotel for 2 hours!

I can only review the casino and this is one of my favorites. I love to hangout and listen to music while playing the slots here. I think the music is what draws me in. It's clean and I've never had any issues. The staff has always been friendly and I have a great time. I try to make sure to stop in while in town.

Wir haben das Hotel für unglaubliche 25 $ pro Nacht gebucht. Die Qualität, Ausstattung und Sauberkeit der Zimmer ist auf höchstem Niveau. Das Hotel selbst ist riesengroß und besteht aus drei verschiedenen Türmen. Alles in allem ein wirklich Spitzenklasse Hotel!

It was my first trip to Las Vegas and I got a good deal on Groupon for this hotel. It was a cool hotel with lots of music memorabilia around. Our room was a little bit bigger than expected(which was a good thing) but our restroom sink was slow at draining. I had seen reviews about construction going and i figured since I got a Groupon deal I would get the bottom of the barrel rooms and here chainsaws all night but I did not hear one thing during my 2 night stay. The girl(wish I could remember her name!!!) at check in was super sweet! It was a great hotel. I would book again in the future. Only thing to complain about was that we weren't allowed in the pool because it was raining AND it closes early :\/

Well, I hadnt been to the hard rock in a long time and I went to see a friend who was recently hired there.   This place has come a long way since I last saw it.  The HRH tower is gorgeous along with the pool, special valet and VIP check in.  Its Nice enough to compete with some of the nicer strip properties while at the same time not completely over the top to seem snobbish like a lot of the elite properties.     The staff was incredibly nice to me even when I wasnt with my friend.  They also look like they have an incredibly fun season ahead of them - signing motley crew for a residency.. I am definitely going to that one!   The Joint an awesome place to watch a show or any event for that matter... Overall I was thoroughly impressed with how far they have come... and it looks like they are going to continue the trend of putting money into the place.... cant wait to see the changes!

A well themed resort with mediocre service.

***ROOM***
I was happy with our pool-view room in the Casino tower. Our standard room was pretty spacious (500 sq. ft.?) with a few noteworthy amenities: an iHome and a bed as fluffy as clouds. The room could have skipped out on the portrait of some rockstar, who kept freaking me out each time I caught a glimpse of it.

We booked the place with the intention to recuperate from our weekend at EDC. Instead, I felt like we were part of the Rehab party. We were fine with that too... it kept the party going. Even with our balcony door closed, we could still feel the vibration of the bass from the pool party. :)

***SERVICE***
Before even entering our rooms, I had already received subpar service --
My hotel package came with a comp bottle of hard A + $40 food and drink credit. While checking in, the receptionist was ready to send me on my merry way with just the room keys, until I had to ask for my vouchers. Though he corrected the mistake, he seemed the least bit apologetic, and even judgmental, like I was freeloading off them... um no! just asking for what I paid! I would not even have to ask if I had received it in the first place!

The second day, we slept through "Tidy Up" time, so I called Guest Services to replenish our tissues, amenities, and towels stock later that night. Housekeeping came 10 minutes later with towels, and a bag with two sets of amenities, but minus the soap. I never saw the box of tissues either D: I guess I'll be better prepared with my own amenities next time. 

***OVERALL*** 
Great view of the pool and back of the strip, especially at night, but this is the last time I am booking a standard room here on my own free will. I would be open to staying at a HRH Tower Suite on a future visit. From pictures, the Suite looks similar to the ones at Vdara. 

Note: Stay away from this resort if you are looking for peace and quiet  in Vegas. :)

The pool alone is worth 8.5 stars.  

Can't say I've had any luck in the casino -- but, it attracts a young, fun crowd.  I'd go elsewhere for serious gambling, but it's a good base of operations to start any night...

I stayed here about 6 months ago with a few friends, and was greatly surprised as to how nice the room was.

We were making a last minute trip and went on Vegas.com to find the lowest rate for a decent hotel and decided on Hard Rock, and I'm glad that we did!

Otter than being off of the strip, I would not hesitate to stay here again!

Sports book????    Not. 

It is mid April, there is a major convention in town, tonight there are Hockey finals, basketball finals, and tons of baseball going on. And yet, at 8pm the sports book screens go dark and the place closes down!!! It is only 8pm!!! I sure am glad that I have MLB.TV on my computer because the rest of the casino can't get all the sports stations unless they are on local Las Vegas cable TV.  Do not go after work if sports is what you are interested in. 

The Mexican food at Pink Taco is the saving grace.

NEVER AGAIN. PLEASE READ. Hard rock isn't what it once was.  Arrived here to a horrible Casino atmosphere. Out of control drunks everywhere. People not wearing shoes or socks in the casino floor! Don't get me wrong. It's Vegas but I couldn't believe the trash allowed in the hotel\/casino. We ended up upgrading our room (for a charge of corse.) Decided to just spend the night in our room and not deal with downstairs. Got comfortable and turned the TV to find out it didn't work. Called the front desk and was told that engineering would be right up. 30 minutes or so later we got a knock at the door. He explained that the TV was out and that he would change it out the next day for us. Noon was best time for us as we knew we wouldn't be in the room while they did it. The next day we went on with our day to other hotels. Came back to our room to find our room cleaned up and the New TV on and the replacment has clearly been done. Now here it is... While my wife is getting ready in the bathroom and I'm in the shower my wife sees in the mirror a man standing in our room. Yes. The guy from engineering is now standing in our living room at 7:45PM for no reason at all. We heard no knock and no "hello?!" "Are you there?!" Nothing at all. From the fear on her face I could clearly see we weren't alone and came bursting out of the shower in the nude to great this hotel employee, intruder in our room. He offered no apology and said he knocked. He said he was checking up on the TV because he had read on a report it wasn't replaced. I knew that was a lie as the TV was brand new, working, was left on and was clearly replaced. I told him it was fine and asked him to leave. I called the front desk to let them know about the incident and they again offered no apologies and offered me a $50 good credit. I couldn't believe it. I was shocked. Here we have a hotel employee not only come into the room unannounced but is found starring at a women in the mirror. My wife makes out what it is in shock and doesn't move or anything for a while to have him just staring at her getting ready and the front desk manager doesn't think this is a issue and offers half a dinner for it? I walked down to the HRH front desk to explain again and they also said they couldn't do anything. I asked to speak to security. I was told if I talked to security that I could no longer talk to front desk about this incident and they couldn't offer us anything. Seeing that all they offered me was $50 food credit they weren't doing anything in the first place. I asked to speak to security. After calling them to the front desk twice a gentleman (Jeff) showed up. I explained the situation to him. He said I could open a formal complaint but the choice was mine. I don't see why they wouldn't look into this themselves without my complaint but ok. We each made gave a written statement and were then offered a phone to speak to a manager. Stephanie who was the manager on duty told me she was going to comp our upgrade of $35 a night and also the $25 a night resort fees. She couldn't comp the room charges for us because we booked through a 3rd party. I didn't book the room. My wife did. For my birthday so I didn't know at the time but that wasn't true. We booked it on the Hard Rock website. 
I called the day after we got home to asked about what charges we had. Our room was booked with a credit card and the charge of $172.51 was already charged but when we arrived I used my debit card. Now my debit card was also charged $226 plus another $6 as well as $85 for a dinner and a $52 charge for brunch.  I spoke to the manager on duty Tod. Explained everything to him and that Stephanie said I booked through a 3rd party otherwise she would have comp'd the stay and he said he didn't think the TV not working or having a employee walk in on us in the shower was a good enough reason to comp our stay. He said he would comp the two $35 upgrade fees and the two $25 resort fees. He had no idea what the $6 charge was and offered no explanation for it. He seemed very upset to even be on the phone with me. He explained that he had the power to comp the stay but felt he didn't think it was deserved. He said he would charge me only the $172.51 and I I had a issue with it I could contact David Rodrigez from the legal department. I was told I would get a email from Tod. 12 hours later I have received nothing at all and still have all pending charges (over $369) on my debit card as well as the $172.51 from my credit card. 

:SHORT VERSION:
So in short if you want to have a hotel employee have the right to watch you in the nude, watch him not only walk into your room unannounced but also sit and stair at you in the nude at 7:45pm then book your stay in Vegas here at hard rock. Good luck. I hope it doesn't traumatize you or your loved one like it has mine.

We always stay at the Hard Rock and usually love it, however not this time. Every person we talked with was rude and not good customer service at all. No one was opening door for you as you enter. Nothing like it was in the past. Looked a little run down too. The fridge in the room would not open. No robes. As hotel guest in the past we always got in to Rehab this time after a mile long hike down to the parking garage, they told us we only got a discount to get in? Not to mention staff all rude again. Super disappointing as this was one of our favorite places to go in the past because of great customer service and the pool party. Going to try a new spot next time.

The hotel is on the  flight path of Las Vegas Airport:  endless noise of flying over planes. 
Construction is on going and  noise is loud 16 hours a day,  
Beautiful large rooms, terrible mattresses, being overused and tilted. you can not hold your self on it,  will slide down.    bathrooms from 1980's a bit old.
Takes mile long walk on hallway to get to your room, Too much smoke in the hallways from unregulated smoking, Terrible diner on the first floor. Good service every where,
Too far from the strip.  Cost a bit back forward all day on a taxi

Had a great experience here this weekend. The only hiccup that we had was at check in there was no clear "check in" line. Both signs said "check out" everyone was confused and waiting in the wrong line. Rehab was awesome, the pool was great!!

One Saturday night, we decided to go on a last minute Las Vegas trip. So, we searched around Priceline to find a good deal. We planned on checking in on Sunday and checking out on Monday in March. Lo and behold, we found a Priceline deal for $29 for Hard Rock. Even though, we knew it was not on the Strip, we couldn't pass up on a $29 deal. We knew that the check in time was 3 PM, but the last few times we have been to Vegas, most hotels have let us check in early especially when it's not peak time. We got to the hotel around 2 PM and when we attempted to check in, they said the rooms were not yet available. Boo. However, they did let us "check in" and we just had to pick up our keys at 3. (There is a separate line just to pick up the keys so you do not need to stand in the check in line again). 

Our hotel room was nice but the bathrooms needs renovations. We saw cracks on the bathroom walls. The parking lot is not too far from the rooms, which is great as there are some hotels (ahem, MGM) which makes you walk miles from the parking lot. It is a little far from the Strip and I definitely would not recommend walking as it seems a little seedy. We found out that there is a shuttle between the hotel and the Strip, but it only runs until 5 PM, so we had to drive. Overall, not a bad experience for a last minute trip. Oh, for those of you using Priceline, the rate does not include resort fee and tax.

This is my favorite hotel, period!  Why, yes, because I am a neighborhood rock star -- but also because it is hands down an awesome hotel.  I stay in the Jimmi Hendrix room (yes, that Jimmi with an "i" at the end) anytime I can ...  the pool (with a beach theme where a gradient of beach sand leads into the water) is awesome -- the club, although they rename it everytime, is even more spectacular (I used to go back in the days when it was called "Baby's").  

I will caution ... if you want to gamble, this is not the place.  This is the place to spend money on alcohol, laying out at the pool, foodery, and concerts (Just recently checked out Wolfmother there).  It was awesome!

Great stay at the Hard Rock. The staff have been helpful and friendly. The room was very clean and spacious.  I don't typically stay "off-strip" but this is a hotel I will definitely return to. There is a complimentary shuttle to the fashion show mall which is on the strip. The hotel has free and convenient parking and on-site meal choices are just right.  The Nirvana pool is family friendly and features a "sand" beach that was so fun for the kids. Nice cabanas and pool offerings as well.

Our stay at the Hard Rock Hotel was fantastic! I didn't pay for the upgraded room size which in my opinion turned out to be a good choice. While our friends who did upgrade for $50 a night had larger rooms, they over looked a parking garage and my husband and I had a beautiful pool side view. The pools were fantastic!! I never thought I'd enjoy being outside all day in 117 degree heat in July, but being in the water all day was so relaxing! Did I say their pools are fantastic?! We didn't go to the "club" pool but took it easy at the other two pools. There was one day the pools were closed for Warp Tour so I asked the front desk for a resort fee credit which they gladly took off our room charge. We went to a different hotel pool that day which was a nice change of scenery. We had fun at the hotel casino and late night dance party and really enjoyed the restaurants! We ate breakfast twice at Mr. Lucky's 24\/7 and had dinner at Pink Taco and Culinary Drop Out. The hotel and restaurants staff was nice and the rooms were clean!

Completely loved this hotel!
Everyone from the front desk people to the awesome housekeeper Dasiy was amazing.
Checking in was a breeze and so was checking out. The rooms were clean and exactly like the images shown on the site.
The food was extremely overpriced but hey, your in Vegas and it's in a hotel, what do you expect.
The only thing that annoyed me was on my last day we had called to find out about getting a cabana and the lady on the phone (i wish i remembered her name) said that the pools are going to be closed all day for a private event. Well when we were leaving the hotel for something we noticed that the pool was open and so were the cabanas. Needless to say I was pissed as I wanted to do that for my birthday and since we were told it was closed we had made other plans.
Other than that misshap this place was awesome.

Absolutely horrible is the only way I can describe my experience at this hotel. I had the misfortune of staying at this property during the Mayweather fight weekend (May 1st-4th).  I was excitedly looking foward to the Rehab pool party event on Sunday, where Ludacris was expected to perform.  I purchased tickets at the hotel box office in advance, only to have the event cancelled due to a brawl that took place.  When I asked for a refund, I was directed to their box office which "happened" to be closed and would not re-open that day.

Aside from the failed event, the lack of organization, rudeness of the staff and terrible treatment of guests made my stay one I will never forget, for all the wrong reasons. 

My non-smoking room reeked of smoke when I checked in and the hotel would only offer a downgraded room in its place.

Did I mention all hotel guests were barricaded from entry to the property for several hours?  They literally placed metal barricades in front of all the entrances and would not let anyone (hotel guests included) into the hotel.

This is unaccceptable.  I would hate to think this is standard protocol for handling guests when there is a disturbance.  But I would hate even more to think this is not standard protocol and only "certain specific" guests are treated this way.    Either way, I will not return.  I'd recommend you spend your money  at an establishment that treats guests with respect.

We just came back from a 3 night stay at the Hard Rock and what a nightmare it was. First let me say I was a big fan of the place. Cool vibe, great characters, just a fun hotel to stay when in Vegas. Never coming back. 
The warning signs started with the reservation process. I booked our suite and connecting room ( 4 people) two weeks in advance hoping  it would be enough, but since the hotel was hosting the AVN's  the entire HRH tower was booked. The only suites they had were at the Casino tower, their oldest one, but I said what the hell. 
Back to my phone experience, first time I called I was put on hold for 7 minutes. Hung up. Called again immediately and was put on hold again, waited 5 minutes and realizing were this was going, hung up. Third time a charm, finally got a very bitter and angry reservationist. Talking to an automated system would have actually been an improvement.  Doesn't matter, Mission accomplish, I got the rooms. 
We arrived on Friday. Knowing that check in was at 3pm, we took our time leaving LA and got to the hotel around 4:30pm. Upon check in the friendly receptionist informed me that our suite and connecting room were not really connected, only one next to each other. I explained to her that I made the reservation two weeks in advance, and that I am hosting friends from Europe who traveled many miles to be here. We don't really have the option to brush it off and come back another weekend. She explained to me that rooms are based upon availability and since the hotel is so busy they don't have the rooms we requested. If someone would have communicated it to me upon making the reservation, I would have gladly left LA earlier, but I guess I shouldn't expected much from Mrs. Scrooge over the phone.
So, we walked into the rooms and it took me about 2 minutes to realize that our "Suite" looked significantly smaller then I imagined. I booked the "Deluxe Suite" which is supposed to be 900+ square ft. What we had was something slightly bigger then our "connecting" room. Determined to figure this out I called the front desk, and guess what? I was put on hold for almost ten minutes. Second try, same. I finally got someone to pick up after the third call. 
Upon explaining the situation the receptionist apologized and informed me that since a few guests decided to extend their stay, our room will not be available until tomorrow. At this point there was nothing to do so we just rolled with the punches, the only thing I asked for was a mini fridge that none of the rooms were equipped with.
Now let me give you a brief description of our rooms and the state we found them. This is supposedly after a 100 million renovation. Bathrooms were filthy, and I mean disgusting. Unrecognizable stuff sticking to the walls ( it looked like bee wax), chipped mirrors, uneven paint job, shower head sticking out of the wall half hanging. My friend took a bath and it took about 2 hours for it to drain. Oh well, we had a fun night around town, and looked forward to our rooms the next day. Btw, fridge never arrived.
Second day came. Our connecting room was ready by 1230pm, the suite however was not. After calling and stopping at the front desk for at least four times we finally got our room at 430pm! 4 hours after the next door room was ready. We also asked again for the mini fridge. These rooms were in a slightly better condition the others. Most annoying thing was that all the flat screens TV's in both rooms had a fuzzy and uneven picture. The playoffs were on and we wanted to watch the game in our rooms since the sports bar downstairs was packed. Alas, the picture was so bad you couldn't even tell the numbers on the player's jerseys. Oh yea, and we never got that mini fridge. 
Upon checkout I explained all of our trials and misfortunes to a very nice receptionist (Angela). She was very sympathetic but couldn't really offer anything so I asked to speak to the manager. 
The manager came out (Patricia) with a look on her face that pretty much said everything. She looked at me as if I was trying to scam her. I explained to her again, everything that happen and what a bad experience this entire stay left upon me and my friends. I also mentioned that I work in the hospitality business ( I am a GM in a large restaurant group in LA) so I am very surprised that the hotel didn't even offer to comp us a night. We ate, drank and gambled in the hotel. Paid a hefty sum for our rooms, we could have got better rooms for less money at the Cosmopolitan or the Palms Place that have amazing suits for very moderate prices. Patricia informed me that we already received a $400 discount on the rooms. My claim that $200 from the amount was because of the difference in room rates, since we got a lesser room on our first night, fell on deaf ears. Patricia would not budge. 
Hard Rock, you lost a very good customer, and for you out there considering staying at that place, look around. There are better and cheaper places In Vegas.

I have stayed here before and had a great time but right now absolutely not. There were no warnings during booking that the main casino area was closed due to construction. I booked on Hotels.com for the first time and viewed all of the details before paying. NO WARNINGS IS FALSE ADVERTIZING. ALL of the main casino and bar were closed. NOT HAPPY! 
Why would you stay at a hotel that is off of the strip with no main casino or bar???

i love this place because of the poolside concerts. i have seen wolfmother and slightly stoopid. poolside trumps any other type of concert venue!

it doesn't hurt that during the day, the pool is filled with beautiful young ladies.

someone grabbed my sandals by mistake while i was in the pool, i informed the security, and they replaced my sandals with some from the store..no charge! they have my loyalty forever!

Eat at Pink Taco, play a little blackjack, lay by the pool, or walk across to the gentlemen's club, Club Paradise across the way, walk back, sleep and repeat. This is an all around great place to stay. They have a very friendly staff and up to date rooms. 4.5 out of 5 stars.

I must have been in a funk last time I wrote about this place, because I really like it. Rooms are always nice, comfortable, and hip. Front desk girls are helpful, efficient, and upgraded me to one of those HRH rooms! The HRH valet was fast, and I still love the pool. I'd prefer to hear some hip hop\/top 40 as opposed to electronica\/fist pumping stuff. still loses a star for being a mile off the strip.

My brother and I stopped into the Pink Taco for a cold beverage mid-afternoon. Pleasantly surprised that the happy hour included 2 for 1 on all bottled beers at the bar! Only downside was they serve both rounds at the same time. If you're thirsty this is a non-issue. Very friendly staff in a cool SW atmosphere.

Hip and happening. Decor is very rockin' and on point. Very lively and busy. Lots to do. Place to be for a wild time. Okay priced drinks, nice pool and amazing concerts. 

I was surprised I saw the Nelson's for 50 bucks and it was right in front of the pool with excellent service and food tables set up. Music was great and so were the views. We were right in front rocking out to their old and new music.

Rudest employees on the planet. For some reason 20 year olds think it is cool to be rude. Got ripped off by a defective machine took an act of congress to get my money back. Circle bar is okay as is the Pink Taco. Steak house overpriced. Rooms are okay. Pool strictly for the 20 year olds so they can show off their muscles and breast implants.
They pulled all the decent video poker. New sports book far better than the old one. Casino is very isolated from all the strip action. Ten years ago this was the place to go but now it is old hat. If you are hip and young go to the Palms or the Cosmo this place is on the way out, there are far better places than this. I have never seen a casino  get such vastly  different ratings, some give it four stars and others a one, if you are a 21 college student that likes to get drunk and hang out at the pool you might be happy in this overrated place but anyone with any sophistication will go elsewhere !

I stayed at in HRH Towers, which I'm not sure how different they are from the regular rooms, but I absolutely loved this place. I had a corner room on the 10th floor with two full walls of floor to ceiling windows, which let in so much light and provided an awesome view. The room was a lot bigger and nicer than many other Vegas rooms I have seen, and the price wasn't bad at all for how nice this place was. The HRH Tower is around 3 years old, which would explain why everything is really modern and beautiful in the room. I loved the decor (I'm big on hotel decor), the bathroom although only having glass walls, was large, the bed very comfortable, the couches big enough to seat six people, two flat screen televisions, a wet bar, and two closet areas. It's not far from the strip at all, about an $8 cab ride to one of the hotels. If I have a chance to stay here again when I'm in Vegas I definitely will!

I've often gambled here and bought the requisite Hard Rock Las Vegas souvenirs, but I've never stayed here.....until now. All I have to say to myself about that is: Why the hell did I wait so long to do so? From the moment I arrived to the Reservations counter to the time I checked out, I've never had such a smooth and comfortable stay. I got a corner room in the Paradise Tower on the 16th floor and was greeted with the best view I've had in Vegas. The left hand floor to ceiling window showed the 2 HRH pools while the right hand side window showed the LV Strip in all its glory. Another plus is that there were fewer drunken idiots there than I thought there would be! I saw people of all ages there, including this cute couple in their 60's hanging out at Center Bar Thursday night watching the NBA game. I've read previous posts about how comfortable the beds are here and have to agree 100% with them. It's not the best I've ever slept in but it ranks up in my top 5. 

While there I ate at Mr Lucky's, which is a personal fav of mine in Vegas. For players club members, the $4.99 steak & egg Graveyard special and the $7.77 Steak & Shrimp Gambler's special cannot be beat. (NOTE: They recently changed the hours for the Graveyard special from Midnight to Noon to Midnight to 8am). I also ate at Pink Taco which was pretty good but not spectacular. They have a pretty good happy hour special for 99 cents tacos and margaritas between 1-3pm and 9-11pm Monday through Thursday, I didn't get around to Johnny' Smalls for their AYCE Tapas but that is on my to do list for next time (NOTE: it's in the HRH Tower casino portion of the complex; I saw more than a few people walking down the corridor where the shops and some restaurants are looking for it). 

This brings me to the only "complaint" I have about this place. Anywhere you go inside a LV Casino, you see signs after signs directing you to restaurants, hotel towers, etc but none at the HRH. In the past, it was a pretty easy place to navigate since it was all in the round, so to speak but since the 2 expansions and renovations have doubled the size of it all, it would be a good idea to have better directions to give customers and guests on where to go (the property map they give you upon check in is good but really, how often is it looked at after you first get to your room and head out?). 

Overall, I had a wonderful stay and look forward to my next stay there in September.

Nice room- except NO hot water at all for two days- staff could care less- called down multiple times IF anyone answered always same - with another guest ( maintenance guy) guess there's only 1!!! Valet staff fantastic!!  Food - ate at three different restaurants - mediocre at best- expected much more!!

I wrote a review earlier this week giving the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino a 1-star rating for having a terrible experience with their valet service. After posting my review, I was immediately contacted by a representative from the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino. The representative apologized for the terrible service and asked me to provide details about my encounter with the valet service. Again, the representative was very apologetic and ensured me that they would look into my experience to improve the their valet service. I look forward to going back to the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino to see their improvements.

Asked for a non smoking  room. Check  but sadly around 430 I got up,and couldn't get back to sleep.
Then at 6 am. The room smells like smoke. 544am the sun is passing though the so called black - out curtains. 
Restroom floor is not clean all the way. Don't come here whit children or your adult child.  .
Needed to tell my children why the the other adults were asking so silly. ( I know ,not hotel's fault)
I didn't like it here. I had a better expectations for such a expensive place. Well in the cleaning areas, there is a wipe of some sorts behind the first bed.this is room(31131 on the 11th floor) I will leave it there!
Floor behind restroom door has lint or dust that looks like about a 2 or 3 week build up. 
Scads of some sorts on a chair. Dusty is the window stills, food for sale.  And no cups, just one glass one .was thinking about using it, but seeing somethings are not all done too par. I thought NO.
Free WiFi free parking and ice is why I have them 2 stars.
I would expect this service quality at motel 6 or something ,bit not here.

Hard Rock Hotel was a major disappointment for my weekend stay. First, booked a room with a king-sized bed and then was promptly told at check-in that they only had two doubles available. Second, after arriving in the room (on the 3rd floor) I noticed that half of the lights were broken and dirty (dust everywhere) and the floors and bathroom were also dirty. 

Next, no one mentioned that apparently if you are on a lower level you will feel and hear the bass from the casino music until all hours of the night. Finally, around 2am I called the front desk because it was impossible to sleep with the noise and the front desk moved us to the 2nd floor because of course 'nothing else was available' but farther away from the casino and over Starbucks instead of the casino. Fortunately, the room was a bit quieter but unfortunately, a hell of a lot uglier and dirtier (half of the items in the mini bar were missing...dear God please don't let me get charged) with pistachio shells sprinkled about the entire room. Also, just as an FYI for you late sleepers, if your room faces the pool (even though it's winter and empty) they start blaring music from the loudspeakers at about 8am until God knows when at night. Really? I know this is Hard Rock Hotel but please respect your guest a bit better! I could really do without listening to Katy Perry yodeling over the loud speakers at 9am that are 3 inches from the room window. 

Overall, I was completely unimpressed with the hotel, the room, and the service. I will never stay at this hotel again. If you are unlucky enough to have to stay at the hotel, I highly recommend checking in early and demanding a room on a higher level (although I hear the top levels have a lot of airplane noise).

On a last note, refrain from ordering room service. I ordered room service for breakfast and I have never in my life been charged $26 (because of course all orders charge for a delivery fee and 20% gratuity) for 2 eggs, 2 pieces of toast, a clump of hashbrowns, and nasty bacon. Almost $30 for a meal that surely cost about $2 to make...painful!!

My boyfriend and I had gone for a wedding in Vegas and wanted to give the Hard Rock a try. It seemed a decent place with a good vibe and reasonably priced. Besides paying a resort fee for every day we reserved  through our booking.com reservation, we then paid a second flat resort fee on top before leaving. Yet, that wasn't the worst part of our stay. The worst was having housekeeping or some staff with access to our room, rummage through our belongings (glad we use the in-room safe) and use the in-room convenience pay items on the dresser.  These items which we would've been billed for but my boyfriend had noticed items were moved as soon as we walked in from the wedding ceremony. Shady. Guest services was good enough to take off the charge but I'm not sure that would be true if we didn't notice & call down right away. So we went back and looked at our luggage and saw that it had obviously been gone through. All of this left a bad taste and I can't say I'd stay there again.

5 stars.  Yes.  What can I say?  I booked for any room at Hotels.com for a very decent price and Larry from guest services bumped me up to an upgrade to a suite at the much newer HRH Tower that even has a view of (some) hotels in the strip.

Service was A+ for me.  Very pleasant stay.  Would definitely consider again with or without the upgrade .

Tip:  Sensors on the snacks and drinks inside the room are very sensitive.  Make sure you report to the front desk if you accidentally caused a bag of peanut to be displaced.  Lol.  You can avoid extra charges, then.

I've stayed here a few times and the rooms are always very nice. Flat screen TV, upscale decorating, and a large classy shower with glass doors. The gambling is very good here I normally get a lot of play. The "Culinary Drop Out" restaurant is a good place to eat, not a big fan of "The Pink Taco" I would say the food there is mediocre for Mexican. The center bar in the casino is the happening place, and I've gotten really good drinks there by casino bar standards.

We decided to check out the new suites at Hard Rock. They are nice. But I prefer theHotel or Wynn still. The style is contemporary meets French Provencal. The rooms are clean and crisp. Good looking. I am not sure if it was just our room but there was a lot of creaking, cracking and snapping coming out of the ductwork. Slightly annoying.

We found it super humorous that there were giant "towel bars" over the beds and couch but not one in the bathroom (ok so there was ONE in the bathroom, over the tub and not near the sink). The full-length mirror is right by the front door inside the closet so you have to hold the door open while you are trying to make sure you look good for the night.

The wall ipod docking system is cool. However, the music only comes from the unit hooked up to the TV so it has to be turned way up to hear it in the bathroom so you can jam out in your underoos while you get ready to go out and play.

Beds are nice. Place was clean. The guest service left something to be desired though. We called down for some help with the safe b\/c it kept saying error. It took 2hrs and two phone calls for anyone to come up. We called for more glassware and it showed up... AFTER we left the room for the evening more than an hour later. I asked for a room tag so they would stop knocking on our door and I never got it (so I stole my neighbors).

I like the smaller casino. The dealers are friendly. Mr. Lucky's is actually a decent diner and a great place to people watch. Tried to eat at Rare 120 but they were closed on Mondays so didn't check it out. People who complain about it being off the strip are a little ridiculous. You could walk to PH, Aria etc if you wanted to OR you can catch a $7 cab. Not a big deal at all.

We avoided Rehab but did go out to the new pool deck on Sunday. Also good people watching. $9 for a beer though.... OUCH.

Would I stay here again? Maybe, but I wouldn't necessarily recommend the place to someone.

Does the HRH make me feel young?  Or does it fall into the ITOFTS (I'm too old for this shit) category?  
 
YOUNG:
Music and atmosphere is great.
Very strong drinks, served by very hot cocktail waitresses.
The pool situation.  You know what I mean.
Getting hit on at Center Bar.
Hell's Belles.  What a great way to play shitty 6:5 blackjack.
Mr. Lucky's.  24 hour great food.  Important.
Standard rooms are big enough for a good party.  50 inch plasma. French doors that open to let the fumes out.
Love Jones.  I love that place.  
Quick walk across the street to Club Paradise.  Woooot!
The clientele.
 
OLD:
Music is waaaaay loud. Great, but LOUD.  Seems louder in the morning.  I dunno.
The pool situation.  If you're over 25, you know what I mean.
Body English:  ITOFTS.  No doubt about it.  
The most important thing in that big standard room with the 50 inch plasma?  The beds are super comfy.
Getting hit on at Center Bar.  Are they kidding me??  I have CHILDREN!! 
The video poker and blackjack sucks.  And it's starting to matter to me. More than the atmosphere. 
The clientele. 
 
IN CONCLUSION:  I still feel the love for this place, but was forced to drop it one Liz-Star (TM) due to my own inability to cope.

Stayed here for a bachelor party. Rooms were nice, condition was great. The pools are very interesting....why someone would pay $30 to go to the Rehab pool when the regular pool was free and had better drink specials without the blaring music is beyond me. STAY FAR AWAY FROM THE IN-HOTEL DINING. Especially for breakfast. Unless you want corned beef hash that come out like soup and has frickin carrots in it! Carrots? Come on, geez.

Here's the low down.  If you get hook ups or ever a chance to stay here, the HRH suites are the best.  There are surround sound speakers with remote controls at the living room area.  An L couch to lounge around, where the TV is pimped out with access to it on both sides of the room.  The room is white, chic, decked out with Rock memorabilia tastefully placed around the room.  The covers and pillows were fluffy and it made sleeping that much more awesome.

There are glass entry doors to the bathroom and the entire bathroom area.  Double sinks, separate massive tub, it's definitely a luxurious room, with plenty of room for 2.  The highlight of the hotel is all the memorabilia that fills the entire hotel.  If you love Rock n Roll, this would be a fascinating place to stay.  I like all types of music and I thought it was a unique experience that only this hotel offers.  It's like their own personal museum.  

On a different tower, the suites with adjoining rooms, on the top floor, facing the pool can be super loud, but it's a pretty cool set up too.  There were french doors that open up to the balcony and that was pretty rad.

I booked a room in the HR tower with city views, we had no city views. We were put on the 4th floor and had a white wall to look at. I loved that it had a separate sitting area, but we kept having issues with the tv in that room having no volume.  Lighting was a big issue, we had no bathroom lights unless you went near the main door and turned on that light switch which controlled everything, so in the middle of the night, we were without light in the bathroom. Wifi was very slow. On the positive side, we were hear to see Journey and they were awesome and the venue where they played was great! Also all casino staff, and staff for that concert were very helpful and friendly!
The room is nice but off the strip . Not the best choice for location, use uber if you stay here it is better cost effective.

DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! I REPEAT!! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!! Very poor customer service. From my butler to the head management of security. I'm very unhappy with our stay, we actually purchased a total of 13 rooms in this hotel including a penthouse suite and were treated worse than bums on the strip. Male Security busted through our doors and walked in on females undressing in the privacy of their own rooms. I was personal harassed by security. I felt held hostage at some points throughout my stay. Also multiple belongings were stolen out of our suite, and security did not assist with the investigation. For all I know it was the maids! We had to end our stay early and pack up all 14 rooms, DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME HERE!! Me and my 40 other guest will never return to this poor establishment again.

OK where do I start this hotel is terrible in customer service. 
I'll syst by saying the rooms were nice.  That's why they get a one star. 
Here's the news:
*you're not allowed in their pool unless you have naked,  "swim wear" .shorts won't even due. 
*half the pools are closed. 
* you have to spend $200 to sit in the rehab pool area. 
*the manager is unprofessional and fights an argument instead of listening.  
*the lines are so long for check in.
*the lobby area smells bad.
I can go on . They are not interested in normal average  guests , they are interested in young people that want to party.
Please stay away from this horrible hotel. They ruined our stay at Vegas. 
The manager Hector has such a bad attitude and doesn't accommodate guests.  There's a way to communicate and solve issues. He chose the unprofessional route and decided to argue with me.
Will never come back !!

This was probably the worst experience I have had while staying in Vegas. Luckily it was just one night and the reason I even stayed there was to be able to get concert tickets. 
The staff is rude when and if they even acknowledge you. The rooms are not near the quality they advertise and seem dirty and not maintained well. The toilet was stained and dirty. Outside the window on a ledge was a large collection of garbage. 

The minibar is weight sensitive and the prices are ridiculous as well. The price for anything within the casino or hotel is way too high, it's like because of their horrible location they think they can make you pay twice as much. If you must stay go across the street to the CVS for anything you may need. 

The staff was plain out rude. And the girl at check out tried to make us pay a higher rate when we checked out than what we were told when we booked and the price when we had checked in. She went and spoke with her manager and  then spoke to us as it was clearly there in the contract and our fault. When I pointed out that if it was in the contract that she could see, why did the two previous people we had spoke to gave us the lower price? She had no answer and offered no apology then she said wait a minute and left to talk to the manager for the second time who never bothered to even make an appearance and came back to find out we were charged incorrectly and she never once apologized. When we mentioned how disappointed with the hotel we were she just ignored us as if nothing happened. 

To top it off there is no hot tub unless you rent a cabana. The pools are only open until dark if they open at all. And the staff won't even acknowledge you exist even if you are wondering looking lost which is fairly easy to do. It may be different if you are a female in a bikini as it was mostly male staff. 

Then as a kicker the display of Nikki Stixx's chopper they call it a "Cusom Hardtail" unless I am missing a brand or style I'm assuming they meant custom.

I really had an amazing time staying here. Always a great party happening at the Hard Rock. Came for July 4th and a large suite ran only $74 for thurs and weds nights! I called on day 2 to check in to our additional room and was told that they could upgrade us to a 2nd smaller suite at no extra charge. This room was only $60! And in the same new tower (HRH) where we'd have our own check-in area and could avoid the huge line again. Score! 

The suites are spacious and gorgeous, mine with small jacuzzi tub in bathroom and jack and jill sinks. Flatscreen tvs (2) in my room, one on living room side and one on bedroom side. Music system throughout the room that includes tunes or you can hook in your iphone\/ipod. Little wet bar in both rooms which we used a lot. There are 5 pools including a sand bottom pool, Breathe which is a glass bottom and has late night entertainment, and the famous Rehab pool which is always a party. There's even blackjack you can play IN THE POOL. We didn't go to Vanity (nightclub) but Pauly D is their resident DJ. What an amazing hotel!

I wasn't feeling well from the heat a couple days so it was great to be able to entertain in our room during the day. I had about 8 friends up and ordered room service for lunch which wasn't ridiculously priced. The casino and restaurants are great, very classy. Two affordable restaurants, but even the diner has a great menu. Hard Rock is a block off the strip but I didn't feel like we needed to leave much. We went to dinner\/clubs off property twice and our total cab fare was about $30. Not bad.

Only complaints were that my Internet (which is supposed to be included) wouldn't easily connect and they don't like for you to bring food\/drinks up to your room. The valet was rude one time when they were backed up and we were waiting in the heat. And one pool security guard was a jerk. All other staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Oh, and my large poolside drink was $30! But I'd come stay again in a heartbeat especially for the value at such an inclusive hotel. I didn't want to leave.

Visited the HRH restaurant specifically for Gamblers Special for $7.77.  It was a steak dinner with 3 grilled shrimp, mashed potato and green beans.  It was a decent meal, the steak was favorable and cooked to specification.  Mashed potatoes were seasoned exceptionally well and the green beans were fresh.  I had hoped for the salad but was told it was not offered with the special anymore.  If you are looking for a budget meal, then this will meet you expectations.

Came down on Sat to check in my SUITE for the first time I ever stayed in one here.  At 2:10 after waiting in line for 20 min was told it was not ready.  Went to get coffe and came back an hour later.  I got back in line for another 20 min, still not ready. Came back another hour got back in line for 10 min wait this time, still not ready.  Received at text at 4:40 my room was ready, got back in line for another 15min and room was ready.  The time was almost 5 o'clock.  I booked this room over a month in advance.  It would of really been nice if I was told about 70% of the casino floor was under construction.  I presume I was not told because they would fear I wouldn't stay.  Great marketing Plan!  
To add insult to injury after all the times I was waiting inline I was never told HRH tower has its own private check in area with a lobby and  chairs for those paying for the suite.  This would of been nice while waiting.  The room charge was about 350 plus all the BS resort fee scam put it to about 400.  The digital music player in the room kept freezing and updating.  The club is also shut down.  I was feeling so violated.  I paid 400 dollars to stay at a casino under construction and no dance club!  Oh, the new pizza take out is good.  Keep it classy HR!  I drove down to MGM to play and party!  I sent my comment card 4 days ago about the stay.  Nobody e-mailed or called me back.

The hotel is conveniently located right by the airport, but not so close that you hear planes taking off and landing. Was a $10 cab ride and about 5 minute drive. Amazing! 

The hotel was definitely no frills and not super fancy...they had construction going on in the casino right by check in when we got there around noon. I was a bit annoyed with it as they had never mentioned they had construction going on and it was very loud and unpleasant just as we had arrived. 

Check in is at 3pm and we got there early. They said no rooms were available but after I put up a little fuss (after all it was my bachelorette) Jose Mari was able to get us a room right away. He also gave us some coupons that we could use around the hotel and casino. Thank you Jose!!

We went up to our suite with a pool view in the HRH tower and settled in. It was a little run down but comfortable enough and considering the rate I got for the room, the price was right! 
The suite very comfortably can fit 4 people...but you could squeeze 6-8. The bathroom was large and had a huge tub and shower. The beds were comfortable, but nothing special. Overall it was clean. 

The casino is small and kinda lame. They have a few restaurants, we tried Pink Taco, it was ok. Room service pizza was perfect after a night of clubs. LOVED the pool!! Both the hotel "family" pool and the Rehab "party" pool are great. Love how they both have sand on the bottom. You really don't feel like you are at a pool in Vegas when your feet are in the sand. Very nice! Also prices for cabanas were reasonable. 

Don't think I would choose to come back to this hotel as I prefer a bit more luxury but it was perfect for a fun, cheaper option for my bachelorette party.

I love this hotel. I stayed in the paradise tower and love the vibe and decor. The bed was sooo comfy I never wanted to get out of it and I even googled like crazy to find out the kind of mattress for future purchasing lol. I loved all the music memorabilia and being a huge music lover could stare\/drool at it all day! I know I will always come back to this hotel if there isn't a major need for a strip hotel. :)

Vegas is Vegas.  I love a good theme hotel.  Hard Rock is full of young people who know how to look good and have a good time.  I'm not crazy about gambling, so I can't tell you a thing about the tables.  However, the bars and the music make this place a comfortable environment for me.  

The room was beautiful, with a shitload of pillows to fight, I mean sleep with.  The lighting in the bathroom was very forgiving, perfect for your late-night face.  Room service was speedy and courteous.  I wish I could tell you about the gym, like I was all packed to continue my workout regimen, but I was uh...sidetracked.  Friggin' Vegas.  

The decor is peppered with famous wardrobe, guitars, and leather jackets from all the greats.  I'm totally coveting the Joss Stone dress, so don't act surprised when that shit's missing.

The Pink Taco was a craving of mine before I even got off the plane, but the Baja fish tacos were disappointing.  The salsa and chips starter was tasty, though.  The Pomegranate martini was the highlight of my dinner.

Thank goodness for Mr. Lucky's, always with the little bite of food to carry me over to my next antic.

The strip has plenty of places for fugly tourists, HRH has plenty of eye candy.  That's nice for a change.  I heart them for making my stay a fun one!

This would probably be my favorite hotel - if I were 10 years younger. However; the plastic people at Rehab and drug scene is no longer my thing. What it reminds me of is MTV's Spring Break show (filmed in Daytona Beach, FL). 
Don't get me wrong, the place is awesome - especially the pool. Who doesn't mind running into a rock star now and then?? My friend met Tommy Lee and Vince Neil in the casino - on 2 separate occasions and we met  the band AFI at our blackjack table. It's a crap shoot (no pun intended) but if you are going to see anyone famous in Vegas, it'll probably be here. 
I love having a balcony that faces the pool...but only when I am pre-funking and getting ready to go out. Try taking a hangover nap midday in that same room and you will be screaming for a cot in a janitors closet, if it means peace and quiet.
I'm surprised they still have balconies, considering the suicide rate in Vegas, but the view from each is totally killer! Again, no pun intended. 
I have no idea if the buffet is any good, because we eat every meal at the Pink Taco. Why? Because I could eat Taco Bell every day and this is like TB times ten! The prices aren't bad either. 
Honestly, the only sucky thing about the Hard Rock - if I had to come up with something - is the jaunt to the strip. Sure, you can catch a cab...but that's money that should be spent by the pool. On $15 drinks. Yeah, that sucks too...but who wants to be inside gambling to get free watered down drinks when you can have a drink in your hand as you experience "Rehab" (pool party). 
Body English (formerly "Babies") is one of my favorite clubs in Vegas...as well it had better be - to keep people from jumping into said cabs to the strip. 
Really, the hotel-casino has done a very good job making the joint (a play on words; also a rock and roll concert venue inside the casino) somewhere you do not want to leave.  
This is a spot that you don't mind paying a little bit extra for.

As usual a good time at the HR.  Mötley Crüe was awesome for sure.  You always meet good people at the hard rock and I enjoy myself there. They have quasi "sold out" and became very commercial. It did loose it's quaintness over the past eight or so years.

Coolaste hotellet jag bott på. Deras utställning runt om hela hotellet\/casinot med musikrelaterade artiklar var riktigt häftigt. Man kan spendera ett par timmar bara till det. 

Konstant bra musik i högtalarna var man än befann sig. 

Stort bra rum med allt man behöver. 
Se upp att inget välter i minibaren bara. Försvinner något från sin plats kostar det. (Dock råkade jag  lyfta några grejer som senare inte dök upp på räkningen)

Klockren skyttelbuss som går varje halvtimme till The Strip. 


Casionodelen vet jag inget om. Spelar inte så har inga referenser. Men vem vill hänga i det casinot när man har the Strip en km därifrån?

Verkligen ett alternativ om jag besöker Las vegas igen.

Great vibe.  Wasted Space is a nice spot to catch shows, as well as the main music venue (The Joint).  The rooms are affordable.  The food at Pink Taco is tasty.  The pool is fun for people watching.  It feels like a party 24 hours a day here.

If you want luxury and relaxation, don't stay here.  If you want to party and meet other young people in the same mindset, this is arguably the best place in Vegas.  Personally, I stay elsewhere and come here for some gambling and drinking from time to time.

Keep in mind that the hotel is actually pretty small (at least until the expansion is complete).  Therefore, rooms tend to book up early during busy dates unlike some of the monster hotels on the Strip.

I attended a bachelor party that was held in the hotel a few years ago.  One of the rooms we had featured a stripper pole and a pool table.  Super classy stuff!  Keep that in mind if you are taking somebody to Vegas that you really want to impress, like a mother-in-law.

In terms of the rooms (Paradise Tower), I think their nice and comfortable.  The VIP guest service was very quick with my check-in.  My only grip is that the hotel is pretty far off of the strip which requires you constantly getting a taxi.  Other than the pool scene, Hard Rock is dead, the casino floor is dead and tables are always full, but for me I like the fact that its close to the airport (helps in the event when your friend forgets to set the alarm and you only have 20 minutes before you miss your flight- true story).  I'll be back next year, save my spot at the pool!

Stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel over the weekend of the 4th of July.
It's a 4 star hotel and they charge a resort fee plus $50 per night you stay.
So it must be up to par right? Wrong when we got to the room there was "Beer" in the carpets and I stepped in it. We called the front desk to have it cleaned up while we were out. When we came back the room seemed cleaner, but not to long after we discovered glass all over the floor and my husband cut his foot, so we called to have it cleaned up....Then the person asks for a flashlight and for help to move furniture so he can vacuum then we did a report for my husbands foot took pictures. We were promised another room in the morning. So the next day we get up to find the room is not ready we had to wait until 5pm we missed breakfast and lunch...
We were refunded our fees for staying at the hotel 150.00 but since we booked
through another website they are not responsible. 
My husband went to a doctor to have his foot looked at we are now seeking legal action. DO NOT STAY AT THE HARD ROCK HOTEL.
This place SUCKS! NO CUSTOMER SERVICE! payed for a suite with a king bed and they give me a room with 2 queen beds! After try to up sell me at check in! Classic!

So we stayed here for the first time over memorial day weekend. 
I give the rooms 5 stars as they were clean, bathroom had no problems and the beds were soft, the only thing that was odd was there was always a weird smell in the hallway by the elevator. 
Anyways, this hotel is a little bit off the strip which was very inconvenient and their prices were the same as hotels on the strip. The casino didn't have a lot of slot options and is fairly small. The pool is great though but it was closed over the weekend because it turned into a day club. Overall, the stay was ok but I wouldn't stay here again because of the location and the lack of good games in the casino.

It is a party kind of away from the party. I was here for the 2011 year and did attend a concert for the group Deftones at the Joint. This place is slightly away from the strip. Slightly meaning really long but fun walk from the actual Las Vegas Strip or an 10 or 11 dollar cab ride from my hotel Polo Towers at the time. I would recommend this spot more for 20 somethings, it is very loud. There is also a chance to spot some celebrities in the crowd trying to lay low from the actual strip you know craziness. I Hope to come back here again soon, ASAP. I heard the hotel fees and resort fees are kind of high compared to other places while staying here.

I stayed at this hotel for two nights and the room was not clean. I found hair in the bathroom and used mouthwash. The maids were notified to not enter my room. They did anyways and they dropped my flat iron on the floor. In result, my flat iron broke. Security came and saw that the iron was scratched and not working properly. They told me to contact Risk Management and they will resolve the issue. So, I contacted the Risk Management department, they said "we're not able to do anything due to lack of proof' BLAH BLAH BLAH. The security guard never mentioned the condition of my flat iron. I will never go back to this hotel.

Came here a couple years ago and had the best experience! From the moment I checked in (had the best check in experience I've ever had and I got bumped into the best room for extra charge but it was well worth it) to the "rock star" room and the best blackjack table I've ever played.

Only complaint I have now is I'm trying to book a room  for another stay but the rates are all over the place. From the Hard Rocks website to 4 other travel sites... what's the deal?  This is a real turnoff, it goes to show that you can have the same room as five other people but you all pay a different price.  Since this is Vegas I'd much rather spend my money in the casinos not in a room I really  won't spend much time in. 

Looking at other hotels for better deals.
Always my favorite place to go!  Great place to see concerts, Vinyl and The Joint!  Pink Taco is fun and great food, great service and bartenders.

We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino last night for a bachelorette party and it started off a little rocky. We booked 2 rooms and we're able to check into one a little early so I could decorate it for the bride. When I arrived later on with the bride, I discovered that all of the decor and gifts I had set up had been cleaned completely. We contacted the executive team and while we were at the magic mike show, they upgraded our room to a suite, went out and bought and decorated the new room for us. We were blown away with the time and effort the team put into fixing the mistake. They really will go above and beyond to make sure your stay is very pleasant.

Whether you're in your early 20s or in your 50s partying it hard like the youngins, I imagine you'll enjoy the Hard Rock. Yeah, you probably don't want to come here to gamble, but if to-be-seen is your goal then I suggest staying here. 

A few highlights:

The rooms in the Paradise Tower were well appointed with showers that could hold several people, if you know what I'm talkin about ;) The beds and pillows were heavenly and put me right to sleep at 5:30 in the morning (although the time and exhaustion could have helped with that too.) And like others have said, do not move anything in the mini bar cuz it is monitored by weight sensors.
